text: I agree- Finally a good Greek Restaurant on this side of town!! The Gyros were huge, and delicious! The service was was impeccable; very friendly and definitely pride in ownership. The "Family Packs" are a great deal- I can see gyros for dinner once a week...!

I live many miles away, but I returned today for the third time. Simply delicious. Friendly service. Generous portions. Surprisingly pleasant patio seating, too, given that the restaurant is in a strip mall. Go there. You will love it.
Deserves every star . Hands down the best and freshest Greek food EVER . You gotta try it !!! Try the feta fries . Yum

Glad  they finally have a location near me . The food is incredibly fresh and great tasting . The BEST gyros in Las Vegas hands down . Prices are very fare when compared . The owner and staff really do care. A must try .

The lamb gyro was good, the feta fries were the best, end it out with a baklava you have a very good lunch destination. Gets a little crowded around lunch time, but it's your Greek eatery they are normally smaller in size. Try to beat the lunch rush so you don't have to wait for a table or sit outside.

We were greeted by the owners immediately upon arrival. We ordered the bowls one with falafel and the other with shrimp. I saw a tray of spanakopita coming out of the oven and had to try it. Sitting on the patio they brought out the appetizer.  Fantastic!  The bowls came before we could finish. Fresh, Beautiful, Delicious food. The shrimp were large and grilled to perfection.  The wifes falafel was cooked perfectly.  The taziki was amazing the julienned cucumbers made it pop! Too bad this is 2000 miles from home.  We will be back for sure!
I've never tried something I didn't love here. Delicious food, great staff, large portions!

We arrived in Henderson after a day at Bryce Canyon. We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn and we quite hungry. Thanks to Yelp I spotted great reviews for this Greek Restaurant which turned out to be across the street. We came to the little restaurant that had some tables inside but chose to sit outside as it was on the cooler side inside. My 2 children ordered the large Greek salads that came with hot, toasted pita wedges. My husband and I each ordered the chicken souvlaki platter that came with small Greek salads, rice pilaf and the pita wedges. The chicken was really flavorful and my picky 17 year old proclaimed, "that's the best chicken I've ever tasted!" The salads were delicious and very crisp and fresh! My daughter also ordered a baklava for dessert to eat back at the hotel and it was gobbled up. ( she loved it and normally doesn't like nuts). We loved our meal and wish they were by our home in Phoenix. I also have to add that the woman who took our order was super friendly and cheerful. The food was quickly served nice and hot!

The Great Greek is the best greek food in Henderson, probably Las Vegas as well. I always order the chicken souvlaki; their greek salad is my favorite part. My girlfriend gets the Pastitsio. Both are delicious.   The only downside- there is often a wait for take out, usually takes 30 minutes.

The food at The Great Greek is incredible and the service is even better! Jack has to be one of the best customer service guys I have ever seen. He made sure he greeted everyone as they came in and was always checking on all the customers. Top notch!! This place never disappoints.
Love this place! Great for the whole family and fabulous service every time I have gone which ends up being about once a week.  Haven't had a bad thing there ever

If you're looking for fresh, flavorful Greek food.....look no further. This is without a doubt the best I have ever eaten. There is nothing on the menu that I didn't enjoy. I have been going there since it opened and it pleases me to see they are getting the recognition they deserve. Jerry and his mom Alice are always gracious as well as all of the other counter staff. I return as often as possible.

Before going to The Great Greek I thought I knew what a good gyro was. As it turns out, I didn't know jack.   Their gyros have incredibly moist and tender meat, crisp veggies, yummy tzatziki and blanket soft pita bread. The feta fries are a great mix of crunchy, salty and tangy. Their rice bowls are really good too!   If you come during busy times, you may have trouble finding seats. It can get packed as they only have limited seating inside. They do have an outdoor seating area but it's probably not the best during the summer. You know, Vegas heat.   They have the whole Greek vibe going with the music and decor. You can call in orders for pick up as well. Friendly service every time.   It's probably a good thing that they're not too close to where I live or work, otherwise I'd find myself there three times a week!

I eat at this place regularly.  They have even catered a couple of events for me.  I have to say that it is the authenticity of the food and the service we get from Gerry that keep us coming back here!  You have to go at least once...You will be hooked!

Let's just say I could be in trouble as this place is basically right across the street from my house.  So I might be spending a lot more time there soon.    Went there for the first time today for lunch.  I had the chicken souvlaki plate which came with either french fries or rice, Greek salad, Tzatziki sauce and pita bread.  I choose the french fries for my plate.  I love it that I have choices on what sides I want on my plate.    It came with 2 skewers of chicken with like 6 pieces on each. The chicken tasted great and was cooked prefect.  The side Greek salad was real fresh with plenty of veggies and tasted real good.  The french fries were cooked prefect crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside.  The Tzatziki sauce was fantastic almost as good as my mom's.  The pita bread came out nice and warm and tasted good too.  I asked for extra onions on my salad and on the side which they gladly gave me no extra charge.  The plate cost $12.95 so price was not too expensive for all the food you get.  There was plenty of condiments, napkins and etc on the counter and on the tables. It was enough food to keep me full all day.  The guy that took my order was real nice and answered all my questions.  The food came out pretty quickly and looked nice.  The place was real clean plenty of different seating areas.  I will be back for sure as a matter of fact thinking about going there for lunch tomorrow already.
The feta fries were delicious! The pita was soft and complimented the gyros perfectly.

Was craving the (gyro) sandwich and went here to get the (gyro) plate.Have got the plate before and it was good? This time i went for lunch alone and got the plate to go with extra pita. Got home and the Gyro was plain? (no veggies)  I mean onions or tomatoe? Who makes a Gyro like that ? or do you have to ask for onion and tomatoe..I thought that was part of the sandwich..Very disapointed..I have to say the youg man at counter was polite and opened the carry out box for me to see before leaving , I assumed that the veggies were buired in there some were, so i took it. If the Owner was on top of the Kitchen stsaff (instead of hugging the guest in the dinng room) and making small talk, The food woould be on point all the time ? Not hit and miss  $10 is alot for lunch to get a Partial sandwich. I noticed the other times i came here and the (owner) was in the Kitchen the orders came out correct.

I've had my fair share of Greek food and this place was great.  I had the Gyro plate and it was too much to eat in one sitting.  My wife enjoyed the Chicken Souvlaki and the kids had chicken skewers.  Nobody left the place hungry.  Get there early though because the restaurant isn't very big but it was packed at 6PM on a Tuesday.  We ordered some baklava to go for later that night and it was awesome.  I really like baklava but am often disappointed at restaurants because the phyllo is soft and mushy because it has been sitting around too long.  The phyllo in this baklava was light and crisp and the filling was so sweet, even maybe too sweet if that's possible.  If you are looking for good food in Henderson you can't go wrong with The Great Greek.

I discovered the Great Greek about 3 months ago and have been back every week since.  Easily the best Greek food I have found in Las Vegas, and possibly even the US.  Every dish is outstanding, and the specials are always great as well. 4 to 5 star presentation and taste and 2 star prices.  Definitely a must go.
Went for dinner and was pleasantly surprised. It's a very small place but the food was amazing! People were very friendly and service was great. Prices were very good and portions were large.

This place is absolutely delicious! I had the hummus and pita bread, which were both perfect. I also had the greek bowl with falafel and it was the best falafel I've had since getting the real deal in Cairo. The bowl was huge, enough for 2 people. I loved the dressing they used, very simple, but great flavor!   The only downside it the lengthy wait to get your food, but for this freshness and quality I will gladly wait! They did bring out the hummus quickly though, so we had something to snack on at least.

By far the best Greek food I've had in the valley, and anywhere else for that matter. I've never been to Greece though. Limited menu compared to most Greek restaurant's, but everything on the menu, and I've tried 98% of it, has amazing flavor! Fresh ingredients, good size portions packed full of meat and not just a salad on a pita. Prices are comparable to any other place, but worth every penny. The staff push this place over the top! You can definitely see and feel in their demeanor and attentiveness that they care about their product and are appreciative of your business. Can get packed during peak hours, but worth the wait. Closed on Sunday's, but I'm cool with that. It's sooo good, I'm salivating writing this review! Make sure you live near by because once you try them, you'll drive completely across town to get your fix, no joke.
Small restaurant, but great find.  Food is always fresh, and the feta fries are amazing!
Consistently great food. Always busy and the service is exceptional. Fresh vegetables and meat cooked to order. Love it!

I'm really not sure why it has taken me so long to review The Great Greek, we first ate there probably close to 6 months ago. We were in the process of buying a new car at the nearby auto mall and came here on our "solo" test drive. I guess they were really close to closing for the night, but one of the workers saw us at the door and came over to let us in. Once we got our food, it was so delicious! The staff is very nice and helpful and the place is also very clean. I will definitely try this place again next time I'm in the area.
This place is amazing!!!! The owners are really nice and the food is delicous. This is one of my favorite places to go with my husband.

Been here several times now. Great service, even though it gets crowded. Still pretty quick. Food is fresh and delicious. Love the gyro, and the skewers. Oh yeah, get the Feta Fries!!!  Yum!  My GF who never liked Greek food loves it here. Regulars now.

The Great Greek is a clean, well established semi-fast food eatery. The owner and workers are extremely professional and very friendly. The food is always prepped with high standards with top notch, hand-selected produce. I usually get either of beef/lamb Gyro, chicken plate, Salmon plate and their feta fries. One of the biggest things here is consistency and quality. A lot of other stores start lowering their quality once they have established their customer base, but i have been coming to this place for the past 2.5 years and they have always been top notch.
We are happy that we found this place! When my mom in law is in town she likes to eat there. We get the hummus, yummy, gyros. The staff is always great.

A little expensive but the food was good.  I would go to again but would definitely share a plate as the portions will serve two for lunch.  Yes it was my first visit.  My friend took me as I didn't even know you were located there.
Stopped in on our way back from Hoover dam. Friendly spot. Generous portions of Greek salad. Tasty gyros. Loved the feta fries!

Always amazing and always quality.  These guys really care about their business.  They go above and beyond to make sure the food is right, that you get what you want in a very clean and friendly enviroment.  We go all the time and will continue to do so

Awesome crew! Direct, but friendly. The food was excellent. I got the large Greek salad with two sides of the gyros.   I wish they had more space to hold more tables. Seeing them do so well on Yelp I am sure they will be expanding in the future.

Best Greek food in town my family and I drive from Summerlin to this location the staff is friendly and the food is outstanding very busy around lunchtime which proves the great food here will be back very soon.
best place ever. gerry get to class at the pit vegas!
This is by far my favorite greek restaurant in Vegas. Easy take out and great service!

Date night with the kids, they were hungry so we had to stay close to home and it could not be a huge wait... I yelped (thank you yelpsters for all of your continued help!) and found The Great Greek... not the one I keep reading about on your way to Cali that makes me drool just from the descriptions... but there's a NEW ONE here in Henderson on Warm Springs!!  Immediately I begin talking the 8 year old (newly picky eater) into the fabulous foods that await him, and my hubby and I repeat lines back and forth of 'My Big Fat Greek Wedding' (oh, if only you knew how close this is to our lives!) including "YOU DON'T EAT NO MEAT! That's okay, I cook lamb for you."    We get there and there is not an empty seat in the house, and you can smell the goodies from the kitchen, and they have the desserts right by the cash register to get your saliva flowing!  We ordered the "Family of 4 Platter"  (approx $45) and as our luck would go, as we filled our glasses, a table opened up!    Almost immediately the salad showed up, simple with bright flavors that totally complimented one another, that even the 4 year old inhaled (and he is strictly a carbs/sugar kind of kid!)  Then the platters came out, and kept coming!  We had ordered a huge platter of the BEST french fries I think I have ever had, seriously! And then 4 heavenly Gyro's (2 chicken, 2 lamb/beef) on "MELT IN YOUR MOUTH" soft pita's, seasoned to perfection and oh so tender, and topped with the best goodies... and HUGE, did I mention how HUGE everything is?  To top it all off we had 4 desserts that came with the platter, so we tried multiple Baklava and Shamali, that with one bite made our eyes roll back and a low "ummmmm" sigh release from the adults at the table!  The food was beautiful, and tasted amazing.  What a treasure to have here in our little valley, that I KNOW we will visit often.  My husband is amazing at packing in the food, and even he stopped 3/4 of the way and said he was done, he was so stuffed!   KUDOS to The Great Greek!

The Great Greek never disappoints. The food is excellent--I recommend the classic greek salad with added chicken kabob--and the employees are always friendly. Never had a bad meal there in the 2+ years I've been going regularly. A must-stop for fans of Greek cuisine, whether you're a local or just stopping by!
Amazing Mediterranean food, I love to seat on the patio and enjoy the rice bowl with shrimp and falafel. The baklava is to die for...

Best Greek food, in town. I live on Ft. Apache and Blue Diamond, and I will gladly drive to this place for the best gyro in town. The food couldn't be fresher and the tastier, it is literally perfect. After having married into a Greek family, I can say, without a doubt, this is the best Greek food, I can eat, outside of homemade that meets all the requirements for true, fresh, Greek cuisine. Just writing this, makes me wanna drive down and eat it, again!
Best place on town.  Everything on this'd u is good. The owner is nice and runs the front counter. Sitting outside right now enjoying the fountains and good food. Enjoy!

We've been coming here for years and normally have had wonderful service and food, but after tonight I don't think I will ever go back.  Three of us walked in and saw an open table and one of us sat down.  We were rudely kicked out of that table to accommodate another party that was ordering right a head of us.  One person of that party  had already sat down at another table and they were in the process of ordering.  Our party was in line to order behind them.  The staff RUDELY told us we couldn't sit there because we hadn't yet ordered (as mentioned our party was in line waiting to order next).  Both parties were 3 people and we were told to sit at a small table for 2 so the other party could have the bigger table.  It was made to be a huge rude deal.  I've never been treated so rudely at any restaurant.  If seating is that important here maybe they should get a hostess to seat you.  We walked out and I doubt we will be back.  What a disappointment.  They just lost the 3 of us and all our friends that have been coming here for years!  I see they are building a new restaurant on the SW side and I was going to recommend it to all my friends over there, but not after tonight!

I ordered the gyro for $5 (only from 3-5 pm) and it was the most amazing gyro I have ever had. AMAZING. I was so very full afterwards. The price for the quality was absolutely delightful.  There was lots of feta cheese which I loved. Might i mention the feta fries were exceptionally YUMMY. Unfortunately and sadly enough, I was too stuffed to finish them. Doesn't mean I didn't keep trying! So many fries and so delicious. The melted cheese on top was perfect.   Might I mention their service was some of the best. The lady at the front is so sweet. I once called and asked if it was possible to make a gyro bowl in  5 minutes and I don't know how they did it, but THEY DID IT! Love this place!!!!!! I give the gyro 5 stars! I still have yet to try any other dishes. BEST GYRO I'VE EVER HAD.

Best gyro I've had in Vegas (or Henderson). The food does not disappoint. I haven't had anything bad from here. they make the gyro well with good tatziki and perfect gyro meat. Even the side salads are authentically Greek tasting with a kalamata garnish. Worth visiting. The service is usually pretty slow, and it's obviously a family joint, as I always see the mother and son arguing. Other than that, it's a good one!

finally i found a greek restaurant in town that i can love. the service was excellent. the food, great. i got the gyro combo with fries and side salad! yum!  i ordered a chicken souvlaki (a side for $3.00) and got a small chicken breast instead , dont get me wrong! it was delicious! i just thought it was way too expensive for the size i got. i want to go back soon! oh, and very clean! great job guys!
The GREAT Greek is worthy of its name would love to have this restaurant near me! Definitely worth it.

This place was filled with huge delicious plates and great customer service!  The gyro plate, the salad and rice bowl, and the gyro wrap were enormous. We were barely able to eat half, but we wish we could have eaten more because it was amazing.  The gyro was well done, sliced thin with no fat, and the pita was light and fluffy. I decided to have the rice pilaf with the gyro plate instead of fries, and I would highly recommend it. The gyro plate and gyro wrap both came with Greek salads which were filled with a lot of veggies, olives and feta.  I have had a lot of Greek salads, but this had to have been one of my favorites.  While we were eating, a gentleman at the table next to us said that the food is always amazing and that he had even had them cater for him.  In addition to the delicious food, the woman we ordered with was extremely friendly and added to our experience.

Love this place! My boyfriend and I split the gyro and the chicken plate. Everything was amazing and the prices are really reasonable for the amount of food you get. I had a glass of wine with dinner as well and I think we only spent around $25 or $30. We were going to save some for leftovers but ended up eating everything because it was so good! We will definitely be back!

Fabulous Greek food.  I eat Greek food quite often because I grew up on it so I do know the usual spots on California to go for great Greek food, so The Great Greek was a surprisingly good find for when I'm in Nevada.

The Great Greek is an outstanding choice for anyone who likes great food.  I guess if you're Greek it is just a bonus.  The food is tremendous, their soup is really good, their fries are some of the best in town and I just had their chicken sandwich with feta cheese and spinach and it was very good, and very filling as well.  If you have never been here, you'll want to come back before you leave.  Check it out!!!

I thought the flavors were great the food was very fresh and homemade the Falafel was moist and tasty smooth and not gritty I was very happy and impressed to eat here the only downside I would say what's the price a little on the expensive side for what kind of food you get that's still relatively worth it
My favorite place to eat in the area. They have the best Greek salad and I especially like it with steak. The staff is also very friendly.

Simply the best Greek restaurant in Las Vegas! I tried pretty much everything from the dips to the baklava (dessert)!  But what keeps bringing me back (aside from the outstanding service, is the gyro and my favorite menu item, the rice bowl . The produce is super fresh ,the dishes are so tasty and they are extremely generous with the portions for the price!!  That makes this place one of my top restaurants in town.  What makes a good dinning experience is also the service .The owner is really  sweet, always smiling, running everywhere to make sure every customer is happy.  Great Greek is the way to go!!! Two thumbs up !!!

The Great Greek is a great casual restaurant for a get together with friends. All of their items are super delicious, but my favorite is the gyro platter! I've been coming here since opening day, and any time I'm in Henderson, I'll definitely be back. Their service is a little slow (as in you should probably sit down and eat in) so if you were hoping for a fast in and out joint, this place might disappoint.

This place is awesome. So are the best gyros and definitely the best feta of fries. The guys behind the counter are great help. There's always an older man an older lady around the dining area every time I go. I think they must be the owners. They walk around asking us how was everything. And is there anything they can do to make our experience better. It's a feel-good place.

Food is great but the service sucks! I ordered two items for to-go during lunch time. A party of 7 people came after me and they got their food first. I ordered the same thing. When I approached the cashier/waiter/busser, the bald guy, he gave me an attitude. I asked what was taking long and his remark was (it's only been 18 minutes). The cooks heard him and looked at me from the window. The other lady worker apologized. I wanted to ask the bald guy how long his lunch break was and if he could scarf down the food in 12 minutes.   Update: I went back 8/3/17 and the service was amazing and dinner was awesome. Will be back :)

Writing this as I wait for my son to finish up his meal here. I couldn't leave without making sure to say just how fantastic this place is! The menu has a nice variety and makes it easy for vegetarians & vegans with little symbols on their items. Staff were all friendly and knowledgeable. The restaurant is clean & tidy and they have plenty of seating, including an outdoor patio. Our table tried the Greek salad, a falafel pita,the mezze plate (enough for two to share or one as a meal if you want to try a bit of everything vegetarian) and the baklava. We had zero complaints and will definitely be back!

Henderson has some pretty stiff competition in a very small area: Kyklos, Greek Bistro and The Great Greek. Personally I prefer Greek Bistro and Great Greek because Kyklos is good and priced around the same as the other two but sits in the Galleria mall so my mindset is fast-food Greek.   Where to start! The hummus and pita was very enjoyable, great flavors and not overpowered with lemon as some other places do. The chicken and steak shewers with rice & salad were incredible. The steak was nice and tender, the rice was perfect and the salad had a perfect blend balsamic vinegar dressing. The chicken gyro was quite tasty but thought it had a tad bit too much tzaziki sauce. I walked away so stuff that I was popping Tums later that night but that experience hasn't prevented me from wanting more. The cashier was incredible, which I'm sure was probably the owner or owner's wife. Oh bring a jacket because I was freezinggggggg while we ate so the food got cold, thus the reason for knockin off a star.  Great place for Greek food but I like how there's the Greek triangle near the Galleria mall. If you don't like this place, try Kyklos in the mall or Greek Bistro by Sunset!

I'm new to the area,been here for about 4 months and have used yelp as a resource for eats. I decided to finally give great Greek a try and I've had Mediterranean food, I never had gourmet Gyro like this before. The lamb beef combo is tasty with the sauce and Greek yogurt,fresh  veggies. Quite the treat for under $13..I will definitely come back to try the lamb chops and hummus.
This place is Amazing! And Momma's rice pudding... Good god! Never not get the rice pudding!

Food was delicious! All that I expected from a gyro combo and more. The Greek salad had lots of flavor and generous amounts of veggies & feta. I highly recommend the feta fries. They are delicious! The customer service was excellent & very inviting. We'll def be back for more Greek goodies.
The food is always fresh and tasty.  We wish they expanded their menu.  The Great Greek should offer Lamb dishes to be authentic.

The Great Greek has gotten "too great" and now it's so swarmed with people at lunch that the wait is 20-25 minutes and there's no place to sit when your food is finally ready.  I went in at 1:30 pm thinking I'd miss the "lunch rush," and it was still jammed with people. Don't get me wrong, their food is superb-- the rice bowl is delicious-- and the staff is super. The young man and young lady who wait tables are both very cordial, but it's still a ONE STAR for OVER-CROWDING.  The food doesn't matter when it takes 25 minutes to be served and only a half-hour lunch break.
Delicious food and excellent service from the young man and woman taking orders and waiting tables. Loved it all.

The Great Greek is as good as it gets. The food is amazing. Fresh, perfectly prepared, and huge portions. They also have a nice selection of beverages in addition to the everyday fountain drinks and iced tea. I bring the family often and get the family meal. We are a family of 5 and we always have tons of leftovers. My only complaint would be the small dining area. It's pretty small and there aren't too many options for parties of 3 or more. We have had to leave several times because there was nowhere to sit. Not much they can do about that since a crowd means customers, and they can't exactly make more room. Overall, fantastic food, and great service. I dream about the feta fries.

If you read no further, try the Feta Fries!  Cute and Clean little neighborhood restaurant. Menu is easy to follow and service was pretty good. Even though the manager was visibly stressed due to having to correct the kitchen staff on an order before us, she still greeted us at the register politely and with a smile! Picked our order up to-go and the place was still busy at 7:45pm! The to-go portions are huge, neatly packed, but it would be nice if they had included napkins. I would highly recommend trying the Feta Fries!

We stopped by this place while visiting from Portland, Oregon, after reading some great reviews. We were looking for something quick, delicious, and light since we were in town for a race and didn't want to eat typical "travel food". This place did not disappoint. I'm not a Greek food connoisseur but we have some pretty amazing restaurants back home, so I feel like I have enough street cred to say this place was amazing.   We had dolmades, chicken souvlaki, greay gyro, and some baklava. Yum, yum, yum. Moist and tangy dolmas. The chicken was just the right amount of salty/seasoned, and it was moist and tender! The baklava was perfect. Ooey gooey, sweet, and flaky on top. Not rich, just perfect.   Staff was friendly, too! Great service. HUGE servings. We were hungry, and we brought home half our gyro and souvlaki plate. We enjoyed a nice patio seat and relaxed while eating. The place was packed when we arrived and left, so that's always a good sign.   Highly recommend eating here!

If this place had a drive thru I would eat here every day!  I will not go on and on about the delicious food. because it is delicious.  One thing I really like is the outdoor seating. Not many places as cute as this in Henderson

This is the best Greek food I've had in a long time!  I got a Gyro Platter, and it comes with a yummy salad and fries - you can actually spend a bit more to have "Feta Fries" so I did that, and they were amazing!  No skimping on portions at this place.  The salad was awesome with oil and vinegar and enough to actually coat everything on it!  Gyro meat had a great flavor, pita bread was soft and fresh, and tzatziki sauce was awesome.  Nice staff, too.

I love the soup here. So, I will continue to come back (not sure if hubby will though). I  am always taken a back by the service though. We find  the 2 girls who bring the food out quite  abrasive and to be frank, rude.  We have overheard other diners saying the same while we are there.

I'm in Henderson on business and am so glad I found this place. I've eaten here once for dinner and twice for lunch. They have some vegetarian options that are actually delicious and satisfying. I especially liked the Greek Salad Wrap and the falafel rice bowl. And besides the delicious food, the staff is very friendly.
great place to grab lunch the salad's good and gryo's are really good as well
Thee best Greek food in the state! The Hummus is to die for. Always very fresh food and an awesome staff!

Sorry, I am GREEK, this will be considered MCDONALD's Greek Version. Save your money, it is mediocre @ best. I did tried twice, just to make sure I was given them the benefit of a cook off day. I guess it is o.k. if you do not know any better. If the owner worked for WYNN, no wonder he does not work there anymore.

One word. BOMB. 1st timer at a Greek mediterranean restaurant all though I had Gyros b4. Found out I been pronouncing it wrong this hole time but let's get to the point. Food was excellent, friendly service, definitely a Henderson crowd favorite. If u want to dine it, it's hard to find a seat during prime lunch hours. But 5 stars all the way.

Awesome Greek food! Its now my new favorite place to eat Greek food. The food is amazing but so are the people who were there. They are so nice and friendly. Also the atmosphere was amazing. You cannot go wrong by eating here!

I have been here several times and the food is always outstanding.  I only tried a handful of items on their menu because it is so hard to try something else when your 'Go-To' item is so delicious. The Greek Salad Wrap is delicious and satisfying without meat and the 'Rice Bowl' with shrimp is a delicious amalgamation of everything delicious-seasoned rice, veggies, shrimp, and a side of tzaziki.  My co-worker and I went here for lunch today because they have the best chicken salad (Greek Salad w/ Grilled Chicken Breast). The young man that took our order brought us a complimentary side of their amazing feta fries because the kitchen made an extra order- This is the kind of thoughtfulness that makes customers for life!  A variety of options for vegetarians and pescatarians too.
This place is sooo good! Im from Arizona, cant find nothing similar to it! Best i ever had!!
Always really fresh and awesome food , I can't help but to order the same thing .... I  CRAVE it! It's the best Greek place ice been to in Vegas !!

My wife and i were intending to go to jasons deli which is in the same shopping center. Too crowded so we decided to try the Great Greek Im glad we stumbled on this gem   Great food with wonderful service.  Clean.   We both had grilled chix skewers with rice and greek salad.  Very good flavor.  My wife also had the rice pudding which she loved.  Staff attentive and polite. They clearly take pride in their shop, and focus on excellent customer service.  Cant wait to go again.

So good and you can tell the food is made from quality ingredients! Our favorites are the gyros and the feta fries, which are definitely worth the upgrade. The tzatziki sauce is really good, as is their Greek yogurt dip. I love their pita bread, it's so fresh and soft! This is our go-to place when we want Greek food!

Finally...a "good" Greek restaurant on this side of town!!! I met a friend there for lunch today because it was highly recommended. Looking at the menu, I knew I was in trouble and if I liked the food, would probably have to come back at least 20 times.   I ordered the avgolemono soup and the dolmathes. Both were very good. The soup was similar to my dad's, it has the right amount of lemon, not too much chicken and not too watery, not too thick...just right. The dolmathes were tasty and easy to eat. They weren't too vinegary like some places and the grape leaves were nice and fresh where some places are all tough and stringy. I also tried my friend's spanakopita, which was by far much better than other Greek places around here. Not only is the food better, but the prices are also much better than the other Greek places out here. Being Greek, I'm obviously picky about my Greek food. Next time I come here, I'll try the pastitsio, then I'm trying a burger because the Greeks make the best burgers and we need more good burger joints out here.  The service is very good. They are very friendly and yes, when my friend at the table behind me dropped his napkin, the owner was immediately over with a replacement. Now that's service.
Best gyro in the Valley, and the specials are always delicious, especially the pork chops. Beer & wine is very affordable, Deven high quality food for great prices

They have the best Greek food here, everything we have tried is awesome.  I highly recommend getting the feta fries instead of regular fries if you get a side order.  The only thing is the kitchen seems too small for the amount of orders they get.  I have waited more than 30 minutes for my food on more than one occasion.  Beware, they get very busy.  I suspect that people got tired of waiting for their order and started calling in their order, because the entire time you are waiting you see tons of people coming in to pick up their large phone orders to go.  No matter what, the staff has always given nothing but the best service and the food is always consistently good.  I am going to phone in my order from now on instead of popping in for a quick bite, because that is almost never the case here.

This was the first Greek food I have ever tasted and I must say wow. I may not be an expert in Greek cuisine but I know what good food tastes like.  I got the Great Gyro with lamb and feta fries combo. It was one of the best things I have ever tasted, EVER. It was $11, but worth every penny and then some.  They definitely made a good impression on me, and they have made a new repeat costumer.
Got a lamb plate , it's was good,but  it's was raw in side ,  the rice it's not real and was very very salty . Salad it's was very nice. Next time have to try chicken!!!
i am a huge fan of mediterranean food.... this place is amazing...great food, super nice staff and great pricing. sorry crazy pita....you lost me to the great greek mediterranean  grill!

Stopped by around 6pm and ordered The Great Greek Gyro ($7.95) with chicken.  Unfortunately It took somewhere between 20-25 minutes to get my food!  This would have been okay at a sit down restaurant but at a order at the counter sort of place I feel that 25 minutes is way too long. Seemed a little unorganized between the kitchen and cash register which really shouldn't have been going on considering there were only about 4 tables full and a few to go orders placed.   I was pretty HANGRY (hungry and angry) by the time I got home but after my first bite almost all was forgiven!! Delicious chicken with just the right amount of feta and tzatziki sauce! Probably the best gyro I have ever had so despite how long it took I have to give the Great Greek 4 stars and return again hoping for faster service. During the long hiatus before I got my food I also noticed that they had a great beer selection (Hoegaarden, Guiness, IPA, Stella)  so maybe I will come back for a sit down with a gyro and beer next time.
Food was outstanding.  Well worth the wait! Nonstop customers!

This restaurant reminded me of the cultural of Greece - inexpensive, casual, and  running on its own clock (read as SLOW). The food is delicious and worth the wait, just don't expect to be in and out quickly. The baklava is also delicious and heavy on the walnuts which is always good (and the expensive part of baklava).

This is my favorite Greek  place in Vegas ...100% for food and really good  service. I visited 2 stores Henderson and then new one the same food ...The new one is bigger and more tables and outdoor sits .

This place has some of the best Mediterranean food in the area. We usually get the chicken souvlaki plate, but the gyros, soup, and the falafel are all really good. They only thing about this place is that it's small, so seating can be hard to come by. Worth a wait, though.

I can't rave enough about this place. The food is delicious, and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable about the food. We've had the shrimp and the souvlaki, both were tender, juicy, and delicious. The portions were also great. If you love Greek food, affordable prices, and a great atmosphere I would highly recommend this place.

Its Friday.  I'm not too fussy, but Mr M challenges me with the choice of Mediterranean or Cantonese.  A couple of checks on Yelp means we can't find a Cantonese we haven't already tried, so The Great Greek was the target.  Nice little cafe-style casual place, and all the tables except one are full.  Place was super clean, staff were lovely.  Mr M had gyro plate and I got Mezze plate.  Good sized portions, and fresh Greek side salads.  Hummus/Tzatiki (sp??) were pretty nice and pitta bread hot and bendy.  I overheard another family leave and say "man, that was good, we'll be back".  I agree.
Wanted something different AND THIS PLACE HIT THE SPOT! Took it home and once my roommates saw my food they drove straight to it to get their own falafel wrap.
Uh-mazing!!!!!! Simply the greatest Greek food in town!

Delicious! I loooove Greek food and was very pleased with the efficiency of this establishment. I've been to Greece and the food, especially the Avgolemono soup, was PERFECT. Service was on par and overall the experience was great. Will be back in the future :)
I had ordered The Great Greek Gyro with Grilled Chicken and Feta Fries. It was delicious!
The best gyros. The lemon soup is killer. The greek salad is so fresh. And the baklava, heaven. They give the best customer service. I wish there was a second location!

We have been here many times, and love it.the food is excellent and fresh.  And, their service is always top notch.  It is a small place, so seating is sometimes in short supply.  They also appear to do a lot of carry out business.  They offer the best Greek food that we have found in the area.
Love this place! Great service and great food! Been im here twice in less than 24 hrs.

This is one of the best Greek restaurants in the entire Vegas area. I've never had a bad experience here. The salads are amazing and the Grilled Garlic Shrimp plate is my favorite entree. Go here if you love great food!
Amazing food with a Mom and Pop atmosphere.  Vegas doesn't have enough small chow spots like this.  We love this place!

3 stars for the food, minus 2 star for service. They have good food but service is terrible. We are a regular. We use to go there at least 2x or more a week. What disappointed us was they forgot to put in our order, We waited for over an hour. We understand it was very busy at after 7pm and it's a to go order but we waited for over an hour to almost closing and still no food. They did nothing but to rush to make our order right before they close. I am all about second chances. We went back and the same thing happen again. This time, it's not a to go order and not at 7pm. It was early in the evening. We waited for over 30 minute, and all the customer came after us got their food. I asked what happen to our order. They forgot about us again. What the heck. If you don't have enough people in the kitchen, hire more people or don't take any more orders if you can't handle it. We still come here but not as much as before. I don't want to starve us or give someone more business if they can't handle it.
Everything about this restaurant deserves five stars.  This family deserves all the accolades.  The food, the service, the quality and the cleanliness keep me going back for more.

Fresh ingredients, clean casual bright restaurant, friendly owner and staff. My favorite Greek restaurant in town. Will not try a different place, no neeed to. I usually order the Beef gyro combo with greek salad but the chicken souvlaki with rice pilaf is also fantastic!
The food is always good, but our carryout took 30 minute. She needs more help out front. There were 3 people in the back, but how long can it take to get 2 orders of soup and salad?  30 minutes?
This is by far the best Greek food I have experienced to date! It will be insanely hard to top the freshness and quality that these guys provide.
Delicious gyros!  The staff is very friendly and helpful!  Not only are they friendly but the service is very quick.

Tried this for the first time over the weekend. Based on all the other reviews, we tried the lamb-beef gyro, which was really good. I liked the thick slices of meat and that the gyro was packed full. Have had gyros at other places in the past that have such dry meat. The Great Greek knows how it's done! We also grabbed a couple of sides of grilled chicken skewers for our kids, and they shared our fries. The chicken  was buttery, lemony, garlicky good. Wasn't a thing left over. Really want to try their famous rice pudding, as well as their veggie app platter next time.

The Great Greek offers up so much flavor, that Flavor Town has a new capital building.  HANDS DOWN, the best fries in this whole town... Feta Fries. FETA TO THE DOME! The Pita is warm and fresh, the Chicken and Gyro are delicious.  The Salad portions are perfect.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  You will most likely have to wait to find a table, as this place is on the small side, and the secret is out, but defintely worth the visit.

This place is great.  I wish I would have found it sooner. The chicken gyro is the best. I never had walnut baklava, but after reading the reviews I decided to try it.  Boy am i glad I did. It was delicious. At first I was skeptical, because I hate walnuts. I am glad i tried it. The food was so good I ate there 2 days in a row. I am going to have to control myself, if I don't I will be eating there tomorrow. Normally I would be embarrassed eating in one place so many days in a row, but it's worth it. See ya tomorrow.
Food was fresh and resonabley priced never had greek food before but would definitely try again.

Never had a bad experience with the employees or the food. This no doubt the freshes salad you will every eat.  We work close and Alice (owner/cashier) knows who we are by name and what our order will be before we tell her.  Ok we are creatures of habit but when you find what is exceptional why order anything else. The side salad with grilled chicken is huge. The sandwich's are delicious and large portions. If you don't experience the feta fries you are missing out.  Lunch time is very busy which to me is a good thing, it means they serve great food. Just call ahead an order, they open at 11am and we call for a pick up time an it is always ready. They have a nice patio when it is not too hot.  Sorry to hear some people had a poor experience, all I can saw is try them again, you won't be sorry.  Karen

Greek food is my favorite and I tend to crave it like a pregnant woman almost daily! And the Great Greek always hits the spot, always!! Hands down this is my favorite restaurant in town and the value here is unbelievable.  The ingredients are always fresh and I have tried a variety of options from the menu. The pasticcio, to the gyro, to the salads, to the Mezze plate and the specials are all phenomenal. Usually even when a place impresses, there is always a but involved, but not here. This place is the best! Zack gives great customer service and his smiling face is almost always here!

I eat regularly at this food. The food is great and the ingredients are good. It is a family owned business with an Old World feel to it. The service and decor are average but the food is excellent. I highly recommend the chicken kabobs and the eggplant appetizer. Definitely a treat for the taste buds

This place is great! It is small, so sometimes seating is limited. But since we have mostly nice weather year round- out door seating is available. I love this place, I love the staff, and the food has never dissapointed! I haven't been back since I have gone vegan, but I am sure there are options.

Amazing. From the moment you walk in the decor is fresh and slightly urban with an incredibly inviting.  The staff is super polite and helpful.  The food is fantastic. Two can split many of the entrees.   I can't wait to return!

The guy behind the counter, the owner's son?, is fabulous.  Great disposition.  Part of the experience.  The food was great.  Very tasty.  Had the baklava ice cream.  It is FABULOUS.  Definitely will come back.

My parents are always ordering take out from here on a weekly basis so when I am in town visiting we always stop and grab their Greek Salad which is the best Greek salad I've had.  So good that I had it twice in one week and I almost went here today again lol.    I can't speak on their other dishes but since my parents are always coming here and order more than just the salad I have to believe that this spot is good!

Ohhhhh yeah. This is my kinda place!  As an avid lover of greek food, The Great Greek delivers. On this particular day, I was here with a man friend and we were lucky enough to score the last table. I will say, a place that gets this busy needs more seating. That is a good thing for them, but not so good for the poor business guys that walked in and were desperate for a table.  I get it though. The place is yummy!  I had a gyro and their fries covered in feta and my friend had a plate with gyro meat. The is the real deal. Right off the spit. Doesn't get much better.  Service wise, they were very nice. They have a lot of people working back there but they seem to have it down. Prices are reasonable, especially for the quality! I didn't notice the Spanakopita until after I ordered but if they have that next time, MARK ME DOWN!!!!

I used them to cater my 4 salon's Christmas lunches on all corners of town. Not only was the food delicious, it was hot , they showed up on time with everything that was needed. The staff goes out of thier way to make sure you are very well taken care of from the planning to the delivery.  Thank you Great Greek.  Studio Salons

This place gets a lot of great reviews which is why I visited, but I have to say the gyro meat was simply too salty.  The hummus, however, was very good.    I will try it again when I am in Vegas, but I will pass on the gyro.

I must admit I'm addicted to gyros.....so of course I love this restaurant! It's a little small (seating only for about 20 or so), but the food is absolutely awesome and extremely affordable.  I was able to feed my family of 4 for under $50. We didn't leave the place hungry, either. In fact, my youngest daughter needed a to-go box.

Holy smokes! What a treat. Beef/lamb gyro was delicious but the feta fries were even more amazing. The owners are so friendly and warm. We felt like family. Don't let the strip mall appearance deceive you. Super-cool for dine in or take out. Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll seek this out again.
Good food! I went with bunch of my classmates after an exam and reunion. I ordered the great greek gyro and it was the best!

A great place for a quick take out or eat in lunch. Gyro's are large and tasty. Greek salad is excellent with lots of feta. The spanokopita was reheated in the microwave so was not the crispy phyllo that it should be. Baklava is classic and tasty. Disappointed that there is no moussaka on the menu. Fast service from nice people. Small inside dining area and nice patio as well.

YUM. Go try this food!!! This is some of the best Greek food I've had, and I've tried a lot! The avgolemono soup was awesome and definitely ranks high up there on some of the best I've tried. The tzatziki was just perfect, and not overly garlicky. The marinated chicken skewers were d-e-l-i-c-i-o-u-s.....tender, juicy, savory, and just delectable. The rice that came with the chicken was also amazing...buttery, flavorful, and so so good.  It looks like a family run place, and they're very service oriented. Very nice ambiance too--casual and modern, but still inviting enough to stay and eat. Highly recommended!!!
We really enjoy the food and the service at this cafe. Great portions, great price, great people. Did I mention they have the best baklava EVER! Yum yum yum! I can't wait for our next visit.

Always busy, and there's good reason!  Previous owners of The Fat Greek restaurant off Flaming/Decatur they have experience and heritage backing the booming reputation.   This is a quaint cafe and location with indoor and patio seating. If you're looking for "affordable, quick, healthy and fresh" Greek food that is pleasing to the palate, this is the place!
Love the selection of their foods... their meat is not dry (compare to the other stores) ,all the sides are goid as well... love the interior design as well...

My husband and I were ready to eat at the Great Greek for lunch. While he was in line to order our food I sat at the only table that was available, then one of the employees came up to the table and told me I could not sit there and that I had to give it up for the people who ordered before me. Is that correct? Can they order people not to sit at a table? In addition to being hungry, we were now upset and walked out. I think this was rude and uncalled for. I've never experienced such a thing at other restaurants. This is unfortunate because we have eaten there before and enjoyed the food but this experience has discouraged us from returning.

Fresh delicious Mediterranean food. Try the classic Greek salad with the add-on chicken or salmon skewer.   Well designed eating area. Outdoor seating also available.   We really needed a good quick easy restaurant choice on this side of town. Right in Blue Diamond.   It truly is great!
By far, my favorite place to each in Henderson.  Their food is extremely fresh.

When we got here, I was worried because of how busy it was. No problem, the staff had everyone happy and taken care of in no time. Apps came faster than it took to wash my hands. Since it was my first time, I got the gyro plate and the meat was as good as I've ever had. (The hummus too for that matter) however, the gold medal went to the baklava ice cream. If you were staying anywhere in Clark county, this little spot is worth the trip.

Love, love ,love this place. In my humble opinion this is the best greek place in Valley. My husband and I go there almost every week (it's a little ambarrasing ) and so far food quality and service has not change. Just excellent as usual.The name Great Greek speeks for itself! Thank YOU!
So fresh and delish.  My husband and my favorite lunch spot on the weekend.  Closed Sundays :(

I love this place!  The food is great, the service is great, the overall atmosphere is really nice! There isn't anything I have had that I didn't like. They have some of the best Hummus and Melizanosalata (roasted eggplant puree) - it is addicting. I always end up ordering the Dolmades with my meal too.   They have a Greek Burger ($7.50), it has lettuce, tomato, red onion, feta cheese and tzaziki - the combination is amazing! If you are craving a burger and are looking for something a little different definitely get this.   You are always greeted with a smile when you go in there. They are very friendly and the service is fast. This a good place to go on a lunch break. You feel like you are part of the family when you are there.

This is 1 of my top 2 Greek places in the Southwestern US.   Good: 1) the portions; 2) price; 3) taste; and 4) service.  Ok: 1) limited seating.  I had the falafel pita (that comes with fries or salad...salad was good), a side of dolmades, and a baklava. Wifey had the gyro plate. They gave us feta fries by accident and it was on the house. The lady at the front of the house was super nice, patient and took the time to explain the menu. It's a little outside LV but definitely worth the trip.

We visited The Great Greek based on a recommendation from a friend a few weeks ago. I am so glad we found this place! My husband loved their gyro and I am in love with their chicken kabob plate and their hummus! Everything tasted very fresh and full of flavor. Although it was very busy and we had to sit outside, the service was great and it was worth the wait. I can't wait to go again! We tried to go last weekend and learned that they are closed on Sundays. Hope to revisit again soon.

I've driven by this place dozens of times and never even knew it was there.  Don't make my mistake by passing it by.  We went there on a weekday after work.  Glad we got there early for dinner because by the time we left there wasn't an empty table inside.  But fear not, there's plenty of tables outside.  The owners are fantastic and friendly, and have such an enthusiasm for their food you can't help but want to order everything, and we just about did.  The food was great, service was great, prices were good... we'll definitely be going back and will be regulars.
Iva and Jack did a great food service was delicious the  restaurant deserves more then 5 stars Can't wait to go back and try more of the traditional greek food .

There are 2 things that set this place apart from the rest. Food - The food is fresh and extremely tasteful. Lots of wonderful flavors. Staff - I think the staff who work counter and tables are also owners or at least they act like it. Super, super, super nice people. Always smiling, asking how are you doing and taking care of the customers. Ambiance - If you want glitter, go some place else. This place seats 35 people and the nose level is just right - Greek level. Lol

Hands down the best Greek grub in town   I'm trying to find something to complain about.  Wait I found it.  I'm going to go broke eating here.  Great staff   Quick service. Worst part that's it literally is a 5 minute walk from my house. I might have to chain myself to a chair so I cannot eat there everyday.  15 minutes till they open. Might have to ummmm.  Take a "stroll".   Stomach is growling now.
Everything on the menu is great. I've been there for lunch several times. My But I do avoid going there between noon to 1pm. The restaurant is small and it does get very crowded.

Food is excellent. Grilled steak melts in your mouth. The rice is the fluffiest (is that a word?) I've ever had. Yia Yia's Pasticcio is superb!! There are lots of regulars since the staff is on first name basis with everyone. What a great place!

DELICIOUS!! Everyone in my party loved their food. Great prices! $3.95 hummus? Small bowl, but sooo good and they offered an extra pita (warm and melt in your mouth) without us asking. My great Greek rice bowl was the perfect combination of flavors. Yum!

We've been eating here about once a week! So good! I usually get the chicken or steak skewer plate, and my boyfriend loves the lamb. All 3 are great and come with rice and salad. Tzatziki is good and so is the hummus! We love the Greek cookies and tried the baklava ice cream, which was yummy as well! So glad we found this place!

My go to place for gyros!! I can't find another place that comes close! The gyro meat is so tender and I love how they put the feta cheese on them at no charge. The sauce is very flavorful as well. Greek salad and feta fries are my two favorite sides. I definitely recommend trying this place if you haven't already done so. You won't regret it!

Two words... feta fries  I promise you, the photo doesn't do these fries justice. They're out of this world. And honestly, make up for the flavor lacking in everything else. The chicken was dry and the steak was very bland. I would say the meal was entirely subpar, however the fries and cookies are enough for me to come back.

Delicious. Great service. It can get packed here but it isn't uncomfortable. They also have a nice patio area which is great when the weather is nice. I've had a lot on their menu. The salad with chicken kabob and their gyros are near perfect. The only thing I have to complain about is that they only give you 4 pieces of pita when you order hummus and pita to go. It makes no sense because they give you a ton of hummus.

This is by far my favorite Greek place. I usually order the Great Greek chicken gyro combo with fries. The chicken in the gyro is well seasoned and cooked to perfection. It's topped with lettuce, tomatoes, red onions and a generous amount of tzatziki. The gyro holds well if you order to go, the fries not so much. The staff is very nice and the service is fast.

What we ordered: hummus and tzakiki with pita, shrimp plate with salad and rice and steak plate.  What we got: A MAJOR case of food poisoning. Within hours of eating dinner here, my mother and I both began a violent night in the bathroom. We were the only ones who ate the shrimp so we suspect they were undercooked or laden with toxins. It is five days since the exposure and we are both still having symptoms, which can vary in severity and time to recover based on how much toxic food you ingested.  I am writing this as a public service, and warning, to just say no and avoid this restaurant.

The Great Greek is a great place for eating with friends. The restaurant may feel a bit cramped when you first walk in, but there's plenty of space for seating. I ordered the gyro plate which came with sliced gyro, pita, and a choice of fries of rice pilaf. The gyro meat is very juicy and flavorful, although if you're watching your sodium intake you may want to pace yourself on the meat. The pita is soft and fresh, and the fries are delicious. Their menu has mostly standard Greek dishes, and my friends always invite me out to eat there. The food is priced in the $10-12 range, but the portions meet expectations.  The staff is very friendly. They would periodically stop by my table to ask if the food was alright and if we'd like anything else. There's no dedicated wait staff, but the service is greatly appreciated.  If you're looking for good Greek food, be sure to check out the Great Greek for a wonderful experience.

Authentic Greek food that tastes amazing! We have yet to dine in here but do call in for takeout. Have not had a bad thing yet. But true to most Greek places you'll be sure to find your salad on top of all of the hot things in your take out bag. That and the price is a little high is the reason for four out of five. You just have to ask them to bag your salad separate. Love that there is a good Greek place on the south west side of town now.
Excellent food. Great atmosphere. Great service. The BEST ice cream. My only negative is that I thought it was a tad over priced but it won't stop me from coming back!
Falafel pita was delicious!  Great service even though place was packed.  Love their order online option - easy to use.  Will return and recommend for sure.

I rated above 3 stars for being a LONG time customer of restaurant  i rated much higher but now quality of food & customer serve has gone down : we ordered food Tuesday this past week my wife ordered as usual from our car outside we waited 15 mins as informed i went early to pay as it was getting busy as usual ( too busy i guess) as the young lady took our order ny wife told her three time what we wanted and she repeated it back wrong my wife told her again as i picked it up she stated what we ordered but as we got hone it was wrong ( SURPRISE) we got shrimp skiers instead of steak I wish I am allergic to seafood so my wife had to eat both tramps without wanting to she called back to the store and the girl said that first you did and apologized and she did apologize that she missed heard and then she told the manager a whole different story as we asked to speak to the manager the young manager comes on the phone was no help whatsoever he was like didn't know what to do how to fix the problem all he said was come back and wish if we were right next-door would be fine but we lived a ways away and wanted to eat our dinner  (so bottom line we will go ELSE WHERE FOR OUR GREEK FOOD. ( also rice was SALTY) THANKS NICK FOR UR KIND COMMENTS & CONCERN ( i wish the manager was as well he was VERY UNCARING OR HELPFUL.
I usually always get the gyro, feta fries, and my gf gets the chicken souvlaki. Their Greek burger is not the best (had the fatty taste - not very appetizing).

My absolute go to! These guys are so friendly and the food is delish. The four dips with pita are everything. Their rice pudding is one of the best I've ever had (don't tell my Mom). I've yet to try a dish that doesn't meet or surpass my expectations. Keep doing what you're doing! You guys are awesome.  P.S. Sergio from EBC says 'Hi'! :)

This place is just as AWESOME as it's sister store on Blue Diamond.  I discovered the one on Blue Diamond about a month ago and fell in love with it.  I was told about the original location in Henderson and business took me to that side of town and I just had to try it.  It was amazingly good, just like the other one.  The Great Greek Gyro is just flat out great.  I have had both the beef/lamb and the chicken one.  I can't pick a favorite.  Do yourself a favor and get the Feta Fries.  Everything is so fresh and tasty.  The staff is super helpful and get the food out to you pretty quickly.  My only complaint is that there are not more of these around Las Vegas.

This place is AWESOME!!  I have been waiting for good Greek food to come to the Southwest and it is finally here.  The food is the freshest in Las Vegas.  I had the Great Greek Gyro and it was packed with flavorful beef/lamb meat.  It is clear that they make their own tzatziki sauce because it was just so fresh and tasty.  The cashier talked me into the feta fries and I will be indebted to her forever.  They are a must get every time.  My wife had a salad with a chicken skewer.  She hasn't stopped talking about it.  The veggies were so fresh and the chicken was tender and had great flavor.  Do yourself a favor and save some room for dessert.  The rice pudding and baklava ice cream are both outstanding.    The restaurant is clean and the decor is very tasteful.   The staff is super friendly and helpful and I just absolutely love this place.  Thanks Great Greek for making this my new favorite restaurant.

Visited recently due to my go to place being closed on Monday's. Was a little smaller than anticipated but was it was packed. Food was good, service was robotic and some items didn't come out (newer operation completely understand). Would visit again, but didn't take the number one place on my list of go tos.

We are visiting from out of state and wanted something off the beaten path. The food is fabulous and the best part was the baklava! It is to die for. You won't be disappointed if stop in for a bite to eat.

The restaurant was clean with a nice atmosphere. Staff was friendly and the service was fast.  Ordered the Great Greek gyro which was delicious.  Only downfall was it was a little pricey. We usually go to the Greek Bistro in Henderson for our favorite Greek food but this is a close second.
Amazing food. Yero & Yero salad were of the highest quality ingredients, fresh. & tasty. Excellent service.
Today I'm having the Greek salad with a side of hummus it was good the gyro was better and the service was good
Delicious and fresh . The staff is super friendly and helpful . Best gyros in LV hands down . Come get one SUCKA !!!

Love the food here! Some of the best Greek food I've had!!! But they only get 3 stars from me because the staff can be a bit pushy and rude, especially when they are busy. One time they even forgot about my Moms order and we had to argue with them about it for 10 minutes before they realized they were in the wrong. There seems to be a bit of a language barrier with some of the staff as well. However, I am likely to return because the food is just that good.
Excellent food and the service is awesome!  The baklava is at its very best and I recommend you taste it...you'll be hooked!
Order the great gyro with fries sooo good!!!  Very friendly  staff kept everything clean!
The food here is to die for!! Reasonable and great service!! Thanks to Jak for helping us with the menu. Must try

One of my favorite places to eat in all of Henderson, Las Vegas and Summerlin! Been coming here almost 10 years and can't believe I've never written a review. The best! Always super fresh, cooked perfectly, and very friendly service!!!

Genuinely Friendly and Courteous People Serving Great Greek Food!  Came here on a whim after looking for nearby establishments that maybe I had yet to visit. Don't know how I missed this place in the past. Arrived on a Saturday night close to closing time and was completely expecting some unhappy folks sorry to see me walk in the door. Much to my pleasant surprise I was genuinely greeted with a very pleasant lady whom I later found out was the owner. Spoke with the owner briefly and felt right at home. AT first glance it's easy to see they have good business sense shown by the fact that no corners were cut. The restaurant s done well, super clean and well kept. Even the business cards and brochures were well done, they even have a well made webpage....sorry but these things matter to me.  On to the more important things, the food! Outstanding food for a decent price. I ordered the Yia Yia Pasticcio, a very tasty pasta caserole with a very tasty Bechamel that is served with a side Greek Salad that eats like a meal itself. Also ordered The Athenian Burger that was topped with Feta and Tzaziki that didn't over power the burger but complemented the meat and allowing it to stand on it's own. Our final dish was the Chicken Santorini Sandwhich. The chicken breast used in this sandwhich does not seem to be of the food distribution variety. The Chicken was very moist and tender and was perfectly matched with  the fresh tomatoes and spinach.  Everything was homemade, fresh and made to order. Absolutely would recomend this place to anyone seeking a nice Greek meal kicked up a few notches.

I love, love, love this place!!!!  This is the hardest working restaurant family helping you get your Great Greek on!!!  I promise you, they will not disappoint!!!!         They are energetic and passionate about their heritage. They certainly show you why the family comes together around food!

Delicious food, quick service. What more could you want from a fast-food Greek restaurant? My only complaint is that it can be incredibly crowded during busy hours (good for them, bad for people looking for a seat). There is outdoor seating available, but it's way to cold to do that this time of year.

The lamb gyros were excellent and the side of soup was delicious. The prices were reasonable. The employees were very friendly and the restaurant was very clean. Finally, a good Greek restaurant that's not too far from the house.
The best Greek food on this side of town. My favorite is the rice bowl! It gets very busy during lunch hour, I recommend to go either before or after lunch.
Great food! Fast service! We will definitely come back again. The place is small, they definitely need to expand for more tables so people can sit down instead of taking your food to go.
Great food!!  But again had to park to find no seats and a line. Had to eat elsewhere again.  Empty store right next door. Expand please

When locals are greeted by name, families arrive for a low-key Friday night dinner together you know you come upon a restaurant worth consideration. With  days of three digit heat behind us the patio is definitely welcoming. Carry out is popular here and in the course of an hour to see half a dozen people walk out with three bags full is not uncommon.i've eaten Gryos here before and quite honestly that's why I came tonight. Later, as my mouth filled with the delicious flavors of lemon potatoes, roast leg of lamb and Greek salad I was all that more happy that I'm a flexible person when it comes to such decisions. Suffice it to say I'm one happy Colaneri camper tonight. Normally, I would also order baklava but the Greek cookies looks so fresh I had to give them ago. Now I'm waiting for a pot of coffee to brew and I'll enjoy my second cookie. Definitely worth your time and dining dollars.

My family and I go there probably once a month we love this place we've gone probably as many as 15 times I recommend this restaurant. The staff is very friendly the place is clean and the food is great.

We were traveling from the Bay Area to AZ staying in Henderson along the way.  Great Greek was recommended by yelp and we were very happy with it.  Some of  the best Greek food I've had anywhere (including East and West Coasts) and, as is usually the case, at a very good price.  Various nice touches in well know dishes.  Excellent pastry (filo) on the spanakopita that was a part of my mezze plate.  Kebab chicken (is the yellow from tumeric?) was particularly moist and tasty.  The wife (very discriminating) and son were pleased as well.

My co-worker recommended this place when he was training me on the job, I had only had Daphne's in so cal and had never really had Greek food. I was amazed at how good the beef lamb gyro was. Food is very fresh and the service is well above par. I feel like I am in Greece enjoying a great atmosphere and some good food while on my boat. I have been back several times and will continue to go back.    I highly recommend the feta fries they are very good. The baklava is also amazing.

The salad wrap is kind of amazing. The plates is delicious too. This place is a little busy and I feel uncomfortable eating inside surrounded by so many people, but there is plenty of seating outside.
This place is good for the price. The fries are Not bad, rice always cooked perfect. Gyros are consistently good. I'll go back when I'm near and craving a gyro.

I'm a huge fan of The Great Greek! It's been so fantastic having a new SW location that's just as great as the Henderson location. The food is always fresh and delicious.. amazing customer service as well!! Thank you Great Greek team!

Really bummed...I wanna like this place but after trying it 4 times now...I can say "meh. i've experienced better."   Maybe they hate me personally or something, but every time I go there they take FOREVER to bring me my food. First time, I was willing to over look assuming they were behind but this last time it was just ridiculous. They brought out various friends food orders (we were a group of 10) by the time mine came out, they had finished there food and started packing to go. Were talking 30 minutes between their food and mine.   Second thing, I got sick after the last time. I'm talking immediately--which disproves the possibility of me having a simple viral infection or something. Andddd I have a hardy stomach. That never happens to me!  Bummer since it's so close to my house, but we will be looking for a new Greek food place.

Food is great.. never had greek before. My 2nd fave dish after sushi.. i had grilled shrimp with rice. They also have salad with a meal.   One thing i dont like is the cashier and food server is the same person. You hold money then hold people's food, i find it unhygienic and inappropriate. Also she was sorting the utensils after doing cashier. Ugh..   Place is also small so it gets crowded.  Will definitely come back

the Great Greek Gyro was very filling (i couldn't finish it)...a little bummed they were all out of chicken, but the lamb was just as satisfying...the gyro was filled with fresh lettuce, tomatoes, red onions, feta cheese and tzatziki sauce...delish!

Some of the best Greek food I have ever eaten. You must try the feta fries if you go here! The pasticcio is the best! I have never seen this place without customers they stay very busy due to the good food. Service is good and they have outdoor seating for the days when its nice outside. I highly recommend!

Awesome, casual eatery in a modern and bright environment. The food is tasty but not at all greasy. Great portions and fast and friendly service. The gyro platter is great, but the lamb souvlaki takes the medal. Platters are served with a small salad before the entree. They are prompt with take-out orders as well. The price point is amazing! Definitely two thumbs up from me.
Good and fast! The chicken was perfectly cooked (thoroughly cooked without being dry). The feta fries are a must try! If you're in the area it's worth a try.

This is my favorite Greek restaurant in town! When I go out I usually talk people into trying this place because I know they'll love it! The employees are all friendly and fast and the restaurant is very clean. I definitely recommend ordering their gyros and feta fries!
This is the best Greek restaurant in town. The salad wrap is the bomb. The staff is really nice too.

O man, this place is amazingly good. I got the garlic shrimp & we also got the steak souvloki(meat was perfectly cooked) Along with the feta fries! Everything was loaded with feta, cooked & seasoned to perfection. I will definitely hit this place when I'm in Henderson

Just touched down in LV for a project and was very hungry. Looked up this place and gave it a try and wasn't disappointed.  The most enthusiastic guy took my order at the counter and the Clover machine they had to take my payment was very impressive.  The Gyro I ordered was huge! The fries were super hot and fresh. The Baklava was the size up a piece of cake LOL!  I recommend this place no doubt.

Best gyro in Las Vegas! I say that with confidence because I strongly dislike lamb yet LOVE the way Great Greek serves it's gyros. If you are in town you have to visit this hidden gem outside of the city. The only thing I dislike is that it is closed on Sundays (hahah can't complain much about that though, they are open 6 days a week!). The rice is amazing too I have to have an extra order of rice to go! Overall a great affordable Place to eat.

Delicious, reasonably priced Greek food. Love the gyro meat here! The staff are friendly and efficient as well. My biggest complaint is that there needs to be more seating! If you come in during rush hours (like 6-7pm for dinner, be prepared to wait for a table).

This is a great lunch spot. I am so happy I found this place as I'm always on the lookout for fresh new lunch places!   We arrived around 1 and the place was packed.  We had to wait for about 10 mins for a table to open up but I'm so glad that we did. The restaurant was very clean despite the crowd.   I ordered the Greek Rice Bowl which had two chicken skewers on a bed of rice covered in lettuce, marinated chickpeas, feta cheese, and kalamata olives.  You can add onion and tomato if that's your thing.  The bowl is deliciously dressed but there is also a side tzatziki sauce which is so good I felt like I could drink it.  At the risk of embarrassing my company, I refrained...in case you were wondering.  The only note I would offer is that the place can be a little pricey (almost $30 for two if us).  There are some dishes on the menu (featuring lamb) that are pushing $18 which seemed high for the super casual atmosphere.   The staff was very accommodating and super friendly. I will definitely be returning!
Love this new place. The food and service was great and the venue is tastefully decorated. Cheap and cheerful.

The staff is awesome and you get that family-owned vibe. The food is great as well and I love the baklava ice cream! Good price for what you get! Love the lamb gyros. I try to bring as many people as I can here.
Place is awesome. Great food. The ice T is good. Close by. Nice employees,fair pricing never a long wait.

Was there tonight busy.  Was here before lots of times. Left because when I was waiting for table and my family of six where just about to order a older guy came out to clean the table I was waiting for and said I couldn't have the table because they are for the people that have already ordered I said we are just about to he said I don't care  told him we are leaving 6  people that was going to spend $$$ usually 100 or more his loss. So if you want rude employees go there

The food is EXCELLENT!! The store is very clean and great atmosphere, and great customer service. Sometimes the food takes awhile like over 20 mins because they are so slammed, and sometimes there's nowhere to sit because it's kind of small and gets easily overcrowded. I wish they had more space and another location on the west side of Henderson. My wife and I love this place and it's probably our favorite food in the whole city. We usually get the bowls with gyro meat. Portions are very generous. Too bad it's always such a long and drawn out event whenever we want to go here. We usually only go if we are in the area and if there's no line out the door.

The BEST Greek food in the area!!! My husband and I have been dining there since we moved to Henderson over 2 years ago and the food never disappoints! The owners are so friendly and they are always busy, which is a good sign that the food is great! We are huge fans of the Rice Bowls and the daily specials are always fantastic!   Also try the Feta Fries, they are awsome! We dine in or take out at least once a week. I would highly recommend this place if you are looking for homemade food that is always fresh and delish! I have sent numerous friends there and they agree that it is the best Greek food they have had. What are you waiting for...go try it!!

Never been to the Henderson location but was ecstatic to find out this new location was opening close to home! Very welcoming and attentive staff, ambiance is very clean and modern with a straightforward menu. I love that it's not a fancy sit down, just order at the cashier, and yet you shall be served! Will most def be coming back as I love Greek food! The guy at the counter was totally right, Baklava ice cream is to die for!
