Words or pictures can't even describe! I have tried the gyro, souvlaki, garlic shrimp, spanikopita, bakalava, greek salad and my personal favorite FETA FRIES.  I have never left unsatisfied.  The services is always fabulous, they are so friendly. This might not be the fanciest place in town but it is definitely my favorite.

Been wanting to try this place for awhile. Finally did today. Had the traditional Gyro. It was huge & delicious! Got a side of Feta Fries with it. Wow! That's all I can say. I'm not a fan of feta cheese, but sprinkle it generously over some fries & let it melt a bit & you've got something. Definitely coming back.
Food was great as usual, make sure and try the "Great Greek Gyro, and the grape leaves!!!!! Boom!!!!!

I'm an out of towner here on business and am thrilled to be staying across the street. So far I've tried the gyro, feta fries, and lamb chops. All of them have been amazing. The lamb chops were perfectly cooked and served with a delicious side of rice pilaf. The gyro and feta fries were great too. I recommend it all.

Too Expansive for a casual dining fast food restaurant.  We ordered gyro sandwich and chicken kabob plate and gyro was excessively covered with white sauce....can't taste the meat , gross! My husband's dish was nothing to wow about ether, just an average place . Will not return.

HORRIBLE customer service! First time ever eating here and will definitely be my last. This place was highly recommended by a coworker.   We ordered our food on our way there and let them know we would be on a very limited timeframe but would like to eat there and if that would be okay, they said sure no problem! As we entered it was a little busy so we grabbed a table and before we could even sit down this young girl that works in the front came over and said "you can't sit there you have to order your food first and then you can sit." WTH?  First of all, say "Hello" and greet your customers with a damn smile not your rude attitude. Secondly, we did order our food! Don't go jumping to conclusions and assume things....after all, you know what they say about assumptions. I'd recommend you learn some manners!   With that being said, we did NOT end up staying (I don't think anyone would after being treated so rude)  we ended up just taking our lunch to go.   The only positive thing I can say is, the salad was not too bad. But I'd rather go to a place with amazing customer service that has mediocre food, than a place that has the best damn food and crappy customer service with rude staff, ANY DAY!!!
The best Greek restaurant in the Henderson/Las Vegas area. The staff are super friendly, the prices are reasonable and the food is absolutely delicious!

I'm so glad The Great Greek moved to this new location. I was initially worried that the food might be different or not as good here but I'm so glad they've kept the integrity of the food as the original location. The salmon Great Greek rice bowl along with the hummus and pita is everything your taste buds needs and more.

I've had better. Kabob Express on the East side is Better and not as crowded. I ordered take-out and thank goodness I did because it was Super Noisy and Loud with kids for such a Small place. The Lamb Gyro was a Huge portion but way too much sauce and cheese. Baklava was Large and tasty. My bf didn't care for the Grilled Chicken plate. Flavors weren't there.
The best value at any Greek place in the area. Amazing garlic shrimp and Lamb Gyros! The place is rather small so you may need to get your food to go, but it's worth it! !

Delicious!!!!! They have the best Falafels in town and the hummus is great too! The services is great despite it being packed all the time. Seating is limited so I would recommend getting your food to go. I think they should expand!!!!!!

I found The Great Greek through searching Yelp. Saw the amazing reviews and thought it should be pretty great if everyone else thinks so!  Pulled up and there's a cool patio area for outside seating. The restaurant was busy both inside and out, although a small space overall.   I told the cashier that it was my first time and asked what they are famous for. He recommended me to get the Gyro and showed me the different plate options. I went with the platter which includes the Gyro, rice or feta fries, a Greek salad and a drink.  I decided on the feta fries because...well, why the hell not!!! :). My total was somewhere around $12.00. I felt it was a great deal for all of the food I was getting!   As I was waiting for my food I asked about the baklava and if it was any good. He said that he would give me a free one as he knows I will be back again after I eat their food.  Hmmmmm...ok!  I'll take the bribe!!!   I waited about 7 minutes for my food, despite the busy restaurant, and I took my food to go. I didn't get to my destination for about 40 minutes so my food didn't look pretty enough for a photo but MAN!!!  Flavors were delicious!!!  Feta fries were somehow still warm and my gyro was just so good!  Their Greek salad was generous and the dressing was awesome. I wish the kalamata olives were pitted, probably my only complaint.   The baklava was amazing!  And honestly it really did seal the deal for me. I will be back to The Great Greek and I'm looking forward to it!  Already recommended the place to several friends. Overall, great food, awesome service, and nice spot. I look forward to dining in next time.

I love this place!  I drop by for lunch at least once a week.  My favorite is the Great Greek rice bowl with shrimp!  It's like no other rice bowl that you have ever had - and its fabulous!  I also love their salmon, which is perfectly cooked.  The family that runs it is so great!  I love supporting locally owned services - and these guys really know good, clean, healthy food!

You will NOT regret trying this place out !! Got the Gyro Combo! Still brought some left overs back ! The service is GREAT ! Food even better ! Walked into my office and recommended this place to everyone ! Next time I need to try the desserts !

Any dining establishment that caters to my kids is a go-to for me! I love this place!   Atmosphere: family oriented. The place is family-owned and they extend that family feel to their customers. My husband orders a greek salad but he asks them to leave off the tomatoes and cucumbers. The owner acts like this is fine with her while I stand there and laugh! They are awesome!  They have the best rice that I've ever had. My kids beg to go there and eat some rice.  The pita and hummus is just insane delicious. Whenever we are waiting for our food, they pop over with some warm, fresh pita slices for our children.   The chicken souvlaki plate is my staple there. The chicken is marinated to perfection and the rice and salad accompaniment are the perfect meal!  We've tried the falafel and the texture is perfect. The flavors blend well with the sauce, onions and falafel and it tastes heavenly.  The baklava is the BEST I've ever had!   Wish they had more seating (it's almost always full when we go in to eat). We often take the food to go for this reason.  Don't miss the rice pudding!!!

I have been here 3 times in the past month...   My first time I had the gyro plate, with a large portion of gyro meat, rice and salad - the tzatziki is amazing, slightly tart - rich flavor, sooooo yummy I wanted to bathe in it!  I couldn't wait to go back!  I met a girlfriend for lunch last Friday and had the Greek salad with falafel, again, I was so happy with the freshness of the food - the portions are perfect and the service is really good - the entire staff is helpful and friendly. My friend had the grilled salmon - oh my gosh, it was so good (even though we had to wait a little longer, it was worth it!).  All in all I was very happy on my second visit.  Saturday I met another friend for lunch - this time I ordered the rice bowl and had the gyro meat again.  Again, delicious and I just couldn't get enough tzatziki! My friend had the chicken rice bowl and was very pleased with the portion size and taste.  It was pretty busy for 2pm on Saturday, but still had great service from very attentive front end workers.    I am a fan for life!

The service was incredible and friendly!  The food was so fresh and authentic!  DEFINITELY my new go to for Greek food! Perfect portions! Such great vibes as well!  Loved the decor and cleanliness.  I will be back :)

GREAT GREEK BOWL WITH SHRIMP! Not even kidding, don't come here without getting this- it is delicious. It's a huge bowl of soft, moist rice topped with cucumber salad, tomatoes, lettuce, feta, tzatziki, garbanzo beans, and the perfectly grilled shrimp. It's basically a Greek salad on steroids, with some rice. That shrimp is the bomb dot com, no lie. Grilled and seasoned to herby, lemony perfection. A light but filling meal.  The GREAT GREEK GYRO is also a tasty option- pillowy pita with a good portion of beef-lamb topped with red onion, tomato, feta, and more tzatziki. It's a good gyro, dont get me wrong, but the bowl is a bit more unique. The AVGOLMONO SOUP is a flavorful lemony broth filled with chicken and rice. The version here is tastier than many other places ice tried it, and as a side, the portion is quite large.  I'm not in Henderson often, but when I am, I'll be keeping this place on my radar.
Great pastitsco I have had, since the ladies from the greek church. Very delicious food and large portions so plan on a to go box. Best greek food I have had in las vegas.

Traveling through the area after spending time in AZ. I had the salmon Greek salad with avocado & it.was.amazing!! The BEST meal I had on my whole trip. My family loved everything we ordered. A new must stop next time we drive through. And the owners are so kind!

Hey Jerry, we found out about the Great Greek through Yelp! We were down at the Galleria and I just did a search on restaurants in the area, Greek food sounded good. I'm glad we went...I have been craving those Feta Fries ever since.  Thanks for taking the time, we'll be back!

Ample portions with quick service, The Great Greek was an excellent lunch for our family. The warm pita is delicious as well as the hummus. If we lived in the area, we would be regulars. The service was high quality especially for a restuarant where you order at the counter. At one point during the meal my son asked for sauce off of my plate, and within two minutes the sauce appeared, even without me or my son having to ask. Great service and good food for the cost.

Excellent food. Service was excellent as well. We had a great meal (4 of us). The works; dessert included. This maybe one of the best Greek restaurants I've ever eaten at!   It's not a large facility. Though they have outdoor seating. It's likely crowded at the busier times so keep that in mind. But even if one had to wait a bit, it's worth it.

Amazing Greek food.   I'm so glad this opened so close to where I live.   I've had the Great Greek Gyro, dolamades, and feta fries over the last few visits.  I've had nothing less than fast, fresh, and delicious.   Great job to everyone on staff.   Can't wait to stop by again.
We love this place! The food is fantastic and staff are wonderful. Go get a great Greek wrap asap!
I love coming to this place. Great service and food. Not to mention they can get your food out super quick. If you haven't been yet I highly recommend going.

Just got back after 3 months and where do we go for dinner? The Great Greek ! Delicious as ever and the servings were great. The meat in the Gyro was melt in your mouth good and tender. The salad was garden fresh. Thank you Great Greek for fresh, delicious, healthy Greek food .

Good quality of good, prices are pretty good.  Had a really solid gyro, fresh pita, lots of lamb.  Saw several other great looking dishes come out of the kitchen that I might try next time I am over here.

As I step up to the cashier,  "Hey John, your salad is 15-seconds from coming out--15 seconds later--boom, here you go" I come here so often they know my name now?!  Update: Jack and Felicia are pretty awesome.   I come back to The Great Greek every Friday when I work on this side of town. They do every thing right at this location. They are friendly, fast, considerate and the food --is absolutely fantastic--  I always order my typical large greek salad, with gyro. I order online so when I show up food is good to go. Sure enough, by the time I drive from my office to the restaurant my food is ready. I commend the staff at this place because they are always so busy but they always get things out in a timely manner.    My order is always to-go but I end up sitting outside to eat. The girl who works on friday afternoons always stops by and asks if I need anything else. This is wonderful, she acknowledges that I might not be "dining-in" but she still cares about my experience at their location. Kudos to you for great customer service.   The restaurant is also very clean. The bathrooms are clean (yay). The staff at The Great Greek takes pride in where they work obviously. They may get busy but they definitely get the job done right and well.   Thank you guys! I'll see you on Friday haha.

Just tried this place out for the first time today! I tried the Avgolemono soup and it was delicious (and by far the best side of Peta slices I've ever tasted)! I will most definitely be coming back! Prices are fair, however it is a small dining room and there's only 4 patio tables outside, all of which were occupied when I went. So prepare yourself to wait for people to leave and open a table or get your food to go.
Fantastic! Loved the lamb rice bowl. Was delicious. This is definitely our new Greek place. Service was great also. Very nice people.
The food is consistently good.  Service is somewhat harsh.  Also that they close on weekdays at 8:00 does not make sense.

Came here based on their good reviews and the convenient location. However, I didn't have the same experience. I came with the expectations of another similar Greek restaurant. I love the grilled chicken/shrimp Greek salad from the restaurant I usually go to so of course I had to try it here. The chicken skewer here was extremely dry, no flavor to them at all, almost like they were over cooked. The salad was alright, lettuce was extremely huge so I had to cut them down with a knife to eat them comfortably. Overall I just wasn't too impressed with the salad that I love so dearly at the other restaurant. Perhaps maybe I'll try their other meat options next time if I ever decide to come back.   They were very busy during dinner time so maybe I might've just had a bad batch of chicken that night.

This place is phenomenal!!!  This was our first time eating here and the food was beyond delicious.  I got the Greek salad with an added chicken skewer.  The chicken had amazing flavor and was not chewy at all.  They also give you a ton of fluffy pita bread and the hummus was awesome.  Everything in the salad was fresh & perfect portions.  The kids' meals come with large portions of food.  We previously went to Crazy Pita, but this place is much better and authentic; the prices are cheaper, too.  Very reasonable prices!  We will definitely be back!

Was looking for something a bit different from our norm so we figured on Mediterranean.  Now, usually, we'd go to Paymon's but this little place had some great reviews and was close to home so why not... Thankfully,  it lived up to the hype. The menu isn't extensive but it doesn't need to be, honestly. I chose the grilled steak, my wife (who was craving a burger from off the radar) chose The Athenian (as did a number of the folks grabbing a bite and the take out).  We also ordered the Dolmas and the Hummus, both being very flavorful. The burger was cooked to order and the feta fries very rich and tasty.  The steak skewers were near perfect as was the rice pilaf. I could have done without the minced onion garnish as well as the onions in the Greek side salad but other than that, no real complaints. The sitting area does get warm in the late afternoon sun so do try sitting towards the front or the mirrored side wall. The staff was friendly (at least the two cute young ladies we dealt with) and attentive, checking in a few times. We didn't try dessert,  but next time.

Great Greek food, great employees. Good Prices . My wife and this Greek really enjoy the friendly atmosphere . The patio out front is a wonderful place to enjoy your meal also. Greek egg/lemon soup and small garden salad are my favorites. Greek beer is available .   Bob and JuliaAnn

This place offers some great Greek food! I truly have never been a huge fan of Greek food mainly because finding good Greek food seems to be a constant disappointment.  This place is pretty decent and I actually got to try something I have never tried before, Avgolemono soup which is like a chicken and rice soup but with a hint of lemon. The place is small but not overly decorated in white and blue which is a nice change.  The service could have been a little friendlier but maybe it was on off day. I definitely will return.
Best feta fries ever. They melt the feta on top. Their meat is delicious as a matter of fact everything I'm tasted Devine. Must come here.

Hands down best Greek food in Las Vegas. I have lived here for over 20 years and have tried almost all the Greek restaurants and this is the best Greek food. I attended the Greek festival a few years ago and fell in love with these fries that I could not find at any of the restaurants until I came here. Seriously the best feta fries especially when you squeeze lemon over it. Simply amazing!

The Great Greek has to be my favorite Greek restaurant!  The freshest salad ever, all ingredients are nice and fresh! Gyros are great! Always juicy! Never dry! The pita bread is so nice, fresh, and soft! Nice place to dine! Even though it's more like a to-go fast food place, but the quality of the food are no less then a fine dine in restaurant.

I am very picky about Greek food because I worked in an amazing Greek restaurant and this is one of the best Greek places I have ever been to.  Their gyro meat is juicy, thick, and it melts in your mouth.  I highly recommend the Greek bowls and they are big enough to share.  We moved away from Vegas four years ago but every time we visit we head straight here from the airport.  Oh and don't forget to order the tzatziki, it is creamy and the perfect combination of cucumber and dill.
Got the great greek gyro and the traditional gyro, both got greek salad as our side. Delicious!!! I would recommend this place to anyone.

Poor service, forgot item in to go order. Manager confirmed everything was there. Had to go back to get missing item. Asked for free small side of hummus for having to drive back and get the item they forgot. They refused and wanted to charge me for a small side. Very surprised for the inconvenience and lack of wanting to make up for their mistake. Not the best way to start out in a new area.

Wifey and I were craving some gyros. Our typical spot is all the way in Henderson so we decided to check this place out. The place is clean with nice decorations and overall inviting atmosphere. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. I gave it a 3 stars based only on their gyros. To me it lack flavor and that certain "umph", it does not beat our favorite spot but it's not the worst either. Fries were nothing special but the feta fries was something worth getting. Wifey also enjoyed their Baklava dessert. Would come back but definitely nothing I would be dying to go for.

This place should be renamed "cucumber heaven" in my opinion lol. I haven't had this type of food before so when I saw a lot of things with cucumber and tzaziki onthe menu I knew my order would be customised. The lady who took my order seemed friendly but she might need a q-tip because my order was eff-ed up. I ordered the Athenian Burger and when the lady said it had the tomatoes, salad, and cheese would all be mixed together in tzaziki I told her to leave all of that salad stuff off and just put feta cheese on my burger. The wait for my burger was long and that was okay but when you bring me a burger that is obviously a frozen patty and put the salad on it that I asked you to leave off something is wrong. I did say something but it would have been a 15 minute wait for a new burger so I just said I would take the salad mixture off of my burger and deal with it. The burger was terrible. Then I tried the Feta Fries that I ordered and hot damn they were good! The fries were great but the gross burger and my lack of taste for cucumbers will not bring me back here.

It was my turn to pick lunch and The Great Greek had been on my bookmarks for a long time.  The location is small inside and seemed to be busy the entire time we were there.  There is also patio seating that will accommodate once the weather warms up a bit.  I had excellent service.  The gentleman helping us was very helpful since we told him it was our first time in.    I had ordered the grilled garlic shrimp plate.  It was accompanied with feta fries and pita bread.   Delicious!  There were 2 skewers of shrimp with 4 on each.   This was definitely plenty to fill my stomach.  Not to mention the outstanding fries.  This was my first time having these and I love feta cheese.  Yum.   My plate also came with a side salad which I didn't finish.  The dressing was a little bit much and overpowering.  But overall it was great.     I had asked the gentlemen if they had lemon potatoes since they weren't on the menu.   They do!  You just have to ask them to make them.  I might just have to go back soon to try those out!   So the business name fits the review - Great Greek! Opa!

We came in right before closing (on accident... We realized this when we saw the door, oops). The staff was extremely nice and attentive. They took the time to explain the whole menu, and we felt right at home! The restaurant was full even though it was right before closing time.   It smells amazing inside, and the dessert looks amazing!   Everything we had was really good! I suggest the fries with feta because it isn't something you can get everywhere! Their soup is VERY good as well! Enjoy!

Absolute best "fast food" Greek spot I've ever been to. Better than my beloved Gyro House at home.  Take the "fast food" part away, and it's still one of the best Greek places I've been to - period.  Very clean inside, ingredients are colorful and fresh, staff is efficient and sweet (and super Greek). Owner can be seen walking around talking to friends.  Amazing hummus. Try the avgolemeno (lemon chicken soup). Greek salad is perfect. Feta fries are to die for. Free extra pita!!!!$&@&$$!

I'm a fan of Greek food and this place is no joke, one of the best in Vegas. The food is fresh, amazing flavors, and portions are sizeable. Great value and the service is excellent. I had my first visit last week and it was so good that I brought others and ended up eating there three times in one week. Got to try the feta cheese fries, they are out of this world. Give it a try, I bet you can't stay away.
My favorite Greek place hands down. Wonderful service AND wonderful food. The best of both worlds ;) and I love the family! So sweet

I've hit this joint twice and, yes, it is very, very tasty Greek fast-casual food. But you knew that already from all the five-star reviews, eh?  The menu is a line-up of all the usual suspects: Gyros, salad with Greek dressing, pita tips, feta fries, baklava, souvlaki, falafel, pastitsio. Everything I've had is heavenly.  Parking/access is sort of odd; once off Warm Springs, you have to sort of wiggle your way back to it, behind a Jason's Deli. But it's worth it.  A wee bit more pricey that other similar venues I've experienced. And a bit shy, portion-wise. And from that, my one-star ding. But the quality IS there.  The last couple of months, I've noticed a big banner right out on Warm Springs, manned by several folks reading "Labor Dispute with The Great Greek." I am OK with collective bargaining, in that it's a big part of how things are done here in Vegas. But since I don't see any Culinary 226 references on the signage, I am not sure what these (likely) former at-will employees are protesting exactly. Because their signage really doesn't say.  Anyway, if you are troubled by scabbing across a picket-line (of sorts), you have been forewarned.  UPDATE (from current owner Nick Della Penna, quoting his comment below): "The picketing is from the Carpenters Union due to the construction of our second location on Blue Diamond and Decatur.  Rest assured that the staff at Warm Springs is happy with their working conditions and will take great care of you."  [ NOTE: The Great Greek's original Greek-Armenian founder Jerry Gorumian sold the Henderson venue to Mr. Della Penna in January, 2016. ]

I ordered a side of steak skewer, shrimp skewer and  a side of rice. The skewers came along with the rest of our orders except for rice.  5 minutes later I asked where my rice is coz I have been nibbling on my skewers.  Lady apologized and said it's still being cooked and it should be ready in a few minutes.  I got up and said to the cashier to cancel the rice and to just order me a side of the shrimp skewer since I really liked it and will pay for the difference.  Cashier said to me that since it's their fault, they won't do a refund on rice but instead to just give me the shrimp skewer without charging me the difference.  Because she took ownership of the mistake and a few minutes later, the shrimp came, I WILL DEFINITELY COME BACK TO THIS PLACE.   That cashier has a great attitude.  Thank you!

Came in to take some lunch to go. Walking in the restaurant was full of people and clean, always a good sign. The workers were super nice and accommodating! I ordered the great greek gyro with feta fries and hummus as an appetizer. Everything was delicious! I have had gyros all around the city and this is by far the best. Definitely worth taking a visit to the Great Greek Grill. Keep it up! :)
this place is amazing! The food is delicious. the staff are kind and helpful. my inly suggestion is more tables to sit at.

Delicious food and friendly service! I enjoyed a chicken gyro with feta fries. The chicken was tender, the tzatziki tangy and flavorful, the veggies crisp and fresh, and oh the pita bread!!! Fresh, delicious pita bread. I capped my meal with a slice of baklava which was also very good. I'm no expert on Greek food but this definitely tops any of the places I've been. Highly recommend!
We love the service with a smile. The food is terrific too. Never had a bad meal. This place is amazing :)

The Great Greek has the best gyro that I have eaten here in Vegas!  It was so flavorful and they do not skimp on the meat!  The pita bread was perfect, as well!  The pita was soft but sturdy enough to hold the ingredients well.    My husband and I shared an order of feta fries.  The feta fries were amazing!  The fries were crisp and flavorful. The feta cheese topping was so flavorful and melted to perfection.  It was a generous amount and was perfect to share with our gyros.    This restaurant is a must for great gyros!  We will definitely go back soon!  The reason I only gave four stars is because of the dining area.  The dining area was not that special.  If the dining area had nicer tables and chairs and a more pleasant atmosphere/ambiance with actual waiter service and wine and beer it would actually be pretty perfect.    I will say the employees were nice, especially the man that took the order at the counter.  He was very helpful!

Just ate the the great Greek for the first time and had a great Greek gyros with beef/lamb. The meat was clean, the feta and sauce taste fresh and light. I'm happy I stumbled on the this little gem. Can't wait to come back to taste other items on the menu. The staff here was very welcoming and fun to talk to. If you are in town make sure you come out and try this place.

All I can say is there is not one dish you will not regret ordering.  Been coming here since the first week they opened a little over a year ago. (Can you tell by all the Yelp photos I eat here alot?? )    Ambiance/Service -Casual, family friendly, modern decor, bright & clean, indoor & outdoor patio seating, place order at counter. If I could I would  give the staff of Great Greek more than  5 stars for service. From the first time I stepped foot when they opened,they have always been welcoming, warm and friendly.  They greet their regular customers by first name when they walk in and leave. Really impressive.  Food: Yia Yia's Pasticcio a Greek style lasgna that's topped with Greek Bechamel is a very popular dish to order here so if you want a slice of savory goodness I'd get here early for lunch.  If you make your meal a combo, get the Feta Fries!!!! Crisped golden fries topped with Feta cheese that's melted slighty. A different and delicious twist to eating french fries for sure!    Everytime  I order a Gyro and take a pic and post it, my friends are jealous cause here I am sitting having this huge Gyro that's filled with tender slices of beef(they also have choice of lamb and chicken)  feta cheese topped with a genourous amount of  their Tzaziki sauce that's made from scratch. Real light refreshing taste. Their Tzaziki sauce is gold!!   Ohhh the Grilled Garlic Shrimp is another plate that stands out. Shrimp is plump, jumbo size, it's an insanely garlickly & buttery masterpiece.  The Chef behind all these delicious dishes worked for notable chefs on the Strip. So you are in for a real treat when you dine here!   I must not forget dessert!! The most important meal  I never ever miss ;)  You cant beat Yia Yia's Rice pudding to top of your meal!!  Im not a big puddin fan but after Chef came over with a sample of rice pudding for me to try, I can say I am fan of rice pudding!! At least  the way Alice makes it here. What sets it apart is  it's creamy but has an amazingly light texture, with hint of cinammon.   Enough said. Don't pass up this comforting dessert.  The proof is in the puddin'!   Great food, great people, Great Greek lives up to it's moniker.

My husband and I regularly order food from here. It is very tasty and usually SO good. We just ordered our usual items and the hummus appetizer was very runny. Normally the taste and consistency is spot on. It was rather disappointing this time, hence only 4 Stars being given.

This place really is GREAT. After few unsuccessful attempts at eating here due to early closing time during the week, boyfriend and I became discouraged from eating here. This place was brought up again when myself, Jaime W, and Molly T decided to have our very own food crawl...at 11 am..  We arrived just as they opened and we were greeted by the friendly owner. I ordered Avgolemono Soup ($3.50) which is the traditional Greek soup with chicken, lemon, and rice. The portion was really quite large. It also came with a side of their delicious pita bread. Molly T and I decided to also split The Great Greek Gyro (~ $8.00) with lamb-beef combination. The portion, once again, was huge! And the gyro was really quite tasty. Jaime W shared her feta fries with us and they were delicious. They sound simple enough, but wow...they can quickly turn into a guilty pleasure.  All in all, the prices are extremely reasonable for the quality and quantity of the food. It does get very packed during lunch time, and they close at 8 pm Mon-Thur.

I'm waiting for Finese who had just pulled into the parking lot and there's only one available table so I take a seat and I'm looking at the menu... and the server comes up to me and says excuse me you can't sit here you have to get up because you haven't ordered yet. I'm shocked and finese just walked into the door. We get in line and order and the server realizes I'm pregnant  and goes oh now I "kind of" feel bad you should get a free baklava. Long story short I'm super offended and I wouldn't force someone who's pregnant out of a seat and he never got me that free baklava.
Yum. Yum. Yum. Food is fresh, delicious, amazing.  The ladies there are so friendly.  Outdoor patio is so relaxing and nice.  Affordable.  Eat there. Today.

Are you kidding?? This place is amazing. Best Greek joint I've ever had. I had a chicken skewer salad. All the contents were crispy fresh, the chicken was very flavorful and perfectly cooked. My husband had a lamb gyro no feta fries. The fries are sooo good. They have some of the tastiest thaziki I've ever had. Also hummus that is the perfect blend. The best part is that is he baklava ice cream. I thought it was going to be baklava with ice cream on top but it was actually more unique than that. It was ice cream with the baklava pieces blended in like a baklava blizzard. So amazing!
Loved this place!  We have finally found a Greek restaurant worth raving about.    Looking forward to returning as soon as possible.
Comida deliciosa,buenas porciones,los gyros son mis favoritos,postre riquísimo,empleados súper buena onda,todo me encanta...DELICIOSO!!!!

This place is wonderful! We came on a weekend afternoon for lunch and it was packed! The family is authentic and friendly. You can tell they care about their customers and food. The gyro was delicious and so were the fries. This is our new gyro place in town.
LOVE IT!! Going back soon. Taste so good, good price for the amount of food. Worth it every penny.

It's Friday at approximately 5:30pm. The place was packed and there was a line. It went relatively fast tho. Place is clean, and bright and had pretty pictures of Greece on the wall.   I ordered the Greek salad with a skewer of grilled shrimp, for myself. For my daughter, Greek salad Wrap w/Shrimp Combo ( Regular fries and a soda) and to share, an order of Dolmades ( stuffed grape leaves) and an order of baklava.  It was busy, and a bit loud, but none of that stopped the hardworking people behind the counter. They were friendly and knew their stuff. They worked fast, and efficiently getting out orders in great time. Everyone worked like a well oiled machine, no screaming, just head down getting the job done.  Kudos!  I took my order to go, the smell was so enticing I almost wanted to just eat in my car on my way home.  Opening the containers the presentation was 5 star.  Everything looked fresh and appealing, with a spring of parsley for an added touch  The homemade salad dressing was sooo fresh!! I could smell each ingredient in it. Just so yummy!  The shrimp were plump and  were grilled perfectly! Not over done or hard in anyway.   I am not a huge dill fan, and many times I find restaurants over do it when they put it in the tzaziki, not here!! The flavor was exactly what I have been looking for. So refreshing.  The Dolmades were just as good too. I could eat them all day.  Baklava was not the best I have ever had, a little on the drier side, but I did like it A LOT.  I like that they chopped the nuts finer than I'm used to.  My daughter loved her wrap and even the fries they use are really good. Other than the occasion joyous moan of happiness  and a "This is soo bomb"  I don't think we said a word to each other while we ate.  I wanted to devour it, but savor it all at the same time. I would have licked the container clean, but I used the warm, soft pita to sop up the dressing.   The bill was a lil over $30 for 2 people, not too bad for fresh food.   5 stars for food and service. But it is a bit smaller, and a bit too loud, but that might not bother others.   Anyway, TRY it! I can't wait to go back and try every single item on the menu. The menu is a not overly made, you don't have to look through a 100 items to figure what you want. It's easy to read, and will cut down on the time of making a decision. Love that!

Awesome gyro! Posted a picture so look for yourself. Perfect combination of meat/veggies and the pita was light and fluffy.   I took my order to go and was quite amazed how my gyro was wrapped perfectly and stayed intact, I mean nothing spilt out, not even a shred of lettuce. They know what they're doing.   The woman who took my order was very friendly and quick. My food was ready promptly with a smile.    We often ate at Jason's Deli right across from them, but I think I might go Greek, try something else, and definitely get the baklava that I resisted getting the first time! This place was definitely as good as the great reviews I read.
The Great Greek is a nice place with great food. I enjoy the people and atmosphere immensely. Only down, closed on Sunday. Come and enjoy!
Pretty good Greek fast food.   Gyros plate was plentiful yet undercooked but order came out fast. Nice side salad with it. If you  are unlucky to sit on counter you get to look at the wall

I've had the gyro salad and regular gyro - both were hits each time I got them! And I love love love love love their baklava! GET THE BAKLAVA! IT'S SO SWEET AND FLAKY AND AMAZING! I seriously take so many people there just for dessert!

We went back to this place before we left for home because it was just so good. This time the meat was moist and perfect, the rice waa still perfect, the service remained excellent, the baklava is something I am still dreaming about. We also tried the 4 dip appetizer which was delicious and came with the wonderful, soft pita bread and the greek cookies which were flakey and amazing. We will definitely come back the next time we are in town.

After coming here on the reg for over a year I thought it was time to write a review. This place never disappoints! So many yummy menu items.. you can't go wrong with anything you order. My favorites are the salad, great greek euro, and the rice bowl. The rice bowl would be my last meal on earth if I had to choose one. Every time I have visitors in town I take them here and they love it just as much as I do. 10/10 would recommend

The Great Greek is amazing. They never disappoint! The food always tastes fresh and delicious and they are very consistent about it. I always order the small salad (more than enough for 1 person) with a skewer of some kind (chicken or beef, both always so tender and juicy). Their garlic feta fries are also a must-have every time.   I've probably eaten there 10 times and I still have yet to explore the rest of their menu, but I'm confident it's all good!  The SW is blessed to have this restaurant in the area.

OMG SOOOOOO GOOD!  Last time I had this kind of food I was in a different country.......They are super sweet here and all the eating customers were happy.....good vibe good place....they get 10 stars!!!!!!!!!
Ate there twice while visiting Las Vegas. Excellent service, great food, and generous portions, will definitely return when we are in the area.

Wow!  Excellent! Everything is fresh and delicious. Saw this place on yelp, traveling from out of town and thought we'd try this place. The plates are loaded with food. The employees take real pride in working here. They have a sweet little patio and the whole place is clean and bright. You must try this place.

I'm always satisfied with this place. Always a thumbs up in my book. Everyone is always so friendly and the food is always fresh!  They are busy around lunch time but it's well worth it. Never had a bad experience!! I keep coming back every time.

Love this place so much. Definitely a little gold mine waiting to be discovered by everyone. Their gyros are to die for and their feta fries make my life complete. If I could rate this place higher than 5 stars I totally would!!

My wife and I have been here a few times.  Every time we have had good food and service.  Restaurant is new so it's very clean.  I have called my order in a couple times and each time It has been ready and waiting at the counter when I showed up.  Order was always correct.  Glad to have a good greek place closer to home.

Doing some business in LV this week, and couldn't wait to come to this place. If the food is half as good as the reviews, this could be my favorite Greek restaurant.  The place is small... 4x4 tops and 4x2 tops, so make certain you arrive, eat, and then leave so someone else can have your table.  Good news... The Great Greek delivers! Ordered the Greek Salad (Large) with a beef skewer and it was fantastic. Quick, fresh, awesome!  Here's the rundown:  Satisfied? Yes Return? Yes Advocate? YES!
Best Greek in town!!!! Need I say more? Why are you still reading? Come down here and eat some authentic Greek food. :)

Greeeeeeat Greek food in the city. At first, I was a bit concerned about the food not being as good as the Henderson location. The food was consistent!!! This makes me very happy, as this location is closer to my house. Very very fresh food, great flavor and excellent service. Try the chicken rice bowl. It's amazing! And, always order hummus ;-)

The food was delicious and good service. It's fast food, you put your order in. And they bring it to the table. After dinner we ordered the rice pudding, but we're all out. Next time I'll order the ice pudding with my food, we got cookies instead they were delicious.
One of the nicest people, clean places I have ever ate at! Great prices and totally worth checking out. YUMMY! I ordered the gyro meat combo and their fries are yummy too!
Awesome food.  Good price and their not stingy on the amount of food they give you.  People working there are friendly and courteous.

Seriously this place is the greatest! Food is always hot, fresh, totally tasty and practically melts in your mouth! Service is always good and everyone is friendly. If it is busy, it is always worth the wait. My favorite Greek place in town!

Picked up lunch to go today and everything was perfect. We had the Traditional gyro combo with fries, the gyro was HUGE and flavorful, the fries were seasoned and crispy. We also had the beef skewers with rice pilaf and salad, again generous portions, well cooked and flavorful. The staff was very friendly, the food was ready in the 10 minutes they quoted on the phone, and the order was accurate.  I will be back soon, and often! I'm so happy to have some delicious Greek food near home.
I miss this place. I love the food and the atmosphere. I cant wait to go back to vegas and eat at the great greek again.  That lamb is delicious
Fantastic food. We usually eat here around once a week. The staff is friendly and the only thing I wish they had was more space for seating. Gets a little crowded due to their popularity.

My husband and I LOVE this place and cannot believe it has taken us this long to give it a try. We're making up for it though, as we just went back for our second visit in four days! Delicious rice bowls and skewers, amazing feta fries, and some of the best hummus I've ever had...there's no doubt that this place has quickly become a favorite. Oh, and the service is great as well, definitely can't forget that!

Hnmmm.I'm iffy on this one. Borderline 3 to 4 stars.   So, it's windy as all hell and is raining around 745pm when we get there. There are still people in and eating. A young girl with dark hair and glasses takes our order, gives us our drink cup, and our number.  We order 2 gyros ...The beef/lamb combo, and of course, I had to try the feta fries.  Our food comes... and it's neither hot, or cold. Maybe this is how greek gyros are..? I'm not sure. The meat wasn't even warm...  While the meat was amazing, melt in your mouth barely had to chew it....The sauce and the feta was out of this world... It really didn't have any texture. The little mess of lettuce/tomato/onion was practically non existent.  I WOULD BATHE IN THE FETA FRIES. The fries were crunchy, warm, and covered, but not drowning in cheese. My guy and I were practically fighting over them, and I had enough self control to not pick at the lonely cheese left behind on the wax paper.  My guy stepped up and went to the bathroom.  That's how I was able to see what I'm about to explain next.  The younger girl with dark hair and glasses that took our order was wiping tables, when a cook from the back got her attention... He made some sort of hand gesture towards her. She stops wiping down tables, goes to the cooler that has the drinks in it by the register, pulls out a beer, and walks down the hallway.  She opens the door directly at the end of the hallway, and hands off the beer....  Drinking on the job.....? Is that why you are serving cold food?  meh. Maybe it's just me. I wouldn't mind eating here again, but I don't think I'll be driving by wishing I was inside.  3.5 Stars.
We ordered the Gyros so good and so stuffed we have been back again wow the Baklava is amazing  and the french fries salad  its just good I recommend to try it

This place is deliciously fresh and tasty. Love the look of the inside. So cute. The food was so fresh tasting. My husband and I shared a gyro meat plate, I also had the chicken lemon soup. It was all so delicious. I usually don't like tiziki sauce (that I've tried at another Greek place down the street) but theirs was so yummy and fresh. I literally could put it on everything. I highly recommend this place and am beyond happy it's right down the street!! :)

I love, love this place!  So far it's the only place I have found that has avgolemeno soup. It's so good, always very very hot.  Tiny little place, and the wait for food can take a little while- especially if ordering take out. But worth the wait.  The greek fries are delicious and the best in town.   definitely a must try.
So good! Very clean place, food is fresh, healthy, and meat is tender. Absolutely love it!

I forgot how much I liked this place.  Have not been in a while but it was awesome as usual. There are a decent number of Greek places in Vegas and this one is the best one I have been to.   For 11 bucks I got the gyro plate. Fries, a Greek salad and the gyro of course.  Food is good, staff is friendly and the place is clean. I'm a big fan.

Oh. My. Goodness. This place is FABULOUS! My husband and I recently moved to the area and were looking for a great new Mediterranean/Greek restaurant to satisfy our tastebuds and this place is truly spectacular! The lamb beef gyros are the best I've ever eaten and the feta fries are to die for. The portions are huge, as such, my husband and I share one portion of the feta fries. I simply can't say enough about how good the food is here! The baklava is truly decadent and definitely were sharing as well! We have been there 3 times in the past few weeks since we moved here and have unofficially planned to make it back at least once a week.
Always greeted with a smile and the food is so tasty and fresh! Thank you for delivering on such an exceptional experience every time! Highly suggest the Feta Fries.... dang!

Absolutely phenomenal food. Great family owned atmosphere. Food is on par. Prices are reasonable for the quality of the food. Portions are a good size. And by all means upgrade your fries to the feta fries. They are amazing

We've been coming here since we moved to LV almost 2 years ago and we are never let down with the service or quality of food. We always order our usuals - Tzatziki w/ extra pita bread, a Great Greek Gyro combo w/ Feta Fries and a Steak Souvlaki platter. Everything is fresh and we're always more than satisfied!

This place is amazing. I am always more happy when I eat at a family owned restaurant and this place has both that and really amazing food.  If you are looking for Mediterranean food, and not wanting to wait a while, but still get awesome food, this is the place for you. It's an order and pay first, then they bring you your food and you can peace out as soon as you devour your last falafel. Which is sometimes just what you need from a restaurant. Waiting for the check is such a pain sometimes.    The food.  Falafel Pita: dang. I'm a sucker for a falafel pita and do I they do it so well here.  Greek salad with chicken: Okay. Greek salads aren't easy to mess up. They are pretty simple. The two most important things that you can mess up are the dressing and the protein. (As long as you have good produce, you're golden.) The dressing and the chicken were so amazing. The chicken is seared on the grill and served like a kabob on top of your salad. And the whole thing is just fantastic all together. One of the best Greek salads I've had.   Feta fries: So these are amazing. But what send these over the top compared to others I've had is 1. The crispness of the French fries and the fact that they use mozzerella and feta on the fries. So you get that creaminess of the feta and the stingy melted mozzerella that makes the French fries stick together. SO GOOD.   I absolutely adore this place. Go there if you like Greek food, go there if you aren't sure you like Greek food, and go there if you think you hate Greek food. Because chances are you haven't had Greek food as good as this.

My favorite place in Vegas to get authentic Greek food. The gyros are on point and the staff is extremely nice. They have daily specials that rotate. Food is flavorful and they have great portions. Don't forget to the feta fries they are so good, they are even better with a side of tzaziki.
This is one of my favorite lunch places, their gyros are fantastic! :D I will definitely come back here again! Plus the staff are amazing :3

Fresh, fresh, fresh!  I tried the chicken soup, a side salad, the gyro plate, falafel, and feta fries. I was stunned at how fresh and tasty everything was. Washed it all down with a fountain Coke...what more do you need.  A great meal after a long day driving.  Locals, this is a hidden gem!

I went here when the place was not busy, aka not a Friday or Saturday night.  The service was very quick and the food was excellent.  Big portions, fresh and very tasty...will be coming back here often.
Delicious! We came in for dinner and I can say the food is phenomenal! Big portion and u can tell the food is fresh!

The Great Greek is really GREAT. One of the best gyros I have ever had. And it is right by my house. I've been there 3 times and the gyro is soo good I haven't ordered anything else! Definitely check this place out.
Fantastic food.  My wife and I go almost every week.  The Feta fries are amazing and the Gyro is always what I order.  Great food, great people.

Such a great spot! Wish I had discovered it sooner. Excellent food, very friendly service and reasonable prices. It does get a little crowded around lunchtime, but that's only because it's a great option for a quick, great meal. Lemon soup is delicious! I recommend you try it! Family meals are I really good value and both have great choices. Definitely feeds more than you'd think.

I love this place. The soup is wonderful. The mezze plate is excellent. Everything is freshens clean. Staff also seems to really care. Super swell!  Note-it's got a to go vibe but I hope it'll continue to grow into a full size restaurant. In the meantime they've updated the decor and it's lovely to eat in.

Crazy. Good. Food. Seriously, the best gyros I've ever had, and being a former Chicagoan I've had quite a few. (Gyros, that is.)  The pitas were so fresh, the meat was flavorful and juicy...and the tzatziki...oh what a tzatziki it was. If I could have rolled myself in it, I probably would have.
Omg this place is the real deal....meat very tender....bread soft....food fresh....very clean.....simply delicious
We love the Great Greek!  The service is great and so is the food.  So glad we found this great spot in our new neighborhood!

Ate here for the 2nd time today and boy was it still a disappointment. First time we came here, I ordered a falafel pita and was disappointed by what I got. Instead of getting light and fluffy on the inside, crunchy on the outside falafels, I got mushy falafels that were falling apart. I didn't think too much of it and attributed it to probably a bad batch. Came again today thinking it might be different, but what I got were still the same mushy, soggy, broken down falafels. They didn't even hold their shape when I got them! It would have been okay if it still had that crispy exterior, but even that was non-existent. To top it all off, we waited for my hubby's Greek salad with chicken for more than 15 minutes, while other people, who ordered the same thing after us, got theirs first. He finally went up to the lady to ask why it was taking so long, and lo and behold, his order was just sitting there on the counter. By the time we got his order, the chicken was no longer hot-- heck it wasn't even warm to say the least. We gave them a second chance, and were still sadly let down. Guess were sticking to Meraki's!

Living in new York City for years I ate at countless greek diners as well as upscale greek restaurants. So I know greek food well. This is real deal. Delicious food and friendly service. I will be back real soon..
We have been here 4 times in 1 week, ya feel me ? Pleasant atmosphere,  good food, daily specials, lots to like. Clean dining room and family run. Hit it up
waited for 20 mins for food as people who ordered after me were getting their food they ordered. dont go here unless you want to spedn your whole day waiting for food.
Excellent greek food.  The gyro's are awesome and the rice is to die for. It's hard to find good greek around here, but this place is the best.
Says they're open till 9pm, closed at 7pm. Please fix your hours on yelp and your website and your door. What a waste of a fresh new spot in southern highlands.
There isn't a better Greek Restaurant in Henderson. Everything I have tried is tasty.  Never had a bad meal
5 stars  Excellent customer service   Excellent Giro and fries  Again, 5 stars   Awesome feta fries.

This is easily my favorite Greek restaurant. Their gyros are amazing and their feta fries are way too good! The only downside is the seating. They have a maximum occupancy of 35 inside, plus a few tables outside. More often than not you have to fight for a table if you plan on dining in.

I absolutely love this place.  It was my first introduction to Greek food, and it has been a fabulous adventure ever since.  The chicken and lemon rice soup in brilliant, as are the beef lamb gyros and falafel.  Reasonable prices and a great clean Greek atmosphere sharpen its appeal.  And best of all, it's a family owned place where you can be greeted by the friendly and knowledgable mother son team daily.

I'm not from here so I'm sad to say I won't be able to come back. This place is awesome! The staff is super friendly and very helpful. I'm he restaurant is very clean with a bright cherry atmosphere. They have a patio for outdoor dinning or you can sit inside the restaurant. They serve wine and beer along with fountain drinks and an assortment of bottled drinks. I had the avgolemono soup and a lamb rice bowl. I wasn't expecting the servings to be sooooo big! Everything was fresh and delicious! Eat here and you won't be disappointed!! Promise!

This is my favorite Greek food in town and actually ever! Everything I've eaten there is delicious! I love falafel but, often find them dry at other places I've tried . At the great Greek they are always soft, fluffy and full of favor! The service is always fast and incredibly friendly even when they are really busy.  The Tirokafteri is a must try , trust me! Also I love that you can get cucumbers instead of pita which I awesome when I'm trying to cut the cards.

Not very good service. I ordered the Greek salad wrap, 15 minutes later still sitting with no food. Went up to counter to inquire, older woman told me chicken takes awhile to cook. I told her, my order has no meat in it. She just kept saying, it was the chicken. I told her, no meat! She said it would be out in a minute. She brought my friends food and then we waited another 5 minutes for my meatless, cold salad wrap..  She dropped off a piece of baklava without a word. Sorry to say, not a big fan of nuts. Our fries with feta came next (we have now been here for almost 30 minutes) fries are plain, no cheese.  Won't be back, definitely won't recommend

We stopped in for lunch and the food was so amazing. We had gyro salad's and those grape leave wrapped things. Wonderful meal, the folks that work there were so nice, and we had a super time. I highly recommend this one!
Lamb, steak and chicken, all a delight! Everyone aims to please.  Yummy and convenient. I'm sure they cater a party for me soon!

Wow! Just a surprise stop instead of the deli across the street, what a surprise! Amazing food. Amazing service. Jack stoped to talk to us while we were eating and was so nice. First time eating Greek food in a long time. And it was so fresh and amazing. I had the small Greek salad with chicken and steak skewer and melitzanosalata aka puréed roasted eggplant with pita. My friend had the great Greek rice bowl with steak and lamb skewer. They ask how you want your steak cooked as well. We were greeted by Brittney, she was awesome. Explained the whole menu and recommended the rice bowl. The place was super busy and she saved the open table for me so I didn't have to leave my purse there. The whole experience was great. This will be a new regular spot.
The employees are always friendly and helpful. The food is delicious! It gets very crowded at lunch time and there's a wait, however it's worth it.

So glad there is a Greek place near me now! The decor is really pretty! Bright and clean, tons of tables and seating options, tables and chairs were clean modern looking.   I got the Gyro plate which was really good. Meat was not too salty, fries were crunchy, salad was fresh, sauces were delicious. My brother got the garlic shrimp and loved it, the rice smelled amazing and tasted great. I like that their plates and silverware looked nicer than you would expect it to, not paper plates or cheap looking plasticware. This is great for pictures :)   First experience here was great, will definitely come back to try other dishes.

Came here for lunch a couple of days ago. What a nice surprise it turned out to be. The location is very clean and inviting with large windows to let in the sunshine. The staff was very friendly and quick to bring out the food. I had the grilled shrimp entree. The shrimp were huge, and perfectly seasoned. Delicious!! It came with a nice Greek side salad, and the entree came with a bed of rice, a side of fresh pita bread, and tzatziki. My husband tried the Great Greek Gyro. It was huge!! Came stuffed with a generous portion of beef/lamb and very fresh lettuce, tomatoes, red onion, feta cheese and tzaski. Ordered a side of Feta french fries that were to die for. Never had anything quite like them. The fries were crisp, fresh and hot. Definitely give these a try. To end the meal we ordered an amazing "Mom's" rice pudding. this dessert was fresh still warm and topped with cinnamon. Some of the best I've ever had!! If you like Greek food. definitely give this place a try. It is delicious food, with reasonable prices and huge portions served by a very friendly staff.

I really loved how great this food tasted, and I appreciated how nice and clean the aesthetic was. My coworker and I, along with a lot of other customers, were just there for take-out, and while the wait was a little long, there was also a HUGE line of people - this place is really getting some business. The prices were a little high, so I wouldn't visit here too often, but the portion sizes were large to make up for that. I really can't stress how fresh and tasty everything was. I highly recommend checking this place out!

I think my rating would be closer to 3.5, but I rounded up instead of down because I really enjoyed the food.  It is a small family-owned restaurant in a strip mall, close to Sunset Station.  This place is really close to my apartment, and since it was highly rated on Yelp, my boyfriend and I chose to go here to satisfy a craving for gyros.  We called our order in to go ahead of time, and the lady said it would be ready in 15 minutes.  When we got to the restaurant, we waited in line for a bit, and got to the counter -- only for them to tell us they didn't have our order in the system and didn't remember taking it.  This interaction threw me off a little bit, because the lady who took our order on the phone only 30 minutes before was the one telling us that we must have dialed the wrong number.  She had us show the call history on my boyfriend's phone to make sure we called the right number.  What other number is there to call???  She did apologize though (after trying to verify that we, indeed, talked to her and not another employee), and gave us a free piece of baklava.  That was nice.  It was too sweet for my boyfriend, so I ate pretty much all of it (yum).  As for the food, it was extremely tasty and fresh.  My boyfriend had the lamb gyro with feta fries.  He thought the gyro was great; the fries would have been better if the feta cheese could have melted into the fries instead of sitting on top of it.  My order was the gyro plate with rice pilaf, which was excellent.  The rice was seasoned great and the gyro was delicious.  It was actually a lot more than I could eat and ended up being two meals for me, which is pretty good for a $10 plate.  It also came with salad, which is another meal in itself.  The phone situation was pretty offputting, but the food is good enough and this place is close enough that we'll probably make this our go-to locale for Greek food.  Perhaps we will just order in person instead.

We lived in the Henderson area for about 2.5 years now and haven't been able to check this place out until last night. Well let me tell you didn't disappoint! It was so good! Haven't had some real good tasting home since we've moved from the east coast. Definitely will be returning for some more!

Staff very friendly and nice. We wanted to change it up from the traditional burger place and I'm glad we did. I ended up getting the rice bowl which definitely hit the spot after traveling all day and eating nothing.
This place is so tasty! The Greek salad with steak skewers is my go to for my ketogenic way of eating. The portions are generous too!

Update:  Happened again... using the app to put special instructions on each item does not yield expected order. The first order of the Rice bowl was correct, but the second on the same order was incorrect regardless of information posted to it. -shrug- ughh I used to love this place  Original review: Order screwed up yet again. Plus 30 min wait for carry out. Online orders seem to have the higher priority than customers who take out or dine in. Other customers behind us received order. I used to LOVE this place, but it'll now be the 4th or 5th restaurant on the list now.  We've been coming to this place before they opened their second location. It's not worth the hassle to call to complain because I'm not driving 5 miles back to fix my Great Greek islands that's just a regular salad.   I threw it out. Hot pockets for me tonight.

It's a good place.  I've been there about 6-7 times for lunch.  I always get the Gyro and feta fries, so I'm probably a relatively terrible food critic.  I do like the friendly staff and fresh ingredients.  One of these days I'll try something else.

Fantastic Greek food... And I love my Greeks! This little place was filled on a late Thursday afternoon. The wait staff advised that everyone loves their gyros, however, he also was able to recommend a delicious salad/rice/any type of meat plate which o chose. The lamb was seasoned to perfection, the salad was fresh with an abundance of veggies and the rice was very flavorful. I couldn't finish the whole plate.  Can't wait to finds self stranded and hungry on Henderson again!
Great little Greek place! We are visiting from San Diego and found this little gem. Service was amazing and food was right in point. We will definitely be back next time we are in town.
Very happy with last few times. I changed my times to not go during their busy lunch times. Now Togo orders are perfect. Great food as always.
Very good quality food... I tried the lamb souvlaki and is delicious  And very friendly staff  I recommend

We were there last week for TISE. Found this place on the way back to LA, the place is very clean and bright. The service is excellent.  The food is really good and so is the quality. We will definitely go back again.

We just drove into town and are staying at a 5 star hotel, yet we came to eat at Great Greek for dinner. The staff was so nice, food is AMAZING, and the atmosphere is perfect. They're busy for a reason. If we're in Vegas again, were coming back!

Excellent food, I always have to stop by when I'm in the area. I love their gyros because they definitely don't skimp on the meat. And it isn't overly salty like many Greek/Mediterranean places I've been to. You also have to try the baklava... Amazing!
I've been to the great greek several time and the food is always delicious!  Unfortunately they close wayyy to early!
This is the go place if you are around Henderson  Amazing! The food is fresh and healthy! I love the salmon bowl. It's packed with greens carbs and protein.

This place is AMAZING. The reviews are on point. My friend and I having never been, both got the Great Greek chicken bowl based on the reviews, and we LOVED it. The bowls come with rice pilaf which I normally don't care for, feta cheese, diced tomatoes, garbanzo beans, a little lettuce, cucumbers, olives and 5 pieces of delicious chicken. Everything was tossed in a light lemony dressing. They also give you a cup of really good and flavorful tzatziki sauce on the side. The flavors, I can't even describe how good they were. Everything just melded together perfectly. I have been talking about this dish since I left, and I can't wait to go back and try some other items. My friend and I also split and order of feta fries, which were really yummy. I love to dip the fries into the tzatziki sauce for an added flavor bonus.   This is a family owned business and everyone I encountered was super friendly. The place is small, with maybe 10 or so tables inside, but they do have a few extra tables outside on the patio. I just wish this place were closer to me, I would be here often.

Amazing Always. Try to stop here every time while driving through Vegas. Family was looking for a place with real food on a road trip and we love Greek food. Very happy to find these guys and they never disappoint. Staff is so friendly. Now I just need to make it for the special days of pork chops and lamb chops.

If you like Greek food and a good place to eat when you're really hungry this is the place. The service is friendly and quick and the food is always fresh.  This is the place that I always take out of town folks to come get a nice lunch. Check it out!

This is the real deal!! From the grape leaves to the tzatziki sauce was on point. I'm usually not a fan of the tzatiki but this one is the best I've had. It's not on the menu but you can mix the meats on the traditional plates!! I'm glad cause I got to try the shrimp and lamb. Both awesome!! The staff here is friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. This place is very clean and they are fast. I will be back I have to try the gyros.
My only complaint is that this place is so fantastic that it's really busy all the time. The only thing better is the other location on Blue Dimond! I could eat here every day.

First time trying it here didn't know what to expect, I  ordered the Greek salad with shrimp and chicken it was greasy and delicious... nice helpful staff as well.. definitely coming back soon to eat more authentic Greek cuisine
I crave greek food every now and then. I'm so glad this place is right in front of my house. My favorite is the really warm pita bread with hummus!! I can eat pita bread everyday. :)
Awesome Greek food and super nice staff. I am afraid there is nothing more to say!  Loved it!!

Great food when we don't feel like cooking and it's right around the corner from the house. It appears to be a family-owned place and that always is a plus for me.  We have never been disappointed with the quality of the food or service. Keep up the good work.

OUTSTANDING!  This was our 2nd trip to the Great Greek and once again it was amazing.  Last time we were there we had the Gyro and a Greek Wrap along with the hummus.  This time we both had rice bowls, I had it with gyro meat and my fiance had shrimp on hers.  Both were huge and were outstanding!  The staff is amazing!!  Everyone, from the ladies taking orders to the guys cooking in the back have a great sense of humor and are more than happy to answer any questions that you have.  We only live a few miles away so we will be back again soon!

3/9/16 - just returned from dinner. Food was good, the young gentleman working the register is a great asset the business.  Upbeat, positive good people person. Atmosphere is ok, don't get me wrong, clean, clean, clean. Just being from out of town I wanted a more relaxed setting.  I will return the next time I'm in the area

Staff is friendly and helpful. The food is fresh. My boyfriend and I enjoyed the classic gyro. The only thing I will do differently next time is ask for the Taki sauce on the side. It was a bit heavy and I scraped some of it off, but the food still tasted great. We will definitely be back!
Wow wow wow.   This place is great.   Clean dining area great service and Super Great food.  I would strongly recommend this to anybody looking for a great lunch or dinner

Must try the feta fries and the gyro.  We came during the lunch hour and it was pretty busy, so not the greatest place to grab a quick bite during lunch. I still want to go back and try the plates and dips. A bit pricey, but the quality is really good.  Employees are really friendly, which is always a plus.

This is my VERY favorite Greek Restaurant in the US hands down. The Greek fries are yummy, the hummus is so very fine!  Literally. The lamb is seasoned to perfection and the serving size is huge! Worth every penny!

I have a new obsession with Greek food. I don't know why but I do. I guess there are worse things to do in Las Vegas.  So I did a yelp search and this was the closest place to my office. The reviews looked good so I went over for lunch. I walked in and the place was nice and clean. It's pretty new with several high tops and many shorter 4 tops. I got in line and ordered a gyro plate, Hummus (togo) and some banana pudding.   Gyro Plate - It was pretty good. I enjoyed the meat and everything was fresh and tasty. Now I'll have to say I enjoyed Ambrosia Cafe MUCH better which is why I gave it 3 and not 4 stars.   Banana Pudding - It wasn't that exciting. There was a  place in Denver that just had the best in the world. It was ok, but I would have liked it to seem like they had put a little more love in it.  Hummus - As always hummus is just awesome. Their pita was soft and yummy. I wish they had given more, but there you have it.   I liked this place but didn't just LOVE it. It's close so there is a chance I'll give it another change and see what else they have to offer.

The Skinny:  satisfying meals but the overall execution falls short on a few items(3), service: friendly for such a busy place (4), value: it's okay but nothing I would go out of my way for (3).  Craving some Greek food,  we schlepped it over to Henderson to give the Great Greek a try.   First of all, the joint is completely packed during Saturday lunch hours. It is good that the restaurant has counter service because every table is occupied. At the least, you can place your order while waiting for a table to free up. Luckily turnover for tables is relatively quick and the staff clean the tables promptly. I could also see the restaurant does a brisk takeout business which also bodes well.   We placed a order for a chicken souvlaki plate($11.95),  a gyros traditional sandwich combo (with their soup and a drink; $6.95 sandwich + $2.95 combo price), and a appetizer size hummus ($3.95).   The hummus was pretty delicious although it could have used a nice squeeze of lemon to really round out the flavor. The only thing is that the pita served was a little too soft (although served warm) which made dipping difficult. In addition,  we could have used a bit more pita to use for dipping.   The combo sized avgolemeno (lemon, egg, chicken rice soup) soup was very generous in terms of portion size not to mention filling. I found a tinge too salty for my palate and again it needed a bit more lemon to brighten up the taste. Overall,  the soup was just okay for me and I wouldn't order it again.   The chicken souvlaki plate was also quite generous. Served with a sizable Greek salad,  it comes with 2 skewers,  pita,  tzatziki and a choice of rice or fries.  The chicken souvlaki was a trifle dry and a bit too salty. Flavorless, it didn't have that lemony garlicky oregano punch that I normally associate with a kickass souvlaki. I don't think I would order this again.  The Greek salad was very fresh and the dressing was perfect. I also loved their tzakiki which was quite flavorful. Fries were okay.   The traditional beef/lamp gyros was very large and packed with meat. The spicing of the meat was good however it lacked that last bit of caramelization to make it the perfect sandwich.   Overall,  we were stuffed to the gills after all the things we ordered. Some of the items were great,  others were a pass.  Given our experience,  this joint rates a 3 starred review.

This is a great place. Warm atmosphere, helpful staff, and an establishment that is meticulously clean. I wish I lived here so that I could come back on a regular basis. The baklava is simply to die for. If I could give 10 stars, I would.

Amazing food! the Feta fries are chronic. Super nice staff. I am never disappointed with the beef/lamb gyro. *Update- this is now my regular place to go because the food is soo amazing. I always bring my family from out of town and it never disappoints.

Hubby and I have eaten here a few times now and have enjoyed the gyros and feta or garlic fries and the falafel, so when the parents came into town thought we'd bring them here.  They are not familiar with greek food due to living in the land of Packers, beer, brats and cheese.  Needless to say, they loved it.  The gyros are the best in town.  Everything is fresh and tastes fabulous.  The gyro meat is nicely seasoned and you know it comes off a doner.  I had a small salad with my gyro and the dressing was excellent, not heavy at all and the perfect amount.  Next time we will have to save room for some dessert.  I wish it was closer to where we live.

What an amazing restaurant. From the family that owns it to the tasty food! My family has been going to Great Greek since they've opened and we won't go anywhere else. Thank you for the amazing food and even better service!!

It Really Is The Great Greek   My husband surprised me one day when he said he wanted Greek food. I couldn't argue with him cause the idea sounded great to me! When we arrived at The Great Greek the little restaurant was very clean, inviting and the help was exceptional!! The place was a little busy but nothing to extreme.  We ordered some Dolmades (grape leaves stuffed with seasoned rice and fresh herbs). These dolmades are some of the best around. The grape leaves were fresh, with a little crisp to them. The rice and herbs were well balanced. They came cold, even tho I prefer mine a little warm, but after a few minutes they were gone so it didn't matter! We also got a side of Hummus (garbanzo beans crushed with garlic, lemon juice and some olive oil). It wasn't bad but I've had better. For the meal we got a Falafel Pita (stuffed with falafel, hummus, lettuce, red onions, tomatoes and mint yogurt sauce, served with a side Greek salad) and a Gyro Plate (tender slices of Gyro with tzaziki sauce, pita, rice pilaf and a side Greek Salad). The Falafel was so soft and done perfect! I couldn't have wanted a better falafel! The combination of the falafel and all the other ingredients made for a healthy satisfying meal. My husband said the Gyro plate was really good as well. The meat was seasoned well! Although, I didn't try the meat, the rice was very tasty! To finish up the meal we got some Baklava (layers of filo dough, walnuts and cinnamon with honey). Seriously, the best baklava I have ever had...in my life!!! I would be very disappointed if I found out that they didn't make this in house. I've had plenty of homemade baklava, which has been very good, but this one tops them all! Overall the food was amazing, fresh and made to order! We have since been back and we will continue to go. So, if you want some great Greek food, head over to The Great Greek!!! You won't be disappointed!  http://inapplesworld.blogspot.com/
Absolutely awesome, great food and service. Staff friendly and knowledgeable. Open and airy.

I will get the only complaint I have out of the way first....my wife and I had planned on eating in (today's date) but upon opening the front door a rather unpleasant smell hit us. I assume they were boiling and peeling eggs and it took over the entire place.   So we got the food to go and it was really great. The giros are top notch and the feta fries are out of this world. Will be going back but please guys.....no smells next time!

I was not a fan of Greek food, but this place proved me to be very wrong. Everything is amazing, the baklava is the best I've ever had. I find myself craving their avgelmono during all my waking hours. The pitas are awesome, their skewers are perfect. Eat here, it's awesome. And it's pretty cheap, too. Great service, great people. There is absolutely nothing about this spot that I don't love. If you're eating in, the feta fries are delicious. I wouldn't really recommend the fries for delivery, but you can have anything else delivered without a problem. The fries tend to lose their crisp during delivery, but that's just what happens to fries and it's not something the restaurant can do much about. I get my delivery through GrubHub, I don't think the restaurant offers it themselves.

Great place. I come here at least twice a week to eat. Local restaurant, family owned. I enjoy the food, always fresh, authentic Greek. I highly recommend eating here! My daughter came to visit from Florida, every time I tell her Im going here for dinner, she is so jealous that she cant be here to eat the food.

There is an asshole in charge here....after 3 people after me were served, I was told "Your sandwich takes time". This is after 35 minutes...this moron then proceeds to throw my money back and says,"Here's your apology" when I asked for my money back...good choice management...stop hiring children to work your counter...

This place is a gem! I've grown up eating authentic greek food and I must say this place is the real deal. Best gyro I've ever had. Also, get the Feta fries! So worth it! Price is reasonable, food is stellar, staff is friendly. Only downside is the place is a bit small for the demand. The line is out the door every time I go and occassionally there is a 10-20 min wait. But so worth it.

My entire experience here was GREAT! From when you walk in, you are greeted very vibrantly by the staff-- and even as you are still making up your mind trying to order, she is patient and always has a smile on her face.   The food is WONDERFUL! By far one of the best Greek places stateside that I have ever had.  The food isn't oily or greasy, the meat is good, and the portion size is great.  Also their tzatziki is delicious--- and they do not skimp on the serving size either.   I am definately going back here again the next time I am in Henderson.
