OMG best Greek Food....not ever but in my work area. LOL.  DO: Order the lamb and meat gyro.  DO NOT: Order the chicken gyro. I ordered one and they took forever.  Service is good. While I was waiting for the chicken gyro (not mine, it was for a co-worker), they offered me everything. Water, drinks, fries, they needed to calm down. I just wanted my gyro.   I'd come back here IF I lived on this side of the town.
Food is fresh and delicious!!! Very clean and nice inside Has a nice outside seating area too Reasonably priced The chicken skewers were my fav! Great place for a quick healthy lunch

We decided to try this place one day and I didn't leave disappointed at all. Everything was delicious and amazing. The service was really good and it was a cute little restaurant. This place is defiantly worth going to. If your ever in the area defiantly worth a stop. For sure I will be returning!!
Simply delicious! BEST Greek food I've had in Vegas! This will definitely be a go to lunch spot for me! So fresh and flavorful!

I was THRILLED...that The Great Greek opened a restaurant in the Southwest area of the valley. I have previously eaten at their Henderson location - quite frequently and loved it. For a brand new restaurant, you would have no idea, because the team that is in place there knows what they are doing. They offer fast, friendly and accurate customer service. There is no different in the food from location to location - at least that I am able to tell anyway.   From this restaurant, I've had the Grilled Garlic Shrimp and the Grilled Steak Souvlaki with Feta Fries - Both were excellent and will satisfy any craving that you're having, especially the Feta Fries. In terms of desert the Baklava is the best that I've ever had. A few weeks ago, I took a friend from Oklahoma here while he was in town and he described the Baklava as "being the best he's ever had outside of Greece."   There is good seating indoor and outdoor. With long lines it can get a little tight, but that's just part of living in a city like Las Vegas. The restaurant does to-go orders, but you have to place the order in the store. Once this location is able to handle online orders I will be more apt to grab dinner. This reason, and because they ran out of rice at 8:30pm on a Tuesday night (it was close to closing time) is the reason for a four star rating. Once the online thing is up and running, five stars!

This place is so delicious and easily now one of my favorite places to eat. It was so busy when we came in and now I can understand why! Everything we tried was so great and fresh. Not a bad flavor in anything. They are really doin it right. It's great that we live just a few minutes away. Definitely coming back no doubt. I recommend 200%!

Apparently this is a relatively new establishment.  I've been in twice now for lunch carry-out and neither time did they disappoint!  I had the gyro plate, grilled shrimp, spanakopita, dolmades, and baklava.  The service was excellent and the food wonderful!  Price-points offered good value.

There isn't much to write about the Great Greek. It is a fast food type restaurant that serves delicious Greek food that tastes home made.  The Gyro, Grilled Chicken Souvlaki, Grilled Garlic Shrimp and Avgolemono Soup are all surprisingly delicious.   If you are in the mood for a wholesome tasting Greek meal, you would do well to give this place a try. You won't be disappointed.

The steak kebab was very tender and tasty and juicy. The Gyro sandwich was very tasty as well and they gave a good amount of tatziki sauce with it. Rice was flavorful.  Service was very friendly. The only thing is that they may need a bigger place to seat more patrons as customers kept coming. Our friend said that this was the best Greek food she ever tasted.
One of favorite places. I could eat there everyday. If you go at lunch expect a wait. Don't forget to order those delicious butter cookies. Amazing.

The food is really good . My current favorite is the grilled chicken soulvaki plate,even the side salad it comes with is amazing. Another favorite of mine is  the feta fries .This place is usually pretty busy during lunch and dinner. It's pretty hard to find a place to sit around noon,But the food is so worth it and the staff is amazing!
Again, Amazingly delicious every time. The best greek food in town. Always fresh with deep flavors and great prices. Doesn't matter what location I visit. Both the same quality and service.
Excellent food, good prices and great customer service.  I will be making this a regular stop

I'm picky when it comes to ethnic food but this place is as good as it can get for Henderson. When I crave for fast Greek food I come here. Reasonable prices, very generous portion sizes and very friendly staff! I don't know if authentically though if fries comes as a side.
This place is awesome. Husband had a lamb gyro and I had a steak rice bowl. It was so good! You should try this place.
Date night with my wife. Fresh lamb gyro for me.  Steak kabob and salad for my better half. Waited 7 mins for table but well worth it.  Best food. Best service!

This is our favorite Friday night date night dinner spot. Service is awesome!  Staff very friendly and helpful. Food is so out of this world GREAT. I switch up between the lamb skewers and the gyro. Stacy has the beef skewers as a rule. The salads are awesome. Just a little heavy on the onion. You must try them if you like real Greek food.
First time here and loved everything about this place. From the food to the friendly customer service! Baklava tasted like God made it himself. I will definitely be coming back!

While in town for my husbands birthday we decided to try this Greek restaurant for lunch. We have a vacation home nearby and heard good reviews. We arrived at 11:15 am on a Saturday. By 11:30 there wasn't a seat to be had. It's a small place with limited seating but the food is outstanding. We ordered hummus, Gyros and a baklava. The staff was friendly and attentive. They acknowledged by name several regulars who came in. The hummus was delicious. I have never had a better Gyro. The taste of the meat was so flavorful and abundant. Feeling bad for the standing room only crowd, I suggested we take the baklava home for later.  We were stuffed from all the other food. We got home and I couldn't wait any longer to dig into the baklava. It's by far the freshest most tasty baklava I have ever had. It nearly sent me into a sugar coma but it was well worth it.  We will be back in April and will be ordering lunch and dinner a few times.
I have had several Greek places around town and this is definitely my favorite so far :) everyone is always friendly and the food is always great.
This place is my absolute favorite. I came for dinner and lunch yesterday and I am back for lunch again today. I love it here!!!!! So flavorful and healthy. So fresh. Amazing!!!!!

I was spoiled on retro row in long beach with 3 amazing Greek places all with different flavors and menus. This place is one of two that have spicy feta here in town and this spot makes it the best! The Avegalemno soup is so-so but they are against my old favorite place in SoCal. However, the rice pilaf perfect. This is my new go to dinner spot. Eat Fresh / Eat Greek ! id give 10 stars if I could.

We love this place - the food is delicious and the service is great! A wonderful "mom and pop" place...it is a great change to all these "same old same old" fastfood chains in the area! They even have some outdoor seating - but since it is rather small it is sometimes hard to find seating outside. Awesome place - it really is  "great greek" food!

I'm not going to lie, I was totally intimidated by the fast paced environment of this place when I first walked in. I was looking to grab something for lunch but the place was packed and the cooks and servers looked very busy, I almost just left. I decided to wait in line and order "The great Greek gyro" which was delicious.  The young woman taking orders was great, gave me a warm welcome and was very nice. After ordering my food was ready in about 3 minutes, and the man who gave it to me said "Thank you, I'll see you next time!" I think it's great when restaurants make a point to invite you back! I would recommend this to anyone for a quick lunch spot. Great food and service for a great price!

We had a great experience! The place was packed and smelled amazing as soon as we walked in. Mom ordered the Gyro plate and I ordered the chicken souvlaki. The fries with feta are a trip to heaven, the meat is well seasoned and cooked to perfection. The  Gyro and Tzaziki are our top favorites and no matter what, do not leave without having Baklava. Superb!  I hope they keep cooking like this, the problem in Henderson is that restaurants change their quality of food and service, let's hope you stay on top for many years!

OMG!!!!!!!! The best!  Everything is amazing, but the feta fries with Taziki!!!!!! Holy buckets, who knew I could be a vegetarian and just eat that the rest of my life!!!  Hummus and lamb the best I have ever had!

OMG!!!!!!!! The best!  Everything is amazing, but the feta fries with Taziki!!!!!! Holy buckets, who knew I could be a vegetarian and just eat that the rest of my life!!!  Hummus and lamb the best I have ever had!

Upon walking into this restaurant, the ambiance is inviting. The decor is the typical blue and white from the Greece flag. I ordered the great Greek gyro (chicken) with tzatziki sauce on the side. Made it a combo with feta fries and a drink - everything was delicious!!!! Fresh, flavorful, and exactly as specified on the menu! Can't wait to go back and try more!

Um, so, this place had the best Greek food I have ever tasted in my life?! I was overwhelmed by their menu because I wanted everything. I even had trouble ordering because my mind was trying to process all the goodness lol. It all sounded soo good, they all looked delicious and fresh. I ended up getting the gyro wrap and feta fries. The wrap was superb, FULL of fresh veggies and meat, and topped with a load of feta YUM! I got a chance to try my friends garlic shrimp skewer and that was delicious as well--perfectly cooked shrimp. Hummus was wonderful and didnt have that over the top sourness to it, which I personally like. And the staff was so nice and helpful! Cant wait to go back!

I have read others responses on yelp and decided to give this restaurant a try.  It is a small restaurant and quite crowded.  The food was nothing short of amazing.  The service was up to par for how busy they were.  You order at a counter and hope to find a table, but they do that as first come first served basis.  I will be happy to eat there again.

took my cousin to go check this place out. i got the lamb/beef pilaf rice plate and he got some kind of salad platter thing. honestly when our two orders came out they had the same ingredients but positioned differently. but mine came with pita bread. the yogurt cucumber sauce was really good. definitely didnt think i would get full off of it but i was stuffed. drinks are self serve. the lady who i assume was the owner would come around and check up on us frequently and came and took our garbage away.
I love the chicken rice bowl here! So amazingly clean and yummy. Chicken is so tender. The young guy at register is always so nice! Great customer service!

Huge fan of Greek food and came across The Great Greek by chance. Tried going to Chick-fil-A close by and line was LONG (as always). Opened up the yelp app to find an alternative.  First of all, their gyro is bomb. Super fresh and cooked perfectly. Ordered a gyro platter which comes with your standard side salad. More than ample amount of meat, definitely not stingy. Also comes with pita bread and your choice of rice/fries. GO WITH THE RICE! I mean, I'm carb conscious and all... but their rice is worth it.  Service was great. Super friendly and smiles all around. Price is fair for the quality of food. Needless to say, I'll be a regular here.

First time here, my husband went yesterday . We both got the Lamb great Greek gyros... they are huge and delicious. We also got fries and the butter cookies which are also really good ! We will be back

This is one of my favorite places to eat when I visit Las Vegas. I go every other week for work, and I will literally risk missing my flight to make sure I get my great Greek fix! Best salmon salad of my life! Shrimp skewers are awesome, I'm never disappointed here. I'm obsessed.

First time trying today and I feel like they bought their reviews or something because I spent $45 on literally a fear factor episode. Everything smelled so good until I bit into it. I got the garlic shrimp and it had no salt or char no nothing and their rice was bland. My boyfriend got the Greek salad wrap and they still put nasty stank hummus in there and we HATE hummus. And the lady recommended the rice pudding and don't get me started on that because that was the most basic smiths brand rice pudding I ever tasted smh. And the best thing I can say was the pita bread and the baklava was whatever.

In the past I have had bad experiences with lamb prepared poorly before this restaurant and I was reluctant to try it. I tried their gyro plate with the full lamb (not beef/lamb mix) and it was absolutely amazing. Best tasting lamb I've ever had and it changed my attitude of the food. 6 stars if I could rate that high and I will come again. Service was friendly and top notch.

This is my favorite Greek place in town, it's just a bit pricey I feel. The food is really good and quality is as well. However, three meals and drinks, with tip was $60. That's why they get four instead of five stars. I'd be here all the time if it were less expensive.   I've never had anything bad or disappointing here, and the kids like it. Even the picky one likes it because it's simple. We usually get chicken or steak souvlaki when we are there, and it's offered with fries or rice pilaf not also comes with a really good side Greek salad. The kids plates aren't quiet half price and come with one skewer instead of two. I order the full size and they split it.   Yesterday they were offering a special of mousakka (sp) and it was really good. It's egg plant, ground beef, potatoes and bechamel sauce  it also came with the side salad.   I recommend the feta fries, falafels, hummus with pita, cookies and baklava as well. We don't always get those but they never disappoint.   I like that they have healthy options that are just part of the regular menu, because you really can't go wrong with a protein and salad.

Great customer service, Brittany and Jack. We came in as the last customers, ( yes we were that couple) but the service was amazing.  The food was astoundingly good. Whoever owns the place, promote these two and the cooks. Way too good. Will be back.
Outstanding food, fresh and tasty and authentic. The staff is great, really a comfortable atmosphere with great food.

This place was very busy for lunch. Not a big restaurant. I went to this place on the last day of Las Vegas trip and ate the Gyro Plate. It was good and a nice way to finish off the Vegas trip. All the ingredients were very fresh. You order at the cash register first and then one of the employees brings you the order.
A-mazing!!  So Delicious.  I want to come back again tomorrow. Fresh ingredients, super clean, well decorated, all around great atmosphere.  The employees were super friendly as well.

Been here several times but never posted a review. Not only is the food delicious, well cooked, and perfectly seasoned, but the wonderful service you receive from this small business is awesome. I wish larger businesses in the area would practice the same wonderful customer service that The Great Greek has consistently provided. Love having this great place in Henderson!!
Fast, casual, clean, and super fresh greek food. Love this place. Salads with a meat add-on and the lemon soup are my favorite but everything's great. Friendly and efficient staff. Good location
Enjoyed a small Greek salad with a chicken skewer. Salad already had dressing but it was the perfect amount. Chicken was flavorful and not dry at all--will be going back

Seriously amazing. This is my first experience at the Great Greek. The bowl is huge and everything in it tastes really fresh and flavorful. I ordered shrimp and steak(cooked to order, med-rare), both meat portions are bigger than I thought they would be, are very good quality and not greasy at all.  I'll definitely be coming back!
First time here i got the shrimp dinner the food is delicious even the fries are yummy. Really great customer service everyone in that place is so nice... definitely will be back.

Delicious Greek food close to home. The flavor is wonderful and it tastes so fabulously fresh. A healthy favorite that keeps me coming back for more. Definitely recommend the Mezze Plate if you want to get a taste for the place. Even their dolmades, a food I typically dislike, is really delicious!

I absolutely LOVE the food here! The chicken gyro is outstanding and the hummus appetizer with FRESH pita is out of this world.   I find it odd that they don't serve Lamb, but since I don't eat Lamb I'm not highly disturbed by this fact.   The food is consistently delicious but the establishment is consistently FREEZING! My suggestion would be to get your food to go and enjoy it in the comfort of your own, temperature balanced dwelling.

I just love this place - it is like coming to see family here.  Food is great, and how I love all things Greek (I am a complete Malakas when it comes to Greek and Greek Traditions).  Best Dolmas in town, and the Pastitsio always makes my day).  Opa ela ethw tora fella arsenoko!!!

Now here's a place to get excited about. It's delicous and delightful. Amazing fresh food. I just moved to Vegas 6 weeks ago and I've easily been here 10 times. Everytime the food is amazing, friendly staff. The place is small and getting a table is HARD, the wait for the food is a little longer than I'd like. But you can't rush perfection and deliciousness! Definitely worth all of it!

My favorite greek spot down the street & around the corner from my house! I absolutely love the avgolemono soup I wish it came in a bigger size. I get the rice pilaf side & chicken skewer at least 3 times a week & that's enough for me as a meal & a snack for work later on. Always on time with my pickup.
I went to this place not ever going to a Greek place before. Not expecting much, I was blown away! Great food, great service, highly recommend this place, I will definitely be back!!

On our way to San Diego we stopped for the night in Henderson, NV. A group of 10 of us were lookin for some inexpensive dinner so I hit up yelp. While it was a bit difficult to find even with a GPS, we eventually found it and were not disappointed.   The woman behind the counter was a jovial Greek woman and another Greek man (son I presumed) was running around helping. She expalined the menu and after much deliberation we went with two family dinners for 4, which included a huge gyro, salad, dessert, and a drink for each person all for about $43. Very reasonable. The other two got some sort of salad, one got the shrimp. The portions are large and the gyro was very tender and tasty. It also had feta cheese on top, which was a nice touch. I tried the shrimp, which were easily jumbo shrimp and very flavorful. The gyro was by far the best part of the meal and the feta fries were also very good. We couldn't decide what dessert to order until a lady behind us in line said their rice pudding was delicious. We ordered both the rice pudding and the baklava. Both were very good. I can only take so much sweet, so I couldn't finish the rice pudding but it was very good. The baklava was one of the best I've had. And I've tried my Greek friend's mom's baklava straight from Greece. It had the perfect flakiness and combination of sweet with the nuts. I'm not a huge dessert fan but the baklava and rice pudding I would order again. Definitely a delicious, affordable meal and I will go again when I'm in the area.  Side note they had raspberry iced tea which was a plus if you don't drink soda :)
Amazing food, fantastic service. Would highly recommend. The best gyro that I've bad, and the Feti Fries are to die for.

I don't come to this side of town often, but as soon as I decided to meet my friend with the big fat Greek appetite I knew we would be coming here.  Great Greek is certainly where it's at for gyros!   A hearty portion of wonderfully flavored beef/lamb meat is sliced thick and surrounded by a warm fluffy pita (the kind you'd feel comfortable resting your head upon if you weren't ready to devour it) in this truly special gyro!  I'm not sure if I would bestow it with the title of best gyro in the valley, but it is certainly one of the best. ... add some Feta Fries and a Greek Salad if you brought your beast appetite... or just want to save some for later because both are great options here. I tried some of my friends Avgolemono Soup...another great addition!  I haven't had the opportunity to try any of their other dishes, but I would order whatever I was in the mood for with confidence based on the quality of what I had.

Discovered this gem on a drive by. Authentic Greek food made with love. My daughter had the falafel gyro and I had the lamb/beef gyro. Both were wonderfully delicious. I also had a small salad and she had fries. The salad was fresh and delicious with romaine, feta, kalamata olives, and most importantly, the tomatoes were fresh and crispy. The fries were crispy and flavorful too. I highly recommend this business. You won't be disappointed!

This place has to be the best Greek restaurant in the Las Vegas area. Their chicken/lemon/rice soup is fantastic and will only set you back $3.50. (with Pita bread). I also can't get enough of the feta fries . The place is small with an outdoor patio to accommodate those who don't mind melting while they eat. After you order at the counter, the friendly staff will bring the food to your table. I can't wait to come back and try some of the other options at The GREAT GREEK!
One of my favorite Greek places to eat at. This place is always clean and the food is always good.

Visiting Las Vegas for the first time and The Great Greek came highly recommended to eat at, glad I did this place will surely not disappoint you. Great family atmosphere and very friendly, will be back on my next visit. Order the chicken rice bowl!
Great service, great food!  Steak kabob and lemon chicken soup were amazing!  We always come whenever we are in town.

If I could give more stars, I would!  I arrived right when they opened, just a minute before actually and within 10 minutes, EVERY table inside was full, on a Monday!  For a quick restaurant type of environment, the service and food quality was amazing! Not to mention that while inside, it had a feeling of community/family, everyone was talking and it felt cozy.  There is a small outdoor patio with nice tables and umbrellas which would make for a great place to grab wine/beer in the evening. They have a decent little selection of each.  An overall great experience, would absolutely recommend to anyone!

Its great to have a new cuisine in the area off Blue Diamond, if you are in the area you know the choices aren't vast. With that said The Great Greek Mediterranean Grill in my opinion is not the greatest Greek you can get in town. Meraki Greek Grill or Shish Kabob House is a much fresher choice for the same value. I found the Grilled Chicken Souvlaki plate ($14.02 w/tax) at the Great Greek to be dry and mildly flavorful. The rice pilaf was cooked properly and probably my favorite part of the dish. The feta on the salad was fresh as well as the other ingredients, olive garden should ask for their vinaigrette recipe its pretty dang good! So I would have to give their salad an A+. I would cover dessert but when I was in line ordering I asked if I could get a order of Baklava but I was informed they where out (this was at about 8:15 pm they close at 9 pm). A customer behind me, which ordered (5) orders of baklava ice cream told me that the baklava dessert was awesome, sad to say I didn't get to try it. That actually might get me to go back on another night when I want a quick and easy fix for some Greek food, that and the salad. Other than that I am traveling to Meraki off Trop and rainbow. The Great Greek does stay open a little later than others so that is another plus and actually the reason I tried them in the first place, as Meraki closes at 8:30 pm. the owner was there the night I came in, great operator, friendly staff, clean establishment. I want to give this establishment a higher rating but the food was just not there for me.

Food is good but service has been slipping over the last year.  Last two time have have gone they took forever to bring my main course out after I got salad.  Second time brought out main dish and forgot to bring out salad first.  Then had to wait for utensils to eat while my salmon got cool.  Not good.

Came back today with my wife. She go the falafel Gyros and love it.  I got my traditional Gyros. It tasted even better the second time around. Bread was soft and meat and veg were super fresh. I ask for some extra peppers. Girl that work there more than happy to give us some. Great service and food. This is our go to place for greek food. :)
Super tasty Greek food, had my first meal there last week and definitely won't be my last. Worth the 15 minute drive from my place!

My husband and two boys are picky eaters and it hard pleasing all of them. We tried this place for the first time and WOW! The restaurant is very clean and simple, the lady that took our order was very friendly and helpful, portions are huge, and the food is fresh. We got the family meal with 4 great greek gyros, feta fries (I paid $2 more for the feta), and huge Greek salad, 4 drinks, and 4 desserts. It came out to $49 great deal to me for the amount of food. I was surprised how fresh everything was considering we went before closing time. The lamb was wonderful tender and full of flavor, the salad dressing was so good even my 11 year old loved it, and the tzaziki was so delicious and refreshing. The fries was a huge hit with all of us especially my 4 year old son. We have baklava which was good, but a bit stale considering it was sitting for the whole day. The Shamali wasn't to my liking, but it was sitting all day also. I really wanted to try the Yia Yia's rice pudding after reading all of the reviews, but she said they sold out. I will definately frequent this place, recommend it to my friends and brother (another big foodie), and bring my mom (the biggest foodie). I give this place two thumbs up and a double ok!

First time here for lunch on 5/27/18. Great food, everything tasted very fresh. Even the soda was good! I will say that the feta fries are great! I couldn't eat them fast enough! Next time I plan on having them with the lamb/beef gyro meat. Very clean inside & a bright room. I will definitely be back! Thank you for a tasty lunch!
We eat here about once every two weeks. Gyros are the best in town. French fries done crisply and flavorful. This fast-serve Greek food at its finest. Food is consistently good all the time!

This is my Favorite place to eat! I've been coming here for the last year and it has been amazing every time. The salad, kabob and even the soup Amazing! If you are in the area it's a must. I've been to a few other Greek restaurants but this is the best. Oh and when you stop in please do not forget to order feta fries, life changing deliciousness !!

My favorite place! I just had the chicken gyro twice this week along with the feta fries that are so amazing. Delicious fries with melted feta cheese. This place has seriously never failed me. Both locations are great which is a plus because sometimes different locations are not consistent. I definitely recommend this if you want Greek food.

3.5 stars   Kind of hard to access their parking lot if you're not familiar.   Came during lunch on a Friday, it seemed busy but not too busy. There's indoor and outdoor seating available. You order up front and your food is brought to your table. The line to order moved fairly quickly and we got our food in less than 10 minutes.   We ordered two lamb/beef gyro combos (side & drink) with feta fries ($.50 extra) for about $25. The gyros had lettuce, tomato, red onion, tzatziki sauce, and feta cheese... A LOT of feta cheese. The gyro meat was moist and had good flavor. It was also sliced thicker than I'm used to. The gyros also came with a couple of small pepperoncini peppers.  The feta fries were tasty; battered fries covered in feta and another white cheese (mozzarella?). They were pretty garlicky as well. I wasn't even able to put a dent in the pile of fries as the gyro had me stuffed.   The food was solid, but nothing absolutely amazing. That being said, I would come back if I was in the area or if a companion wanted to go.

This place is a 10min walk from my house and I absolutely love it!!! We don't have a lot of good food in our area and The Great Greek was such a breath of fresh air! Not only was it one of the only food places I could eat while pregnant(everything made me super sick) but my daughter is 6months and I still crave this place. Iv never been given bad food. Service is always fast and AMAZING.

Simple fresh ingredients! I love good Greek food and The Great Greek is just that - great! Came here on a Monday afternoon for lunch and the place was pretty busy. I ordered the Greek salad as a wrap. The dish was simple yet the flavor was amazing and the lettuce seemed very fresh. We also enjoyed the feta fries - you can never go wrong with cheese and fries!   My friend got the combination plate with lamb and steak and said the meat was excellent. I would return to the Great Greek and recommend it for a quick healthy lunch!

Since I moved to Henderson I've been looking for some good falafel.  I found it at Great Greek.  When my wife was out of town I ate there 3 times.  Their grilled shrimp also delicious, get it with the feta fries.  It may be a little pricey, but it's to die for.  I would recommend it to anyone looking for s great Gyro, baklava, or anything Greek head on over to the Great Greek.  You won't regret it.

The grilled garlic shrimp plate was so full of flavor, it was hard to put down. The shrimp was juicy, well seasoned and cooked perfectly. The Greek salad is delicious and very refreshing. The pita bread and tzatziki is super yummy and the fries give it just the perfect crunch. A local family owns and runs the business and takes great pride in their work. It is kept immaculate and is very welcoming!  This place is a keeper.

Now that I've been back to The Great Greek several times and have had the pleasure of trying several additional dishes on their menu, I've had to raise my rating from 4 to 5 stars.  This really is as good as this type of food gets in this type of setting.  Everything is always fresh and delicious and the several people I've brought all think so too.  I now make it a point to come here about at least bi-weekly or more.
Great rice pudding. Their salad is good and gyro was decent. I will definitely try this place again. It was clean and had very good customer service.

Ok folks I just got done eating at this gem of a place. I have started a plant based diet (ignore the cheese)....lol. So what better food to get then Greek/Mediterranean. I ordered Dolmades, Falafel Pita with Feta Fries. First the place: it's a very clean and quaint place with both indoor and outdoor seating. The Service: Quick and Super Nice. Now to the fun. The Food: I thought the Dolmades were very good. The Falafel was DYNAMITE!! VERY TASTY and filling. Then comes the feta fries. THERE was a recommendation to add hot sauce. So I did. I wanted to jump in the fries and live there. They were divine. One side note that doesn't matter but I had to say because it was kinda cool to me. Now I'm married and happily but the amount of beautiful women coming here to eat was phenomenal. They just kept coming. Anyways! Give this place a try. You will totally love it!!!!

I have a new addiction ... and its Greek.   Have tried the greek salad, gyro and rice pudding. Reasonable prices and large portions - the large greek salad usually lasts me two meals!  On the greek salad you can get, for an additional charge, your choice of added "protein" ... I usually choose the gyro meat.  They also give you sauce and pita on the side, so its like getting a mini gyro and salad.    On my last visit, someone in front of me inquired about the rice pudding and apparently it is made fresh / in-house.  So I had to get some to go!  WOW - it is amazing.  fresh rice pudding ... don't make a habit of eating it, but I just may need it each time I visit for a gyro or greek salad now.  Have outdoor seating also (although you look at a parking lot) but its a nice option.  order at counter and dine in, on patio or to go.

I joke with friends that I could easily eat here every day of the week and not have a problem with it or get sick of it. It is by far the best Greek restaurant in Henderson, and I'd argue it may even be the best in Vegas.   I typically order the chicken bowl but also really enjoy when they have lamb on their specials menu (this changes daily which I appreciate because it means the meat is very fresh). The portion is normally large enough that I have enough for a snack later in the day which makes the somewhat high price (in my opinion) worth it. All of the food here is very light and fresh and is a great pick me up after a long stressful day. The service is always incredibly friendly as well. I definitely go there regularly, and look forward to many more meals there.
If you want authentic Greek food prepared by a Greek family, go to The Great Greek. Fresh, high-quality ingredients. Kind & courteous staff. If I could, I would eat here everyday.

Absolutely FANTASTIC!!!! The service was a+++!!! The girl at the counter was so nice and so informative. We got the feta app with cucumbers (OUTSTANDING), I got the Greek salad (small) wth gyro meat, my husband got he rice bowl with double chicken and said it was incredible. We happened to be in the Henderson area, and pulled up yelp for a lunch spot, SO GLAD we did! So yummy, super clean, and excellent service. What more could you ask for?!  And we found out they just opened a location right near our house on Blue Diamond!! So naturally we went there the next day, LOL!

I have been a customer of The Great Greek located in Henderson for quite some time. So, when I saw the sign go up that they were building a Great Greek near me I was pretty excited to say the least. My to go meal is the greek salad with gyro meat. It's always so fresh and crisp! I have tried several greek salads around town and the Great Greek remains my favorite! I recently tried their chicken skewer plate and it was delicious as well! I have noticed it's quite busy at this location as well, but worth the wait!

This has become are go to spot for lunch and we keep coming back for the amazing food. The bonus is the customer service is great, such a welcoming enviroment.   Our usual orders consist of:  The Great Greek Bowl with Chicken, other choices are steak, shrimp or Gyro for 10.95 and salmon at MKT price  Traditional Gyro $6.95, make a combo for additional $2.95.  Tzaziki extra pita $3.95  Side of Steak Skewer $3.00  We had pretty much everything and we have liked everything they served us. They also offer daily special like Lamb chops plate or pork chop plate etc all at reasonable prices.

I must start this review by saying, I LOVE Greek food. The flavors, the fresh vegetables, and feta cheese is a god send. With that said, I've been to my fair share of Greek restaurants in the states and The Great Greek is hands down the best place I have ever been to.   This place is ALWAYS packed, on my last visit a family of 3 had to cram into a 2 top table and I had no choice by to take mine to go (literally the only drawback to this spot is how popular it is, go figure).   My favorite items on the menu are the gyro's and feta fries and the consistency in their meals is fantastic, always delicious, always perfect. Honestly, you haven't lived without trying the feta fries (extra lemon!)

We went to the location in Henderson the day prior. Had we not have gone there first, this would have been 5 stars. The food was still outstanding  -Feta dip w cucumbers  -Greek salad with gyro meat -Greek bowl with double chicken   The service was ok....... nothing great nothing bad. But after the over the top great service at the Henderson location, this location was more get you in and out and boarder line rushed you with ordering and picking up your order. Again, still a great experience, just not on the same level as Henderson!  See you tomorrow, LOL!

The best Greek food spot. I travel from Summerlin to Henderson. That's how good it is. I have gotten their Gyro and athenians burger. The meat isn't too oily and is seasoned well. The feta fries are nicely seasoned and the feta is melted properly and not burnt on top of the fries. It's a small place so it's hard to find a table but the service is good and the workers are nice and helpful. Their rice bowls are good too with good amount of protein and vegetables. Will continue to get my fix here.
Simply the best greek food in Vegas. Gyro plate has a very generous helping of perfect meat. The rice is wonderful and the side salads are extremely fresh.
I order the Greek salad with chicken/shrimp skewers. It was so fresh and so satisfying! Will definitely be back! Place was nice and clean. The staff was friendly.
My employer caters with this place once a month or so. DELICIOUS food. It is always a work favorite when we order here. Fresh ingredients and great taste!

Food is absolutely amazing! We ordered through Postmates and were not disappointed. So glad we have a quality Greek restaurant in the area to keep coming back to. I highly recommend the Greek salad and beef and lamb gyro. So fresh and perfectly seasoned and made with pride. We will be back. Thanks!

Best Greek in town IMO. Our family's typical order is Greek salad with gyro, Greek salad with chicken skewer, and the steak souvlaki. Everything has always been outstanding. Salad is fresh, pita bread is killer, tzatziki sauce is great. Service is always friendly and pretty fast. Dining room is clean and nice atmosphere. It's our go-to for Greek in Vegas!

We love the Great Greek! The service is always fast and the food delicious. Having Celiacs it's not always easy to find delicious gluten free meals when I go out to eat. We eat here about once a week! I love that they really listen and don't put the pita on my place because of my allergy. Some restaurants will accidently put it on and then remove it but I still have a reaction to it. I've not once had this happen at the Great Greek and they always take special care to make sure the pita is not any where close to my plate! I love the steak souvlaki on the plate of rice. The side salad is comes with is a traditional Greek salad. After starting with the salad I usually take half my meal home and enjoy it all over again the next day!
This place has the best greek food I have ever tasted! I always order the steak kabob greek salad. It definitely does not feel like I am eating fast food. Their baklava is really good too!

Food is still really good but I am through with this place. I have a family of five and every time I go, there is never any place to sit. They have four tops and two tops. The two tops are always open and the four top tables  always have one or two people taking up the tables meant for a bigger party.  I am tired of going  in and having to leave because there are no tables. Then I usually settle for Jason's deli. I don't like Jason's deli.

Excellent little corner Greek restaurant, authentic with a full menu of Greek specialties. Lamb soulavaki and gyros. Probably the best French fries Ive ever had !  Casual. Little pricey but quality food and generous portions. Best of all..... the best customer service Ive experienced in Las Vegas  thank you fellow behind the register!

Went here again a second and third time and service was not as expected.  Second time I went after work around 4:00PM. There weren't any customers ahead of me so there shouldn't have been any problems. Took about 15 minutes to get my chicken gyro to go. Since I was off I wasn't in a particular rush so I let it slide. Food was still great so I would give it 4 stars.  The third that I went I was around 1:00PM on a Thursday. The lunch rush looked like it was about to end because many people were finishing up there food. I got in an ordered the grilled shrimp plate thinking it shouldn't take so long to make...that is if the kitchen doesn't forget order.   I sat and waited patiently for 25 minutes and noticed people that came in after me after got their food already. Nobody came to check up on my even though I was at the table right in front of the counter. I approached the counter and asked what was going on. The lady working the front looked confused and shouted at the kitchen asking what's taking so long with the order. The slip was still just hanging at the food window untouched. I couldn't wait any longer as I had to get to work and asked for a refund since my food haven't even been started yet. The lady did not even say sorry and just kept shaking her head at me as she voided my transaction.  Maybe back of the house were new? I don't know, but I was not treated very well by the front of the house. Maybe I'll try this place again later, but it's going be a long while before I come back.

Came here for lunch. Staff was super friendly and helpful with the menu. The decor was very modern and fresh looking. The restaurant was set up fast food style where you order your food at the register and it is brought to you. Don't let that fool you the food isn't fast food style but gourmet Greek food. The gyro and steak souvalki was very good full of flavor. I love that they have a kids meals here not only with the traditional chicken nuggets but actually Greek food made smaller for kids. My children loved the kids chicken souvlaki and they offer it with soda or a juice box.    You have to have to order the feta frys. I've never had anything like it feta and and another type of cheese with more Greek seasoning on it so good I could not stop eating it!!
Tiny spot but amazing food. The Greek fries or feta fries are beyond amazing. Even my picky kid was trying to steal my fries. This place is a must if you are in Henderson.
I dream about those Feta Fries! Very friendly Staff. This place makes driving all the way to Henderson worth it!

This place never disappoints. Their tzaziki and garden veggie app is amazing, the gyros are huge and delicious,  kid's meals can be made healthy and are always a hit, and the falafel is a really yummy vegetarian option. This restaurant is a true gem.

Stopped in for lunch... it has a nice, fresh look to it.  I ordered the mezze plate, my husband got the greek salad with a steak skewer.  The mezze plate was good. The spanakopita was huge. The grape leaves had a great taste along with the tzaziki. The hummus was ok. I wish they had falafel on the plate too.    My husband said his salad and steak skewer were good. The salad (small) was huge. He could not finish it. This is a great spot for a fresh meal on a road of fast food.
First time at the Great Greek. Food deliciously fabulous. I had the lamb gyro special. It was the best I've had!
Good food, quick service, nice size plate of food for the price. I'd recommend it to anyone in the area for a quick healthy bite.

It's a tiny space that is well lit, with a charming little fountain in the outdoor patio.  10mins before opening for lunch on a Wednesday, there's already a line outside.  I was in the mood for Moussaka but had to settle for the grilled shrimp with extra Spanakopita, while my friend had the Beef Souvlaki (grilled skewer).  We were extremely happy with EVERYTHING.    The Spanakopita was light and satisfying, the skewers (esp the shrimp) were cooked perfectly, and the accompanying sides were all faultless... from the fries, tasty rice pilaf, salad to the pita and tatziki (yogurt dipping sauce with cucumber).  These large, composed plates are a treat, an in-between fast food and fine dining.  They have great service and sell wine here too!  So if you're craving for great greek grub, the drive to Henderson will be worth it.
Been going here for years and we love it. Never had a bad dish and the portions are huge. Staff is always friendly. The only place I go for gyros.

Excellent Greek food, full of flavor. Downside was it was kind of pricey, and the lamb gyro was not very good because the meat was too soft so the texture was all the same. Would definitely come again if I'm in Vegas.
Amazing food everything tastes great! The burger is always picture perfect if you want french fries get the Greek feta fries! They are amazing

I was running errands and I happened to pass by the Great Greek. Earlier this week I went to another Greek restaurant that was just average, so I figured I would do a round 2 and hopefully score a better experience.  I did, but unfortunately not by much. From the outside it looks like a big place, but it is actually quite small with only a handful of tables to sit down at. It is very casual, and I suspect most people are taking their orders to go.  Surveying the menu, I decided on going for hummus, and Lamb Souvlaki with fries and a bottle of water. That turned out to be much more expensive that I thought for such a casual place. But if the food was great I can justify it.  My meal started with a greek salad (comes with the entree), and that was very good. Honestly, it was the best part of the meal. The hummus with pita bread came next. The hummus was good, much better than the last place. Creamy, with some whole garbanzos mixed in with some paprika and olive oil. The pita bread was nothing special, but worked for dipping into hummus.  Then came the Lamb Souvlaki and fries. The fries were very disappointing. It reminded me of my childhood when I would make Ore Ida Zesties freezer fries. The Lamb was cooked okay, but had very little seasoning on it. It just tasted like meat. It was good quality, but not properly seasoned.  A lot of this could be forgiven if it was properly priced, but as it is I wouldn't go back. While I was waiting for my food, three ladies went to order and there total was over $70. They were shocked and just left. So I think for this class of restaurant, the price is steep. But they seem to be doing okay, lol, so perhaps it is just me. :)

Quick lunch here with friends. I had the small salad with falafel. Excellent salad, liberal use of cheese, kalamata olives-watch for pits- and perfectly prepared falafel. The tziziki sauce - hey my spelling stinks- was thick and rich with a lovely flavor. Cheerful staff- eager to please. We ate outside. Very pleasant time. Locally owned. I will return next time I am in Henderson.

Everything on the menu is delicious! I think they have really excellent pita. The salads are excellebt. I also really love the chicken and rice bowl! All their ingredients taste really fresh! What I love most about the place is that it's quick and they are very friendly!
This is my new favorite Greek spot!! Portions are very generous and the food is quality. Plus they have some of the best dolmas I've ever had!

First timers, I ordered the garlic shrimp with rice plate it was delicious and more then filling. Walked in around 11:30am and it was packed, but the staff found us a table. The dining area is extremely small.

Good food and good service. My husband and I came here for lunch and it was pretty good. We came around 11:30am and it was just before the lunch rush. The ambience is very modern and casual. I ordered the Grill Chicken Kabob and my husband got the gyro plate. Both selections were very yummy and their fries and yogurt sauce is on point! The service was great, as well. We got our food less than 10mins of ordering it and the staff checked up on us frequently. We will definitely come back in the near future.

The Great Greek is super delicious and well priced!! I recommend getting the avgolemono soup which is a creamy, lemon, chicken soup! For 3.75 a bowl you can't beat it, even comes with complimentary pita bread. I also tried their great Greek gyro which had tender meat, a well flavored tzatziki, and a generous amount of feta. Lastly, my boyfriend tried their steak souvlaki plate that came with rice and a side salad. He said his steak was perfectly seasoned and cooked.  *** Bottom Line: The Great Greek provides well flavored food, good-sized portions, friendly service, and fair prices!

I wanted to get some Greek food for lunch and found this place. I got a chicken gyro and salad. It was really good. The pita was so soft and I'm glad I didn't ask for extra feta because finally a place that puts on the proper amount!  I will definitely go here again!

A fly in my food.  How gross. I payed $45 for take out and when we get home there was a dead fly in my wife's salad.  Did not even want to take it back as we we live in Southrrn Highlands and the girl behind the counter was extremely rude anyways so it's just not worth it.  Clean up please!! We took a loss but will never go back.

I love Greek food! This place did not disappoint.  The staff was friendly and the Mezze Plate I ordered super tasty and fresh.  Obviously this place is very popular with the locals because it was jam packed.   My friend and I cleared our plates and probably would have ordered seconds if we weren't stuffed.

Colleague recommended this place. We walked to it from our hotel after a workshop. Fresh fast food. Comes out hot. Ordered a plate of grape leaves and they were large and seasoned well Great price for 6 of them! Loved the salad bowl with warm rice, Topped it with salmon and it was delicious. Very filling meal. Casual dining, outdoor seating as well. Good prices. Vegan foods available.
Amazing gyros! The feta fries were delicious as well! My daughter loves the chicken fingers and fries. And I love that it tastes like real chicken!

I have been searching Vegas for a long time to find a Great Greek restaurant that would make me feel like I was in the kitchen of a homemade cooked meal. My search is over. Yai Yais pastitsio can't get any better! The seasonings in the Greek salads cannot get any closer to booking a trip to Greece itself. I am in the food industry and I will send everyone I know,that has a longing for excellent Greek cuisine.It gets busy,but well worth the wait. Portions are large,price is right. You have a new customer for life. OPA!!!! Good luck to you and your family.

Starving, famished, desperate, and craving some Greek food, I stumbled upon The Great Greek and was so please with their delectable fresh offerings. I ordered the Chicken Souvlaki plate with rice. Bascially it's grilled chicked skewers over a bed a rice. It comes with two slices of pita bread and a small greek side salad. With a small drink the whole meal cost maybe $13 which is a little pricey for lunch, but it was defintiely worth it. The chicken was so tender and juicy and the biggest suprise to me was the rice. Usually at most restaurants they just throw some rice on the plate so it looks like you got a lot of food, but oh no, I feel in love with this rice. For some reason the rice had a hint of a lemon flavor and it was just really delicious and comforting. I could have just eaten that rice by itself.   So enough of me gushing about the rice.. but bottom line.. if you're looking for some fresh Greek cooking, come try The Great Greek. You won't be disappointed!

I've never had a bad meal here. I just tried their rice bowl which was kind of like a Cafe Rio style salad but totally Greek. I took that bad boy home and drizzled some Sriracha sauce and it was heaven.   All their food tastes so fresh and very flavorful. Some people don't do Greek food right, but these guys are great, they run a solid restaurant.  Five solid stars.

I must start this review by saying, I LOVE Greek food. The flavors, the fresh vegetables, and feta cheese is a god send. With that said, I've been to my fair share of Greek restaurants in the states and The Great Greek is hands down the best place I have ever been to. If you love garlic, raise your hands. If you love Greek food, raise your hands. You have reached my favorite Greek Food Location in Las Vegas. Not only do they offer great food, they sell good deserts too.
My favorite Greek food in Vegas. Great service, delicious and fresh food. I love the people who work here and the rice bowls and baklava

5 freakin stars. This place is one of my TOP 3 spots to eat. The food is always excellent. The service is even better. The feta fries are to die for. The only complaint I have is it I wish there was some closer to my neck of the woods, Summerlin. But it's always worth the trip!! Thanks Great Greek for living up to your name!! (:

One of my favorite local, family-run businesses in Henderson. Their Gyro Plate is my absolute favorite! It comes served with your choice of rice pilaf, fries, or Greek salad and then AMAZING tzatziki!! It's  super delicious - I cannot get enough of it. Yia Yia's Pastaccio ("grandma's lasagna") is also another great option. Oh, and don't forget their mouth watering Feta Fries!!!  Whenever I come in the staff is super friendly and personable. Zack is awesome and makes sure you're getting taken care of and that everything is to our satisfaction. The place is always clean and they have a lot of beverage options as well.   I wouldn't get Greek food anywhere else in town, this place is just too amazing!

Came here to see what the hype around the feta fries was all about. They were alright, felt like I could have made them at home. Nothing really special about them, still good though. Got good service and the staff was really nice and friendly.

Food is great and reasonably priced! Everything looks pretty clean and the staff is very friendly. Busy spot at lunch (went to pick up lunch on a Saturday and place was packed), good thing we pre-ordered over the phone for pick up. Definitely coming back!

By far one of the best Greek restaurants in town.   The food! This location off blue diamond is always spot on with their gyro meat. Juicy, perfect spice blend, and generous in portions. I recommend the Gyro Plate with rice pilaf or Great Greek Gyro with feta fries if you're feeling indulgent! Haven't tried the baklava yet, but have heard amazing things about it.  Service has been top notch every time, with speedy serve times and plenty of staff to handle lines. It is an order at counter style eatery, so no table service. However, the effort that goes into the food and service deserves a gratuitous thank you. Treat them well and your tummies will thank you for a Great Greek time!

The Great Greek is hands down the best Greek food in Henderson/Vegas.  The girls at the counter are always great and funny.  The food has inspired a new love in me for Greek Food. Their food is always made with love and particularly their Gyros are always on point.  Go there now!
Love this place! Friendly staff and by far the best Greek food in Vegas! Get the gyro plate!

3.5 STARS   Friendly service. Love the rustic industrial ambience. We ordered the great Greek gyro, feta fries, Athenian burger & hummus.  Greek lamb gyro A+ says my husband  Feta fries C Athenian burger B Hummus A+  I gave the fries a low grade because it tastes like the fries were old & fried again.  The Athenian burger was good but not the best.  The hummus with pita bread was excellent. My husband loved the gyro.
I try something new every time I go! Their Gyros and Falafel are my favorite!! Must try!! So good!

This place is awesome, especially for a quick lunch. Portions are huge food is awesome. Employees are friendly, area is nice and clean. Def recommend for anyone in the area that has a small amount of time for lunch.

Most of the dishes are tasty.  Love their salad dressing, tziki sauce and their fries.   The meat dishes are good too.  Unless they expand or change their menu, it can get a bit tiring to only have the same options all of the time.  Other than that, I haven't been disappointed

My favorite Greek restaurant in town! Staff is consistently helpful, friendly & efficient. The food is fresh & delicious. My only concern is occasionally waiting for a table or a line because of its popularity!
Excellent food! Mix up on our order, but overall extremely pleased with taste and authenticity of food and customer service. Will definitely be back next time we are in Vegas.

I am sitting here now, waiting to pick-up my order to go, happily anticipating them calling my name. I have already been here several times, and it is superb each and every time. This is the best Greek food that I have ever had. Luckily, I live right down the street, so I get to visit as often as I want. I highly recommend the gyro meat, it's beyond delicious!

I fell in love with this restaurant when going to their Henderson location. Then they opened the Blue Diamond location and I have to say it's not a good representation of this company at all. The food is still good but the service.. Jesus! The girls in the front are either overworked to the point where they don't remember to smile OR they really don't smile! There's one that I try to avoid at all cost when I go. I am a regular customer and by "regular", I mean I purchase food from here 3 times a week at least. However, I will NOT go when that girl is there. Which is hard because I think she's part of the owners family or something? She's unprofessional, rude AND unorganized. I heard her tell the kitchen staff "If you have something to say, you can work somewhere else" while I was eating today. I was shocked and that was the last straw. I will not eat at this location anymore. If I ever want their food I'll make the 15 mile trip to Henderson just to avoid this chick..

My favorite restaurant, hands down!! Always pleased with food and great service. Great Rice Bowl is terrific and the soup is a must have.  The chicken is my favorite so far, but after 9 or 10 visits I must admit I haven't tried the beef or lamb, but my husband has and he really likes them. Pita is wonderful and tender, and giros are really good too. We do feel like family when we dine here...everyone is warm and friendly, quick and efficient too. And the place is spotless. What more can you ask for? Even the prices are reasonable.

New restaurant in Southern Highlands, which Southern Highlands greatly needs more of. The food is fresh, good portions, and lots of options. However, I'm not sure why but the food just doesn't stand out compared to my other favorite greek spots. Everything was just, okay ... not wow. Good ambiance and service though, food just mediocre.

If you love garlic, raise your hands. If you love Greek food, raise your hands. If you love feta! You have reached my favorite Greek Food Location in Henderson. Not only do they offer great food, they also sale beer!   I had the absolute pleasure of trying, The Grilled Chicken Souvlaki! I have now idea how to say Souvlaki, but it's amazing! For $12.95 you get two skewers of Marinated Chicken Breast, rice Pilaf or Feta Fries! Yes Feta Fries can you believe it!! check the photo out, they are in no way cheap on the Feta! My entire order came out hot, and ready to eat, the restaurant and it's service second to none. When the suns out you can eat outside or inside either or!  Other great items to try, warm pits bread and hummus $2.00 and Falefel $2.50.. gyros run, chicken $6.95 enjoy all and don't forget the gum after or the mints!! Garlic is life here! Yummmm
So good...and the family really makes you feel welcome. The food is consistanly delicious. Alice makes all feel welcome. The baklava is outstanding

One of the best Greek and Mediterranean places in Vegas by far. Ran across this place while losing my paycheck at Sunset Station.  Tucked away in a parking lot, it's a little hard to see or find unless you're really looking for it. There is plenty of parking at theres always a slight line and wait around dinner time. They have about 8 tables inside so it's better to order ahead and pick up.  The food here is well above average. The meat is extremely fresh and all the items on the menu are pretty authentic as far as taste.  Decided to try the lamb kebobs. 2 skewers of marinated lamb chunks, not the ground stuff, served with either rice of fries or for an up charge you can Greek fries, fries with feta. The lamb was succulent and tender. Seasoned perfectly and very juicy. The rice is to die for! Rich buttery taste and seasoned to perfection! They also give you a side salad! Whole combo is a 5/5!  Then we tried the beef kebobs. Didn't do the ground but the chunks as well. Try not to go past a medium when ordering. Smaller pieces tend to dry out. The perfect flavor combination on these skewers!  For dessert try the Greek cookies. Their take on sugar cookies leaves you wanting more and feeling like you were cheated as a child for never having these introduced to you!!  Only gripe is they tend to be temperamental at times. We've had amazing service and then we've had just ok service, all by the same people. But don't let that discourage you! Food is phenomenal!
This is the best Greek place in Las Vegas! Everything tastes fresh and delicious every time. I dream of their hummus! The feta fries are to die for too. I would eat every meal here if I could!

Been here twice and the delicious food is always on point! Be prepared to have an appetizer, entree and dessert! An Authentic Greek Grill   Congratulations, to the owners with a beautiful restaurant and a prime location. Way to hype up the SW Las Vegas area!

Very nice Greek restaurant on Blue Diamond and Decatur. Near Fruits & Roots and Capriotti Sandwich. They have a nice size patio and parking lot. The restaurant itself is very spacious and clean! The menu offers many option "sandwich for smaller portion" or plates if you are very hungry! We ordered 1 Gyro plate and 1 Chicken plate. It comes with choice of rice or fries and a yummy side salad (baby romaine, red onions, feta cheese, tasty tomato & olives) It cost about $42 including 2 fountain drinks and 2 rice pudding Our order was brought to our table. The chicken was juicy and tender. The gyro meat was very good and nicely flavored. Very happy to have another great Greek in SW!! I like that they had some Franks Hot sauce, Sriracha & Tapatio available

I went to this place the previous week and I'm still thinking about it. I got the great Greek gyro combo  (beef and lamb) with a salad to go. I was expecting typical gyro, but I was wrong. The sauce and the feta cheese was really good. What I really am still thinking about is the salad and salad dressing. That salad was very good, the dressing I used as additional sauce for my gyro.  This is definately a place I'm coming back to. The place is an okay size restaurant, but it's so busy there is no room to sit. That's really tells you it's a good place to eat. Just be prepared when you want to sit down and you have to wait 10 minutes.

Great experience! We were created by friendly, informative staff. The food arrived quickly. Tasty and flavorful, but the chicken was a bit dry. We suggest trying their cheese fries. Overall, great experience!

I love love this place the food is amazing BUT if you order to go becareful, the foil container they use to put the salad in sliced my thumb! Would hate for a child or anyone to have to experience this!

Go! This place is superb. Everything is fresh, the family that works here really care that you're satisfied, prices are fair, and the portions are huge. We had a felafel gyro and lamb gyro. Fabulous. If you feel like outdoor dining, no problem. They have tables with umbrellas.

Good solid food - great and simple greek salads, gyros, passticio and other greek favorites.  Woman who runs the counter is friendly, and all of the food is fresh, with fresh ingredients.  Has a home cooked quality to the food.  Recommended.
I'm from Chicago and a very picky greek eater. This was the best gyros I have ever had.  The place was packed but it was well worth the wait.

Visiting from the Bay Area we discovered this gem by walking by on the way to a nearby Starbucks. Checked it out on Yelp first. What a find! Fresh delicious authentic Greek food with friendly, fast and fun staff. Generous portions and did I mention fresh and delish? My favorite is the traditional gyro but the homemade pita and dipping sauces as well as the lamb chops were all amazing too. Hubby loved the crispy falafels too. They are closing end of July for a week of renovations but check it out as soon as you can. Worth the visit!
So good. Been there a bunch of times and Everything that I've ordered from here tasted awesome! I do however wanna try their desserts, they looks delicious but I'm usually too full to try them.
The service here is very good. The Greek food here is some of the best in the valley. If you are in the mood for something fresh and fast check out the great Greek.
Me and the hubby went here the other day for the first time it was amazing. Service was outstanding,  food portions were big, food was super good! Cant wait to go back
This is a yummy place. We have gone to their location many times in henderson. Glad there is one closer to our house now. :)

I was passing thru town on a cross country trip.  Got a Greek salad with a chicken skewer and feta fries.  It was absolutely delicious.  Tasty and filling.  And the service was outstanding.  I would eat here anytime!  What a find!

I more than love Great Greek. I could eat here every day if possible. It's more than just delicious food. When I come into Great Greek I feel like a part of the family. Every person who works at Great Greek is friendly, efficient, and they make me want to come back to the restaurant. We met the owners and their family, and each of them thanked us profusely for coming to eat at their establishment. What more could you ask for?  Well, I guess you could ask for good food, but that is a given when you come to eat here. There is so much to try and not enough time! I haven't been able to eat the rice due to a gluten allergy - they did not feel confident that the pilaf was OK for me to eat (it rarely is), so I had Feta Fries instead. They were terrible. Never eat them! I will suffer the torment and eat anyone's orders if they don't want them! They're simple, overloaded with dressing and cheese - just delicious with herbs and feta. For $13 you get a Greek Salad with delicious good quality Olive Oil dressing, Pita (if you're not GF), 2 Chicken Souvlaki Skewers, Feta Fries and happiness. Could you ask for more? Their steak is also always cooked a perfect medium rare, and their shrimp are so delicious I could eat 4 skewers and still want more!  Their Avgolemono Soup is my favorite...ever. This is made with just white rice, no pilaf. Their hummus is homemade, smooth and delicious, just like everything else on their menu. What's not to love?  My husband has had the gyros and the rice bowls and loves them both. The gyros meat is good, not as salty as the meat we had back home in Chicago. He says the rice could be eaten in pounds all day long, the rice bowl is great because when you mix everything together and add a pita nothing can go wrong!   I would call ahead if you're ordering take out, or if you want to know their daily special. I've had their grilled lamb chops, and I assure you, it is worth every last dollar spent on that dinner. SO GOOD. The Greek Chicken special is one of my favorites too! You won't go wrong stopping by here! Eat and enjoy!
This place is always great.  Exceptional food with a culture of great customer service.
Food is generally pretty good but not exactly worth the prices. The service is decent and I have never had any issues with staff.
After 5 years of living here it is still I'm my opinion the best greek food in all of Vegas!  Still my goto place when looking for a quick bite!

Definitely glad this placed open near me! There were no Greek places nearby when I would want to just go grab Greek food. I love Greek food and this place did not disappoint. I got a traditional lamb gyro as well as the the feta fries. That was a great deal of food that I could not finish but worth the price for delicious food. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for some great quality food!

This place was fantastic. The gyro plate and the steak souvlaki were both amazing. Rice pilaf was tasty, and the french fries were also great.   They're getting pretty busy. We showed up at around 8pm and they were out of Baklava. The owner told me they were going to have to start making twice as much. Awesome.

So good! I was very happy with the service and the food, you can tell everything was prepared fresh and in house from high quality ingredients. I will make sure to add this in the rotation for a fast casual meal.

I love this place! I haven't been to many Greek fast food places but so far, this place is my favorite. Everyone is really friendly and orders are usually pretty fast. Everytime I've come, there's always been people dining here, must mean I'm not the only one that thinks they're awesome!  I love the combination gyro- beef/lamb, so flavorful and tender and also enormous. I would recommend sharing if you aren't starving or if you can't save the rest for later. Their chicken gyro is pretty juicy and good but is basically just grilled chicken. Good option for those chicken sandwich type people lol. I also really love their feta fries. Because of them, I always request feta on top of my fries anytime I go to a Greek/Mediterranean place. Their tzatziki sauce is also really flavorful and has the perfect amount of tang. Everything is also really fresh everytime I come! Next time I definitely have to try their Baklava & plates!

Every time I come here the food is amazing and the service is above and beyond! A great lunch spot or weekday dinner. The outside patio is great when the weather is nice if you can grab one of the four tables.

Baklava is awesome!   So YUM!  Pretty big portions and can be shared. If there are 4 of you.... get the Family Platter... it comes with kebabs, rice, salad, grape leaves, hummuss, pita bread and bakalava.  And it's a lot of food for a really great price.  They have a small patio area so you can sit outside when it's nice.  Note... It's a fairly small family run restaurant so the wait for your food can be long.  Suggest calling ahead and getting take out.

I love this place. Lots of vegan options: falafel, eggplant dip, hummus, grape leaves... My omnivore bf also loved the steak gyro. But what really sets the Great Greek apart is the staff - super friendly and helpful. Can't wait to go back!

This is hands down one of best Greek food you will get in Henderson/Las Vegas area. The owner and staff is so friendly. Gyro combo with the Greek salad is probably my fave. It's a must stop! Little hard to find if you're not familiar with the area but it's right behind Jason's deli if that helps.

Not to be confused with fast food, the food at the Great Greek is made from scratch. and is fresh and flavorful and very satisfying.   Without missing a beat the staff takes care of you in a timely fashion.  The  establishment is squeaky clean and the simplicity in the decor is a sign of sophistication.  Dining at  The Great Greek is a delightful culinary experience.  I ordered our rice pudding to go because it had just been prepared and needed time to set in the refrigerator.  We ate it later that night.  What a coup!  It was the best.
Ordered the great geek gyro with lamb & beef, and a side of pita bread with hummus. It was absolutely delicious and was delivered in a timely manner. I will definitely be ordering more often.

FUN local place with impeccably fresh and authentic tastes of Greece.   Order at the counter, and be prepared to do as the locals do:  when the restaurant is full get your food to go or ask to share a table.   The line to order can stretch out the door, but moves quickly and efficiently. Lots of cooks in the kitchen on a Friday night -- we saw 6 -- cooking as fast as they  could in a kitchen we could see was stocked with authentic quality ingredients.   Kids meals re the perfect side for smaller tummies but don't dumb down for Americans: choices are 1/2 gyros, 1/2 souvlakis and other smaller portions of Greek favourites -- no chicken nuggets or grilled cheeses. TWO THUMBS UP FROM US!!   One of us had the beef souvlaki and asked that the steak be cooked rare, and IT WAS!! So many Greek places seem to be unable to cook steak rarer than medium, so we were excited! The steak was tender, deliciously seaoned, and did we say RARE??  The cup of Avgolemono soup comes studded with rice and chicken, served with a quartered pita on the side. It is easily enough for a light meal, and was so delicious we took what we couldn't finish back to the hotel to finish with breakfast tomorrow.   A side of falafel arrived fried perfectly, not greasy at all, and spiked with cardamom for extra YUM.   Two of us got the Great Greek Original Rode Bowls -- large Greek salads with a scoop of yummy rice pilaf.  These salads were made with perfectly crisp fresh leaf lettuce, seasoned chickpeas, small diced red onions, tangy pitted Kalamata olives, and a meat (chicken or beef souvlaki or gyro meat)  or fish of your choice (salmon or shrimp) or falafel, all dressed in tangy and lemony Greek dressing. DELICIOUS!!   We got an order of fresh homemade Koftiedes cookies to go.   We HEARTILY RECOMMEND this restaurant -- Henderson locals have a gem in this place!!

Small busy but every time I go there, the people that work they're are so friendly. The food, oh my I get the chicken rice bowl and that is so great tasting and filling. For me it's enough for two meals. I recommend this place to everyone no matter how far they live, it's a must place to go.

This was our 1st visit. Service was great, the young man that took our order saw right away I had 3 children,  said he would hold having our food prepared until we got a table inside.  The food was excellent, it was my oldest's 1st gyro, and he said it was amazing.. Service was great , pleasant, friendly and accommodating.  My 4 yr old are all his chicken fingers, which if you know him says a mouthful.  Thank you for the delicious food and awesome service. We will definitely be back. Got some baklava,  can't wait to eat it.

Had a great lunch with friends before the movies, was awesome. I enjoyed the grilled shrimp and Greek salad and watched so many delicious looking entrees served around me. Have to go back and try them all!! For dessert I devoured the baklava ice cream which was heavenly. The service was great, you order up front and they bring it to your table. Truly enjoyable.

So I'm a little confused by this place. It took 30 min to make two gero's to go. We ordered next door a Capriottis and from this place. Within 5 min, the sandwiches were ready. 30 min to shave some already cooked meat and put on a pita? Capriottis had to cook their meat and it was done within minutes. If the food was extraordinary then I would understand it would be worth it but.... it's not.   Good luck, if you keep this up.

Upon arriving in Las Vegas today I enjoyed a simple, well crafted dinner from The Great Greek. True to other's comments the feta fries were unique and tasty. I was a little worried the fries would be soggy with the added cheese but they were crispy to the last bite. The gyro was warm lamb with cool veggies. A little double flavor with the white sauce on the gyro and feta fries. Knowing that now I may have gone with the falafel. All in all a delightful meal if you have a few minutes to wait for fresh made food in a small restaurant.

Was really excited to have a Greek place close to home but after trying was a little disappointed. Ordered the Rice Bowl. Not sure why they called it that considering there was barely any rice yet there was a lot of greens which was fresh but it drowned out the rice and you couldn't even tell if the rice had any good flavor. Had the steak with the rice bowl and asked for medium but instead got way well done not to mention it was so little meat it really wasn't even worth adding to all the greens and barely any rice. I also added the Mezze Plate so I could try a few of my favorite Greek items. The Spanakopita was the best I've ever had, the Dolmades were really tiny and had no flavor, the Falafels were really dark brown which I can assume was way over cooked, the Tzatziki sauce was watery, and the Hummus was extremely lemony. I love lemon but not as the main taste in my hummus. I guess I won't be having Greek food so close to home after all because I won't be going back anytime soon.
The great greek has awesome food.  I live right around the corner and come here often.  I get a greek salad wrap with chicken and feta fries. Sooo good!!

Place was crowded, while waiting to order the rest of our party sat at a table, when we were approached by a white haired man (who said he was the owner) and told us "tables are for people AFTER they order". Really?  You need 6 people in line when 2 know what to order.  Ended up leaving  & going to Millers Ale House around the corner.  Guess the "owner" doesn't want us!  Have to find a new Favorite Greek place

I love Greek food and had seen some good reviews plus been recommended from a few friends to try this place out. It was good but nothing to really make it stand out from any other greek/ Mediterranean restaurant I have tried! Not worth going out of your way!

Ive been here three times and the food is exceptional. If you have never had a gyro that you cared for you need to try one more time at the Greek.  All the meats are done to perfection on their grill. The steak and lamb are moist and tender. Crowded at lunch time, but there is a reason for that.
Great shish kabob especially their chicken. I never get tired of their food and I'm here even on a Saturday
This place is so yummy. Really enjoy eating here. The foods great the service is great. The great Greek is just great.
Really really good food. The place is clean, the food is fresh, the service is fast. It's nice to have more food options in the Southwest of Vegas.
By far the best Greek restaurant I've been to. The staff is awesome and the food is delicious.  This is my spot!

The Greak Greek is one of the best things that has happaned to our neighborhood. The Fries alone are worth the trip and I believe the Chef has created an amazing deal for a $5 Gyro which makes Subway look like a Ford parked next to a Rolls Royce. If you are looking for an affordable place to eat that serves quality fresh food at its finest then go to The Great Greek.

SOOO GOOD! My favorite place to get my Mediterranean craving. This place has the best hummus and the best rice pilaf I've ever had. The lamb is my personal favorite cut of meat, but the chicken and beef are great too. The falafel is good but needs to be eaten right away since it gets quite dry quickly. And oh my goodness, the rice pudding is the BEST way to end a meal here, a must have in my opinion.
