I've had homemade rice pudding for years and this is just as good (maybe even better but don't tell my mom that).

Love this food!!! Can never get enough!!!! I come here at least once a week!!! We always get the chicken Greek salad!!! The portions are big and I always have left overs. Staff is very friendly and when I call in my order it is always ready for me when I arrive!!!

I am usually really generous with my stars and giving the Great Greek 3 stars is me being generous. I wasn't super impressed with the food here. We got one chicken and one steak Gyro and although huge in size, there is too much feta cheese on it to really get the flavor of the meat and the rest of the sandwich. We also got a Greek side salad and overall it was ok. I will not be coming back to eat here because at almost $20 bucks for dinner, I would rather make something at home.

As far as I am concerned this place is tied with Milos at the Cosmopolitan as far as taste, authenticity and freshness. I am always willing to make the trek to Henderson so my pleasure that there is one in the SW can't be measured.  If you love Greek food - do not sleep on The Great Greek.

Came here with a friend for lunch a while back and it was packed so we went to Jason's deli across the way. This time I found a seat I ordered the Great Greek rice bowl which is a 9" bowl with a base of rice pilaf covered with Greek salad and two skewers of chicken. Everything was phenomenal. I really enjoyed the quality of the food. I ended up coming back the next day and ordering the falafel and tzakiki sauce. The falafels were some of the best I've tasted no exaggeration and the sauce actually came with a pity bread which the menu doesn't mention but was a pleasant surprise so I had some pita falafel sandwiches with tzakiki sauce fantastic. I will try everything on the menu eventually and I will also bring my girl here cause she loves this type of food. Oh yea the people that work there are awesome friendly and attentive I really like this place keep doing what you're doing guys n gals!

This is my favorite Greek spot to go to for lunch or dinner!! I've been looking for years in Las Vegas of a good spot and I swear this is it! And it's conveniently close! I think their food is so fresh, and my favorite is their shrimp & rice  I come here about 1x a week if not more.

Yummy chicken gyro! Friendly folks and fresh food. I have passed this place many times and never even noticed it. Thanks to Yelp reviews, Torrance and I decided to give it a try... and I am glad we did! Torrance had the beef/lamb gyro with feta fries. I had the chicken gyro with regular fries. We both ate every morsel, it was so good.  2 combo meals cost us a little over $20. We will be back soon!

I love coming here. My all time favorite Mediterranean place & I've lived in a few states. I used to live in Pahrump, now Summerlin & I still make the commute whenever I'm craving something Greek. I have not one complaint. The staff is amazing and always so welcoming. It is a small cozy business, but plenty of seating outside if you have a larger group. :)

I am so excited that a The Great Greek location has opened closer to my house in the SW. The food is delicious and the customer service is excellent. One of my favorite places to eat and I cannot wait to become a regular again!

I know everyone raves about the Gyros, but the Souvlaki plates here are incredible. Skip the Feta Fries and check out the rice pilaf. You won't be disappointed.  This place has great service but small dining room. It's perfect for grabbing some food to go.
Great gyros, nice portion and full of flavor. Plates come with good portion of rice and salad. All of it's was great, would definitely return!

The staff was not friendly. Nobody smiling at all. It's like they could care less if your there.  Gyro meat was very good  Fries were half cooked and mushy.  Probably won't be back mainly because I did not feel welcomed.
Love this place. The food is sooooo good.  My only complaint, it needs more menu items!

Dear Jerry G, On May 11, at 4:30, we placed an order of your House Special Pork Chop, the lady said it'll take 10-15 mins. We came at 4:45 and I sent my son to get our food, they took my son's pay but did not give him a receipt and told him we had to wait another 10 mins. after the 10 mins, it yet was still not ready, I was furious, I finally went inside to see what was the hold up, and they said that they didn't want to serve raw pork. like are you serious?, Who does that! I finally got everything by 5:05. If I knew it would take more than 30 mins to cook my dry pork chop, I would've chose another place to eat. They also need to stop telling people that it would take 10-15 mins, when it take 30 or more minutes.   P.S. This is the first time I've ever written a review on a restaurant because of how many flaws and how much I was disappointed. I didn't enjoy my food because of this, yet this would've never happened if they told the truth of the time.

very average.  I got a gyro sandwich.  the meat was overdone.  lettuce was starting to wilt.  there was very little tzatziki sauce.  when I asked for additional sauce I was charged $1.00.  told her it was light on sauce.  still charged me.   nothing more annoying than feeling like they are trying to get every last cent from you.

I wish I was a better review writer so that I could do this place justice.  That being said, I'll try anyway.  The food here is amazing!  The portions are large and everything tastes fresh.  I have had the gyro plate, falafel pita, and feta fries.  The feta fries are really addicting.  I am normally super picky about falafel and usually only like it if it is homemade.  The falafel here is quite possibly the best I have every tasted, it is flavorful and isn't dry (the problem I have with most places).  My mom came here with me and said it's the best baklava she has ever had.  This is definitely my favorite place to eat in Henderson.  The woman that works the counter (the owner?) is super sweet and friendly on top of it all.  I highly recommend this place to anyone.
This great food is so good! The ingredients are so fresh it makes me wonder if they have their own garden. We come here each time we passed through Las Vegas

The food is really good here, but finding a seat is sometimes hard! They are busy and the restaurant is almost always full! The staff is helpful and extremely friendly which makes the atmosphere fun and enjoyable! Portions are appropriate for the price too!

The freakin best.  Those feta fries... lord have mercy!!! Must try.  The gyro meat is very good as well, flavorful and tender.  I'd prefer crispier but that's minor.  The gyro plate is very filling,  loved the salad and rice and pita with the meat.
Went for the first time last week and was very impressed. The food was fantastic. Would have loved a few more small pieces of pita with the kabab dinner, but it was nothing short of fantastic.

I'm an out of towner. Looking for something to eat. came across this place online. Through yelp. On our way to our hotel in Lake Las Vegas. We called and placed a pick up order. Not knowing what to expect. Hoping that it will be decent at least. We ordered the chicken kabob, rice and salad. The portions were large. Salad was placed in a separate container. Which kept it crispy and fresh. Chicken was tender and so good. Overall so pleased by the results. We took a chance and so happy we did. They had my order ready and they even made me my own personal dressing for the chicken. Loved loved the food. Thank you for not disappointing. We will definitely return once we come back in town.   Only negative thing I have to say was. Google maps has a different directions then where it was actually located. But wasn't hard to figure  out the mistake once we arrived. But yet confusing especially from a non local.

We've eaten here once a week if not more since they opened. Food is is fresh, fast and taste amazing. Love how they ask you want your steak. The usual is the great gyro and a steak plate and a small side of hummus....and the FETA FRIES!! Those are a must try. You can also do a mixed plate... I do steak and shrimp sometimes. Only reason they didn't get 5 stars is they messed up on my to-go order, nothing big just forgot my small side of hummus but was refunded for it.  Put it this way, I don't review anything but I just want people to know how great this place is!
Delicious. Love the gyros and the feta fries. A little pricey. Great customer service
Wonderful service and delicious food! I always feel  welcomed.  My favorite is the shrimp skewers and hummus! I've tried almost everything on the menu and can't say one bad thing.

Love this place. The food is great and fantastic customer service. I usually order the gyro plate with side salad and drink. Gyro meat is perfectly cooked and the salad isn't overly drenched with dressing. Highly recommended!

Read good reviews about the place on yelp and it didn't disappoint me or my wife. The service is very welcoming and the food tasted equally better. Would definitely  recommend this place to all my friends.

Thank you Yelpers! Very much enjoyed our meals and the friendly people. Portions are huge and tasty. The night we went there were several tables that had ordered one of the special family meals (looked like a good deal). The baklava seemed especially good (albeit still very sweet). I would definitely recommend this place.

YES. Let's get this out of the way: I am born and bred in Astoria, Queens, NY (Greek hub of NY). I'm half Greek. I can tell you about Greek food. Being out here, I didn't expect to find such a great place to eat, but I did, and it was awesome.   The Great Greek is a fast-food, very casual style restaurant that seems popular for both dine-in and take-out. With my family of 5 people, some of us were hungrier than others, so we opted for the Meal #2: 2 dips, 8 pita, 8 dolmades (rice stuffed grape leaves), Greek salad, rice pilaf (or french fries if you want), 8 meat skewers, 4 desserts, and 4 drinks. It was the perfect amount of food.  The grape leaves were tender and flavorful, the salad was huge and modestly dressed (I like a ton of feta, so I wish there was a little more), there was more pita bread than we knew what to do with, but that was chewy and served warm. For dips, we chose hummus and tzatziki. Both were creamy and tasty as heck. It tasted, though, like the tzatziki was made with sour cream rather than Greek yogurt. It lacked the pungent tang I expect, so it had a softer flavor but it's a personal preference. The rice pilaf was perfectly cooked and lightly lemony.   The meat skewers! SO GOOD. We got 4 chicken and 4 steak, cooked medium. Dude, the meat was tender as hell, well-seasoned, and surprisingly juicy. It's the kind of food that makes you wish you were hungrier so you could eat more. We were all so stuffed that we ended up taking the dessert to go - baklava. But later that evening with coffee, it was delicious.  It needs mentioning that the service was incredible. Maybe I'm just used to rude New Yorkers, but the staff here was very friendly and accommodating.   Overall worth driving to for the great food and atmosphere. Man, I have some very exciting leftovers.

Since our original visit, we have eaten here 6 or 7 times (Just about every time we are in Vegas). Every meal has been outstanding, the place is immaculate and the service has been excellent. If you like Greek food, this is definitely a must-try when you are in Vegas!
This place has the best service and the best food. We come here atleast twice a week. The staff knows us already and we love coming here !

This place is a hidden gem!   Everything here is incredible!  If you want a great family style restaurant run by a great family, make the drive out to Henderson and check out The Great Greek!!  You won't be disappointed!

This place was awesome. The food was delicious and the customer service was awesome! I ordered the lamb gyro and the rice pudding and both were delicious. My sister and her husband are both vegetarians and they left full and happy as well.
Always delicious! I have been to this place too many times to count! It never disappoints. Even when it's slammed the service is northing but great! Love coming here!

Best Greek food in Las Vegas and Henderson. Needs to be bigger but the inside is clean and service is great. Food is fresh and made to order. I go with my parents and brother so we get the family meal which is 4 gyros, a big thing of French fries, a big Greek salad, and 4 desserts.. AWESOME

Great food! So happy it's close to my house. Great pita bread and hummus they will give u more if your sitting down to eat but make sure if your ordering to go you order extra pita bread they do not give enough.  Tomatoes in salad are little big I always cut them smaller. They once Ran out of rice ...... thought that was really weird but substituted fries . Great chicken tenderness and flavor

i think this is the best greek food i have tasted in las vegas....i lived in new york before coming here ...and the food here is excellent.....the staff that works here is very friendly......i would highly recommend this place......

Amazing gyros, we come here every time we are in town. Def a must have if in Henderson! The large gyro salad is my go to when I need some greens that have a little protein and flavor to help wash down all that healthyness. The baklava is worth trying if your diet can spare the extra amplifier of sugar but in my opinion well worth the extra time at the gym to indulge now and again. The specials that are posted daily are usually really tasty I had the salmon avacado wrap as a special and was sooo good.

I was thrilled when I saw they were building this super close to home. Naturally, when it first opened my boyfriend and I visited. The space was a bit smaller and it was super busy. Not complaining tho, I'm sure everyone else wanted to try this place out.  Customer service was good. The staff is super friendly and very professional.   I would recommend the feta fries! Ugh. To. Die. For! No complaints here! I will def be back.
Great food...staff...whats not to like??  Quality at its best and prices are unbelievably low compared to other places

I ate there today with my kids and grandmother. She in in the early stages of dementia and acts out with unprovoked hatred and anger at the worst possible times, today at lunch was one of those...The food we ordered was all DELECIOUS! Service, unbelievable, they could not do enough to try to accommodate us. They were challenged today with an elderly customer who at first glance is a bitter old bitch, they were understanding and patient and no matter the insults being unjustly screamed-she complained about EVERYTHING, the yummy food, clean tables, great service etc. the young man and woman remained professional, kind and attentive. I would go back based on their authentic food alone but their customer service went well beyond amazing.  Thank you!!!!

Really good food!   The Gyro plate is such a GOOD DEAL! You get so much Gyro meat for your money. They give you a Greek salad, that is really fresh. Then you get a choice between fries or rice. And they give you so much Gyro lamb and beef.   And it was really delicious.  The girl working the counter was very friendly. Restaurant was clean and so was the bathroom.   I live about 15-20 minutes from here but I will definitely be back again.

The Great Greek NEVER disappoints. Another fantastic meal! Chicken Souvalki Plate -.Excellent! Steak Souvalki Plate - Excellent! Yia's Yia's Pasta Dish - Excellent! Side Salad - Fresh and Excellent! Side of Rice - Excellent   As always my takeout order was packed so securely and everyone that works here are so nice.

I was dying to try this location and just like their Warm Springs location this restaurant did not disappoint. The freshness and flavors and service are EXACTLY the same as their other location. Quite impressive!  I have to add the consistency clearly states how well run this business is. My favorite meal is the Original Greek Rice Bowl. The flavors just work so perfectly together. I order it twice a week!.....it's a huge salad consisting of perfectly seasoned rice on the bottom topped with the freshest, flavorful greek salad you'll ever taste. I always get a chicken skewer on top and the chicken is consistently cooked to perfection. Their tzatziki sauce is outstanding too. The food here is always so fresh and flavorful I just keep coming back.   My only complaint is I wish they'd open a restaurant around the Anthem/Eastern Ave area. PLEASE!!!!

Haven't gotten my food yet but there is a line out the door and the vibes are just so good. Everyone who works here is so happy and seems to know every person in here by name. It's bright, clean, and popping. Though I had to wait in line awhile to order, I can already tell it's worth the wait. Great environment!

I just love this place . The food is just so good, Staff is very friendly , they treat you like family. I really like that they have specials going on every week. To have a big menu with a lot of things on it. I recommend it to everybody

Best Gyro in town!!! And the Avgolemono soup is amazing! The soup is a must! And Jack is truly an asset,  he always has a friendly smile, and a heartfelt greeting. He remembers people, and and is genuinely glad to see them again.

The food as always is absolutely delicious. They deserve the 5 stars...  But sadly disappointed with my delivery today. I was missing 1 chicken skewer which was my daughters lunch. I called and apparently they are closed for the day.. at 1 pm??

Brought my family here for first time.  Recently moved from San Diego.  The slightly higher priced menu was absolutely worth the quality of the food and the quantity; there is no short changing.  The shrimp were tender and flavorful on the salad.  The gyro was jam packed and the meat popped.  The gentleman running the cash bay was spot on and actually made me feel like they were happy to see us.  Would eat here again and was added into the retinue of restaurants in Henderson.  Super happy.  Pretty fast service also which was surprising for how large an order.

Came here after shopping around at Costco. We ordered the gyro plate with feta fries and a rice bowl to go.   The mini salad that came with the gyro plate was BOMB. Just be careful for the olives... they still have seeds in them and you could easily break a tooth if you aren't paying attention. I loved the feta fries because they had a nice crunchy coat/soft center with a strong garlic taste. I recommend not ordering this if you plan on going out afterwards because your breath may stank.   I think each dish was hovering around $10 to $12 range which was not too bad considering the decently large portion sizes and fresh ingredients. The meat was quite tender and flavorful which was a huge plus.   The guy working the register today was a cool dude. Very customer service savvy and eager to serve the patrons of the restaurant. All in all, I would recommend people to come check out this place especially if you are craving some fresh greek food.   I haven't tried the wraps at this location, but that is on my list of things to try here.

Awesome food and amazing service. I either order yhe steak souvlaki or the shrimp skewers with the feta fries. The gyro plate is also really good as well. If youre really hungry, try some of their deserts!

After working at Estiatorio Milos inside of the Cosmopolitan for over three years, I'm a little spoiled and critical when it comes to Greek food. This is my third time visiting and each time it doesn't disappoint.   The restaurant was packed and every table was taken at 2PM on a Thursday. I was on that side of town after hiking in Boulder City and was running late to class, but decided that a chicken gyro was worth being 15 minutes late for. After having a few gyros from Paymon's and having issues with being skipped on hummus, I was worried that I would have to ask for extra tzatziki with my gyro but after seeing the monster of a sandwich that came out, I knew I was in great hands. So much chicken, so much sauce, the pita was perfect- a week later I'm still dreaming about it.   While waiting for my sandwich their cashier was sweet enough to let me try their vanilla cookie which was just as delicious and satisfyingly sugary. I can't wait to come back and am thinking of making the 30+ minute drive from my house just to have another gyro!

Excellent quick serve Greek food. I ate at their other location in Henderson a couple of times, and I'm super happy to see a Westside location. Their food is excellent, always fresh, and I really like the atmosphere. Best gyro in town. Highly recommended!

Ive now gotten take-out here a few times and ordered meals for multiple people at work. And I have to say they have exceeded my expectations both times. The food is delicious and the stuff is fantastic! Thanks again honey bunches!
My coworkers and I ordered here for lunch. I got the greek bowl with the gyro meat. EXCELLENT! We all were greatly pleased! Only wish they delivered.

By far, the best Greek food in the valley. The feta is mild and delicious. It is always busy so be prepared to wait for a table but it is well worth  the wait. The gyros are delicious. The salads are superb. The staff is nice. It is just good food period.

Delicious little Greek spot! The food is delicious and the service is fantastic!! It is always busy when I'm there, but I think that's just a testament to how great this place is. (Okaye, the space is a little small as well) definitely plan on coming here more often.

I can confirm that the food is excellent and the people are friendly. My chicken gyro was way more tender and flavorful than what I have come to expect from normal Greek joints. Excellent, in fact. And since my order took all of 10 milliseconds longer than my server deemed appropriate, I got a slice of complimentary cake! Yay for Great Greek!
Delicious every single time! You can't go wrong with the traditional gyro. The place is nice and clean and has plenty of seats if you want to dine in, but I usually call ahead and get carryout.

Tried for 1st time 10/4/14, everything we had was awesome! Athenian burger, chicken gyro, soup, and feta fries are worth the calories. The service was very friendly and they have outdoor patio seating which we enjoyed. Will be back.
So.... We are really getting in to Mediterranean food.  We found this local eatery and we were very pleased.  The food was flavorful and fresh.  We will be back to try other dishes.

I've been to this restaurant probably 4 times so far and I'm surprised I haven't given a 5-star review yet! Quite possibly the best chicken gyro I've ever had and their salad is right there with it (those are the only 2 things I've had).  One thing I did notice though is that the time it takes for food to come out can be long. I know that it bothered me a couple times primarily bc I had a to-go order and needed to get back to class, but the food took over 30 minutes to come out. However, the flavor and quality of the food made up for it. Just know that this isn't a stop and go kind of restaurant.  Prices are fair for what you're getting. Middle eastern/greek food is always going to be on the more pricier side, but then again its the quality that matters so the prices here are decent.  Service is great and everyone is nice over there! I'll be back for more!
I don't write great reviews but I'm in love with this place. The service is awesome and the food is better. Favorite place to have lunch during my lunch breaks.

This place was awesome. We were near the galleria and searched up food places in the area, and this place popped up. I read the reviews and hey who doesn't like good greek food? So we decided to try it out. Glad we did. We walked right in with no wait even though the place was poppin. The staff was friendly we asked him what we should get and he told us about the chicken bowl. It had everything you could think of in it. Kalamata olives, feta cheese, fresh tomatoes chicken on a skewer, rice and mixed lettuce with a tasty vinaigrette. It was soo good. I recommend you try this place.
Great food and friendly service. Got the Mezze Plate appetizer and the Rice Bowl with Gyro meat. Both were super tasty and portions were plentiful. Would definitely come back again.

Very disappointed. We came to dine and usually my wife or me will get a table while the other orders our meal. Well the cashier male who is always congenial with us told my husband in front of everyone to hold off sitting at a table. We were embarrassed and left the establishment. Long story short we thought seating was first come first serve and feel this treatment was unnecessary. We ended up eating at Mimi's.
Ordered takeout, The food was very flavorful. Ordered fries w/ feta but they forgot the feta, but that's ok bc the fries were hot and crispy.  Will definitely be back.

This place is always amazing!  From the staff to the food. Even the free smells as you walk by are amazing. I've eaten at that location for 2 years and never a disappointment, ever. The lady that owns it is so sweet and even her sons that run it now are always friendly. Any way you want the food is how they will make it and they always remember me and what I want.  Love this place and will always go back!

Been coming here every other day the last 2 weeks because the food is great! Tonight we ordered for pick up and our order was missing the Pita bread & one of our plates did not come with much meat. We usually don't have issues but bummed out about this missing pita haha.
So impressed!  Food is incredible.  Service is just as great!  Am devouring the Great Greek Rice Bowl with chicken as I type this.  Will definitely be back!!

They catered a meeting for my local Labor Union and it was a hit. Not even salad left over. The gyro kit was perfect so everyone could build the sandwiches how they like them. Plenty of food for everyone. Everything was fresh and it came with lots of tzatziki. Super nice staff. They even fit my order in at the last minute while already having aa bigher cstering order at the same time. That is awesome customer service. We will be coming back for dinner for our meetings again.
We had a delicious late lunch today. Brittany was super helpful and friendly. The food is fresh and flavorful. The feta fries were pretty damn good!!! Will definitely be back
Excellent food. Excellent service. Seems to be family owned. They were all very nice and genuine.  I feasted on the gyro plate. Very good portions. The food came out hot and delicious.

The food here is close to perfection in every Greek way. Reasonably priced and delicious. The only drawback is that  it does get busy here at dinner time and there are not that many tables so you may have to order to go. Great service and once again this is probably the skimpiest food review I will ever post because everything here is really good! You can't criticize perfection, the end.

I HATE HUMMUS, but bought some for my wife... I devoured the hummus here! Had the Gyro and feta fries which came with a salad....I practically licked the plate clean! To top it off,  I finished the meal off with some Baklava....perhaps the best thing I've ever ate! Run to this place, do not walk! It is AMAZING!

Was in for Labor Day weekend w/ the family, visiting ... family.  Asked My sister n Law, "Wha's goo' 'round hurr" ( terrible texan accent, maybe it's 'cuz I'm not from there)  She had no clue and I had to whip out the phone.  I was looking for something healthy, quick and nearby and .. BAM!  This lil' place had good reviews and I hadn't had a gyro in 4-5 days!  Got there 5 min. after they opened, there was a chick taking pics of a plate ... prob. for some paper/mag. and the guy looked greek, the lady that took my order looked greek, so I was pretty confident that this place was going to be good.  11:15, this place was busy, no seats available and when I saw the Gyros come out, I knew why.  Everything was fresh, except for the pickled stuff, obviously ,,,and I think they make their own Tzatziki sauce since I've haven't had cucumbers in long strips.  Delish!  I highly recommend this place because they were not stingy on the proteins and that's always what most places skimp on.  took away a star since my order was lost in the shuffle due to a guy being late and didn't know who ordered first.  There is also outdoor seating but who the hell wants to sit out in 110 degree shade.... yeesh.

Everything on the menu is amazing.  Seriously.  Uh-may-zing.  The lamb gyro, the spanakopita, the salad, the steak souvlaki, the shamali, for all that is good in the world, come here and try them all!   Seriously.    I cannot express enough how good the food is here.  The rice pilaf, the rice is loose and flavorful and filling.  The spanakopita is fluffy and dense at the same time (yeah, I don't how that happens, but yes, just yes).  The souvlaki, oh, hello super flavorful and rich meatiness on a skewer.  The salad, there is something addictive about the dressing, and I really appreciate the olives having the pit.  The gyro, well, this is how most people judge a Greek place, and I can say that it is flavorful (everything in this place is flavorful, you cannot go wrong), sliced at just the right thickness, and just works so well with the tzaziki, vegetables, and pita.    Oh and the shamali, dense poundcake like with an orange infused in it, a great way to end a meal.   I have only eaten on carryout, so I can't speak for the waitstaff, but the lady at the register, she is such a welcoming and kind person.  She really does make you feel like you are in her kitchen and you're a guest.

This is my second time in the area and this place is 100% worth a repeat visit. Let's face it, there are tons of places to eat in the area, but I felt I would be disappointed if I didn't come here!   The staff are super friendly and it's very clean inside. The menu is simple and easy to navigate. You order at the counter and they deliver the fresh meal to your table.   They sell wine & beer but I came for the  Avgolemono Soup $3.50, Classic Greek side salad with falafel $7.50.  Fountain drink= $13!  Did I mention how nice the staff is? Everyone here seems to enjoy their job and takes pride in their food.
This was such a delicious meal! I had the Gyro and feta fries and I was shocked with how good it looked and tasted. I will definitely make it back out here some day :)

Great Greek food :)   What else do you need to know? We got chicken gyro and steak gyro plate. So delicious and fresh! I couldn't stop eating. The place is small and very busy. But totally worth the wait - great lunch spot!
Real greek food! Delicious fresh and over all beyond expectations! You should go! Food coma !
Great interior, clean bathrooms, importantly a great lamb gyro. Awesome lamb burger too!

Delicious Greek food! Tried the gyro and side of rice and loved both however seating is limited. Maybe 12 tables plus a bar like counter. Went here on a weekday evening and took the last table. They do carryout as well!

I had a chance to try this place out and decided it was well needed.  I ordered a gyro platter, which I figured would give me a solid impression of the overall quality of the food. Their gyro meat is tender and moist, always a good sign for the hungry patron. Diced tomatoes complimented the meat well, which was PLENTIFUL. They served it on that standard white flatbread that you see at a lot of places. Not my favorite choice of bread but it was not problematic. The tasty cucumber yogurt sauce was authentic, as expected. The salad was pretty delish-- it had that ever so tasty olive in it and that yummy vinagrette dressing. Their rice had a nice wholesome taste to it but I wouldn't have minded a bit of extra seasoning in it. The fries were good but also could have benefited from some additional seasoning.  I'm very much looking forward to trying some of their kabob dishes and specialty salads in the near future.  Final verdict: good quality, authentic greek food, served in plentiful portions.

Went to great greek with a group on Saturday and ordered the chicken Shawarma Salad, the Beef and Lamb Gyro fries hummus and Tatziki. Overall the meal was great and everything seemed awesome. Until night time 3/4 people in our group all had extreme stomach discomfort. We were all sharing food so I can't pin point exactly which dish did this to us but we hadn't eaten anything else the rest of the day so we are guessing it was the food we had.

When I found this place off blue diamond I immediately fell in love! So good I returned 2 nights in a row! And am yet to be disappointed. I got the hummus and pita bread for appetizer and you can tell right away the pita I quality either home-made or locally sourced based on the freshness. Went with the great Greek gyro combo (beef) which comes with a side Greek salad and a drink. The auto was huge portion and the salad was dressed properly (not too much dressing) I also tried the mezze platter for an appetizer that gave you a good variety of Greek finger food and everything was amazing! The second night I got the shrimp plate which was also a hefty portion for the price with amazing flavor start to finish!
Great food, great people. I got the burger, which was very good, and my wife got the chicken gyro wrap, she liked hers too. Place was packed, always a good sign, the food is superb.

I've stopped in a few times and there's always a steady stream of people. If that's not a sign, I don't know what is... Actually, my bf says that he sometimes passes by people picketing a labor dispute here, but I guess those signs don't deter anyone. Like they say, "there's no such thing as bad publicity..."  Talking strictly food, I do enjoy ordering from here. Even though the beef/lamb gyro seems to be a customer favorite, I prefer to get the grilled chicken option. The traditional gyro ($6.95) comes with tomatoes/red onions/tzatziki, while the Great Greek gyro ($7.95) includes that plus lettuce and feta. Worth getting the latter. Love me some feta cheese. The traditional plates range from $11.95 to $13.95, which include your choice of protein, along with a Greek side salad, pita bread, and your choice of rice pilaf OR french fries. Plenty, plenty food. I've only bummed off a few bites from my bf's plate, but their rice pilaf's good -- light and lemon-y.  Tip: Order ahead of time online using ChowNow. It'll save you from sitting around and waiting for 20 or so minutes. The first time we went, the poor cashier was handling both for-here and to-go orders, AND bussing the tables.

Good place for fast food.  They have a great service, all the Employees were super nice. I ate the chicken skewers with rice and it was delicious! Will absolutely go back for more.  Highly recommended!

Two words: Falafel Pita.   I'm not lying when I say that The Great Greek's Falafel Pita is the best I've had. Bold statement, yes, but I have my reasons.  FOOD I made my order into a combo and chose a side of fries over the salad (not this time, lettuce). The combo also comes with a drink which I wasn't aware of, because I'm accustomed to dining at Greek and Mediterranean restaurants that normally charge extra for beverages.  +Falafel Pita: Hummus, shredded lettuce, diced onions and tomatoes, and ground falafels all wrapped in a soft, warm pita and topped with a pepper. To say that it was "good" would be an understatement, so just look at this photo instead: (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=BJO8YVuJQo1jVeyGoDovuw&userid=epkRB3J_oBEiyiwahvdmGg).   One of the main reasons why I like Great Greek's Falafel Pita is that It's easy to eat. Unlike the ones from other Greek and Mediterranean restaurants I've eaten at, Great Greek breaks down the falafels, thus making it easier to consume. I couldn't help but think, "Duh, why didn't anyone think of this sooner?!" while I was eating my pita. It just makes sense! Breaking down the falafels saves me time from having to unwrap my pita and eat my falafels with a knife and fork.   +French Fries: Originally, I wanted to order a side of Feta Fries, but taking into consideration that this was my first time dining at this establishment, I stuck with my combo's fries. Deep fried, golden brown, and crunchy, the fries are delicious as they are. I can only imagine how wonderful they would taste like with crumbled feta cheese on top.   SERVICE Restaurants where the employees greet you with a smile are a plus in my book. When I first walked in, I was welcomed by the kind lady working at the counter.  The food here is quickly made and served right to your table within 10 minutes, so you won't have to wait too long to eat.  OVERALL Their Falafel Pita combo has won me over, and now I *have* to try everything on their menu, as well as their baklava that's displayed right there on the counter, ready to be consumed.
Amazing. That's all I can say. I tried a lot of different dishes and everything was better than the last! I'm craving it as we speak :) can't wait to come back!
I didn't expect the food to be this good. The staff is incredibly friendly! I am definitely going to come back and recommend this place to family and friends!

The Great Greek is everything you would expect from a Greek restaurant: gyros, salads, baklava, you know the drill. The interior is sleek and modern, and the staff were friendly.   The Great Greek has a perfect location if you live in that part of town, since you literally turn right off of Blue Diamond to access the restaurant, perfect if you're craving greek on the way home from work. Give them a call, order up, and your food will be ready by the time you arrive.   The food is good, but nothing that will particularly blow you away. The tzatziki was noticeably creamier than other tzatziki sauces I've had in the past. It was an interesting change of textures, but was slightly ruined by the fact that they LAYERED that s*** on my gyro. Unless you're into that, be mindful when ordered and maybe ask for it on the side to control your own destiny.   Overall, it's nice to have another Greek restaurant, but Stephanos is still the undisputed Greek God when it comes to Greek food. The Great Greek is...good, but I'll have to visit a couple more times and have something magnificent before I would consider it 'Great'.

Husband & I travel between Las Vegas & SoCal frequently. BUT we have not found a better Greek Restaurant like The Great Greek! I get the chicken skewers & he gets the steak bowl. If I could eat it everyday I would. I mean it.   Place is always popular so get there early or order take out or delivery thru grubHub.

I'm a huge fan of Mediterranean food so we decided to try this place out for lunch on a Saturday.  The place has indoor and outdoor seating which would be nice on a warm day. (we sat indoors as it was not) Very casual dining atmosphere.  The food was very good and the price was very reasonable. I had the Gyro sandwich combo with soup and a drink and it filled me up.  The only downside that prevented me from giving 5 stars was that the Baklava that I ordered never came... The brought out all our food except for the baklava but since we were so full we forgot about it until we got back home... so partially our fault too I guess??  Either way, good food, good service, good price = Will be back.  Good to take friends, family, coworkers, and a date.

This is my new favorite local place. Yes, I know Vegas has lots of great restaurants, but this one makes me feel like a nice Greek family invited me over for dinner and served AMAZING food!  I've tried a little bit of everything but my absolute favorite dish is the gyro rice bowl. First of all, it's delicious. The meat is always perfect, the rice is seasoned just right, and the portion is big enough you can squeeze three meals out of it.   I've also had the gyro and chicken pita sandwiches, but to be honest, I go for the rice bowl everytime. Also, the lady who runs the restaurant is always so nice and attentive. I love eating here.

They have the best Gyros in Vegas! It's worth the drive, except on Sundays because they're closed. If they were open I could bring the whole family. Excellent customer service and very patient I picked up a to go order at 5:00pm on a Monday and it was packed!

Food is freaking amazing! Eat here alot but...figuring i only order a small side salad with a lamb skewer cooked medium i thought it would be a fast order to call in. Not the case. I had to call 27 times for no one to answer and went inside and nobody was on the phones at all only taking orders at the counter and someone expoing the orders ready. Then waited 20-25 min for my sm side salad a one skewer.  Bummer

Came here for dinner the other night and I was glad to finally check this place out. Inside isn't huge, but it was clean and there was a girl constantly cleaning tables and the floor under them. The woman at the counter who took our order was nice and gave us a number to put on the table. It took about 15 minutes for the food to come out, but the place was busy and they claimed to be making everything fresh so I didn't mind.  I ordered a side "Classic Greek Salad" priced at $4.95 with house made Greek vinaigrette. The salad had crisp greens, tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion, kalamata olives (has pits...be careful!) and feta cheese. The salad tasted fresh and the dressing was delicious. The salad also came with some grilled pita bread that I put some cucumber and tomato on and folded it up to grub on. Yum! Hubby got a burger (said the patty seemed frozen) and made it a combo with "Feta Fries" for us to share. The fries were excellent! Especially dipped in some of their tzaziki. I will be back to try a gyro and baklava.   They also have tables outside if eating inside isn't your thing or you can call ahead and place your order to-go. Ask about their family meal deals, they have a couple to choose from.

Food was really good but I watched them handle all the food without gloves.    2 cooks kept wiping their noses.   As foul as foul can get.  Not one person handled food with gloves.  I cancelled my order and left.    Visit at your own peril
The Gyro here rivals and or tops any I've ever had. A healthy portion of feta cheese over the top I think is the secret vs the competition. Well worth the $7.50.

OMG this place is heaven. The traditional gyro with the feta fries is so good and my girlfriend had the Falafel pita with the feta fries it was so delicious it should be illegal for reals. Its very busy during lunch and dinner but believe me its worth the wait. The staff is friendly which is a plus.  The Great Greek just earned 2 forever customers. I will tell my friends and family about this awesome slice of Greece.

After wondering what I should eat for dinner other than In-N-Out, I remembered reading about the Great Greek.  I decided to order a gyro meal to-go.    The lady at the counter is super nice.  After explaining to me the items on the menu, I went with what I know best, the gyro.  I shared the meal with my bf and it actually was enough food.  The gyro was tender and flavorful, the salad consisted of fresh ingredients, the fries were freshly fried.  Definitely a delicious meal.  We will return to try other items on the menu...
Awesome food and really nice owners!  I love everything I have tried here but the Greek fries are my absolute favorite.  The falafel rocks and the gyros are the best in town.  I love it!!!

Decided to see if things had improved.  We didn't have chicken this time but tried the falafel. They give you a lot but they should for the price.   We were looking fwd to french fries we'd had before that were great, they changed them...the new fries are terrible. .coated with something flaky and greasy. Big let down. Service is good. Wouldn't rush back but it's OK in a pinch.

We come here at least a 3 times a month.. love love love it! Clean, fresh, nice employees, quick service and food always tastes good. We have been eating here since we moved to Vegas almost 3 years ago My family always is happy after eating here and we will continue to come back!

Really tasty food, friendly staff. Prices seem a little high, especially if you take the salmon option (why is salmon so much more $ than shrimp?). But, excellent falafel, rice bowls are huge, delicious hummus, grilled steak plate was nice, & great pastitsio (this is over 2 trips). The salmon for my rice bowl wasn't cooked quite as much as I like but given it's twice what I can eat in one sitting, I can cook it up a little more when I have the leftovers tomorrow. All in all, very good and we will be back!

Awesome food and very friendly atmosphere.  I had the small Greek salad with chicken. The portion was hearty and the dressing light. The chicken had excellent flavor and was not dry. The hummus is probably the best I've had. I will definitely be back soon.

I had the Greek salad with gyro meat last week for lunch. It was very fresh and a generous portion. My only complaint is that the meat was soggy. It didn't have any of the nice thinner edges that stay slightly crisp. It was still very tasty.   Service was okay. We got our order to go and it took a while for the woman at the counter to acknowledge us when we were at the counter.   Their tzatziki is amazing in both flavor and texture.

Went there for pick up only.  Nice little place.  I ordered the greek salad, and a side of hummus and the bread.  The salad was huge!  I think next time unless I'm sharing I will get the 1/2 and the hummus and bread.  I was so full off of this meal.  I paid about $12.00 for it, it was enough for 2 people to eat if you both like this combo. I will be back to order something else in the future, because as I was waiting for my to go order, there was some pretty nice looking dishes going to peoples tables.  Try it, you might like it!
bomb bomb bomb!!! portions are huge and the food is delicious!! i'd eat here everyday!

The food is SO BOMB. I haven't had anything I don't like. The chicken lemon soup is my absolute favorite. The service is great, cute little location. I highly recommend this place. The portions are a really good size too.
I love this place. The food is amazing, the staff is friendly, and the overall experience is just awesome.

Food was solid, but I think they prioritize Togo orders faster? When I arrived there were two people in line who got their food within 10 minutes of ordering. 5 or so minutes after I ordered they did get 3-4 customers ordering to go who all got their food extremely quick as well. My gyro took almost 30 minutes to get to my table. Not used to waiting that long for Greek food and not the best experience for my first time here.

The only reason its not a 5 star is that they close at 8pm ... stay open later guys.  I had the Gyro platter ... beef strips, pita bread, rice pilaf, and a mixed green salad that will blow your mind with how good it was.

I had been wanting to try this place for lunch after a coworker's recommendation. Since it's a little over 10 minutes from my office, I decided to try ordering from Grubhub for the first time. Before I placed my order it said "total time will be 30-40 mins". AFTER I placed the order it turned into 90 mins! Yikes! So.. I decided to cancel my Grubhub order and just go to the place directly.  I drive the 10+ minutes, park, and when I walk inside there is a huuuge line and only one person working the counter. I'm waiting for at least 10 minutes which seems silly - why not have at least one more person working the register so they can handle the crowd more? On top of that, the person at the counter was also taking ordering calls so we had to wait for her to finish making the line move even slower. I was almost ready to bail but since I had waited this long (and made the trek), I decided to stay.  When I finally got up to the front, ordering was thankfully fairly smooth. I got my food to go and when I asked, I was told it would be another 15 minutes for it to be ready. I wish the lady behind the counter would have volunteered that information instead of me having to ask after I placed the order. But once again, I'm already committed, so might as well ..   Ordering food to-go is kind of weird because they don't give you a number and there's really no where to sit and wait. I didn't want to take up a spot at the table for people dining in since it was already crowded, but I didn't want to stand because it was gonna be at least 15 minutes? So the whole thing just felt weird and clunky. I saw a lot of people get to-go orders so I would have thought they'd have a better process.  After a few minutes, I decided to check on my order, and I found that my original Grubhub order was actually made instead of being cancelled. I panicked because I had just placed an order for the same exact thing. The lady at the register assured me my order had been cancelled and so I wouldn't be charged (even though it was made). At the same time, the order I had placed a few minutes ago came out, so she packaged that. While I thought she would just give me the second cancelled order as a nice gesture since it was already there and ready, she instead put it to the side and had zero interest in offering it to me. This was a huge disappointment as other places happily offer me "mistake orders" all the time. I mean the food wasn't cheap to begin with. But, since I had to get back to work, I didn't want to fight it.  And as for the food? It was just okay, but definitely not worth the hassle. The steak was decent but the lamb was super tough. I got it medium - which the lady recommended - so I don't know if it should have been cooked less or what. I was also REALLY hyped about the feta fries, but when I got them they were way too cheesy. They also didn't taste very feta to me? If you love cheese then you'll be fine, but if you're looking for more crispy fries with feta accents (like other places I've been to), I think you'll be disappointed.  Overall I'm hesitant to recommend this place for lunch. If you do, order ahead or be prepared for a long wait.

After watching Guy Fieri munching on some gyro I also had a craving. I remember seeing the Great Greek when I met some friends at the neighboring deli so I drove here. A small dining area inside and a patio outdoors there were plenty of seating option.  -Started out with the Melizanosalata. A roasted eggplant purée with garlic,  olive oil, lemon juice, tomato and onion served with some pita bread. It was delicious!  - next I had a beef lamb gyro. It is loaded up with meat, tzatziki, onion and tomato on a pita. A nice portion had me filled up in no time. I got the combo which came with your choice of soup, salad, fries or feta fries. I had the feta fries and glad I did. These were very good.

(O)rder the Meze Platter to start..great way to try different things (P)izza pans are cleverly used as trays here...Sorry kids, This ain't Cici's...:( (A)vgolemono is the way to upgrade your combo especially with this weather...Fries go with burgers and salad is for rabbits  (G)angnam Style won't be on the stereo here....THANK GOODNESS!!!!!!!! (R)eally huge portions here (E)verything we ordered was very delicious (E)xcellent Beef/Lamb Gyro...Iliked it better than the Chicken Gyro (K)alamata olives have pits inside...don't be that dork who chips your tooth!  (S)panokopita is usually made using Filo Dough (T)hey make their version with Puff Pastry and its just as tasty! (Y)assou ain't got NOTHING on the Great Greek! (L)ooking forward to trying other things when we return (E)xcellent service here as well  (!) !!!ALOHA!!!

Happy to see this business thrive in the Las Vegas community.  Serving great food!  It's quick service, great quality and friendly service.  Restaurants like Me Gusta Tacos and Great Greek coming into the southwest part of the valley are a great thing!  Keep doing your thing great Greek!

Exceptionally good food! Fresh, quality ingredients. The salad is always crisp and flavorful; the meats are lean, tender, and moist. Even the rice pilaf is delicious. So happy that they opened a location in the southwest!
Great choice for Greek good. The quality is good. Prices reasonable. My only complaint please have mora lamb. Every visit lately I ordered dishes with lamb buy they were out of it. Thanks.

I ordered the Yia Yia's Pasticcio which is a ground beef pasta casserole with Greek bechamel  and fresh tomato sauce, I also had a Greek salad and an order of their baklava. I am not usually an adventurous eater so I called the restaurant and spoke with a very friendly woman named Alice. I asked her about it yia yia's pasticcio and she described it to me as a Greek lasagna.  I decided I would try it and I am not disappointed. it was incredible. I don't typically care about baklava either, but this was truly delectable,  due to the amazing food and very friendly staff, I will be coming here time and time again when I visit Las Vegas.

We've visited this location 3 times now and each time the food has been delicious, very clean inside and never a long wait. I can only comment on the salads & skewers because it's the only thing we've tried. But we keeping back for them!!! I can't wait to try some other menu items.
I didn't have much time. Just popped in to get a gyro. It was incredibly good.  one of the best I've ever tasted!

I eat at The Great Greek at least once a week, and as a business owner I witnessed an awesome employee tonight. Brittany did amazing job with a costumer tonight under a tough situation! Their food speaks for itself but this employee is a total asset! Stop by and say hello to her!
I got the rice bowl with shrimp it was so good. Can't wait to go back and try everything else.
Amazing Greek food. Their Turkish espresso was phenominal. Steak scewers were great as well. Jack was awesome and the whole staff there was great.
Went back for some Fetta Fries and Gyro, if i can change my previous 4 start to 5 star i would. Had some Greek some other place and DID NOT COMPARE to the freshness they offer here.
1st time having Greek food and I was very impressed!  Ordered the chicken gyro with fries.  The gyro was bomb.com! Can't wait to come back and try something new again!
Great food. Will definitely come again and try more of the menu. The spanakopita was tasty. Service was fast and friendly, the place was clean and inviting

This place is clean,tasty and quality food although I do wish they would do a better job of keeping the line down and being more flexible on their combos.I don't want 5 servings of rice..how about 1 serving and a salad included?I refuse to go here anymore due to the portion sizes,I go to the place down the street usually but I do still enjoy this place very much.

I moved to the area about a year ago & instantly was in search of a good Greek restaurant. I stumbled upon The Great Greek and haven't gone to any other Greek restaurant since! The food is always fresh and the staff is always nice and welcoming. I recommend the Greek salad with gyro meat - such good portion sizes and soooo delicious! I love this place!!!
The gyros here are bar-none the best in town.  I have not had a better gyro in town.  The shop is extremely small but they are good at turning tables quickly.  I enjoy their food thoroughly.
Excellent food. Good value. We really like it. Service is quick and fast.
This place rocks! There are a couple greek places around here and this place is by far the best one... I seem to catch them closed more than I would like but other than that, I am a raving fan!

We visited for the first time yesterday (7/13/17) around 4PM prior to the dinner rush.  The restaurant is clean, with a modern/minimalist interior.  We frequent Greek/Mediterranian establishments quite often due to our diets, and this has risen quickly to the upper ranks of our list.  You go to the counter to order, and the food is brought to the table by a runner.  Drinks are self serve.  The tea is fresh brewed, so that's a huge plus.  All of the staff members were super friendly and helpful.   The menu has a large variety including avgolemono soup, all types of skewers, and even baklava ice cream.  Prices are very reasonable.  An add-on skewer (shrimp, chicken, lamb, beef, salmon) is only $3.75. The kid's menu is fantastic.  They offer gyros and skewers, not just the usual chicken tenders kid's fare.  As someone who has a very restricted diet, I appreciate that I can get skewers separately or a decent kid's plate without a hassle or a weird upcharge.   I got the plated gyro from the kid menu and my husband got the regular gyro plate.  He substituted additional salad for rice at the suggestion of staff.  It has to have been one of the freshest salads I've seen in town.  I don't even like tomatoes, but they looked glorious.  My kid plate was larger than I expected.  I don't know that it would be a full meal for most adults, but it would definitely not fall too short.  The food was fresh, super tasty, and very filling.  The Tzatziki was wonderful. The gyro meat was nicely carved and wasn't overly seasoned.  The pita was not as soft as I would have liked, but not because it was old or stale. I believe it may have been baked just a little too long.  Overall it was a nice experience and very convenient for the SW end of town. I look forward to a return visit to try the skewers and soup.

The wait time here is always ridiculous. The food is good, but not worth the wait. If they tell you it's a 10 minute wait, it's really 20. Today they said 25 minute wait, but I waited 55 minutes! It's Mother's Day, they're busy, I get it. But I asked them before i made my order how long it would take. Don't tell me 20-25 minutes and have me waiting an hour! And he's worse, the girls behind the counter acted like I was inconveniencing them! I would like to leave then a 1 start for rude service and inaccurate wait times, but like I said, the food is good. But I most def won't be back. If I wanted to wait an hour, I would go to a sit down restaurant
This was delicious, the service was excellent, the portions very generous!  Next time I'm in Vegas, I know where I'm eating dinner

On Friday I searched Yelp to look for a Gyro Sandwich, there were alot of different places to choose from so I chose to try this place.   Great decor and Food. Had to wait about 25mins for my order and that's because this place was rocking, there was nice amount of people eating outside and inside when I got there. I ordered the Gyro Sandwich with fries. The only problem I had was that I ordered the fries with tzatziki and they forgot to add it, so I had to wait for another order of fries. The staff was pleasant.   If in town you should try this place.
Just had the great Greek rice bowl it was awesome it's a nice location here and the people are very friendly and the establishment is clean
Was decent. Not 100% authentic but it's close. Will try again. Wasn't too impressed. My friend loves it. Will b back

I could probably eat here for the rest of my life! I've tried a lot of different things on the menu and they're all delicious.  My favorite is the greek salad wrap with chicken, it is perfectly tangy and delightful but the gyro is solid too.  My boyfriend always gets the falafel which he loves and sometimes if we're feeling wild we'll get dolmades and hummus.  I almost forgot about the feta fries!!!  Great Greek is really doing something right with those fries they're the best.  I believe its family owned and the woman behind the counter is always so sweet and welcoming.  It can get pretty busy though so we always order it over the phone and pick it up, otherwise there are about 8 tables or so inside- not bad but it can get packed

Simply amazing. Best Greek food I've had since I went to Greece in 2009. Chicken gyro was tender, fries super crispy and the pita bread was so fluffy and delicious. I took my food to go but I'll dine in when I return. Great selection of domestic and Greek beer (Mythos!) and wine. Great menu, too much to choose from is a good thing. Can't wait to return.

Got the Chicken & Falafel rice bowl and Feta Fries. Both were delicious, especially the bowl. Portion of the bowl was humongous so I had to put half of it into a to-go box. Overall, amazing Greek restaurant and customer service. Will definitely come back here whenever I'm visiting.

We are always happy when we leave this restaurant. The staff is very friendly and attentive, the food is fresh and delicious, and the price point is spot on. I recommend the hummus with a salad and a side of falafel. My husband always gets gyro & we share. The children get a very generous portion with the kids meals. If you like cheese fries, get the feta fries! My daughter & husband love them. Fries are not my thing, but their fries are crispy. The tzaztiki is thick and good.

Wow, what a not so hidden gem in Henderson. The food is fresh with cool crisp salads and hot, tender and juicy meats. My friend goes apes over the Pita bread and hummus or Tzaziki sauce. The staff are always smiling, very helpful and there to serve . The only drawback is the building is a bit small and there is often a short wait to get a table. But when the food is tasty and fresh it's no problem to wait. Also the new Blue Diamond Hwy location is just as good with a bigger seating area and a nice atmosphere!

This place was so cute! Walked in and was greeted very warmly by staff. It was pretty packed inside so I knew I was in for a treat! The guy at the counter was super friendly too and even gave us a couple suggestions since it was our first time there.   Like I said, they were pretty busy when we came in so I can understand waiting a little longer than usual but when I got my food, which I took to go, it was cold and the pita bread was a little hard.  Regardless, the food was still delicious and very flavorful. I ordered the chicken skewer which I highly recommend along with the feta fries! Yum!  Another disappointment was that they forgot to include the side of hummus in my order :(  I was super disappointed since I was really looking forward to trying it. Oh well !   The food was delicious but I really wish it wasn't cold when I ate it and I wish I got to try the hummus. I gave this place 3 stars but I want to give it another shot and maybe dine in next time! Will definitely update this review!!

The Great Greek used to be my favorite place for lunch or pick up. But that changed today, last time I picked up the food was just okay. Salad with mushy tomatoes. So I figured maybe an off day.   Today I ordered the same as always 2 salads with two med rare steak skewers. When I got home with my food once again mushy tomatoes but this time the steak was so well done I could not eat it Two salads both with charred steak skewers.  Not sure what happened in the last couple of months but I I'll not be back.

Great people, great food, This place does it Right!  We usually stop in here every time we come through the area. It's always a very comfortable and casual atmosphere. The staff are the most happy and relaxed group and always smiling and helpful. To me that really adds to the mood of the restaurant.  We have a toddler and they are always super friendly to the baby and accommodating.  The food is delicious and well priced. We have eaten here several times and tried several dishes. They are all very good and worth your time.  We found the great Greek by searching for something outside of Vegas because we don't really want to fight the traffic or the crowd just to eat. This place is easy to find, easy to get to, lots of parking, no wait, fast service and even a patio.  So If your just in the area or looking for something good outside of Vegas this is a must try!
Great place for a casual lunch! We got the gyro plate with the feta fries. The feta fries were amazing!

This place has the best Greek in town in the most friendliest owners I've ever met. They know what you're going to order even before you sit down when you've been a loyal customer I truly appreciate that
This is my favorite Greek restaurant!!! The people are always so nice and the food is above and beyond delicious. We always get the hummus and falafel rice bowl. They are fantastic!!!
The chicken gyro and avgolemomo soup are absolutely delicious. I haven't had Greek food this authentic and tasty since I moved here from So Cal.

This is THE best dive in Henderson!  Great food, great service and always packed.  Whenever I'm in the mood for a gyro, this is the only place I go.  They also have great salads, great chicken, and the humus is amazing!  If you're ever in this neck of the proverbial woods, stop by and give it a try!
The food was OK but having tried a lot of the other Greek food in the area I definitely think there are better options

Just moved to the area. I love this place. Salads with gyro meat is OMG Good! The kabob chicken with yellow rice my grown boys just love. I will be a regular here. Food is always fresh and the service is great with a smile.

Amazing customer service!  Looking for a place to eat and chitchat with a dear friend, we happened upon the Great Greek.  She had her one-year-old with her so we wanted to find some place appropriate, accommodating, and with indoor seating.  It was quite packed when we got there, with no seats left inside (only tall counter area left, which is kind of difficult to manage with a one-year-old).  Before we walked out, one of the servers / food runners saw us and told us to hold on because a couple tables were getting ready to leave soon.  He told us that he'd clean it up right away and get us a highchair, too.  I thought it was amazing that he even spotted us in the midst of all the food running and the fact that it was quite busy.  It's not a waiter-type of restaurant; it's the order-at-the-counter-and-get-a-table-tent-number-type of restaurant, but still.    The food was just as good.  The hummus was absolutely delicious.  Not the overly fancy kind where they try to throw everything but the kitchen sink in it.  Just straight up good hummus.    The gyro was rather large, which was great because I was super hungry.  I enjoyed it.  The vegetables were fresh and the meat was tender and flavorful.    The baklava was good, but different.  Kind of tasted like cereal, granola, and really tasty honey.  Overall, I really liked this place.  It's a cute, casual spot that's great for catching up with friends or grabbing a bite with family.  Nice, friendly, and helpful staff.  Would recommend and would definitely go back.

Well, this was a surprise!  The husband and I were craving Greek food and he remembered seeing this place "coming soon" not too far from the house. We swung by tonight and, in all honesty, I was expecting decent grub and a so-so atmosphere. It was far better than that.  The place itself is very nicely put together, especially considering it falls under the "fast casual" umbrella. Beautiful wood on the walls, lots of planters, nice lighting, lovely tables all with vases and fresh flowers. It was very inviting. Also, food is served on real plates with real silverware and the plates have a kind of pottery look and feel to them which adds to the overall effect.  But more importantly - the food!  We ordered two gyro combos; my husband's had feta mine didn't. Both were the lamb/beef combo with juicy fresh tomatoes, red onion, deliciously fluffy and thick tzatziki sauce, and a scrumptiously fluffy pita to hold it all together. Guys, it was phenomenal! Meat was tender and delicious, veggies were on point, and the sauce was addictive.  I had rice pilaf as a side (yummy!) and the hubs had the feta fries. The feta fries were a revelation. Perfect spuds with feta and tons of oregano mixed throughout (I hate it when there's only cheese on top!) and cooked together into a creamy, gooey, crispy, unctuous mass of magic. I stole many of his fries and husband is a good man because he let me.   We also got some eggplant dip as an appetizer and it was very good. All good was ordered at the counter but brought to your table. Service was wonderful, extremely friendly and genuine.  I short, I'd go back in a heartbeat. The only problem is deciding whether to eat that amazing gyro again or try something else because the whole menu looks awesome.
If you're looking for a gyro, this is the place to go.  At other places, I have to order two and it gets pricey, but here, one is plenty!  Definitely give this place a shot.

I would like this place more if it was next door to my house. Actually I would like this place more if it were in my house. 1 star because this place is not in my house.  Kidding! I loved every last bite on my food crawl with Jaime W. and Dana S. That egg-lemon-rice soup, yeah, I would bathe in that shit. It would make me smell funny, but I feel it probably contains healing properties for the soul that regular bath water can't fulfill.  The Gyro meat was especially delicious as well. Yeah, I could see myself eating here on a regular basis...they just have to move in downstairs. A major plus is that you can dine outside and they will bring your food to you. I know that their tea is just regular Fuze tea, but it was so good!   5 stars. Go before I renovate my basement to be their new kitchen.

We were there once and we loved it. Order was quick and easy. We ordered soup and two entrees. The soup was tasty and hot, as well as the big plates. Everything was fresh and looked delicious. We ordered the skewer meat plates and they were yummy. Will definitely be back there when we are back in Vegas!

AMAZING! Amazing customer service and OUTSTANDING food. (Sometimes there is a wait for tables but seriously doesn't even affect my 5 stars) Their flavors cannot be best. Stop by here. You will NOT be disappointed.

I have been to this place over a dozen times in the past 6 months and it is AMAZING!!!!  The service is always friendly and helpful.  I usually get the hummus appetizer (ask for extra pita bread!!) steak-lamb gyro and fries.  You would never think that fries would be good at a place like this but they are delicious!  A little crisp on the outside and soft on the inside.   I have also tried their greek salad with chicken. So good, especially if you are watching your waistline.  A little of their dressing goes a long way.  If you have room for dessert you need to get their rice pudding.

Fantastic Greek food, especially love the feta fries!!! Took away one star due to the employees sitting outside the front of the establishment in the outside dining area smoking, other than that I have no complaints!

Fresh and fast, and YUM! You know you've made a good lunch choice when there are police officers eating at the restaurant as well - they always know where to go for food with a great value. We tried chicken soup, dalmades and a salad. The salad was amazing, definitely try it with the falafel or chicken, comes with a couple pieces of warm pita. The dalmades, do they make them fresh? Because it sure tasted like it, comes with 6 pieces and a wedge of lemon. The soup is a little strange, it doesn't know whether it wants to be chicken-based broth or a cream-based, but very citrus-y and refreshing, so I let that slide.   Basically, a great place for a quick lunch, it's very clean and as usual with restaurants in Henderson, NV, tons and tons of parking.

So.. I haven't tried ALL the greek spots around town, but now that I've found the Great Greek, there's no reason to look further. Their chicken and steak souvlaki is amazing. The seasoning is just right. The grilled shrimp is delicious. The rice pilaf compliments the meats very well. And... Feta Fries?! Come on dude..   The one and only knock I have on this place is... You can't call ahead and dine in. But they still deserve all 5 stars on the food alone. Great people too. So yeah, only greek joint in town that I would suggest!

Best Greek spot in town, hands down! The food never disappoints and I'm speaking for both this and the original location in Henderson. Their salads have so much flavor, the gyros are crave worthy, the feta fries. Yeah, I'm gonna just leave that there.   My girlfriend and I usually get the souvlaki (chicken, steak and/or lamb) plate and it is so satisfying, and for the price, you really can't beat it. The staff are also very friendly and efficient. If you don't like to wait, I suggest you call in your order for takeout as it usually takes about 10-15 mins for them to have your food ready. Hey? At least you know it's fresh! But personally, I think it's well worth the wait. Enjoy!

Came to try based on a friend's recommendation. So glad I did! Service was very friendly & helpful. I tried the gyro bowl based on cashier's  recommendation. It was fantastic. Lots of lamb, perfectly prepared. The bowl was a huge portion, I got 2 meals out of it!  I would definitely come back again.

A friend an I stopped by here during a long lunch break. The interior is small, with limited seating but on a nice day you can always enjoy your meal on their outdoor tables.   The guy who took our order was very friendly and he  immediately made my visit a little bit more enjoyable. Both my friend and I got the great greek gyro which comes with lettuce, tomatoes, red onions, tzaziki sauce and feta cheese. I made it a combo and got the regular fries and a drink. The food came out quickly and just looking at it made my mouth water. The gyro is a good size, the meat was flavorful and the tzaziki sauce and feta added just the perfect amount of a cool, creamy contrast. I was pleasantly surprised that the french fries were hot, crispy and didn't taste like frozen potatoes.   This is a great place to get some Greek food in the Henderson area and I would highly recommend checking this place out.

This place is decent but nothing to go out of your way for. I tend to go due to its location.    The service is super slow and they seem to be a bit unorganized, im sitting here now waiting 15min for a gyro.  If your in the mood for greek and just happen to be in the area its ok but i think there are much better options with better service.  Ive changed to 2 stars as im gettimg close to 30min wait for a f'in gyro!!  From now on I will take extra time to drive to rainbow where there is a much bettet greek spot!

If I could give more stars I would. This place... oh this place. I have to admit I eat here at least once a week. I have never, ever had a less than perfect meal here. The only downfall is that the place is so small!  That being said, they are so organized that even when the line is out the door with the greek food addicts like myself, they always make sure people get seated in order if they choose to dine there and the wait is never too long. I am surprised with the magic that these people create in such a tiny space.  The staff is so friendly and they work their butts off!  The presentation of the food is like fine dining and the price is outstanding. If I ever win the lotto, I'm getting these guys a great big spot... next to my house. :)

Small place with a pretty big wait but I understand why. I got a falafel rice bowl to go without the yogurt to make it vegan and it was so amazing. My BF got some kind of burger and he was equally impressed. The people at the counter were super nice. Everything tasted really fresh and I will absolutely be back.

Omg!!! The most excellent Greek salad I've had. Add the gyro meat, which is superb, and you have a great lunch. The staff was extremely nice, and welcoming. They were very attentive to the customers. There was one guy running the show, and in between taking orders, he was cleaning up the table and even had the sense of making sure those who needed a table, got one inside because it was a very hot day.

Terrible first experience. How do you run out of rice? I mean I guess it happens but you should really be prepared if you are running a business. I'm Asian so I need my rice or I won't be satisfied. Ugh, waited 30+ mins for it. So annoying when you are starving. Their food is ok. Not bad but but nothing special.

This is a great little neighborhood Greek spot. We went in mid-week around 8 p.m. and the place was clean and the customer service was fantastic. We were recommended to try the feta fries (amazing) and we ordered a gyro plate and a grilled shrimp skewer plate. Both came with a really fresh Greek salad and rice pilaf, which was also quite good.  Portion sizes were huge (we had enough for dinner and lunch the next day). My husband really liked the gyro, he only wished that they had put it on the flatgrill for a couple of minutes to crispen it up just a bit. My shrimp was flavorful and not overcooked and the plate came with 2 large skewers of shrimp. We will definately be back!

It's so good that we seriously need to consider leaving bad reviews -- it's getting too busy!  EDIT: After a couple years, the Great Greek just became too busy. The quality has suffered a little bit (chicken soulvaki tough on a few occasions) but overall it remains a solid place to eat. Us, personally, we've found another Greek place in Henderson that we enjoy a little bit more (I will not disclose the name, because both are very good, and the object is not to take away business from the Great Greek -- because, it is, in fact, great. It just isn't as great as it used to be. And I have to be fair to the original five-star review.   This seems to be somewhat of a regular problem in the valley: places open strong & then cannot deal with the influx of customers.
I went there once and that would me the last time. The management is very rude and extremely un organized. Do not waste your time and money to go to this over crowded zoo.

We grabbed food here after leaving the Las Vegas airport. The heat was a startling more-than-100-degrees, so there was no way we were leaving the air conditioned restaurant to eat. We had to wait about 15 minutes for a table to open up. The interior of the restaurant itself was pretty cramped. The service was alright - we ordered at the counter, and the staff came around to clear off tables every once in a while. The ambience was very similar to that of a well maintained fast food restaurant.   I ordered the rice bowl with falafel. It was a huge bowl, and the vegetables in it were very fresh. There wasn't as much rice pilaf as I assumed there would be, but they say when you assume, "you make an ass out of u and me." The rice pilaf was slightly salty and it added more flavor to the bowl (which was extremely reminiscent of a salad). The falafel was flavorful, although the middle was a little mushy.   Overall, the bowl was really good, healthy, and filling. I believe it was about $11, which I thought was a fair price. I would definitely recommend this place yes

Best authentic Greek food in town, hands down! The flavors are rich and zesty, the people are friendly, the atmosphere is energetic. For a great overall taste of the menu, I recommend the Mezze plate.
I travel to Henderson often for business, and I have been wanting to try this place for some time. I'm glad I did- WOW! I will be back often!

Nice, clean place with friendly staff. Food is your typical Americanized Greek food. I suggest if you can't tell the difference than I would give it a shot. Decent portion but more on the expensive side.
Great food, friendly service. We were passing through town & this place sounded like it would hit the spot and it did. We had gyros, rice pudding &  baklava ice cream. Everything was so good & fresh.
