There is absolutely nothing great about The Great Greek with the exception that they greatly manage to fool a lot of Yelpers into thinking this is a four-and-a-half star average listing. "Eek! Methinks not."  If this is the best greek in the valley, then I should quit eating greek food right here and fucking now because it was "A-OK" at best. Add to the sum of the equation the shittiest service I have received anywhere in Twenty-Fifteen, and you've got yourself a one-star. Great job, Great Greek.   The night I went -- the last time I shall ever patronise this shit show -- it was packed. It might be always packed here. (People have no taste.) Now, I will never penalise a business for being too popular; however, I will deduct stars for how they handle their high amount of traffic.   Service The ladies providing the table service were beyond rude. "Excuse me!" they would loudly shout every couple of minutes in the same way one would exclaim "Get the fuck out the way, asshole." The queue exists, and it only has a very small area where to exist, and those in it weren't even excessively occupying more square space than necessary. "Excuse me!"   On the other hand, the lovely, middle-aged lady behind the till was pleasant without exception the entire time  we were there. She should get a raise if she is not already the owner. "Excuse me!"  The service aside from the cashier continued to earn itself the Worst In Show with one of the "Excuse Me!" ladies tossing the plates on our table and snatching the table number without asking if we needed anything else. Missing was the dessert, naturally -- "Excuse Me!" -- and my fucking salad.   Food The food was alright. I had the Greek lamb burger because I am boring. The dessert might have been the greatest thing west of the goddamn Mississippi; however, I shall never know.   Just like The Great Greek will never know anything other than this one-star from Edwin P. from Las Vegas, Nevada, U.S.A.  The yuppies with no taste and no sense of decent service can keep it. One star.

I'm so sorry I ate all my food before I could take pictures. My boyfriend and I both got gyros (one chicken one lamb) and they were delicious. Get the feta fries as well you will thank me later.   Food was awesome, and the service was just as great! Both young ladies assisting us were very sweet and efficient. While they weren't ringing orders through they were keeping the place spotless. We will be new regulars here. :)

Gimme a bucket of tsaziki and slather me up!  I have been absolutely craving Greek food for the past few weeks.  Maybe it's the upcoming festival season.  Maybe I'm getting tired of of my wife's cooking.  Uh, maybe I better shut up.  Whatever the impetus, I was determined to give this place a shot.    The lady at the register was really nice, despite having half the dining area overrun by my two monkeys.  They don't have kids meals, which posed a bit of a challenge in ordering, so be advised if you do have kids.  As a workaround, I decided to order the soulvaki plate with one skewer each of chicken and beef, with rice and a salad (about $11).  My wife opted for a gyro pita ($7.50) combo that came with fries (hey, don't judge) and a drink (add $2.50 for the combo).  +1 drink for me and our total was just under $25.    The food came out reasonably quick and smelled delicious.  The salad was fresh and refreshing, with just enough dressing for taste, not drowning in it.  The beef I ordered medium rare and it was cooked perfectly.  Some steakhouses can't even get that right!  I don't know what kind of beef they use, but it was really tender and the seasoning was pitch perfect.  The chicken was also cooked ideally and oozed juices when cut into.  Of the two, the chicken was my favorite - whatever is in the marinade makes it sing.  The skewers sat on a bed of really tasty rice pilaf that seems to have some tang to it.  Add to that some of the best tsaziki sauce I've had and you're in business.  I could have slathered everything with it.    The kids were shoveling my rice and took about a third of my meats, so thinking I would be left hungry, I ended up ordering a third soulvaki chicken skewer ($3) and a side of rice ($2.50).  Of course, as soon as I paid for the extras, my kids say they're full.  Typical.  So what's a dad to do except scarf it all down myself?    Unfortunately, I ran out of tsaziki because I shared it (rare for me) with my wife, who, of course, didn't share any of her gyro pita with me.  But $0.75 for a side?  Yikes!  No matter how good it is, I can't justify paying that much for a small container.  The only thing more disappointing than running out of tsaziki was the fries.  Yeah, I know, who the heck orders fries at a Greek place?  Well, blame it on the kids.  Also, the pitas don't taste home made, but that's not a big deal to me, I'm just giving fair warning if that's a must have for you.  Despite the hardships I experienced, I overcame.  I used some creative ordering, decided never again to share the most cherished items on my plate and made a note to self to always leave the family at home.

Best Greek food I have had in a long time.  Moved to the area recently and heard about this place from some co workers.  Good value and really great service.  A little crowded with how many tables there are but they do a good job of shuffling people around if needed to accommodate bigger groups.  I had their Gyro and it was excellent.  Also you got to try to their fries.  Excellent!

Fresh, delicious and healthy. The enthusiasm of the staff is delightful to observe. This place is light, cheerful and the food will not disappoint. It's that great combination that you get from truly good Greek food: light, delicious foods but filling and full of flavor. The coolest part of my experience here came from the attitude of the staff. They were just so damn happy to be there! That upbeat vibe was unexpected but very welcome.

Great food with quick, friendly service. We order take our here from our office a few times a month. It's fresh and consistently tasteful. Love the feta fries!!!! So good! Although I usually stick with the healthier choice of rice with my chicken kabobs & salad, but it's an e notable "cheat treat" occasionally. It seems to be appreciated by all as it has always been very busy every time we've eaten there. They're efficient though because I've never had an unreasonable wait time. Enjoy!

The food was wonderful and had a lot of flavor. I loved all of their clean eating options. The food had a please take presentation. A few of my friends ordered the same thing and our food came out a little different but all was really delicious!
Super nice staff and amazing food. Seasoned just right and presentation was awesome. Appetizer was so good it DIDDNT stand a photo.
The food was fantastic! The Falafel was not too dry, it was perfect! Highly recommend if you enjoy Mediterranean food.

Very good service, prices, and food.  I had a lamb gyro with rice and feta fries and a piece of baklava. The lamb had very good flavor and was not dry at all, as is the case sometimes. The feta fries had a great balance and were not overpowering. The baklava was a large piece and it was delicious.

This place is a go to place that you can count on every time to be perfect . I love the Greek Salad and I get 1 of each meat . The chicken and lamb . The owner is super friendly and always in a good mood . Poor guy needs a day off though . The place Is always packed so give yourself plenty of time .

I wasn't overly happy to be dining here, as I'm a vegetarian, and most Greek places don't offer a lot, other than a Greek salad which I can make at home. Alas, my friend was set on coming to this place, and worst case scenario, I could go next door to Capriotti's.   That being said, I ended up ordering fries with feta and tzatziki sauce on top, and they were DELICIOUS!! However, not something I can order regularly unless I want to gain a hundred pounds lol. The tzatziki sauce was so incredibly good, I took a few bucks back up to the cashier to order another side of it, and she just gave me another side, free of charge. Staff was super friendly, and restroom and dining area were clean. This is close to my house and would really like to dine here again and try something different! Oh, he loved his gyro that he ordered, also.
Love! Love! Love! I cant get enough of this place.  I really love the feta gyro!  The service is quick too which makes it nice when in a hurry

This place was packed I went at 430. So it was dinner time I got the gyro platter with feta fries to go. It came with aside salad also. Feta fries were so good never heard of them before the fries alone were nice and crispy. The gyro was good but I didn't get any onion on it and I asked for everything on it. It had what looked like pica digalo. Just tiny chopped up tomatoes with looked like cilantro in it. It was still tasty though.  Last complaint is they cut the pita in half. This makes it really hard to eat. But it was still good

I decided to try Greek food for the second time in my life. As a Jamaican Chinese, I fancy myself knowing a thing or two about delicious food. I was absolutely thrilled with the high quality of the food itself and the service. I had the Greek Salad with the grilled chicken and it was flavorful, fresh and delicious. The pita was also warm, fresh and delicious. The handsome young fellow serving and being ever so busy was very welcoming and warm. His attitude ensures that I will be coming back as well. Thank you for the great experience.
My favorite Greek quick food option and now it's on south west side of town at Decatur and Blue Diamond.  Can't go wrong ever with chicken kabobs or the gyro plate. Delicious

We love this place!  It is a very clean family owned restaurant and the pride in their work and food shows!  I am a VERY picky eater and have an allergy to cheese and I feel that they always take that seriously when I tell them No Cheese on anything of mine.  Thank you!  I also can't say enough about how good the food is here too.  I love the chicken kabobs and the shrimp ones are OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!!!  I am a huge fan of their Greek Salad and their gyro meat as well.  We get carryout about 3 times per week and would eat here more often if we could.  :)

Simply put: great food with fast and friendly service. Absolutely great Greek food. I had the great Greek gyro with the feta fries. You must try the feta fries. Also the soup is really good. Everything is fresh and delicious.
Love The Great Greek and beyond excited to now have it in the SW on Blue Diamond and Decatur. The food is always so very fresh so you can't go wrong with anything  here! The decor is also very nice.
Oh so good. I think their veggie wrap is the best I have ever had. Really nice people too!

The Greek food here is so good and smooth. The steak for the pitas melts in your mouth . It is so great. The lobby is very welcoming and inviting. Our cashier brought us our food and continued to make sure our food was delicious and we were comfortable. Which we were

Excellent Greek Food!    After searching around on Yelp for places in my neighborhood, we found the Great Greek.  Most of the reviews raved over this place and I for one can not disagree.  We got in around 3pm on a weekday and this place had a lot of patrons dining at the time, always a great sign.  The food, cleanliness of the dining area and service were top notch!  We started with our orders at the counter.  We explained that it was our first time here and the lady who took our order was very friendly and was kind enough to give up some recommendations on things to try.  We placed an order for a Hummus App, Great Greek Gyro with Lemon soup side and the Chicken Souvlaki with a side salad.  A lot of food for about 27 bucks.  The Hummus which was very good, not the best I've had but very good for the price was out fairly quick.  The Chicken Souvlaki was excellent with the rice pilaf.  The Chicken was very tender and had a great taste.  My wife had the chicken gyro which looked amazing.  Her soup which she was kind enough to let me try tasted great.  Very unique on the taste, the lemon soup can really bring together a great meal.  My salad was good but I really had wished I got that soup, I guess next time!     As a lunch or dinner option, you can't go wrong with the Great Greek.  The menu is diverse and food tastes great.  Decent size portions for the price will probably have you coming back for more.  I for one will be adding this place as one of my regular stops whenever I am in the mood for excellent greek food!

Don't let the strip mall frontage fool you, this place is unreal. The best Feta Fries I have ever had and some of the best Gyros in the West. Absolutely amazing food and the service is just as good. I'd take a meal here over most places on the strip.

Solid local joint for a quick dinner. The gyro meat is really good, not scary and blobby like you sometimes get.  Portions are very generous - one of their rice bowls (comes with veggies and your choice of meat) can easily feed me and the 2 li'l kids. Same goes for the dolmades. I've noticed other places shrinking their portions, some all the way down to 3 in a serving! The Great Greek still offers 6 good-sized dolmades in a serving, and they're delicious. Prices are reasonable, about $10 for the signature rice bowl, similar for a gyro meal with fries and drink. Bonuses for being family-owned and having a nice patio.

Had the Lamb Skewer Plate with feta fries, and my bf had the traditional gyro plate. It was alllll delicious. Plates came with a salad (yummy), pita & hummus (yummy). Everything was awesome and the feta fries were freaking fantastic!! Coming back for just those in general. And, the service was great. A woman served us and she was so incredibly nice and explained the menu to me!!
Always fresh, juicy chicken with excellent rice pilaf and a salad that's PERFECTLY dressed every damn time!!! If you don't like this place, you are not from this planet.
Wa sadly disappointed. The spanipokita is no longer made with filo  instead they are using a berry gummy puffed pastry and flavorless spinach fill. Ugh. Do not order it. It's not Greek and not good
I am in love!!!!! I bought like 7 different items to try, and it was alll amazing . My 3 year old son loved EVERYTHING !!!! He is a picky eater so I am amazed . I could eat here everyday

Very very good, and great that it's so close to home. The southwest has needed more Greek options and this is a great one! Got a traditional gyro- gyro meat was good, tzatziki sauce good, and my stomach will leave happy! 12 dollars for the pita, fries, and a soda which is pretty average. Can't wait to come back and try more on the menu!

Stopped in to the Great Greek today since one will be opening in my area in May.  I was very impressed.  A lot of menu choices and reasonable prices.  Large portions and great food.  The gyro was the best I've had in awhile.  Better than the other local food truck and sit down bar options.   I'll be happy when they open near me!

spectacular food and service.  chef worked with the hubs during his wynn days.  now he's got his own place, serving up his food - the way his family has served it up for  generations -- and you can taste the love.  great flavors.  simple, honest, fare.  Our only complaint is that tgg is not open sundays when my chef is usually home - so we have to go on those random week days when he is because he loves it, too.  we usually leave happily with buddha belly accompanied by a serious food coma.    greek salad is not to be missed -- best in town by far.    and for me with celiac, I eat here with confidence knowing I'm safe and can just relax and enjoy the food and my husband's company -- that's the best part.
Great place to eat Gyro. Neat, fast service & friendly staff. It gets busy most of the time but good quality stays the best. Reasonable price menu and well worth driving for.

I picked this restaurant for reunion lunch of my friends who live in Las Vegas.  We are so delighted with  fresh good tasting food.  I like shrimp plates.    It was the first time visit to this restaurant for all of us. We were so happy to pick this place.    I recommend this restaurant!!!  We definitely come back for another reunion. Thank you !!

It's almost comical how often I've eaten their food without actually making a visit. Now that I have, it's time to review.  My friend and I were going to try another Greek restaurant closer to my place, but they had already closed on Christmas Eve. Luckily, we had a plan B that was still open: Yelp and Las Vegas Weekly "Best of Las Vegas" darling The Great Greek.  It's tougher than expected to reach it because whoever designed the plaza inexplicably didn't add enough entrances or even paths. Even though you can see the restaurant from Warm Springs, you'll have to make several turns to arrive at the parking area. It's welcoming enough once you finally enter, with indoor seating for around 20 and a TV with ESPNEWS in HD.  The Great Greek Gyro ($7.95) with a beef and lamb mixture (or chicken if you really, truly must) is a solid lunch option. In addition to the tomatoes, red onions, and tzatziki of the "Traditional Gyro" ($6.95), this pita comes with lettuce and feta. I had experienced this in an assemble-it-yourself form many times with trays ordered for group events, and while it was certainly fresher and warmer at the restaurant, it still didn't truly tantalize my taste buds.  That said, it's at least on par with if not better than any other recent gyro that I've experienced. And it's really cool that they cut it in advance per request so that I could share it with a friend.  I also split one of the "traditional plate" menu items. The Grilled Garlic Shrimp ($12.95) has two skewers of four marinated shrimp a piece. The shrimp was cooked properly and had that juicy bite to it. I can't say that the stated garlic, and oregano were particularly prominent flavors, but I liked squeezing the lemon wedge for acidity. The pita was good, the tzatziki was fine, but... the fries.  Specifically, the feta fries, which I think was a slight upcharge (maybe I'll back-calculate from credit card records) from the regular fries. But it was worth it for the rich feta and its creamier partner in crime. Sure, the fries alone are the fairly thick, floured kind that I enjoy the most, but do the feta fries if you can.  There was also a small salad included in the plate, with a simple vinaigrette not really contributing as much as that ever-present feta. It's cool though. I mean, what are you doing here anyway if you don't like feta?  I'll probably be back, but not in a huge hurry or anything. My first visit bore out my past perceptions that the food is really solid, but not the be-all and end-all of Greek cuisine.

I really like this place. 2 times in the last 5 days good. I have had the steak traditional plate w/ feta/mozzarella fries(omg best fries I think I have ever had), side greek salad. Yesterday I had the small greek salad w/ chicken and steak skewer and a side of feta/mozzarella fries. I love Stephanos but, Great Greek has just been put on my radar. I stayed away for the first few weeks due to the reviews. Well either they just had some opening pains or people are morons. Either way "Great Greek Fam" amazing job and I love how hard you all work to make this place somewhere we can grab something not so unhealthy other than the feta fries but, omg I can't those fries are so dang good keep it up!

We drive by the place a lot and we finally made it in for the first time. There was a line when we walked in and the dining room was almost full which was a good sign. It also gave us a chance to look at the menu as well as see entrees being brought out to the tables. We placed our order and about 10 minutes later one of the girls came to our table telling us that it was going to be a 30 minute wait for rice and asked if we wanted to wait or get a different side but we went ahead and decided to wait since we wanted to have rice with the meat. It really did take 30 minutes for the rice to cook. Then we noticed them starting to serve plates with rice and other tables that had been there way after us we're getting their food first. My husband had to go tot the counter and talk to someone and let them know we were there way before these other customers and the girl told him that they just start putting rice on all the plates but not in the order that they were placed. We finally got our food and fortunately it was very good. It was disappointing that they would run out of rice on a busy Saturday during lunch causing us to have to have a long wait for our food. After this experience we don't know if we will come back or even recommend the place to our family and friends.
Nothing beats FETA fries and a gyro for a great lunch!!!  Been here numerous times and always greeted as a regular and never disappointed with great food.
Excellent service. Very friendly and amazing food. We go there for lunch and dinner all the time. Best Greek place in town.

The Great Geek is a prefect mix of classic Greek Diner to fast, on-the-go. The gyro plate was on fantastic - and be sure to try the hummas & pita! I'm definitely trying the Feta Fries next time!!!  The owners are pleasant and hard working! They have customer service down-pat!

4 1/2 stars. The Great Greek looks like a fast food joint but don't let that keep ya from checking them out. There was plenty of parking during the evening and the owners were so friendly.   I ordered the gyros meal, beverage and balklava for dessert. All the food was delish. The salad was fresh and the gyros and rice portion was gererous. I was so full I ended up taking the baklava to go. When I ate the baklava OMG,  It was the best ever. I would come back here just for the baklava!  I looking forward to returning again.

I wish we had one of these in Baltimore  because I would eat there everyday. I had a Greek salad with dolmades and chicken skewer and it was the best meal I had this week while in Vegas.  The veggies were crisp and fresh and tasty.

Had the Great Greek cater a second event for me and as with the first time, it was fantastic!! Nick is especially helpful and nice to work with. He was able to make some vegetarian modifications which my guests appreciated. Everything was delicious as usual. I actually think the catering food is better than the restaurant food. The biggest crowd pleaser was the salmon kabobs. I really appreciated that the catering order was cooked the same day and everything was fresh and all the meat was moist. I also appreciated all the serving utinsils that came with it. From start to finish the entire process was easy and one less thing I had to worry about!

this place has great fresh homemade food. one Friday i had the Greek lasagna and been craving it ever since.  highly recommend this Greek food as much as the other great place around the corner, the family run hole in the wall Manna.  if you love this place try both, love the homey feel

I am typically very picky when it comes to Greek food because it is the cuisine I was raised on. I went to The Great Greek over the weekend while in Las Vegas and can I just say.... AMAZING!   All the food was fresh, seasoned well and delicious! Definitely a great representation of the Mediterranean Diet.   I will be coming here again next time I'm in Vegas!

When I visited The Great Greek for the first time last week, I was simultaneously irritated and pleased and both for the same reason.  The place was packed.  It is irritating because I hate crowds and I hate waiting.  Pleasing because a crowd like that means this place is doing something right.  Need I say more?  Yes, if I am any sort of worthy Elite ;)  I stood in line for a few minutes to place a take-out order.  I settled upon the Mezze Plate which is Spanikopita (spinach pastry), Dolmades (stuffed grape leaves), Falafel (fried chick pea fritters), tzatziki (cucumber and yoghurt sauce), and hummus (pureed chick pea dip).  This plate also came with a small Greek salad and some pieces of pita bread.  Its kind of a great way to sample a lot of good stuff.  The spanikopita was great.  Super flakey and packed with spinach, one of my personal favorite greens.  The dolmades were good.  They are stuffed with an herbed rice. These appeared to have a ruddy tinge presumably from the herbs and oil used.  Different that what I am used but they were very tastey and I would happily order them again.  The tzatziki sauce was fresh tasting and delicious on both the pita and falafel.  Speaking of falafel, this was probably the best I've had.  It was well seasoned and not at all dry like other examples I've had.  The hummus was good and strong with the taste of garlic and oil.  It made me wish there was more pita to dip in it.  Perhaps my least favorite part of this meal was the Greek salad.  The olives, complete with pits, were great as was the dressing.  But this salad had a particularly strong red onion sliced up in it and the entire salad ended up tasting of onion.  Kind of a turn off for me.  I am picky when it comes to onions and this fell outside of my preferred dose of the root.  Waiting the 15 or so minutes for my food ended up being a sort of treat in itself.  It gave me the opportunity to notice how clean the restaurant was even though every table was being used by some couple, small group or family.  I also took notice of the Greek music playing softly over head.  In those days immediately prior to Christmas, I was feeling overrun by Christmas music.  This was a welcome departure to the seasonal norm even if I understood no words being sung in this ancient language.  I was also able to observe the hard and constant work of this Greek family taking care of who would become extended family simply by walking through the doors.  It was like organized chaos at its finest.

I LOVE this place. It is by far my favorite Greek place in Las Vegas. The food is so fresh and you can tell lots of love goes into every bit of making it. Yes it is busy and crowded, but that's how you know it's a really yummy place. I'd wait any day because it's worth it. You have to try the RICE PUDDING. Seriously amazing. The service is great and the people working there really make you feel at home and try to accommodate you wherever they can. I laugh at reviews that say"it needed a bit more salt" or the pita was a bit too soft? If you are that picky you should dine at 5 star restaurants. It's a mom and pop place( family owned) people. Geez....trust me try this place. You won't regret it.

Food is amazing especially the Feta Fries holy snap! Employees are personable and polite. I've come here multiple times on my lunch break and unfortunately didn't get the chance to write a review until today. Give it a try, you'll be hooked! :)

This is usually my favorite Greek restaurant but the last time I was there was so disappointing. I got there 5 minutes before they opened but they let me in and took my order. More people came in and started ordering. They all started getting their food and I'm still sitting there waiting for my order. After waiting for 25 minutes(20 minutes after they are open), I asked them how much longer it was going to be. They said because I ordered before they opened, they didn't have the chicken prepared yet at the time I ordered so they were still waiting for the chicken(that makes no sense they start prepping at opening time and not before?) I asked if it took more than 20 minutes to cook chicken so she said she will check on it. I got my order almost 10 minutes later. I don't think it should take 30 minutes for a Greek salad with chicken and rice bowl with chicken. Specially when a party of about 10 people came in after I did are almost finished eating their food that they ordered after I did. I only gave them 3 stars because I like their food. Otherwise, it would've been 1 star
Fresh, tasty meals. A definite must try, if you are in Vegas. There are a few good choices in Henderson, but this place has to be on your list.

Delicious.  I called up and placed an order to go.  2 gyros.  Perfectly delicious.  Only next time I will order tziki on the side, as it wasn't evenly distributed, but who cares cause the food was great.  Growing up in NYC and lots of gyros, I was very happy when hubby brought it home. Since first posting, we have been there over 12 times.  Three of those times we brought other guests, a few of them from out of town.  I just recommended them  Saturday night to a friend who lives in the neighborhood who didn't even know it existed.  They went yesterday (Sunday) for lunch and loved it.  I think they have a new customer who will be back. Reminds me of a greek fast food place back in my home town of Bayside, NY.

I didn't know what to expect walking into the Great Greek. I was hungry and had heard good things, so I decided to check it out. It is a fast food Greek restaurant. The interior was clean and orderly, even though they were at the tail end of a busy lunch rush.  You order at the counter and they bring the food to your table. The staff are helpful and will help you figure out the menu.  I tried the beef/lamb Great Greek Gyro, with a salad on the side. They also offer the Gyro with chicken.The Gyro was a little heavy on sauce, but the flavors were good. The tomatoes and onions were fresh and popping with flavor.  The salad was crisp and refreshing. Watch out, the kalamata olives still have pits in them.  The staff collected our dishes as soon as we finished, they were definitely on top of their game. Impressive for such a new restaurant.  This was a quick and easy meal that tasted pretty darn good. I'll be back!

The reason I give them 2 stars is just because of the food . I ate there few times , the food was always fresh , the chicken was great ..  too bad that the employees made my last visit my last one . The Mexicans in the back kitchen thought because I'm white I can't understand Spanish ..while I'm waiting for my food I hear them laughing at the customers that coming in including myself , saying stuff like "why this niggers come here ? They should go to McDonald's " "now this old couple gonna take forever to finish eating " etc...  I don't know if they were mad because people came like 5 minutes before closing but they were just unbelievably disrespectful .. I'm not the one who will anything to them .. I just took my food , threw it to the trash outside and left the place .  Never coming back there again .  The owner should definitely fire the back stuff !
Love love love this place.  Great portions and very consistent!!  So nice having a place of quality near Mtns Edge!  My husband usually is not a fan of Greek food but he loves this place!
This place is fantastic....so fresh and tasty.  Love this place and the staff is always on it.  Great menu.  Whats not to like about the Great Greek.

This is our second time ordering from here. The service is awesome I love the fact that its a family owned business. The food is authentic and tastes sooo good! Last time we had the Greek plate 1 beef/lamb and 1 chicken. This time 2 Gyros and they were fantastic. You have to try the grape leaves and feta fries!

Fabulous!!!! I work in the area and I been going to Kyklos in the Galleria Mall for years! Well today I thought I'd give this place a shot! Loooove it! I ordered the Rice Plate and chose chicken as my meat. Glad I did! Everything is so flavorful!! I thought how good could can rice taste, it's rice? WRONG! It's so good!! They put a scoop of rice in the middle, salad along the outer edges and your choice of meat on top. It is the most favorable Greek food I've ever had! Everything compliments each other. Not a fan of garbanzo beans which are in the salad, funny? I don't mind them! All the flavors compliment each other! Oh I will be back! Yum!!!!
The best Greek joint in town.  Excellent and fresh every time.  Get the rice bowl or the plates, you won't go wrong.

Very good quality. Restaurant.was more like take out than sit down dining experience. Shrimp, rice pilaf & tazaiki were some of best ive ever had. Athena hamburger was also great. Side salad perfect size. Great value for money.

My husband and I came here on a whim, and we could not have been more pleased. The food is incredibly fresh, and not to mention absolutely delicious. The salad was delightful. The dressing was perfect, and it had all the yummy crisp veggies you would expect on a Greek salad. The gyros were enormous, and the meat was cooked perfectly.  The hummus was wonderful, and the warm pita was delightful. Don't let me forget about the baklava. Hands down the best I've ever had. I didn't want it to be over. Can't wait to come back! Thank you for such a wonderful dining experience.
The food and service is fabulous. Real Greek food. Will be back again and again. Fabulous food. Great for takeout for special events at home. Everything is YUMMY...
I love the Great Greek! The good always tastes fresh and delicious! This is my favorite mediterranean restaurant.

I haven't even taken a bite of the food yet and I Will never be back. Some of the worst service I've ever had.  The cashier was incredibly ride like o was inconveniencing her. I wasn't quite sure on what I wanted bc it was my first time here. She rolled her eyes and as she walked away she rudely said, "just let me know when you're ready, I need to do forks". Then I let her know I was ready to order, and she said, "hang on I'm not ready"  Then someone else came up to take my order and I thought she would be a better experience. We are healthy eaters, so when I didn't want fries or rice, I asked for a side of vegetables and she told me no. She didn't even give me another option. I told her I wanted to buy a side and she said that would be five dollars. And that they don't do substitutions. Overall it was a horrible experience.

first off, around 1120am the placed is already packed.  there are police officers sitting in a table. whenever I see police officers in uniform at a restaurant I get excited because they know all the good places to eat. after tasting the food I understand.  best Greek food I've ever had. rice pilaf is perfectly seasoned, meat is juicy and well cooked. if you're in the mood for some Greek food come here. if you're in a mood to try Greek food for the first time come here. highly recommend.

I love the food here! I always get their grilled chicken souvlaki plate with rice pilaf, and it's usually enough food for 2 meals. Everything is always cooked to order, so if you're in a hurry, you must call your order in 15-20 minutes ahead of time. They're also pretty busy most of the time, so you will more than likely wait a while for your food. The staff is very friendly, and the guy always offers me a cup of water or something while I wait. The only downfall to this place is that their dining area is really small and always busy.

This has become my go-to place for Greek food.  Fresh, fast, large portions. I always get the KIDS size because once I got the regular portion and I had enough for 2 meals (which is not a bad thing). I have gotten the Gyro sandwich and platter from the Kid's menu with the salad and fries as sides. I have also tried their lemon chicken soup, which I think would be wonderful when you are feeling sick. Don't forget to get the Greek cookie to finish your meal! They are yummy! I have only taken my meal to-go but the restaurant is clean with a very nice design. You order at the counter and they bring out your food. They also clear your plates when you are done. Overall, I highly recommend them. I look forward to trying something new on their menu the next time I visit!

This is the only Greek restaurant I will ever go to. I have been going her forever now and the people are so nice. The customer service is amazing and they remember people. The food is amazing and i've never had a bad experience. Always delicious and I would recommend to everyone.

Can't wait to try more from their menu!  I needed appetizers for a gathering after work.  I ordered the Four Dip Combo:  Tzaziki; Hummus; Lebni; and Melizanosalata.  The Melizanosalata with roasted eggplant, garlic, olive oil, and lemon juice was my favorite! But all four were super delicious!  It came with warm, yummy pita bread.  They were a big hit!  Just because I can't pass up on dessert, I also got the baklava.  OMG - it was perfect, not too sweet, just perfection!  I arrived right around 5 pm, just before a huge rush!  :-)  Will be back for a full meal!

Very good.   Ate there today and had the gyro plate and greek salad.   The Rice Pilaf as a side item was excellent and the gyro was tender and moist and the sauce was excellent.     Place definitely gets a thumbs up from me.   Clean, inviting, and very friendly staff.
We have eaten here several times and never been disappointed!! The food is awesome and the place is clean. Highly Recommend place

I am giving this place a 1 star because of the customer service . As soon as we walked in the door at 8:50 we were told .. ohh we close at 9 by the way . Not a hello, welcome nothing . So basically she told us we couldn't stay and eat that we had to take it to go . It was so uncomfortable that the couple next to us was sitting down eating and they got up and left and the lady cleaning the table said oh you can stay and they still got up and left . About 5 min later a group of 8 people walked in and they told them the same thing I can take your order but you can't stay . I will never be back because of the horrible service .

The place is clean, nicely decorated and the staff is super friendly and not to mention good looking  ahaha  The food is delicious, and flavorful!  I've gotten the chicken gyro and the chicken and rice soup. The veggies were all fresh and the only minor thing was that the chicken was a tad bit on the dry side.

Pita bread was super toasty, the Greek yogurt dipping white sauce was creamy, the chicken didn't have any burnt tips at all, salad was delish, and the rice pilaf was kick ass!  Good shit y'all! Keep up the good service, too!  Opah!!!!!!!!! Yours truly, Onasis

This is hands down, one of the best Greek restaurants I have ever been to! I lived in Europe and have been trying to find a restaurant in the states that has the authentic taste I miss... Not to mention, the friendly people that work there, the filling portions, cleanliness and good variety of options on the menu!   If you don't live in Henderson but are in the Las Vegas area, or even just visiting, this is worth the drive!
My forth time here and everything is super good...I am transported  to Greece everytime!

The customer service was very friendly and the atmosphere was nice, but there are only a few low tables in the center of the restaurant with hightops along the sides of the restaurant.  The beef platter was very good, with tender meat along with a choice of rice or french fries.  I was in the mood for rice, as it goes well with the accompanying Greek salad.  You also get some soft pita bread and a little side of tzatziki.  I will definitely be back for more!

Everything u can ask of for a Greek place! Great fresh made pita, feta fries were new for me(I think there was also some mozzarella on them too), decently quick enough, moderately priced! Minus 1 star cause my fried were not as crispy as I would've liked.
Food was really good. The service was also amazing.  She was very aware of us having 3 kids and helped.  Gyro meat was awesome and hummus tasted fresh
Best Greek food I've had out here in Vegas! The staff that work there are very nice and my food came out fresh and hot!

EXCELLENT and DELICIOUS FOOD, a FRIENDLY and INVITING STAFF, and IMMACULATE RESTROOMS!     This Greek bistro in Henderson is a winner on so many levels.  I'm fairly picky about Greek food and haven't been too satisfied with the choices of Greek-themed restaurants in Las Vegas, but The Great Greek in Henderson has won me over.  I ordered the Gyro plate, which was stuffed with ample meat and other fresh ingredients.  One another occasion I also tried the Avgolemono Soup (a traditional Greek chicken and lemon soup).  When I first tried this soup some 25 years ago, I fell in love with it.  I could tell that The Great Greek prepares this soup daily, as you can see and taste the fresh dill, roasted chicken and pasta in every spoonful.  I also highly recommend the Dolmades (stuffed grape leaves with rice and fresh herbs).  Squeeze a little fresh lemon on them for a tasty treat.  The Spanakopita is also delicious, made with spinach and feta cheese inside a light and flaky puff pastry.  What I like most about The Great Greek is the staff.  They remembered me each time I visited, they knew what I wanted and prepared my meals quickly, and they engaged in a friendly banter that made me feel right at home.    The Great Greek's menu is designed for customers to return again and again to try new dishes.  I've been there three times in one week!    Finally, dining at The Great Greek won't break your bank, unlike many other Greek-themed restaurants.  Just about every meal can be purchased for under $10.  Now THAT'S a bargain!    OPA!

Looking for a delicious place to eat while out of town, I stumbled upon this restaurant. It had great reviews and the photos looked delicious, so I had to give it a shot. Let's just say, I was not disappointed! Not only was the service great and very friendly, but the food lived up to the expectations.  The food was definitely authentic but it was also very fresh. Mediterranean food can lean towards the heavy side, what with all the gyro, tzatziki, and rice, but even with those delicious ingredients it did not weigh me down. I got a Gyro wrap that had fresh lettuce, tomato, tzatziki, and feta, as well as a bowl of rice on the side. My fiance got a "Rice bowl" which is essentially a large salad with a scoop of rice dolloped in the middle, topped with cucumber, tzatziki, tomato, meat and feta. We were both really impressed!   The service was on point; though there were few tables in the restaurant and it wasn't a sit-down restaurant, the staff was very knowledgeable regarding who was sitting where and which group of people got the next table. As someone who has dealt with trying to find an open table in a busy restaurant, this was very refreshing to see! Seriously, the staff was great.   I would definitely go back if I find myself in Henderson again!
Best Greek food in town.  Everytime we come here the food is great.  We started with a side of Melizanosalata.  It was nice and creamy.  Great gyro plates

If you're in Henderson, and want Mediterranean/Greek food, this is the place. Their chicken kabob is grilled to order, and is always fresh. The salads are huge, crisp, fresh, and their greek dressing is fantastic. I do enjoy a gyro on occasion, and the quality of gyro meat is very good, and tasty. Tzatziki is made in house, along with the hummus, and baba ganoush (which they call a different name) all delicious. They sometimes have a lambchop special which is fantastic. Plan ahead during peak hours, because it does get busy. Definitely worth the wait. Nona, at the counter, is the greatest too! She keeps things moving swiftly, and efficiently, and has never gotten my order wrong.
My falafel rice bowl had no rice, no dressing, no tomato, no garbanzo beans.  I came in today around 2:30 for a takeout order and didn't realize until I was at work and could not return.  :(
This is the best Greek food I've had. The quality of food is great! The amount of food they serve you is great! The employees are friendly!
This place is amazing! I love their rice bowls, and their damaldes and baklava are the best I've ever had! If you're looking for a great meal for a really reasonable price this is the place to go!
This place is so stupid good it doesn't make any doggone sense. Like, seriously... Yes, it's the bomb!

As much as I love the atmosphere here at the Great Greek, there are no seats available tonight. Which I'm totally okay with, because the friendly smiles, the delicious authentic dishes make take out just as good as dining in! My wife and I love this place, from their traditional dishes like Souvlaki (chicken or steak), the gyros, or their modern options like feta fries, and the Athenian burger. The variety of delicious Greek food is worth the sometimes long lines out the door.  Come hungry, leave full and satisfied. And if you have any room left after a helping of their generous size dishes, the baklava and the baklava ice cream is phenomenal! The Great Greek always does everything right! I wish them continuing success, and I can't wait to done with them again!
Living in the southwest, it's really hard to find a good greek gyro place. I'm from Chicago and the gyro here reminded me of back home. Friendly staff and great customer service.

This is as good as it gets. My husband and I have loved this place since we first arrived in Las Vegas two years ago. I would drive across town for this restaurant, but lucky for me it's around the corner from home. They are awesome in food and service.  We've had a variety of items from the menu and everything is very tasty. My favorite pick is the steak souvlaki plate. There is more than enough food with this dish. It comes with two skewers of tasty steak, a salad, pita, and the choice of rice or fries. I typically choose feta fries because they are crazy delicious. My husband is a fan of the gyro. Another one of my favorites is the pasticcio. You can't really go wrong with their food since everything I've had has been delicious.

The Great Greek is next to a deli place. It's a bit smaller and kinda hidden/easy to miss, and the parking lot isn't super big.  I really like the Greek salad wrap with gyro. I love that they load it with a nice serving of gyro as well as a good serving of fresh vegetables.. gotta get my vitamins and proteins in somehow! I also like the spanikopita and baklava. How can you say no to baklava? :)  Service is prompt and courteous. The food comes out in a timely manner, depending on what you order.

The best Greek food in town!  We always get the gyros with  feta fries and a spanikopita...so yummy!  We will have to try some of their other items that look delicious.   Super friendly staff and it's always so clean.

I have been going to this place for a few years now and it is a consistent and always a 5 star experience. It is setup as a fast food place but the quality of the dishes is of a home made meal. I have had every single item on the menu... Yup every item. My favorite is the beef shish kebob. It is hard to get good lamb in the US so naturally the beef one is better. If you like feta cheese I recommend upgrading your side of fries to feta fries. The place gets busy around lunch time so do not expect to get there and be out in 5min. Good food takes time and the key is having everything made upon order and not a month prior... One overlooked item is Yia yia's Pastitsio and it is amazing!!!
My favorite Greek restaurant in Vegas. Great service and great food! Never had a bad meal here.
Great place to dine for lunch or dinner. Our meals were made fresh, using fresh vegetables, well seasoned meats and fresh pita. Overall, we had a delicious dinner and look forward to coming back.

Went for dinner. I ordered take out ahead as I  wasn't sure if it was fast casual or more sit down. It is fast casual, order at counter and they bring to the table. Food was ready b4 I got there so quick. We got 2 gyros. One with lamb and one with the gyro beef/lamb meat. The lamb was very good; tender and juicy and seasoned well absolutely perfect.  The gyro meat on the other also tasted good. We also got the 4 dip app. It is huge, 3 types of hummus and a yogurt dipping sauce. Lots of pita bread. Also get the feta fries,  delish.

I came late to the party because I didn't know Gyros could be this good!! I was so used to going to that other Gyro place on Eastern, but now I realized I settled for mediocre food there. Well Thank you Great Greek and my Yelpers for opening my eyes to what a Gyro should be. The presentation was wrapped in a pretty and neat package. Tender seasoned meat sliced perfect, with a tzatziki sauce that actually has taste (I always thought tzatziki was a bland yogurt sauce) and the freshest feta cheese, lettuce & tomato. Nice touch with the pepperocini on top to add a little zing. Bite then drizzle juice on the gyro. The bread was soft and allowed the gyro meat to shine without getting in the way. The perfect vessle to hold this delicious creation. OPA!! I can't wait to come back!

Amazing food! I've had Greek food from coast to coast, this was one of the top two places I've eaten. My hubby even told me as we were leaving that this would be our new spot. I'm glad there was a lot of food so I have leftovers for breakfast.
So happy to have a new restaurant in the area that isn't fast food. The chicken gyros here are amazing. Nicely seasoned and juicy.

To me this is the best place for Greek food in Vegas. I travel from Summerlin to get food here. It is a little pricey but worth the money and the portions are reasonable. I just wish they were open on Sundays.

This place is great! Had the garlic shrimp, comes with choice of feta fries or rice pilaf. Comes with a Greek salad, pita and tzatziki.  Very fresh and taste great! I highly recommend this place. Looking forward to trying other things on their menu.

The name says it all.  It was great!  We each had chicken gyros with rice and fries.  Great!  We also ordered the rice pudding! Great!  Ordered a cup of coffee...Great!  Really hit the spot.  Family owned. Great!
I have eaten a lot of Greek food in my life, but this place stands out. The Spanakopita was amazing. The Gyro was amazing! And the Baklava was on another level amazing!

My wife took me there for the first time and told me they have the best Gyros, she was right, I absolutely loved them. We had two older gentlemen almost going to fist fight over our table while we were eating . They were arguing over a table, That shows how good it is when you're fighting to get seated. My only complaint is that I don't have one closer to me in the Southwest, but the drive is definitely worth it.

Just had the Great Greek cater our get together. They delivered on time. Ordered a half tray of chicken Giro kit and a half tray beef/lamb Giro kit, a half tray rice pilaf and a half tray greek sald. It was so much food, enough to feed at least 25 people. We only had 10, but I have The Great greek for the rest of the week and we're not complaining. Everything was perfect, just like eating at the restaurant. We will definitely be ordering again and again, just a bit less since it was so much food. The prices are very reasonable. I recomend them catering any event you're having.
I couldn't even eat the food, the sewage smell was so bad I gagged!!! I mean how can you not smell it while sitting in here eating

I don't hand out 5 stars lightly, but this place earns it. My wife and I just returned from Greece and were craving authentic Greek food. This is the place to go. It's the same stuff you get over there. Prices are fair, portions are generous, staff is friendly and efficient. It's a very casual place, but nice and clean and has a nice outdoor eating area. We got gyros. I've had their kebab before and my wife loves their greek salad. We got a small appetizer -- tzatziki -- their pita is great. There was a decent sized line (no surprise since it's so good), but we didn't wait long. We'll be back very soon. In fact, I almost ordered a second gyro just because it was so good!

I came around 2:00 pm on a Saturday and the place was packed! Staff members were absolutely wonderful! Fast service, friendly, gave recommendations on the food, asked if I would like a water cup while waiting, and was busing tables the soon as one opened up. Excellent food, staff, and atmosphere! Great little gem in the Henderson area.
The food, beverage and customer service is awesome.   If you are in the Henderson NV area, don't hesitate to stop by here to try some greek food.  I recommend it.

I have eaten a gyro wrapped in tin foil off the coast of athens, and I'm telling you, one bite out of my plate here in Henderson, I was taken back in time.   This place is not only delicious, and authentic but its reasonably priced.   The lady who owns the place is super friendly, everytime me and my wife go in, she remembers us and preps some hummus and pita for us.   I love this place.
Outstanding quality of food at a very reasonable price. Everything we tried was excellent. Very quick and courteous service. I highly recommend this place.

I love the food here. However, the growing popularity makes your service lack. You can see the bustle on the faces of both front line staff and cooks. A bit of suggestion to maintain the flow. If you know your kitchen is behind why not slow it down by just having one person ring in transactions on one register. The rest can do what they were doing which is one busing and the other running food. The guy at the register should not bounce back and forth between the two registers, you made the wait time horrendous. Especially since people who walked in 5 minutes behind me got their transaction and food before me. I truly hope you guys sort out a game plan on how to handle the business before the food becomes sub-par cause of lack of attention to quality and poor customer service.

Just a wonderfully family oriented staff that is so friendly and make the most amazing Greek food. I love coming here! The Greek salads are to die for! Even the small size comes with pita and a side of yogurt!
Fabulous gyro! My wife is raving about the soup. We'll be back.
Best Greek food in Henderson. Consistently great!! Parking tight but worth all the struggles.

Love this place! We order out from here about once a month. The fries and chicken gyro are my go-to and my husband loves the steak souvlaki. The service is always good even when they are completely slammed with customers. Get the greek yogurt for dessert!
We've had take out from here numerous times and never been disappointed. It's our go to place for good Greek food when we're back in town visiting relatives and friends.

I guess I'm just not into Greek food but while others in my group ordered Greek (and didn't much care for it) I had the cheeseburger.  Note here: Don't go to a Greek restaurant and order American food... I had absolutely no flavor at all.

I guess GREAT sounds better than FAIR Greek Grill, but that's what it is, fair compared to the Greek in Houston, Chicago, Denver, etc.  The Gyros were flavorful but dry and some pieces slightly crunchy.  The salad wasn't very Greek: a sprinkle of Feta and 2 kalamata olives drenched in a way-too-oily dressing? Come on.  The tzatziki only tasted of yogurt, no other flavors, so thank goodness they had Sriracha.  Fries were standard.  The pita was good.  I didn't get Baklava because it wasn't shiny as all other Baklava I've eaten has been.  The woman at the counter seemed bothered by me despite my 20% tip paying at the counter.  She didn't even give me a water cup.  She just wanted to chat with a couple of regulars.  If you don't know Greek, it'll be bomb.  If you do...this place will disappoint.

Yesterday around 6:30 we ordered dinner for 4 people through Eat24. While ordering we weren't to clear about some of the items on the menu. No big deal. We just decided to call to get clarification. We called three separate times: 1st time: we just wanted to know about their combos. When the call was answered we were asked if we cold be placed in hold. The wait time wasn't long at all but the woman at the other end of the phone was EXTREMELY rude and hung up on us before we could ask all of our questions. We only had two....   2nd time: same thing.  3rd time: our order arrived between 45-60 min after we pressed, which was expected but our order was incorrect. When we called back the same woman from the first two called answered and continued to be very rude. And again hung up.We just wanted to let them know that what we presented was not prepared how we ordered it.    All though our order was incorrect, it was very good. There's no question that they have good food. The reason for two stars is because of the customer service we received. I'm not usually one to leave reviews. But I think they may need to look at how they treat customers who call their establishment. That experience alone is enough to not make me want to order there again regardless of how good the food is. Customer service is key!!

We wanted to take my parents somewhere different.  We had the four dip appetizer which everyone really liked.  The pita bread was outstanding.  Our party had the shrimp fettucine, the falafel salad, and the lamb souvlaki.  Everything was flavored well and cooked well.  My parents said they would come here again!
I have eaten here twice and the food is sooooo delicious!!!  I highly recommend that anyone looking for quiality Greek food should take a trip down to The Great Greek on Warm Springs.  Opa!!!!!
Delicious fresh food, friendly service and nice indoor and outdoor seating. The lamb/beef gyro is huge and perfectly seasoned. The feta fries are simply delicious. Perfect lunch spot.

Dropped by for another gyro.  The wife had the shrimp platter.  The fries were kind of gross tasting tonight.  I think the gyro would taste better if the meat and pita were grilled up a bit.  I want a slight char to my meat and the pita is a bit doughy.  The shrimp were a tad undercooked.  They were slammed, so I chalk it up to being too busy.
Food was wonderful we had the great Greek gyro and great Greek salad and the rice pudding was perfect. Will definitely be coming back.
Excellent Greek food, authentic and staff was very nice! Traveling thru, right off expressway to/from Vegas in Henderson. Definitely will be back when in area!
Just ate here and we are leaving so happy!! Everything we ate was so great and the service was excellent as well!

So let me start off by saying that I used to manage a small family owned Greek restaurant back in Florida, and in my opinion, we had the best gyros I've ever had. Coming from a large Greek family, I've tried a lot of different gyros. But today, having eaten at the great Greek for the first time, I have found my new favorite Greek restaurant. It's a small, family owned place with beyond amazing customer service, perfect atmosphere, and some of the best Greek food I've ever tried.  I've also never taken the time to actually sit down a write a review of a place for Yelp, but this restaurant was so good, I wanted to be able to share my thoughts. If you're looking for a place to eat, please go here!
This place was average. The kabob was good, the rice was ok, the hummas was ok. It wasn't my favorite in town, but if you're looking for something close by, for an ok price this place will do.

So thrilled a Greek place opened nearby. The food is fresh, no frills, and delicious.   This is my second time in and it's still very good. I love consistency! The service was also faster this time (came on a Sunday holiday weekend evening).   Also checked out the bathroom this visit and it's clean.   Love this place!
The best! Staff are so nice and friendly, food is excellent! Would always go for great greek!

This place is great. The food is always fresh.  Sorry I ate everything and forgot to take pictures.  The staff is friendly.  And they are efficient and fast.  The fresh hummus is super yummy.  My favorite dish is the garlic shrimp plate! So yummy! I highly recommend this place. The price is right!!

This place is definitely worth the hype. It is up to par with yassous. The lamb is great, the tzatziki was amazing, the fries were BOMB, and the gyros are one of my favorite. This is a place that I would absolutely go out of my way for.
EXCELLENT IN EVERY WAY!!! We've tried several different dishes, every one was great. Service is friendly and fast. You can't miss here!!!

Just as awesome as the original location in Henderson, The Great Greek is a solid addition to this side of town. I ordered at the counter and the food was brought out to my table in less than 5 minutes. I'm a fan of the fast casual restaurant format, especially for this type of menu. Much faster than a sit-down casual format.   I ordered the Great Greek Gyro and made it a combo, adding a drink and rice pilaf. My gyro was filled to the brim with meat and was happily stuffed at the end of my meal. Since it's so close to home, this will be my go-to Greek restaurant going forward.

We are visiting from out of town and stumbled upon this place.  The staff is amazing as well as the food!   We had the humus,  geek salad wrap, feta fries and baklava.   They were all out of this world! We are in town 1 more day and are considering coming back. It is a little pricey but well with EVERY dollar.

Tonight was my first time at the Great Greek!  All I can say is WOW!!!  I was immediately impressed with how clean and sleek the restaurant looked.  You know when a restaurant goes through the effort of putting fresh flowers on the table, that they care about freshness.  Now onto the food, absolutely unbelievable!  We had hummus as an appetizer, then both my husband and I order traditional gyro's where he had rice pilaf and I had feta fries.   This food was spot on and the pita was so fresh you could tell it was right out of the oven.   And the lamb was incredible! The staff was quick and friendly,  I loved everything about it.   I will be back!  My new go to for Greek food!   Love love love!
One of my favorite Greek spots to go! Food is always Delicious and great service is provided weather donning in picking up or delivered.

BS +++  Holy Greek.  I am very fond of good grilled food.  As soon as I saw this place I was curious.  I've been eating lots of fried foods and I want to see what the buzz was all about.  Holy yum. Me and my wife had the salmon salad, grape leaf wraps, and I got the chicken gyro.  The portions was just right and the meat was cooked to perfection.  The prices here are super good and the wait staff was friendly.  If you're a vegetarian or a omnivore like myself this place has all the right choices.  I'm a foodie from NYC and trust me this is authentic Greek food.     * Boomsauce scale. BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage). Not recommended. BS = it's just O.K. (experience) BS+ = Yo! I like this place. BS++= That's Whoa! This place good. BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE!

This restaurant gets one star for seating options food is exceptional but every time you go there there's nowhere to sit the owner needs to do something to increase his seating capacity you order your food get your food and there will be no where to sit and you have no option other than take it to go home and then it's cold

Two stars for their bomb ass sauce! But oh man! What to start with...  The girl that was helping us out was really nice and knowledgeable with the menu. My main complain is the bowl itself. For almost $12, you get a SMALL skewer of DRY chicken, rice & the cucumber and veggies. So basically, the whole bowl is 80% rice 15% veggies and 5% meat. The chicken was very dry and was hard to eat. Although once the sauce has been added, it's good. Overall, wouldn't go back to this place. Too pricey for the quality of food

The restaurant was very busy on the Saturday evening, but a table opened up just as we approached the counter to place our orders.  My wife and I each each chose the Great Greek gyro - lamb and beef gyro meat wrapped in pita bread along with lettuce, tomato, tzazki and feta. At a nominal additional cost, these were upgraded to a platter that included a small Greek salad and soda.  We were more than happy with our dining chose this evening.

After our long flight to Las Vegas, we are not usually interested in large sit down meal, so once again we settled on dining at this fast casual restaurant.  This time we ordered their eponymous gyro (beef+lamb, lettuce, red onion, feta and tzatziki) and requested extra tzatziki sauce which involved a nominal up charge and not really necessary.  The gyros were delicious and very filling though we left nary a slice of lettuce on our plates.

I've had this place bookmarked for a long time, but what finally pushed me to go now was a recommendation for their Avgolemono soup. Greek is one of my favorite cuisines since I grew up with gyros, tzatziki, baklava, etc and it can be tough to please (though I don't consider myself an authority on the matter). Either way, I really enjoyed The Great Greek and I just wish it weren't so far away!  I started with Avgolemono ($3.50), a traditional Greek soup made with simple ingredients - chicken broth, egg, lemon, and rice. I had to try The Great Greek Gyros ($7.95): beef & lamb (the other choice is chicken), lettuce, tomato, red onion, feta cheese, and tzatziki all stuffed into a folded fluffy pita. I also ordered a side of Feta Fries ($3).  Side note: You can add Feta Fries and a fountain drink to your sandwich for $3.45. All other combinations (regular fries, rice pilaf, Avgolemono, or Greek salad) plus the fountain drink is just $2.95. I'm not sure how much a drink costs separately, but this is still a great deal!  Gyro is actually the traditional preparation of meat on the iconic vertical spit, but we associate the name with sandwiches since it is typically served as that. Although not the traditional choice of meat in Greece (it's pork), there is a 50-50 combination of beef and lamb that we have come to love in America (also dubbed gyro meat). At least I love it. It's so good. I don't even care that it doesn't resemble either animal or that it falls apart easily. It's delicious. Good Beef & Lamb: Roasted appropriately with a bit of juice, some crust doesn't hurt (yum), and cut about a centimeter thick.   Although their gyro meat didn't have a crust, it was still delicious. I loved the fresh tomato, onion, lettuce, feta, and refreshing tzatziki. The pita was nice as well. The soup was tasty and they generously served a whole pita with it (cut into four slices). The Feta Fries were good, but not amazing. Either way, fabulous meal and good prices! I will definitely try some of their other Greek specialties next time.

I can't believe some of the sub par ratings here. Service was amazing! I just ordered take out but they gave me water while I waited and extra to-go supplies so I could bring some for lunch tomorrow. Food was super good. This is fast casual people! I'd say it's like Pei Wei for Mediterranean.

Excellent food. I took a group of friends (14) there this past week. All agreed the food was hot and delicious. There are large portions. This is a walk up but you are served almost immediately at your table and the food is hot, cooked to order. I have to keep saying that it's hot because so many fast food locations give you "almost" warm food.  My lamb was cooked perfectly. Others said the beef was excellent. Gyros were huge! The salads were fresh and the employees were friendly and helpful.

This is the one of the best Greek foods in Nevada. All my Greek friends go there and love it. You NEED to try this place. Our favorite is chicken souvlaki with rice pilaf, feta fries and their tzatziki sauce
Its places like these that make Henderson a great town for families! The people, food, music, and atmosphere........OPA!!!
This place is the best. Everything is very fresh and good. Even the vegetables that come on the side are good, and I seriously dislike vegetables.

This place is "off the hook"!!!  The food is very fresh, with large portions.  I had the Mediterranean Salad and added gyro meat. It came tossed with a Mediterranean vinaigrette dressing, the standard veggies, a generous portion of feta cheese, and a side of delicious tzatziki sauce with a full serving of pita bread cut into quarters.  The salad was perfect.  If I could say anything constructive; I wish it came with kalamata olives.  I paid about $14.00 with a drink, which is about the going rate these days.I saw the Gyros coming out of the kitchen and they were huge!!  If you are coming during the lunch rush, plan on sitting out on the patio in the hot Las Vegas heat or just order "togo" or "pick-up" via their website.(www.thegreatgrill.com) This place is busy; which is a good sign for the freshest ingredients but not so good for seating. Inside the restaurant, they have four 4 tables that seat four and 4 tables that seat two which means the inside seating capacity is only 24. The patio has 4 tables which seat four each. Rents are high these days not to mention the common area maintenance fee that they have to pay, so I totally understand the small restaurant foot print.  The staff is super friendly, efficient and the restaurant is super clean .  I highly recommend this place. You will not be disappointing.

The first time I had this 2 years ago And it was great I had it last week and ordered the same thing, and it was disappointing.  I was just sitting here with some coworkers in my office and we were just talking about this place Mixed reviews I guess it depends what you order and when.

What I mean this side of town in Henderson I absolutely have to stop by the great Greek phenomenal food great service very fresh very clean and great desserts a nice little Beer and well. I thoroughly love the traditional plates a lot of food great fast service I got the rice pudding which is outstanding Tzatziki is lively. I ordered the combination plate of grilled marinated shrimp and the chicken Slovakia which was outstanding and very filling. This is a must if you're in the mood for some great Mediterranean or just a great lunch.

I really don't know why I see so many 5 star reviews, where are people's taste buds? I think its because it's the most decent "Greek" you can find in Henderson. I got suckered into the hype but I have had way better.   I called in an order for pick-up. The guy put me on hold but I hung up after hearing him chat the whole time with another customer about irrelevant stuff. Second time I called the guy took my order and I liked how fast he turned around my order, said it would be ready in 15 minutes.   The restaurant is a bit small but it's really cute. It has an outdoor seating area with shades and a water fountain. The inside looks very clean and organized. I ordered two gyro sandwiches and a combo which comes drink and fries. The guy that took my order was a lot nicer in person and very cute I must say. When I got home I chowed down and it was satisfying but not out of this world. The amount of meat was good, how gyros should be, but it was not that marinated it was bland. The tzatziki sauce did not taste much like cucumber or the fresh dill it's described as but it had a lot of feta which made it taste better. The fries were ok.  I want to give the greek bowl a chance. Place is convenient for Hendersonians but I rather drive and use my gas tank to Las Vegas and go to The Fat Greek on the corner of Flamingo and Decatur. My review is from 2011, check it out but my thoughts have not changed. Maybe I held my standards high for this place in comparison but I'll update this review if my mind changes.

This place is a great find. Counter service always seems busy, but it's worth standing in line. Hummus was tasty, but the "Great Greek" gyro stole the show. If you're not watching your waistline, get the Feta Fries as your side.

It is wasn't for the staff I would give it more stars. I was very disappointed by the way we were treated after patiently waiting for our order. It's been about a month (6/14/17) but I cannot get out of my mind how rude the guy at the counter was, and his excuse for reacting the way he did was "I've been here working for over 12hrs". I wish I had taken his name, but at that point I just wanted to get out of there. I was really looking forward to this place but unfortunately that one person ruined the whole experience.  The restaurant needs more tables and maybe add a drive thru.  The Greek salad was my favorite item on the menu.

Today is Saturday and I hadn't eaten with the old folks for 4 weeks now. So I grabbed the better half, cranked the old beater car up with my cranker, shouted "contact", and off we went to take them out to dinner. I have been wanting to try these 2 Greek places out near Galleria Mall, since, well since the last time we went to eat. With a name like the Great Greek, it's got to be great, right?  It was very good. I don't think it was great. (It's The Good Greek to me.)The place is busy and fast paced. The kind of place where they are so busy that they might tell you to get the heck out and don't let the door hit your rear end on the way out, if you disagree, type of place. IF they were that type of establishment.  But the place is very cheery and inviting. We arrived at 6 so there was a line of 2-4 ppl. I didn't know what to expect when I walked in. So I heed and hawed until I figured out the arrangement. Yup, you order, they give you the numba and you sit down for them to bring the order out. I don't eat Greek too often. Ok, why lie?I don't eat it barely. So I stepped aside and stared at the menu on the wall. Since I couldn't make up my mind, I took a paper menu and stared at that some more, thinking something would jump at me.  The prices range from $2.95 for the feta fries to $12.49 for a entree dish. We ordered 3 dishes, feta fries (because all the good ppl of Yelp said they were to die for...a little more on that in a bit), and baklava for dessert. The girl taking the order is more than happy to teach you how to say these alien sounding words on the menu.  The tables have a nice touch with a flower in it. The place is bright and welcoming. The food came in about 10-15 min. I went to wash my hands in their uber clean restroom and hallway since I was anticipating eating my fries with my hands and not with a knife and fork as they do in England I am told (as that is how 007 would eat, being all debonair and a spy I suppose).  I munched on a fry and then I munched on another. It's crisp and fried hard but tasty. Not so hard that it will crack a tooth mind you but sufficiently more fried and nice and brown then McDonalds (my fries barometer). All I have to say is those people who die for the feta fries, they must not have much to live for. Because heil no I wouldn't die for this fries. They melted some feta cheese on the fries? Forgive me if I contain my exuberance. But I might shout more if I was in a shampoo commercial like Julia Louis Dreyfuss did years ago. The fries reminded me of In N Out chili fries. Does slapping a American Single on top of their fries denote chili fries?  Yeah, like that kind of to die for if you ask me. The fries is better enjoyed left alone without the accoutrement if you ask me. But then again, what do I know about Greeks besides their IMF downgrades and EU bailouts? I think I vaguely remember that they are famous for catering bathrobe parties in college fraternity houses.  We ordered the pasticcio, mezze plate, grilled steak souvlaki, and gyro plate. The steak was perfectly cooked medium rare and was tasty. The mezze plate composed of hummus, dolmades, falafel, tzaziki, and spanakopita (I have no idea what these things are, they sound very cute though).  The falafel was small and it didn't remind me of falafel. It was ok. Is it supposed to be that small and dry? I honestly didn't know which was the falafel but my better half pointed it out to me. I just eat. It was the size of a giant Walnut. The hummus was ok. The plate came with yogurt, Greek "yoghurt" that is. I think it had olive oil in it as it was green. (That or my yogurt was crying green.) Greek yogurt is so special that they included a H in it. The rice that came with the steak was tasty. It was more yellow than I was so I assume it must've had butter all over it? A salad came with 3 of the entrees. It was good, it had feta cheese in it? Really Mediterranean olives that were tart enough to make Stevie Wonder see for a second. It was a nice small salad. The pastry looking baked things were nice and flaky. The pasticcio was a lasagna it turns out. Basically cheese on top and macaroni on the bottom that's been impregnated with meat all swimming in a nice tomato sauce. It was good.  By 7pm there was a line that stretched from the counter to the door. Now this isn't Katz's Deli kind of snaked line but it was long, then again there's only maybe 6 small tables inside. If they sold pizza, I'd have to go outside to eat a Large pizza.  The girls were nice and friendly and brought out the food fast and cleaned up just as fast. They cleared the table for us before bringing out the baklava dessert that was drizzled in honey. Yes, it was sugar on sugar on honey. If it was any sweeter, Shirley Temple would've been a penniless Vaudeville player (I am a history buff). So if you are in the hood, want friendly and fast service with a small neighborhood feel restaurant, stop in and see The Good Greek. (Yes, I said good not great.

200+ Yelpers certainly have the right idea about this place.  After spending the day hiking in the Grand Canyon, everything about this place hit the spot.  My party ordered a few different wraps, a rice bowl, a couple salads, and a rice plate.  The base ingredients had flavor beyond what you'd get from your grocery store produce, and that flavor was enhanced by the best yogurt sauce I have had in all my trips to Greek restaurants.  For my own dish, the gyro woke up your taste buds when it hit your tongue.  In short, the Great Greek has a commitment to both price and flavor, something that's not nearly as commonplace as it used to be.

An unassuming, spartan dining area in a fast food type setup, but oh boy, is the food good. We went with another couple and each ordered something different. It was all delightful. The gyros, the lamb kabobs, the Greek chicken, and the salad was amazing. The staff is friendly and upbeat too. Good Greek food is hard to find in the valley, but this place is one of the best.

Not sure why this place is currently 3.5 stars! This is my new go-to fresh restaurant. The first time I came I loved their juicy gyro plate and today I had a large Greek salad with the falafel and a side of hummus. The presentation of the plates makes your mouth water before you even start! Everything looks fresh. The falafel are better than Crazy Pita and the salad was crispy and not overly dressed. Any time I want a fresh, healthy meal and I don't want to cook, I'm coming here. Oh, and my dining companion pointed out the plates and silverware are all machine washable, so they are helping the environment, too!

Good food but too many times we have missing items from our order! So frustrating! So we either have to go without sauces or humus ect... or go back at a later time for refund. What a hassle! A small family owned business should have better QC than this! Honestly we've just stop ordering from here.

I came here with my friends who lived in Vegas.  They suggested Greek and this was the place to GO!!!.  They are busy but you dont have to wait super long to get your food.  We ordered the traditional gyro and it was THE BOMB.  The sauces they use are super tasteful and they are super HOT (hot service).  The hummus and pita are on point, fresh, warm, and fulfilling on a cold night.  Overall, If I were in Vegas again or ever lived in Vegas, this would be my regular Friday night spot.

I personally didn't think the food was as great as people said so on the reviews.
