Mediocre to me i give the gyro a 5/10 to be honest maybe it was a busy day an they couldn't put to much attention on it who knows. The feta fries were good just wish the cheese wasn't melted to the point where it was dry. The tiziki sauce was fair the red sauce they hard was rather good I enjoyed that. The shrimp skewers I had were fair. Like I said. Nothing special who knows if I'll be going back. Best place for gyros is Greek bistro in Henderson by sunset station I'll continue to go back there.  If you see me at the great Greek it's because my wife dragged me...

This was the worst experience all around. Waited an hour for 2 small crappy salads with under cooked poor quality chicken. I must be glutton for punishment because although this is the last time I come in it's not the first time it's happened. Save yourself the hassle if your in the area and go to capriottis next door. I wish I could give negative stars but one will do.

I ate here for the first time yesterday, the food was AMAZING!!!  I could not believe how large the portions were for the price either.  I had to take half of my lunch in a to-go box.  The staff was extremely nice as well.

This place has great food with generous portions! I got the beef/lamb gyros wrap to go. When I got home I opened it up and was really glad that I was super hungry because it was a pretty stuffed wrap.  The meat is tender, juicy and flavorful without being too salty or greasy. The feta cheese and tzatziki sauce added a nice dimension.  My only complaint that isn't really a complaint because it's also kind of a good thing is that it's messy. With the feta and tzatziki loaded on top, and the wrap stuffed full makes it a good messy. Especially when it gets to the part where its wrapped, use caution when unwrapping to be able to continue enjoying it as a wrap and not a splat.
The Avgolemono Soup and Greak salad are amazing. I would highly recommend this place.
Great food and service! I'm in love with their chicken skewers :-p

Loved it. Very authentic! The girls were doing double and triple duty, serving as cashier, bussing tables, and serving food with a great attitude and a smile. The gyro was fabulous. Didn't skimp on the Tzatziki sauce like most. The salad wrap is actually on a grilled tortilla. (I missed that in the description). Though my fault, I was still disappointed. I love pita. Why would you choose a tortilla when you could eat a pita?? Still, food was great. Highly recommend it.
Great gyros and salad. Friendly staff. Only problem was tough to get a table at lunch!!

There is love in this food. Family owned, casual restaurant. Worth the 30-minute one-way drive from my house. If I could only eat one thing for the rest of my life, it would be their Greek salad with chicken. The olive oil dressing is perfect. Also love the perfectly cooked gyro meat, the tzatziki and the feta fries!

Within 30m of eating here, my stomach was turning! It is now the next day and I'm still not right. My stomach has been tied since!  It's now 24hrs later and I still can't be too far from a bathroom. I'll never eat here again. I had the traditional gyro and salad and the falafel appetizers.

I'm addicted to the lamb rice bowl. The food is great and people friendly. Being as clean and organized as it is says alot on its own. Employees always happy and manager keeps plates spinning like a pro. We are regulars for a reason.

Trying out a new Greek restaurant! We ordered a beef/lamb gyro and a lamb wrap. The gyro was pretty good but I wasn't really a fan on thw wrap. I thought it was ok. I wish they could have add more ingredient to the wrap though such as rice or some more lettuce. All I tasted on my wrap was alot of sauce and lamb.. overall, it was ok for me but my husband loves the gyro that he ordered. The area is very easy to find and the restaurant is pretty spacious. It's not like a togo place.

I am always on the hunt for great Mediterranean food....and great is what this place is! Upon walking in, there was a line and a few folks on the phone on hold, so I had a feeling we'd hit the jackpot. It's not super easy to find and is located next to a couple other restaurants, so I'm sure you have to serve something top notch to stay in business here.  I had their world famous rice bowl which had generous portions that left me feeling full and satisfied. Their rice isn't typical, and is cooked to form a very soft, tasty texture.  Whatever they're doing, it's delicious and worth a million bucks!   Joe C. had the gyro plate which came with a massive salad and a bunch of delicious feta fries. The friendly ladies and the made to order business model makes it my favorite Greek place in Henderson!
We had the gyro after a day of golfing and the feta fries with a shrimp plate and it was absolutely to die for.

This restaurant came highly recommended to me, and it is really is a great restaurant. This is our only salad restaurant we have found that is excellent. We have visited many times and always salads with chicken skewers.  I have recommended this restaurant to many friends who have also heard good things about it. Without doubt a second restaurant near Mountains Edge would be a gold mine.
This has to be one of my most favorite restaurants. Everyone about this place is great. The food was amazing I went with my family last night and everyone loved it. Best Gyro's in Las Vegas!

Wow...great food! The place was full and had a line of people waiting. I ordered the Great Greek Gyro with lamb and Feta fries. The lamb had great flavor and was not dry and the feta fries were great. Definitely will be back!
Good food, but very limited indoor seating, which was a must since it was winter, and yes, it does get cold in the desert at night!

FAVORITE!!! FAVORITE!!! FAVORITE...Greek place I have ever been to! I have tried many different Greek places to eat from Utah, Phoenix, California and Nevada. I can tell you with 100 percent honesty that this place has beat them all!   The staff here treats you like family and are always welcoming. The Chicken Gyro is so so good! The Feta Cheese that they put on it.. whewww heaven seriously! The side salad is amazing with the cucumber yogurt dressing.. Ohhh and I cannot forget to tell you how delicious their Feta fries are. You have to try those no joke!   I seriously could go on forever about how great this place is! If you are in the mood for some great and I cannot emphasize great enough.. then you need to check out The Great Greek!   On the plus side.. the owner is a Hottie.. just throwing that out there ladies! :)

Only 4 stars because they are a bit pricey. But other than that....let me tell you about the extreme measures I would go for just a drop of the lemon rice soup. It has such a fabulous taste! Get extra pita bread with it and make it a meal. Dip it until the last bit is gone. The hummus is pretty good, too.
Slow service and incredibly rude customer service too. Person was on their phone the whole time. Never coming back. Don't recommend. Wait time and ugly attitude isn't worth the food.
Very great food and the customer service is awesome best Greek food in Henderson for sure will come back soon.

Food - 4/5 Value - 5/5 Service - 4.5/5 Atmosphere/Decor - 2/5  Gyro Plate - Deliciously seasoned gyro meat over soft pita bread. Served with tzatiziki and rilce pilaf. Rice was a bit undercooked and underseasoned. Served with a salad with feta and unpitted kalamata olives. 4/5  Update: First visited 11/3/2017. Ordered from here 1/5/2018 and the rice was both cooked and seasoned perfectly. Updated to 5 stars

I absolutely love this place. Been going to this place for years when I lived by their Henderson location. Now that I moved closer to Blue diamond I was really excited to see that they decided to expand! The food is still consistent with the right flavor and portions. I love that this new location is larger. I usually order the chicken gyro with feta fries and my hubby gets the gyro plate which also comes with a salad. The prices are reasonable with the amount and quality of food you get. Great service that is always welcoming. I support these family businesses.

My least fave falafel in the valley.  They do not carry tahini...and the falafels were mushy. Which is still bettter than the raw ones Ive gotten at another falafel joint in town, so 3 stars for decent edible food.

I'd like to give this place 3.5 stars, but I guess I can round up.  It is a clean little restaurant in a strip mall, with a nice outdoor area complete with fountain. That said, I didn't expect world-class Greek and a wine list.  I ordered the Greek bowl with gyro meat, hubby ordered the gyro with side salad. Then, we sat down to wait.  After a brief wait, we got our order of dolmathes. They were skinny and soaked in oil and, frankly, not that good. But, I'm addicted to Mezze Foods' dolmas, so it would take a miracle to find any worth comparison.  We sipped iced tea and proceeded to wait for dinner.  And wait...  And wait...  And watch both parties that came after us get served...  And wait...  And, just as I heard my husband's stomach actually complain louder than he was whining, the food came.  Lots of it. Fresh and tasty. Absolutely no complaints about food quality - yummy. Plenty of feta and meat, nice crunchy greens, good dressing.  One thing I will say, particularly to those who complained of "too much" cheese on their food: No. Such. Thing. Weirdos. Loved that my salad was nice and cheesy, much like my hubby. :)   But, worth the wait? Meh.
The best place in our area for Greek cuisine we have found.  Very small though, so you may have to wait in line to order.

and I did come back! but to a different location this time, the brand new one- and it definitely lived up to it's name, it's great Greek:) the food was absolutely delicious and so fresh, even on a 120 degree day, service - fast and attentive, everyone seemed to be enjoying their meals, we for sure did! will gladly come back:)
I ordered a Chicken gyro and greek salad it was very good.  The lady behind the counter was so nice!

I visited this place during dinner time on a Saturday and there was a crowd! The good thing was that the service was quick and the food came promptly. They have inside and outside seating which is pretty nice when there's nice weather.   My husband ordered the great Greek gyro. He ordered it as a combo and it included a drink with a side. He picked the feta fries and they were good. He also said he really liked the gyro. It looked full of lamb and yummy!   I ordered a plate with rice, lamb and pita bread. The portion was big and there was food left on my plate when I finished eating. I thought the food was very flavorful and fresh.   We also ordered the dolmas as appetizers and they were pretty good! There were 6 pieces in our order which I think it was more than enough for two people. I do wish they offered a 4 piece for 2 people since we ended up not eating all of them.   I would definitely be back!

Great first experience here! Large portions, fast, delicious food, clean and bright atmosphere. The bows, gyro plate and chicken dish were all great. The baklava was just ok but we'll definitely return. Great addition to Blue Diamond.

Best Greek food in the Henderson area!! Small but well appointed eat in area, we normally do take out its very tasty and packed well. And even during busy weekend they said twenty minutes and it was ready on time!  The dolmades are amazing with the proper hint of mint. The gyros and feta fries are our favorite along with the chicken Greek bowl. Pricing is in line with the quality so not the cheapest but the best we have found. Hope they expand someday so we can try sit down service.
We had the Gyro, Feta Fries, Kabob, Hummus and Rice Bowl.   All were delish!   Portions were large, very filling.  My friend is Vegan and the staff were very helpful with guidance for her meal.

Falafel wrap is good.  Be warned:  portions are big, so come hungry.  The feta fries are ok.  The feta just doesn't melt well like other cheeses, so I was disappointed with the "upgrade."  The dolmathes (stuffed grape leaves) were not good.  Too oily.  Not enough rice.  They were on the thin sized.  Daphne's Greek Cafe's dolmathes are better.  Restaurant is small, so come early if you plan to eat inside.    Prices are reasonable and bathrooms are clean.

Okay, it's clear I love this place.  BUT, I recently, and I can't believe it's for the first time, got their baklava.  As expected, it's fantastic.  Perfectly moist and tasting of honey.  I don't usually get dessert here because the gyros are so huge, but of course we'll start to now.

I tried this place for the first time yesterday. It was so good I'm back today for lunch. The lamb gyro is amazing! The owner just came up to me with the sweetest greeting and smile asked me how I like it I told him I'm back today I like it so much. Super friendly vibe. Very clean. Nice staff. I see us visiting here quite often to get our Greek fix.

TBH pretty pricey for the amount of protein you get. For my steak bowl, it was $15 because the upcharge for steak. You only get ONE skewer of meat, which is very little. Your basically getting all salad and rice. I dont think I'll be coming back.
The Best of West! This is the place you go to to have nice Gyro , Kebob and salad! Friendly staff and clean organized place and delicious meals! ***** 5 Stars!

I went for lunch and the restaurant was exceptionally busy. I requested the gyros sandwich and a side Greek greens. Everything was extremely crisp, truly delectable, served rapidly and with an inviting state of mind.  I'll be going by again soon!

I gotta say I loved this place.  My gyro was the best I've had. The pita was incredibly soft and fluffy and the tzatziki sauce was awesome. Make sure you get extra sauce on the side... The had my  Lagunitas IPA and a nice little bottle of wine for my wife. The lady behind the counter told us about the kids meals even though they were not listed on the menu. Even my kids loved their half gyros in their meal.  Great place for a very good gyro.  They were semi busy and we got our food promptly.  This place will be my first choice for gyros in the future.
Came to Vegas for work, had the chicken rice bowl yesterday and it was so good I had to come back again today fo

Outstanding Greek fare with super friendly caring service.  Had the Gyro Platter with Rice Pilaf & the Souvlaki Platter with Feta Fries, both with Greek Side Salad.  The Tzaziki Sauce is some of the best we've ever had anywhere.  Henderson is truly fortunate to have such a choice for truly Mediterranean Grill!

We had the garlic shrimp plate about $13 and the chicken plate about $12. The place is clean but small. Grab a table right away they go quick. Service was efficient. The food is awesome. Fresh clean taste and the ingredients are quality. The only thing that keeps me from giving this place 5 stars is that the desserts was a limited selection and the plate doesn't come with hummus.
Very delicious food and excellent customer service! A must go if you haven't been here yet!

My mom and dad are in town and love Greek food! We were on our way home from Bonnie Springs and saw this restaurant just opened up on Blue Diamond and decided to give it a try. It was packed but the wait wasn't too bad. Very well put together with very cute decor. The kid menu was 7 bucks for whatever you choose to get but the portions are large! Very tasty food and will be coming back again soon!

Soft pita Tender gyro meat Top notch Mouth orgasm Very filling For cheap Crisp and sweet Wonderful treat!  Will provide a more elaborate update of my full experience soon, wanted to provide my enjoyment in a quick silly poem initially!

The Great Greek is such a cute place to eat at. The service is always so welcoming and friendly! This is my boyfriend and I's FAVORITE place to go. We are very healthy and consider this a healthier alternative compared to most fast food. The meat skewers, chicken or shrimp, the rice and the pita bread  are all so flavorful, comes out hot and quick! My boyfriend always always always gets the lamb or chicken gryo. Im assuming that is very good as well!

We have been here a few times and everything has always been really good and fresh!! The chicken and steak skewers are good, pita is hot and hummus is delicious!!  The service is always friendly and you can tell that they work very hard!!  Last night I ordered the Salmon Greek Salad and the Salmon is the best thing that I have had so far.  The Salmon was seasoned and cooked perfectly.  Make sure to order it medium because they said if you order it well done, it will be dry.  I am so glad that I listened to them because it was AWESOME!!!  This is definitely my go to place for Greek and Mediterranean food now and can't wait to get back there and have some more Salmon!!!

You just can't go wrong with the Great Greek. Their food is fresh and delicious. If your looking for traditional Greek food this is the place.   If your going for lunch make sure you get there early. The Great Greek has limited seating and although quick are still packed. They are just that good.   On this visit Joel and I both had the Great Greek Gyro with beef and lamb. We also shared some Feta Fries. Definitely spend the extra fifty cents for the fries. They are crispy, tangy and cheesy. Perfect combo! The Gyro was huge and piled with meat. It also had a generous helping of taziki sauce. I looooved their pita bread. I would be happy just having that and some hummus. Which I can't wait to try next time.  If you have a hankering for some seriously excellent Greek food the Great Greek should be your first stop in Henderson.

Any other day this place has a 5 star rating. My family and I have eaten the food here countless times. Until today, we've only had one bad experience. Where our food was overcooked...but today the person taking the order was full of attitude. That I chalked it up to maybe them being busy or her having a bad day.  But when I gave my son his kids plate and plastic film wrap embedded in the food that is not ok. I'm glad I caught  it before it went into his mouth.  Please be more carful with your food prep I don't care how busy or backed up you get.  Safety should not take a back seat to speedy service.

Food was decent. The steak skewer was the best. The chicken could use more flavor. We ordered fries but received the plate with rice instead. The rice was good.  The plate comes with a delicious greek salad. The girls servicing were a little rude. It was very busy but we sat down rather quick. You make a line, order and then you ate able to select a table and sit down.  The lemon chicken soup was very good.

EXCELLENT FRESH DELICIOUS FOOD!!! If you are looking for a great Greek meal, this is the place.  The chicken greek salad is to die for, the salad dressing & toppings are always fresh & yummy.  The employees are always very friendly & it's more like a family style restaurant.  Every time I call me order in they remember me and when I show up I am greeted immediately by 1st name and taken care of in a timely fashion, no matter how busy they are.  They have daily specials that are always delicious and nice variety.  There are several Greek restaurants in the neighborhood but I only go to the GREAT GREEK.
Fabulously Exceptional Greek salad + perfect chicken souvlaki kebabs + light and tasty rice and warm pita....Opa!!! Welcome to Greece!!!
Love love love the feta fries!!! Best Greek food in town!
The food is always outstanding! The service is just okay and the food takes forever to get to your table. In the end, it is well worth the wait.
This place is great, everything on the menu looks amazing but I have only had the gyro. Can't wait to go back. Better than other greek places in the area that I have tried.

This place is definitely one of my favorite Mediterranean/Greek restaurants in town. Excellent customer service with great food. My boyfriend found this place on yelp months ago and since then.. we order from here every time we crave their gyros, tzatziki dip, & fresh pitas. This place never disappoints us whenever we come in.

Food is great! However definitely need to improve on the customer service. I spent $75 on a dinner and asked for 3 extra sauces. The girl at gives me major attitude and says they are extra .95 extra... ok fine... charge my card for an extra $3 for sauce WOW ! You would think that it would be on their menu if they charge for sauce or they would include one with a meal but nope... I'll probably be back but was really disappointed with the lack of customer service. If I could give 1 star for service and 5 for the food I would..

Since my last visit this place can keep 5 shiny stars. The are definitely worthy. Service was great last night and the food was delicious as usual. Went for the same steak souvlaki plate to share. Meat was tender and delicious. Feta fries were crispy , savory and melt in your mouth. We tried the soup this time. So comforting.  Definitely don't get a huge lemon flavor but it's there. It's so comforting and hits the spot. I can see myself coming here in the cold months and ordering 2 bowls it's so good. We also tried spanakopita which was good as well. Crispy phyllo dough with spinach and cheese the bitterness of the spinach could have used some more cheese IMO but nonetheless still yummy. Last but not least we had some Baklava .  Oh my gosh ! I thought I died and went to heaven. This was absolutely delicious. Layers of phyllo dough and ground walnuts and honey. I heard they only use honey and not sugar. I'm glad because I can't handle things that are overly sweet. This was perfect. So delicious. I will be back great Greek. Next time I will try and order something other than the steak. I've stuck to it because it's just that good.
One of my Henderson favs. Great service; awesome food; great specials! Great location! A++++++

The food here is good and I'm a regular here, but after my last visit I will not be back. I ordered takeout via GrubHub and prepaid for my food and when I came in the service was awful. I waited and waited in line without any acknowledgement from the staff and a woman came in after me and walked right up to the counter to pickup her food they served her immediately and she walked out with her prepaid order. I said to the woman at the counter that I also ordered via GrubHub and had been waiting long before that woman walked in and her response was "hold on." If that wasn't enough for me to not come back, she then sat my bag in front of me on the counter and walked away without saying a word! Smh so rude.

I work in the area,, and stopped in after reading the reviews... I ordered the gyro, i can honestly say it was the best gyro i have had in a long time.. It was a nice size, loaded,, I came back and ordered the pastisio,,  that was very good as well..  Generous serving,, took me 6 hrs to eat it all,, greek salad was the side salad,, the dressing was decent,, order 2 extra,,  I will continue to come here,, its good, busy, the people are nice...  Its across from Sunset Station on Warm Springs side..

I have been meaning to try this place for quite a while now after seeing the reviews. Well Thank you fellow yelpers! You never let me down! I had the chicken gyro with a side of feta fries. The chicken was delicious! Very moist and flavorful. Just the right amount of ingredients on a soft fresh pita! The fries were tasty and not at all greasy! The staff here is so friendly and I had great service! I have been looking for a good Greek place on my side of town and I finally found it! Adding this to my list of favorite restaurants

Sadly, my knowledge of Greek food comes from My Big Fat Greek Wedding and a killer hangover from a few too many shots of cheap ouzo and pine sap Retsina to wash down "Greek" takeout in Hawaii.   With those credentials to back me, here goes.  The Great Greek makes very good, tasty Greek food.  Simply put, proteins are juicy and properly cooked, breads are fresh, everything is flavored with fresh herbs and well seasoned.    Dolmades (grape leaves stuffed with rice dill and other herbs) a real surprise.  Dense, moist and herbaceous, the leaves so tender you can eat them.  Lamb and beef gyro and grilled chicken gyro are real standout.  Juicy, well seasoned, sliced beef and lamb or chunks of chicken , atop simple veg, bathed in a zesty tzaziki, piled with a tart goat milk ricotta all enveloped by a fresh, warm, fluffy pita.  Grilled steak souvlaki, no complaints.  Deeply flavored, juicy tenderloin on skewers over a fluffy rice pilaf.  A squeeze of fresh lemon to brighten up the dish.   Done.    Finally, desert; baklava.  What's not to love, flaky filo, butter, sugar, walnuts, cinnamon all bathed in honey.  Friendly counter service.  Clean dining area.  Reasonable prices.  Poker Pro Tip:  Give a bud who lives in the area a ride to the WSOP. On the way stop for lunch.  For days after "hey, you want me to stop at that Greek place and get you something?"  Heck yeah!  Ponder if you must, is the food so good because it's different from our norm or is it the difference from its norm that makes it delicious?  It's all Greek to me.

Really fresh veggies and tasty sauces and cheese.   Did take out to avoid trying to find a place inside to sit.... as it turns out it wasn't too busy.  The fries are fabulous.  Crusty and still crunchy 15 minutes later when we got home.   Great Greek gyro is enough for 2 meals!  Again.... so fresh! Tasty tasty tasty

PERFECT Greek food.  I got a chicken santorini sandwich the other day, but I substituted pita for the roll it normally comes on.  It was THE BEST THING I EVER ATE, hands-down.  The Great Greek continues to impress me!

Food is great, but the young girl at register very rude! No personality, acted as if she was doing us a favor, from the get go as soon as we walked up all we got was attitude instantly. As a person in the food and beverage industry this is no way to treat a guest at your establishment. Will not be returning here any longer.

Outstanding food and service.  Warmly greeted when we entered the restaurant.  You can tell this is a family owned business.  I ordered the small Greek salad with grilled shrimp.  Delicious.  Everything was fresh and excellently prepared.  Tables were bused quickly, so you feel the restaurant is clean.  Many "regulars" came in for lunch while we were there.  We found our regular Greek food restaurant.

This place is fantastic. I have yet to eat anything that wasn't good. The Chicken Souvlaki and Feta cheese fries are my favorite. The Gyro is a generous size. The lamb is outstanding. My boyfriend get the salmon and loves it. Great food good service and my order is always right when I take out. It always on time. It's my favorite Greak place.
Best Greek food around! This is a regular spot for me, family owned and operated, you can go wrong with this place. I love the Greek salad and Greek fries.

This place is awesome! I love the gyro plate and the baklava ice cream is the best way to end a meal. Service is consistently good and it's perfect for a grab and go on the way home from work. So happy it's opened close to my house!
Dolmades and avgolemono were excellent and authentic.  Baklava is not over sweet with excellent flavor.  You can tell they spend the time to make it right.
My first time here, and I have been to other similar restaurants. This one is by far my favorite, when I'm on this side of town I will be eating here ..

Finally popped this bookmark....how does the GYRO fare??  The Great Greek Gyro ($7.50): Beef-Lamb, Lettuce, Tomato, Red Onions, Feta Cheese, and Tzaziki. This was very good, with LARGE thick slices of meat, and heavy...had to be a POUND of goodies! Yum!  I think the meat here is a little thicker than the others I've tried, and it was seasoned well with just the right amount of salt.  But when I compare it to my current favorite, this one didn't really blow my mind.  Now I have to try the other spot again to refresh my memory, to see if it really WAS that good.  Check it out if you are in the area!  :)

I live right down the street and this place is a favorite. It's usually pretty busy but hey that's a good thing right!?!? Super fresh, healthy, and delicious. The service has always been on point as well as the food.

This is the best ever! I have been all over town and I am so glad we have a local place this fabulous.  Impeccable service with great owners that take it all seriously unlike most places in henderson. Friendly service and very clean restaurant.    Everything was fantastic! The gyros, the rice, the salad. The Steak was so tender, the soup addictive.  We've been twice already and may make a weekly indulgence. :) Do not pass this place up!
There's been a line at the counter almost all the way to the door since we got here. After my Great Greek Gyro with feta fries, I understand why. Will definitely come back!
Great place to eat! The food is really tasty and good portion sizes. One of my favorite places to drop in when I don't feel like cooking dinner.

I just moved out here (from Orlando, FL) 10 days ago.  In those 10 days I haven't had a meal that I would classify past substandard.  Not only did I just eat the best Gyro and Feta fries that I've ever had, It's also the best meal I've had since making the move.  I will definitely be coming back here weekly.

If you are in Henderson and want a great Greek meal you need to go here. I love a good pita and that sauce I cannot spell. The folks here are super friendly and will also give you a soda while you wait. Price wise it is affordable and filling. Good portions and great staff. Go here if you have not been. It can get busy so be patient. Not a large space but they have outdoor seating if needed.
Now Open!! Was excited to have a Greek place finally on this side of town, this place doesn't disappoint.  Gyros are great with a reasonable price, combos about 12-14$.  I'll be coming back

Absolutely  delicious. Not phenomenal atmosphere - after all, it's in a strip mall. But very friendly and helpful service, and the food was great. The  great Greek Rice Bowl with gyro meat was delicious and more than enough. My wife tried the gyro - maybe not the best ever, but good. The feta fries are killer, matched only by our dessert choice, the kourabiedes  cookies.  Well worth a stop.
Whenever I have a chance to eat here I'm always impressed. The Great Greek Rice Bowl with falafel is one of the best plates.
This was quite a surprise! Great authentic Greek food made with quality ingredients.  Staff was very friendly, personable, and professional. Will definitely go back!
Great place to pop in for yummy food. Wish they would open one in Summerlin I would be here weekly.

To write this review while I am starving is dangerous because I am tempted to eat my screen to see if I can perhaps capture just a drop of the deliciousness contained in the chicken gyro at The Great Greek. My stomach is angry at me for even attempting to write this while it is suffering, so I will keep it brief.  The spot is casual and spotless. You order at the counter. The prices are reasonable.   I ordered the chicken gyro combo and selected the Greek salad as my side, and as soon as it hit the table, I was in love. The pita was fluffy and piled high with every condiment I could covet. I snapped up a morsel of chicken that had fallen out, and I made a little "oh yeah" noise upon eating it. It was tender, juicy and filled with flavor. The side salad was super fresh and topped with the perfect Greek dressing.   I know it is trite to say, "I wish it were closer," but it is true! I want a chicken gyro, and I want it now!

Delicious Greek food on a small scale. It was definitely authentic and rivaled that of our trips to Santorini, Mykonos, and Athens. Great prices and beers from the Greek islands are available. We had the Lamb Gyro and the sampler plate with Greek salad. Everything was fresh and on par. Definitely will return.
Best Greek Food I've ever had!!! Probably the nicest staff I've ever seen too!!  I drive all the way from the north side of Vegas to eat here!

Really enjoyed the food.  Only reason I didn't rate 5 is because the prices were maybe a dollar two more expensive than I'd like to see, and I don't care for the order at the counter option.    With that said, I definitely will return.  Falafel, dolmades, and salad were all great.

I always love coming here. I have brought friends and family here many times. Everyone loved it. The food is high quality and the service is great. Every employee from the kitchen to the register is constantly working for the customers. This isn't a fast food place. Food is made fresh every day.    I will order my food a head of time for pick up. It's great when I am in a rush to get back home.

We were blown away by the excellence of this Greek place. My mom got the shrimp entree; succulent mild shrimp over rice, topped with a scattering of raisins and sliced almonds, and served with greek salad; it was fantastic. The pita bread was the best we had ever had. Good hummus, too. I tried the famous rice pudding (far too sweet and heavy for me - Paymon's Mediterranean Cafe on Maryland Pkwy has the best) and the baklava (just okay). Staff was entirely Greek; family-owned place, with the requisite blue and white everywhere. Made me smile with the predictability of it all. In a good way. The wife-side of the ownership came by our table and chatted with us; very pleasant. There is another Greek spot very nearby; I had a hard time deciding which to try. It may be good as well, but I'm so glad I picked this one! It's not fancy, but there are tablecloths and they do serve wine and beer, with a couple of imported Greek beers.

I love this place! They're always busy. I usually call ahead and order takeout. The food is always fresh and delicious. My go to place for a healthy meal when I'm too lazy or tired to cook.   Portion size is fair and reasonable. They always cook the steak skewers to the correct temperature. I've ordered chicken, shrimp and steak. They always cook the proteins perfectly, it's never dry at all.
This place is such a GEM! Not only is the service great but the food is excellent!!! The shrimp side with the Greek salad is a perfect lunch and will keep me going back again and again.

Rice pudding Home made is to die for. Family owned and run. Very friendly staff. They used to offer a salmon version of the greek salad wrap. So so so so so good, but not sure if they still offer it with salmon.

The feta fries were the highlight of my family's first time here. I've been to numerous greek/Mediterranean spots and since this place is fairly new and near where we live, we decided to finally give it a try. We ordered the traditional gyro and shrimp and steak kabob plate...it was alright. I tried asking if they have the special garlic sauce, my heart shattered when the gentleman mentioned, "I know Stephano's has it but we don't have that here." I haven't been there (yet!) but I've been to places like Manna and Meraki that carries the super "oh so yummy" garlic sauce that makes the food that much more delicious. For two plates, it was close to $30 which is quite on the pricey side, in my opinion. The place was clean and the traffic was steady on a Sunday afternoon. The workers didn't seem as upbeat as other Greek/Mediterranean places that I've been to. My son enjoyed the pita bread and I guess that's why I gave this place three stars...it was fresh, warm...the way it should be.
It's a cute little place. Awesome food, awesome service and awesome portions!! The guy behind the register explained what we were getting and he was right on the spot.

I've never taken the time to post, this time I made the time. Love this place! Food is fresh with great flavor. Love the Greek Salad, Lamb Gyros and Feta Fries. Busy but don't worry, you won't wait long and it's worth it!

Along the way to Hoover Dam, there was really not many choices. The Great Greek was the best I could find. We only tried Gyro Plate because they were not serving other grilled places that day. Attentive service, bright dining environment and food was served in a really generous size.

I stumbled upon this restaurant when the wife and I were out running errands. I had been craving Greek food for a while and decided to give it a try.....boy am I thankful I did! As soon as we walked in...it was clean and refreshing! The Vegas summer has been kicking our bum...but it was comfortable the moment we walked in the door. The first thing I noticed, was how nice the decor is and how well kept the location is. I was excited to get to the counter.   Since I hadn't been here before, I stared at the menu in amazement...I feel the young lass at the counter is used to the shock on new faces...so she advised I grab a menu and make myself at home at a table...excellent idea! The wife and I sat down and looked over all of the delicious options.....thankfully she pulled me back...or I would have ordered two of everything!   Everything sounded beyond appetizing! We decided on a few appetizers, a salad, and some fries, but then I noticed they were offering a special that included a few of the items we were ordering. So we decided to get that and split it. I wanted the greek salad, hummus, and fires....but I was worried that us splitting the meal would leave us hungry.....boy was I wrong!!!!  The ladies behind the front counter continued to bring us parts of our order, as soon as they were ready...and I thought it would never end! I do wish the tomatoes for the salad were cut a tad smaller.....but that's just because I need to be able to shovel the yummy foods in faster!   Everything we tried was fresh and more than I expected for the prices. Our table was cleaned as soon as we finished each plate, and everyone was beyond kind and helpful. I look forward to making another trip here very soon and highly recommend you do as well!

Filthy disgusting place! The owner is rude and I'm going to call the health inspector. We arrive and got the greek salad, skewers, and chicken pita. My boyfriend split the salad with me and when I was about to eat it a black hair was in it. My bf went to the owner and she said, "must be the wind, so what do you want." My bf said I'm not eating this so she said ok and took the salad back and said she would make a small salad for him not even the entree salad he purchased!! Then he asked how come she's keeping the salad back there he returned she said oh she's going to reheat the chicken when the hair was mixed with chicken and the salad. My bf said no he's not eating that and she starts arguing with him and my bf said he wanted a refund. He got the refund. She got upset and better yet she told the chefs to hold on to the salad so yet another customer who orders it would have it! We have been here multiple times and honestly the food isn't as good as it was before and the owner is a ruthless old hag. WILL NEVER RETURN! Unless you want to eat hair and deal with it.

Will have to come back another time to try other plates. Food portions are bigger than I thought and even more delicious. Prices are reasonable but my only regret, I walked away without trying the baklava. I didn't have anymore room in my belly and had to pack up my leftovers (which my dad ate and loved). I'm definitely going back again.
I'm a big fan of their Greek Salad.  I usually get it with slices of lamb in it...

Food was very good  Service was ok. One of the woman who worked the front was a bit rude when my mom asked a question about her order.   Atmosphere was ok. Small location.   The only negative was the cost of the food. It was $90 for 4 people including drinks and a side of hummus. I don't think this place was work that cost.   You - we had 2 gyros plates, 1 vegetarian plate and 1 shrimp skewer plate, 2 sides of hummus and 4 drinks. With 15% tip it was just over $90.
Delicious and FRESH ingredients in all their dishes.  Salmon is delicious and perfectly cooked.  Veggies are crisp and SO fresh.  Love love love this place.  Wish there was more seating and delivery!

That soup (which is named a word that I can never pronounce) is so good! More lemon would have made it even better. The feta fries that everyone was raving about are very good; the perfect bar food munchie. I was pretty hungry, so I also got a small Greek salad, which wasn't very small! It was very fresh and good. Same with the pita bread. Yum yum yum! Customer service was great, too. I wish they had Jasmine tea or something unique like that, but only unsweetened Fuse.
Amazing food.  This place has great food and amazing service.  Everything is always extremely fresh and tasty!  They have indoor and outdoor seating.

Honestly was stocked to have this near the house. Heard it opened and been wanting to try it. Asked the Hubby if he wanted to have dinner there this evening only to be disappointed.   We ordered the traditional Gyro (beef/lamb). It was a HOT mess! Everything was falling apart. The sauce was overpowering and I couldn't taste the flavor of the meat. The meat was cut carelessly. Some where thick, some were thin and some were super thick. The feta fries were very sad. Served "cold" where the feta was just blooped on top. Was difficult to eat as well.   Ordered a chicken fingers kids meal and it was overpriced. Came with three very small pieces of chicken, fries and salad.   Place was packed, clean and LOUD!  Would we come back? Nope.
I love this place! The whole staff, especially Jak always make me feel so special. I would recommend anything and everything on their menu.  It's always fast, fresh and always exceptional service.

We came on a Thursday for lunch and ordered 1. Athenian burger combo with fries, 7.50+2.95 - Grilled Angus Beef, Lettuce, Tomato, Red Onions, Feta Cheese, Tzaziki 2. Great Greek gyro combo with rice, 7.95+2.95 - Chicken or Lamb. Lettuce, Tomato, Red Onions, Feta Cheese, Tzaziki for $23.08  Side choices include: French Fries, Rice, Greek Salad, Avolemono Soup, Feta Fries (50c more) - Nice patio seating. Food delivered to us.  - Wait time around 15 min. Fast food style but wait time like a dine in restaurant. - Big portioned burger. Fresh and crispy fries.  - Packed Gyro. Lame rice. - Good taste. A bit pricey for what it's worth. Worth it for 1 try.  - Hard to compete when there are so many around for about the same taste with coupons for cheaper.  - Uncertain if I'd return.
This place is flat awesome! Super friendly staff, clean facility, and great food and value! Enjoyed the Greek gyro with chicken and feta fries. Will definitely return.

Wow, let me start by saying I this is the first time any business has asked me to give my seat up for other patrons. I came in and ordered to go, feeling under the weather so I decided to get dinner for my husband and I. After ordering and tipping I found a small table and waited for my order. The Owner/ manager comes over and taps me on my shoulder and asked me to move to a single chair by the door so other customers could sit. Wow! I'm African American and a business owner myself, and that is a complete no! No! There was a gentleman ordering to-go whom sat at a table with four chairs and remained until his order was complete. I wish I could've un-tipped and left! I will never return as well as letting all my friends and family know just how this establishment feels about people of color! I'm more hurt than anything that this type of action is allowed yet still. We are all humans, no matter what color.

There are a lot of good Greek restaurants in Henderson.  From my house to this place is like climbing Mt. Olympus but it's soooo worth the drive.  Holy Michael Bolton, this is my favorite Greek restaurant in all the land!    It's a small but very clean restaurant.  This may be irrelevant to most people but for somebody who freaks out a lot when the battery on my phone is less than 90%,  the high top tables against the wall with outlets was a great plus! Oh yeah, the service is great too.  It's quick, to-go orders are quicker and phone-in orders are quickest.  The steak souvlaki is tender and has great flavor.  It comes with Greek salad and you can get it with either rice pilaf or fries.  What I always get is the beef and lamb gyro and feta fries.  Soft and warm pita bread hugging slices of meat topped with melted feta cheese and tzatziki...underneath lettuce, tomatoes and red onions.  It's heavy yet portable and non-messy.  I can eat their gyro hot or cold.  Raw onions give me a headache but theirs is sliced rather than chopped so it's easy for me to just pick them out.  The feta fries are amazing.  Each fry is lightly breaded for that extra crisp.  Hot fries topped with feta cheese = cheesy goodness!  "I'll be there someday, I can go the distance I will find my way, if I can be strong I know ev'ry mile, will be worth my while When I go the distance, I'll be right where I belong"  - Michael Bolton

My mom and I stopped by here to get a couple of gyros to go. This place was super busy but from the looks of the food we weren't about to turn around. I ordered the traditional lamb Gyro and my mom got a traditional beef Gyro meal, that came with a salad and fries. We sat and waited for our food. A party of two ordered after us, then a party on one and a party of three ordered after them. ALL of them were served before our food to go was ready. We asked the cashier/server/bus boy why three parties for their food before us and he said "we're really busy right now. Maybe that big order up on the window is yours." My mom told him "We ordered two things and everyone else ordered way more than us. Why is it taking so long? This is not ok." The guy said sorry, but didn't try to make anything right. Thankfully when we got home and took a bite of the Gyros they tasted great. Hopefully, if we decide to go back this place will be on their game.
Had a great lunch here today! loved the food and service. I will definitely be back.
Ordered the steak souvlaki with extra tzatziki, it was so good. Take out was fast and easy too.

best gyro ! love the feta fries.  mom and pop place, always try to support local!!  make sure your call in orders around dinner time, bc it gets busy! they recently just renovated to make it bigger...

The grilled shrimp was excellent at a reasonable price. Grilled perfectly, great fresh taste. Crispy fries and fresh salad. If I lived here, I would frequent this place! I took some baklava to go. Delicious!

Delicious... hit it out of the park again. Greek salad with gyros meat. Huge sluces of vegies in it snd lots of meat. Always my fav greek place. The service was gast for lunch so i appreciate that and the people are always nice.
This place was so awesome we had a lamb chops special it was the best night ever have had, and I'll be Greek food all over the United States!

Do they put crack in their food?!? It is so extremely addicting. I get an undeniable craving for the Great Greek at least once a week.  The restaurant itself is casual and small but has many tables to dine in at, and they have outdoor seating as well. It does get busy but you'll get a table soon enough. You can also call ahead to take out.   The service is OK. The employees are nice enough and they're great about clearing tables. It usually takes me quite a bit of time after ordering to get the food but it's so worth the wait.   Their classic greek salad is delicious. The hummus and pita is the perfect side dish or snack. They also include pita with the salad so I try just to get a small side of hummus and not the whole appetizer dish. The portions are great.   If you haven't tried this place I'll warn you, the food is so amazing that your first taste will make you a hopeless Great Greek addict just like me! I'm going to need a support group soon because my husband must think I have a serious problem with how often I want to come here!

Excellent food and service here!  Checked out the restaurant shortly after it opened, and it's a great addition to the southwest part of town!  I come here fairly often, and am always satisfied.  During my last visit, I witnessed a grown man have a meltdown over a pepperoncini, and the staff responded professionally, and calmly despite the comments made towards them.  They work hard to provide a welcoming environment, and they are great at ensuring customers are satisfied.  Cleanliness is always spot on!  Even when busy, they make their way around to clean up the seating area, and pick up your plates when you're done.  I've come here every week since opening, and haven't seen the place a mess yet. The food is also always consistent, and is made perfectly every time.  If something doesn't come out to perfection, they quickly remake it without incident.    I will continue to frequent this location, and highly recommend this place to others!

This was really great place and food was amazing. The place was very really clean. We ordered several items as take out and all of the dishes were good. The surprize was  the Yia Yia's Pastitsio, it was so flavorful- super yum! I hope to come back again soon.

Who needs a Fat or Mad Greek when you can have a Great Greek. The Great Greek really does hit the nail on the head. What was so great about my meal? Everything, start to finish. It was a completely enjoyable experience.   Dinner with fellow Yelpers, Judd and Lynn L., put this place on my bookmarks and it was about time to pay them a visit. With two other Greek food lovers in toe, we came out to try as much as possible. One Mezze Plate, Two Beef Slouvaki Plates, two fountain drink, one bottled water, Rice Pudding, a Baklava, and two secret Greek Coffees (explanation later on) cost a little under $50. There was even left over after I tried to cram as much in as possible. As I write, I lay in bed in a semi-comatose state.   The Mezze Plate is a combination of vegetarian favorites; spanakopita, two dolmas, hummus, pita bread, tsaziki sauce, and two falafels. The puffed pastry was flaky, buttery, and filled with spinach and cheese. The falafels were crispy on the outside and light inside creating the perfect combination. The Slouvaki Plate boasted the most tender and juicy beef. They were drool worthy at medium rare and the juices oozed into the rice. Taste bud overload! With the second plate there is an option to pick between three different sides; rice, fries, and Greek salad. The gentleman behind the register gave us all salads on top of one rice and one order fries. The guest service is amazingly friendly. We were continuously checked upon during dinner as well.   After our meal, one of my friends pushed me to ask about coffee. It is not listed on the menu, but it could not hurt to ask. The same guy who took our order made a joke that it was on their secret menu and it was no problem to make. Now to desserts! The Rice Pudding is thick and rich. The Baklava had great depth and not too sweet. They are definitely one of the best Greek restaurants in town. On the way out, we even got a warm farewell. Thorough is a good way to describe the service.

My friend brought me here while I was visiting Las Vegas. I wasn't sure how I felt about Greek Food, but after trying the food here, I am on the lookout for a Greek restaurant around me that can compare and I don't know if i'll be able to find one.  First of all, the service was amazing. The staff was friendly and we received our food in a very timely manor. I tried the Great Greek Gyro and Feta Fries... I don't know if I have words to describe how delicious they were. I know that the next time I visit my friend in Henderson, I will be begging her to take me back!

This is a really great spot for some great affordable Greek food. We came here as a family of 12 and the employees were so nice and catered to us like we were family. I will definitely come back here next time I visit the area. All the food was great!

This is one of my favorite Greek eateries in the valley. I used to go here frequently when I leaved close by but now that we moved across the valley I can only take advantage whenever I'm in Henderson. They have a delicious Greek rice bowl which is my go to dish here but all the other options are good too. I like the fact that they play Greek/Mediterranean music it gives a good mood should you choose to dine in.
Checked in to this place based on the reviews and it did not disappoint. Not a spacious sit down affair but the food is delicious. Lamb gyro and Greek salad were both amazing.
Awesome unreal super fresh .... this will be a favorite each year really good food great people

A friend that knows his food told us about this little place and was he ever right! Went out of my dietary comfort zone and fell for their feta fries. Saw them on several tables and it was a done deal. Thank goodness after a few my craving was satisfied and I moved on to the real food. The chicken souvlaki plate was more than tasty. The two chicken skewers of marinated chicken breast were moist and tender. The rice pilaf was seasoned perfectly and side salad was delish with a more than generous side salad, romaine lettuce, too, no iceberg lettuce here! My hubby had the chicken bowl which he said was excellent.  Bascially,  it was a Greek salad with a skewer of chicken breast served over a bed of rice. We also sampled some hummus, which was also flavorful.  It was presented in a little bowl topped with  several garbanzo's and sprinkled with paprika. My only comment was that the grape leaves were bland.  A tad more seasoning would be helpful. The were presented beautifully and again the portion size was generous.  This family run restaurant has personalized excellent service. Very friendly and helpful!  Parking is easy, close and free,  can't beat that!   Next time we're in the area we will be back and I'll see if I can be strong and not yield to the temptation of the feta fries!
I have been to The Great Greek a couple of times. Tasty food with nice size portion. Friendly service . Defiantly will go back there again.

Like Ellie Goulding's song "Lights," Greek food never gets old to me.  On any given day falafels and gyros can keep calling, calling, calling me to lunch or dinner.   Been wanting to try out Great Greek for a while, but it's a little more east than I usually travel.   Tonight I found myself in the area and decided to call in some takeout.  I went with a lamb gyro with feta fries on the side, and asked for a side of falafel because I simply have to try some at every Greek restaurant I go to because it's in the title of my list here on Yelp for Mediterranean eats.  When I arrived the food was ready and waiting for me and I was happy to see Dr. Pepper on the list of fountain drink options because as you may know, Dr. Pepper is the unofficial non-alcoholic nectar of the Gods.    I did have to drive about 20 minutes until I got home, so please take that into consideration for the food review that follows.  I immediately went for some feta fries which were pretty standard french fries covered in, you guessed it, feta cheese.  Because of the drive, the feta cheese had sort of started to congeal a little, but it had no effect on the taste and I found them delicious.   I will say for a quick comparison that I do prefer Yanni's Gyros fries where he adds garlic, feta and hot sauce, but I digress.  Then came the gyro.  With the first bite I knew it was something special.  Tender, flavorful gyro meat with the standard lettuce tomato and onion SMOTHERED in tzatziki and feta.   I think it had more of these two ingredients than any gyro I've had elsewhere, and to me that was a good thing.  Between the fries and the gyro the meal was fetariffic!  Sorry about that.  Lastly I tried some of the side of falafel, and was a little disappointed in those.  They weren't bad by any means, but I feel like I've had better in many places like Hedary's and the Fat Greek for example.  The texture was good, but it just wasn't as flavorful as I like.  Prices were reasonable and service was friendly and efficient.  If Great Greek were closer to my work or home I'd make it a regular visit, but for now it will remain a solid choice when I'm in the area (which is almost never.  Step your game up Sunset Station!)
Hands down THE BEST GREEK FOOD IN VEGAS!!!!!!! Need I say more? What are you waiting for, go check it out.

I have been here several times and I truly believe it's the best Greek restaurant in Henderson. Last night my husband and I got the  falafel pitas with a side Greek salad and the feta fries. Everything was fresh and tasted amazing! This place never disappoints which is why we choose to come here for our Mediterranean flavors. Not to mention the price is very reasonable for the portion of food that you get. The place is very clean and the staff is very friendly. I believe the owner took our order last night and he was very helpful and so very polite. The restaurant feels very family orientated and I like that. There is plenty seating on the inside and outside and the decor is pretty. All around a great place to eat and will be eating here in the future.
Loved it! Really good Greek food, awesome and fast service, good prices!! My favorite Greek restaurant in the valley!!

Lamb gyro is big and delightful! Their white sauce is very tasty and has feta cheese mixed in it. The lamb has ingredients that lingers in my mouth in a good way. Their fries are perfectly thick and and perfectly crunchy on the outside. Their baklava is wonderful-not too sweet either compared to others I've had.   Customer service is on the friendly tip.

I'm not sure what all the fuss is about this place but I can honestly say the best part of the food was the pita my gyro meat was cold and the fries were not seasoned. The chicken souvlaki was okay but tasted like it was old. The salad was just plain with some feta cheese and dressing plus this was kinda expensive. You do get a lot of food for the price but you won't eat most of it

My friend took me to lunch here for my birthday! I was craving Greek and had never been here before and she doesn't eat lamb, or onions, or... so this was a gamble on her part as well.  Absolutely terrific, delicious food.  When I ordered the gyros plate I was specific as to what I wanted and got exactly what I ordered and it was DELICIOUS.  Meat was well flavored and tender, the tzatziki was perfect and the pita was exactly the correct mix of soft/crispy that I like.  My friend discussed all her requirements while ordering at the counter and the gracious and helpful server made sure that absolutely everything was perfect before we were served at our table inside.  We were lucky enough to be against the window and watched a tiny boy and his father signing back and forth about his food demands...it would have gone viral if we'd filmed the 2-year old feeding himself the hummus.  So I think we were served immediately but can't be sure. lol.  I will not only go back but I've already been back.  And I ordered the hummus this time.  Great flavor.  Clean, great food, gracious and polite staff, efficient...it's my go to Greek forever.

The food is fresh. The service fair.  Upon ordering and paying i am prompted to, would i like to leave a 15-18-20 % tip.  For what. Standing in line to order my food to go or at best eat there. Get my own water/drink.  I dont think so. The online ordering was a terrible experience. I could not order what i wanted. The site kept showing the wrong quantity. The lid to my salad dressing was not put on tight and leaked all over the bag.
4.5 stars. Very friendly service, fast to bring out the food and excellent gyros to boot! Highly recommend you check this place out as it's definitely one of the best gyros I've had in Vegas.

This place is fairly new to the southwest side and I'm glad that they opened to add more cuisine flare to the long Blue Diamond stretch. The food is delicious and portions are fairly large. Customer service was superb. I would definitely recommend this place !
A little pricey but worth the bang for the buck. I love the French Fries. Nice clean place very friendly and great service.

We have been here a million times. Never disappointed. We seem to always order the same things. Gyros plate with rice and salad, I like my salad village style...tomatoes, cucumbers, feta cheese and dressing.  My man orders the 2 skewer meal, lamb and beef, with rice and regular Greek salad. If we are really hungry we order the feta fries also. Feta fries are fries covered with melted Feta and I believe Monterey jack cheese...mmmm mmmm mmmm! The Gyros is cooked to perfection and so flavorful. The rice is buttery and lemony perfection. I don't know where they get their tomatoes from but they are always so ripe and red and flavorful.  The meat for the skewers is always cooked exactly how you request and the steak skewer meat is so tender and tasty I would think it was filet mignon.  They need to expand their Henderson location because they are sooooo busy that sometimes you have to wait for a table and they are always busy with take outs!!! We LOVE the Great Greek and even though it is a drive for us it is well worth it!!!! We always take visitors there for dinner when they come to town!  Keep up the great cooking!!!

While traveling on business we stopped in for lunch, and what a great choice it was.  We had the Beef & Lamb Giro platters.  They came with the Greek salad as a starter and french fries.  The giros where excellent, served with lettuce and tomato.  The Tzatziki sauce was very good as well.    Appears to be a family run business and they did a really good job of serving and keeping us happy.  Don't miss this one!!!

Best Greek food in Henderson and some of the best Greek we have had.  The portions are great, the food is great, the staff is great, and the speed of ordering to food arriving is great.  I wish they would expand their store so there would be more inside seating!  People waiting for orders sometime take up the seats for those of us wanting to eat inside.

Delicious Greek food! I usually get the chicken gyro with feta fries. Very fresh and tasty! If I come in during peak lunch hour, I usually get my food to go because it's so packed that there isn't an open table. No big deal - just shows how much people enjoy their food. I'm glad that the manager clarified on Yelp what the picketing on the street corner was about. We were  really curious.

First time here & I have to say... GREAT customer service and amazing food, with a pretty environment. It's like I'm in Greece again! Thank God there's a Greek place nearby! Definitely coming here more!

Can we just talk about how aesthetically pleasing your food looks on their wooden tables as the sun is streaming in. It's absolutely beautiful to a foodie who is obsessed with food porn shots. Have visited this location and twice, and both times did not disappoint, nor did they differ in experience or quality. The staff is extremely friendly and patient to newbs like me, who have absolutely no idea what to order.   On the first visit I ordered the Gyro Plate with rice pilaf. It seemed a better option and a more bang for your buck kinda thing, but wasn't as yummy as the skewer. Second visit I went with that instead, and was definitely more satisfied. Go with your gut peeps!   Service was prompt, and location clean. It was definitely yummy!!
Love , Love, Love this place!  Best greek food in town.  Glad they opened on this side of town. Because I usually drive to Henderson to get my greek fix at their original location.
Eat anything on the menu! Delicious! I have visited this place three times in one week! That rice bowl is to die for, it has the perfect rice, salad ratio.

Awesome food!! love the gyros plate!! amazing staff so very nice and helpful!  and nearby my favorite shopping making this the best spot to stop for lunch or dinner!! Gyros plate is delicious the fries are top notch and salad is fresh, and tasty! I love to stop here when we come to Henderson! 0

My yo go place for lunch. I used to pass this place every day on my way home. Finally I got to try it and wasn't disappointed. Good is EXCELLENT! I haven't try everything yet but I will. Interior is very nice and clean. Easy to order for pick up, usually ready by the time you get there if you call in advance.

This really is 'Great Greek'. Hubby and I popped in for mid-week dinner to go. I got a grilled chicken gyro with feta fries, he got a grilled chicken plate. Both were really good! The cheese on the feta fries had gotten a little cold by the time we made it home but they were still pretty tasty! We also ordered a side of dolmades, which leads to the -1 star, they were out of dolmades so she offered hummus instead which was priced less than the dolmades. We didn't make a big deal about it because we paid with a card and it would have been more hassle to refund such a small amount so we just ate it. Plus the hummus ended up being good anyway!! Over all I will definitely be visiting again!

This is one of the best Mediterranean restaurants I have tried. The chicken and steak is very moist and tender. If you love lemon soup this is the place. I add a little rice pilaf to it this just perfect for lunch or a light dinner. You can't go wrong

WOW OH WOW is what this place does to my tastebuds. I stopped by here on a whim & was not disappointed. I had the avgolemono soup, the great greek gyro & feta fries. OMG the feta fries are ridiculous good. Everything was so fresh, flavorful and amazingly delicious. The restaurant is quite small but extremely clean & service was A++. My husband & I are now regulars.

I searched Yelp looking for Greek, this popped up and was near. Good decor and food. The staff was pleasant and place was clean. Was a nice small quality restaurant. Will be back  If in town you should try this place.

Excellent service, the portions are huge and the taste is great, the price is good, for Greek food, the restaurant is impeccable. Will definitely come back  again. If you come with a group the family deals are the best: Gyro, rice or fries, salad, soda and dessert for about $45-48. We had the 4 people deal and could not finish it. My husband wanted for me to add: "The rice pudding is great, just like my sito used to make."
Best Greek food in Vegas! Great service. Wish they would open another restaurant closer to green valley but, we'll drive

This place is the best in town. It is consistently delicious with SUCH courteous service.  I recommend this place to any and every person in the area. You won't be disappointed.  The mezze plate completes me.  Last time we ordered from them, my husband went to pick up the food and there was an incredibly rude and obnoxious patron and we got a free baklava for the inconvenience. They didn't say anything, just slipped it into the bag. Needless to say, it was the greatest baklava I've ever had.  LOVE this place!

I've eaten here a couple of times now and felt the need to truly express how much I enjoy their food. The food is exceptional! I usually get the skewers, like all the skewers they have and I'm always delightfully satisfied.   I couldn't think of any other place I'd rather try for catering my daughter's little 4th birthday staycation than The Great Greek. OMG it was AMAZING!  I ordered a half tray chicken 5 skewers of the chicken, steak, pork, and vegetable Appetizer combo  And it fed 10 people vegan and non!! Bonus, it was under $150 which was unbelievable!  If you have not tried this place please give it a shot. You will not be disappointed!!

Happy that they opened something different on this side of town.  My fiancé and I tried the traditional Greek beef/lamb gyro and they definitely didn't disappoint.   Get ready to eat with both hands because the Gyros are packed with meat.   Look forward to coming back and trying other things on the menu.

The food was tasty.  The atmosphere OK.  Price was reasonable.  The Gyro platter was good.  I thought the sauce was a little bland (could have used more dill and seasoning).  The feta fries were good.  Food easily deserved 3 1/2 or 4 stars.  Customer service pulled them down a star.  The reason:  When they were taking my order, they asked how many were in my party (I was alone) and they told me to sit at a 2 person table (a reasonable request since they were almost full (a testimony to their good food), but when I finished placing my order, only a 4 place table was available (someone had sat down at the place they had pointed out to me).  The only table left was the 4 place table, so I sat there (outside was too hot).  When my food came out, they were clearing a recently vacant 2 seat table and put my food there, and motioned me to re-seat myself.  I felt they could have handled moving me a little better then to put my food at another table.  If they had asked me 1st, it wouldn't have been an issue, but somehow the way it played out without a polite exchange of communications made me feel there was an underlying lack of customer commitment.  I will go back, because the food was good, but hope this review will help them sharpen their customer communications skills.

Great family place good dessert the baklava ice cream is so good. The best gyros and Greek salad I've had. It's authentic Greek and the owners are friendly. Always come here when in Vegas.  Price is well worth it. Tried the garlic shrimp and Greek salad first time was here then the gyros but always get the ice cream. Lol
Newly opened closer to us and the food and stuff are still great.  It's bigger than the one on Stephanie but it's not to crowded here which is good for me lol

One of the better Greek/Kabob places on this side of town. Everyone is always friendly. Place is always clean and they are working FAST to get you your order.  Their lamb gyro is good and on par with most other gyros I've had. Their fries are normal fries. Nothing super special. I'm used to krinkle cut(which I love) fries at Greek places usually, though. The salad was super fresh, but needed a little more dressing (maybe on the side, as not everyone would agree with me).   All in all, I am here once or twice a month cuz I live in the area, but I wouldn't drive across town for it.

I love this place for 2 main reasons. First, the food is delicious. I recommend the lamb souvlaki and the Great Greek Bowl with falafel. Their hummus is so creamy and light, I could have it every day. So much flavor with everything, we were pretty much quiet the whole meal bc we didn't want to do anything but eat! Two, the portion size is phenomenal for the price you pay; you definitely get your value/ money's worth. The ambience is cute, fresh and clean and the staff is very friendly. I liked seeing that they enjoyed their job and being there while we were having our meal, it was just a nice extra touch. Outdoor seating is available and the dining room feels like you're eating at your place or a friend's house. Worth a try!

Amazing! Such. Great service, even better food! So fresh, so crisp! First time here but I will be returning. Inside and outside seating. Great menu selection. Easy to read. With plenty of customization options.   We had the two kabob plates with rice, warm pita, and a side of Greek salad. Huge and delicious portions. Chicken was cooked perfectly. Grilled  crunchy but soft on the inside.Rice well cooked too. The salad was my favorite. Just the right amount of every ingredient with every bite.    We opted for sitting outside since it was nice that day. They brought our food to the table. Had a great time. They are well priced and with the amount of food you get its well worth every penny.
This is one of my favorite places to eat in Henderson. The food is delicious (and I have tried several different dishes) and the staff is unfailingly friendly and helpful.

Home run for anyone who loves Greek. We finished a fun day mountain biking and climbing and we're looking for a good, healthy dinner. Fresh, crisp Greek salad, rice plate and Mezze plate was a homerun.

Excellent food, great service!!! Only complaint is that the place is bursting at the seams! It gets quite busy and it's hard to find a place to sit... but then again that just proves how good the food is! This is my favorite restaurant in Henderson!

I cannot believe I have not reviewed this place before. We have been coming here for literally years. We only moved to Henderson about one year ago, but this place is close to our office here that we visited many times before and we used to only eat here. Solid, authentic, tasty Greek food. I LOVE the chicken lemon soup. The Greek salad is good too - they use good, real feta unlike other places. I usually get chicken skewers that are yummy and juicy too. The crazy fries are amazing - the French fries are very tasty and the crazy fries have feta on top that melts and tastes like a dream. Ok - I am done now. Just thinking about this place and my mouth is watering

OMG!! OMG!! OMG!!! That is really all I can say.  I ordered a gyro sandwich and feta fries. TO DIE FOR! Yup really. Can't wait to go back on my next visit to the area. Can I franchise this is San Diego please???
This place is the best greek food I have found in vegas. Hands down worth the drive off the strip.

I'm happy to report that this place comes in second best next to the original. I did like the open seating at this restaurant plenty of space for family style dinner. The benefit to this place is definitely being closer to the strip.  I highly recommend the feta fries

I'm going to keep short and just say that this is quite possibly the best Greek food I have ever eaten. Everything from the souvlaki to the pasticcio to the rice pudding was phenomenal and I can't wait to go back. Loved it!!

I have been to the Blue Diamond location a few times and it has been good almost every time. The steak and chicken souvlaki is amazing and you cannot go wrong with the rice pilaf. The baklava is actually very good and just enough honey. A bit on the sweet side but I prefer that.   Each plate comes with a salad so no need to order a huge salad is you are ordering many plates.

Beef/lamb gyro + fries + drink = $10?  Yes, that's what I had for lunch today at The Great Greek and it was a great deal!  It's probably only the second time I've had a gyro and this one was overflowing with meat, lettuce, tomatoes, feta cheese,Tzaziki sauce, and flavor.  The fries were also delicious.  The service is attentive, the place is clean, and I'm just sad that I didn't take baklava to go because I'm sure it's great, too.  Opa!
Yum, yum yum lemon rice chicken soup with fresh dill? Wow.  The baklava is beautiful, can't wait to eat it... But too full from the small Greek sale with gyro meat. Good stuff.
Excellent,  very very good easy to read menu and reasonably priced. Fast service and lots if parking. They could be a little more friendly but over all 5 stars.

This is our favorite neighborhood restaurant.  The food is so delicious and the family and staff could not be more friendly.  Our go to dishes are the rice bowls, gyros and feta fries.  And don't skip dessert- the baklava is the best I've ever had!

Wow! I'm coming back. By far the best Greek salad I've had in the Valley. If you haven't tried this place you should have a solid case of FOMO. Get in and get some amazing food prepared the right way.
Yummy...awesome food, great service, fun atmosphere. A wonderful place to go with a group of friends and just relax and cpmmunicate.

This place is awesome!! I've been twice and look forward to returning on my next Vegas  trip--it is worth the drive from  the Strip.   I've ordered the same thing both times: the Great Greek chicken gyro with the feta fries.   Today, I also tried the hummus and souvalaki. Amaze-balls. Everything is fresh and delicious. They bring you warm grilled pita. I gobbled every morsel. We were almost tempted to order to go. But the portions here are huge and our room does not have a mini fridge.  Hands down, the best Greek food I've ever enjoyed!

There's a reason I keep coming back every time I'm in Vegas. This food is AMAZING. The girls who work the front are so sweet and helpful. The soup is to die for and super clean.. Oh come back to So Cal with me.

Standard Greek takeout food but with sit-down restaurant wait times to get your food. Staff seems a bit frazzled and confused.  Menu is made up of gyros, casseroles and salads with rice pilaf or fries (the good kind, not garbage Ore-Ida crinkle fries cut like Raisin' Canes.)  Food is pretty standard, tastes like Kronos gyro meat. Prices average about $10 per person. Dining room gets extremely busy at dinner time so maybe order ahead to go to avoid fighting for a table.
Delicious. I really enjoyed the feta fries and gyro. A lot of delicious Greek food. The people are very nice. It gets really busy at certain times but it is totally worth it.
When I go to Vegas we always have to eat at Great Greek. Everything in their menu is delicious, you really can't go wrong.

The food is consistently good. We always enjoy our meal no matter what we pick. The manager Jack is great! He always checks to see how we are doing and keeps us laughing. We will continue to eat here regularly.

1 - 5 scale Food 5 Service 4 Decor 4 very clean  I think the gyro is as good as what I've tried in New York City, but the fries are the best in town. The flavor is fantastic if you're a chicken or lamb fan and the feta fries are killer good.   This is a great little place to grab a quick lunch on the patio.

I am obsessed with their feta dip (Tirokafteri)! It is creamy Greek feta with spicy roasted peppers and it is amazing! I seriously dream about this dip.  My Husband loves Greek food, so it doesn't take much convincing to get him to take me to dinner here. We traditionally get the gyro plate, which comes with sliced gyro meat, pita bread and your choice of french fries or rice pilaf. I usually get the rice because it's a healthier option and it's very well made.  The restaurant is small and gets crowded. There is no table service - you order at the counter and they will bring your food to you when it's ready. The gyro plate is just $11.95, which is a much better value than many of the other local Greek places we've been to, and in my opinion this food is better. They've been around for a long time, so I'd say they're doing something right!
AMAZING!!!  We drive all the way from Summerlin.  A good 30 minute drive!!!! Everything is delicious.  Please build a cafe in Summerlin!!
This Greek place is EXCELLENT!  :-)  Very high quality food, service and facility + good prices = GREAT VALUE! I've become a regular over the past several years!
I love the chicken souvlaki and the beef gyros are great.  The rice pudding is sooooooooo good.  Definitely a new regular spot!

Ordered food to go got home had no tzatziki and no pita with my gyro plate.. gotta have some Ziki with gyro meat. I was really excited to try this place and let me down on my first trip. Food is fresh and tasty and salad was really good & fresh with the dressing, but not happy with no ziki sauce, to me that's what I love most about gyro meat it's the combo of ziki and gyro. It's quite a ways from my house also so not traveling back, maybe I'll give it another shot in the future. All in all tasty food 3 stars for the lack of order completion, went to a Greek spot by my house for a side of zeek.
Food was wonderful, clean restaurant, fast service and all around great experience! Definitely a new fave for my family
