We were looking forward to eating here. I stood in line while my husband and kids secured a table. We were asked to give up the table because "whoever orders first gets a table".  This was broadcasted over the entire restaurant. We got up and left immediately as that's the first time I've ever heard that. I will be sure to never come back to this restaurant and I will tell all my friends about the rude way we were treated.

Someone recommended The Great Greek and boy was I impressed! I had the grilled marinade shrimp with extra pita bread...sooooo good! The restaurant was clean and the service was food.  Will definitely be going back.

The fiancée and I love Greek food and wanted to make a stop to try out a new Greek place! After walking in we were greeted by friendly people. We ordered two gyros. One was a chicken meal with feta fries (yum) and a beef/lamb gyro with an added steak skewer. After waiting a few minutes our food came out. Instantly we were both surprised by how much tzatiki sauce was on both gyros. Seriously there was a ton! After scraping some of the sauce off we were ready to eat. I went first with my lamb/beef gyro and it was quite tasty. The biggest problem with both gyros was the tzatiki sauce wasn't implanted into every bite! The tzatiki sauce was misplaced and hopefully they can fix that. The chicken we both tried was very dry. The steak skewer was cooked to perfection. Seriously good, but it could have used some salt. Overall I'll be back but ask for lighter tzatiki sauce and hopefully they can put it on the pita bread as well as some on top.

I can be your gyro, baby.  . Went on Saturday 2-6-16 at 12PM and placed a to-go order.  $32.20 got me a greek salad bowl with chicken, a greek salad wrap, and some goodies for my baby boy.  After about thirty minutes and watching many who came in after me receive their food I went to the front counter to see what was going on.  I think they lost my order to be honest but shortly after that they had my food bagged up for me and I was on my way.  They were nice enough to give me a free baklava for the inconvenience.  COOL!  .  $10.95 Greek salad rice bowl comes with your choice of meat (I chose chicken), rice pilaf, lettuce, tomatoes, red onions, cucumbers, garbanzo beans, kalamata olives, feta cheese, and tzaziki sauce, though I received no tzaziki sauce.  Unfortunately I didn't notice the tzaziki sauce was missing until I was already home.   It was still pretty tasty, however.  The rice was cooked well, the chicken was nice and tender, and the salad was delicious even without any dressing. For some reason there was half an avocado on it which is not on the menu and I didn't ask for it.   .  $7.95 Greek salad wrap comes with lettuce, tomatoes, red onions, cucumbers, garbanzo beans, kalamata olives, feta cheese, tazaziki sauce and is wrapped up in a grilled tortilla.  My husband inhaled it and said it was delicious.   .  I didn't like having to wait so long and they kinda screwed up my order but the food is delicious and they gave me a free baklava...soo.....4 stars I guess.  I definitely want to come back and try the feta fries!

Tried the gyro and after all the positive reviews on here was not as inspired by the taste as I thought I would be.  The cost was more expensive than the normal.  The meat was not that tender as well .   I will try again however

Wow! I was delighted to have sampled the delectable Mediterranean cuisines at The Great Greek. I savored the steak entree and my hubby had the gyro one. Each dish starts off with salad and the fries were so so tasty. I have to say, the hummus here is one of the best I've had. The service was very attentive and the whole restaurant well kept. The portions were very generous and the value for what is served is quite plentiful. If you're craving appetizing Mediterranean fare at a great price, you'll love The Great Greek!

The is place is awesome my fiancé and I come to the Great Greek every other week. The food is super fresh, the staff is friendly and we highly recommend it to anyone looking for a good moderately priced meal living in Henderson.
Great place. Great food, ambience is pretty amazing! I have gone to both locations now and I appreciate their consistency throughout the brand.

The Greek bowl here is good. It's basically a Greek salad with rice pilaf, garbanzo beans, a tzatziki dressing, and your choice of meat (I pick gyro) . It runs about $9-10 but it's enough to make two meals out of it and leaves you feeling light and not sluggish like fast food does.

My quest for a good Greek restaurant in Las Vegas has been a long and arduous journey. I am admittedly quite picky, you see I've had the real thing in Greece and it was so delicious and effortless that I refuse to settle for fake American alternatives. This is definitely the pinnacle of Greek food in Las Vegas!  This cute little mom and pop shop is spotless. The decor is surprisingly simple with a few Greek finishes. They have the typical menu and are very friendly. I got a traditional beef/lamb gyro and made it a combo to include a greek salad and a drink. The greek salad was delicious. I am not a huge fan of olives and onions, so I gave half of the salad to my husband, but I was sure to clean up the huge chunks of cucumber and a good portion of the lettuce and tomato.   The gyro was gigantic! The meat and the tzatziki sauce were delicious and complimented perfectly by the soft pita bread and the tomato, feta, and lettuce. I couldn't have been happier. While it definitely looked impossible to eat the entire thing, it was exactly what I did. I cleaned my plate and stole a few of my husband's feta fries. The feta fries have melted feta and herbs and were pretty good, but I have definitely had better. Unfortunately, for the amount of cheese on them they didn't have much flavor at all, in fact I had to dip them in ketchup which seemed like a real shame. The fries were rather thick, perhaps it would have been executed better with shoe string style fries. Other than that, this place is fantastic! I am so happy to finally have a good Greek restaurant in town to curb my cravings. I will definitely be back!
Love having a great Greek restaurant in the neighborhood. Food is always delicious and fresh.

Came here for lunch yesterday.  First time here.  Looking for comfort food with a dog friendly atmosphere and ended up here.   I had the chicken kabob plate with feta fries. It came with a side salad. The wait time wasn't that bad after ordering.   Dog friendly patio makes me happy. I love bringing my dog wherever I go if possible.   I would definitely come back and get other things on the menu.   Parking lot.  Casual dining. Indoor and outdoor seating.  I'm a fan.

Overall: The Great Greek serves up good Greek food, and everyone seems to know so don't be surprised if there aren't any seats!  Food: 4  Grilled Chicken Souvlaki: The chicken was moist with a nice grilled flavor. The rice was fluffy and separated, just how I like it, but it's not as flavorful as the rice at my favorite kabab place. A lot of places seem to skimp on the quality of their pita bread, but their pita bread was fluffy and soft.  Grilled Steak Souvlaki: The steak was tender and moist. I enjoy the grilled flavor on meats, but they took it slightly to far and some edges were burnt and bitter.  Both our plates were on the saltier side (in terms of meat and rice), but it became well balanced when eaten with the light tzatziki and acidic salad.  Service: 3  The restaurant is quick service, so you order at the counter and servers will bring out your dish if it's eat in.  The servers were nice. I didn't realize that there was feta cheese on the salads so I didn't specify no cheese during my order, but they were still nice enough to exchange our salads for us. Even though it's quick service, the staff was nice enough to stop by and ask us about our meal occasionally.  However, the cashier did seem to have a little bit of an attitude. She made a face when another customer ripped open a packet of sugar and ate it alone.  Ambiance: 4  The restaurant is fairly small but super busy. As a result, it may be difficult to find seating inside the restaurant. They do have some nice tables outside with umbrellas, but I'm not a fan of sitting in the heat.

What can I say...  food from The Great Greek is made with love and that's the not so secret ingredient!!!  First off, this place takes care!!!  The food that they serve is definitely a reflection of the quality of produce and products used!  This is an important element that differentiates their food from surrounding competitors, and it's a difference you can really taste.  Moreover, the food here is extremely affordable and definitely worth the price mark, add ons and all!  I'm always open to new food but when trying a new Greek restaurant I always take it back to basics.  Hummus and tzatzki with pita bread are ALWAYS a must for me so I was delighted with the fact that I had found a place who knew what they were doing.  The texture and seasoning was on point and I love the accompanying pita bread!!  It was thin, soft, warm and didn't overpower any of the dipping sauces.  In other words, it was not overly thick and hard.    Do try a little combo of the different appetizers such as the hummus, tzatzki, dolmades, pita bread!!  It's a wonderful selection of the most popular Greek comforts.  Those little dolmades were fresh, flavorful and stuffed just right.  Please... Do yourself a favor and get an order of the Great Greek feta fries. Damn!! This dish really won me over cause i'm a sucker for fries and this little twist was such a nice palate pleaser! Amazing!!  Can't stop thinking about them!  Gyros are tricky ordering for me because others i've tried either had too much of something, or too little.  The Great Greek's gyro was huge and each ingredient it was stuffed with did not outshine another; it was the perfect amount of everything.  Presentation is simple and to the point but also exhibits a hidden wow factor that I like.    The restaurant itself is extremely inviting and exudes a very "my house is your house" type of feeling!  Being that it is a family affair, there are no inconsistencies when it comes to service!!!  This is what I love about gems like these... It doesn't have that "chain restaurant" feeling... and that brings me back to the not so secret ingredient: love, love, love!!!  You can tell that you matter as soon as you step in cause you're always greeted with a smile and a welcoming hello!  Anyway... Go ahead and give The Great Greek a try for yourself.  You'll see just what I'm talking about once you take your first bite.  I highly recommend! *love*

Sooooooo impressed with every single aspect of this beautiful restaurant. First of all, the service here is so genuine, really refreshing decor and the food is amazing. Yes, AMAZING!   The owners of the restaurant should take pride in the wonderful people working behind the counter. They are so helpful and really know all the dishes that they serve. They go out of their way every single time when it comes to our order to make sure we're satisfied. I just can't say enough great things about the staff here.   The food is fresh and very flavorful, I don't know where they find such beautiful tomatoes for their salad but these are the real deal! These are not your grocery store variety tomatoes, they really do taste homegrown.  Their hummus and their pita bread are probably some of the best pita and hummus that I have ever had. As a family, we have ordered many dishes here and a lot of crazy to go orders, and they are perfect every single time.  I highly suggest this place for a date, a fun dinner with family, and especially if you're looking to impress coworkers or a boss! My family eats here just about every single week because we love it so much.  Love, love, love!

I love Greek food and am happy this place opened on this side of town.  Their veggies are crisp, meats are juicy, hummus is on point, rice is tasty.  I tried their soup, yogurt and rice pudding as well.... and wow!  So good!!  It's a place where you walk up, order, pay, sit, then wait for them to serve your order.  Definitely a more delicious and healthier alternative to drive-thrus.

I've only tried the gyro here, but based on that I would return to try other menu items. The flavor was great, but the only thing holding me back from 5 stars was the amount of meat in the sandwich. For me, a gyro isn't top of the line unless you need a fork to eat some overflowing meat first  just in order to hold the sandwich. With this one, all the meat fit too nicely in the pita! Also, they put the tzatziki sauce on the sandwich for you, so if you're someone who doesn't like a lot, make sure you ask for it on the side.
So much food for your buck and the quality is top notch!!! Love everything I've tried! Very authentic!

Nice to have Greek food on this side of town. Build out is very clean n modern. Food was very tasty. I ordered a gyro plate which came with basically an open face gyro sandwich with rice and salad. Portions were ginormous and price was on point. Not expensive for what you get. I could of shared this plate with my husband and it would of been more than enough. Husband had the chicken souvlaki plate, which was 2 large chicken kabobs with rice, salad n pita. I tasted the chicken and it was moist and tasty. We also ordered the hummus. Everything tasted fresh not like some other Greek chains we've eaten at where the food tasted frozen and just heated up.  For 2 meals, 2 drinks and hummus w pita =total was around $35... we went home with tons of leftovers.  Yes will be ordering food from here in the future.

The food here is great.  I've never been disappointed, customer service is on the other hand a different story..  While I waited for my food I went next door to get a juice, came back and in a couple of mins my food was ready I went to get it and the girl handing it to me threw it on the counter top!  Not sure if she was having a bad day or what, but that is really terrible customer service. Hopefully her day gets better and the customers after me have a better experience.

The best Greek food I have had!! I am not an easy customer to please and this place always hits the spot.  Family run. Always greeted warmly.  They do get busy around lunch and dinner so call your order in if you are in a rush.  Limited inside seating would be my only complaint but their amazing service and food bring them right back up to the 5 star level. Food takes a little longer to be made than say a sandwich place and prices are a bit higher than other places, but the value is served; all fresh ingredients made in house.  Well worth it!

First time here and have to say we tried the hummus and Greek salad and the food was very good! The staff was friendly and the manager on duty was very helpful and explained some.items on the menu to us. The pita bread was fresh and was so good with the hummus. We enjoyed it so much went back to have hummus again and tried the little fried dough balls that have a Indian spicy taste to them. I can't remember what they are called. They tasted very authentic.  We are a fan now of this place especially when we are in the mood for a good Greek Salad. It was very good and one was enough to share. I think there is one other location in Vegas for this restaurant and the girl we spoke to thought they maybe opening more soon. Check it out you won't regret it! Especially if your a hummus fan like us!

Came here on a Saturday afternoon when it was pretty busy. We decided to come here due to the good reviews and were not disappointed.  I ordered the Greek salad wrap (4/5) with chicken which was very filling and fresh. My husband had the gyro which was pretty big and stuffed with meat and all the toppings (5/5).  The feta fries with lemon were 5/5 due to the yummy melted cheese all over. The service was also fast and friendly.

It's so good and everybody is SO friendly!!  My husband got the lamb gyro and I got the Greek salad with lamb kabob.  Both were so delicious. We split a lemon soup which was fresh and hot, delicious and light. The food came out quick after that and had plenty of soft warm pita. The Greek cucumber yogurt sauce is the best to dip pita in!!  The half salad is a large portion, so if your a light eater it's perfect as salad doesn't keep well for leftovers. Grab a small baklava or butter cookie for after your meal. Dont wait, they sell out quickly.

I come here regularly, as it is by far the best Greek food spot I've been to in town.   My favorites are the grilled shrimp (either the entree, or added on a salad). The marinade/seasoning they use on the shrimp is flippin delicious. I'm also a fan of the falafel and greek fries.  It's family owned and I've always had great customer service. Try it, you won't be disappointed.

Cute place with a fun light-hearted ambiance and decent lunch rush. Nearly identical to Stephano's, almost creepy how similar they are, but Great Greek has a much smaller menu.  Prices are higher, but probably dictated by their lease.  Food was very mediocre. Americanized Gyro offering with average flavor tzatziki. Fries were grossly undercooked, pita was cold and gyro meat was not freshly sliced; it was not even warm.  Probably won't be going back.
It's hard to find good Mediterranean and Greek food here in town, this place always hits the spot! Menu is simple and food is amazing!

Every once in a while I crave a Gyro and when I do, this is my place!  The tortilla is so soft and yummy and the beef-lamb is so tender and flavored just perfect!  The family meal deal is great as are the kids meals which are half a gyro with a side of fries and a drink.  Great place for a gyro!  The Baklava is amazing and a very good portion, best for sharing!

Great find!! This is a perfect spot for a quick and tasty meal.  Don't let the fact it's in a strip mall keep you from trying this jewel of a restaurant.  The food is great and the staff is very friendly.
I love the soup they have here and the rice. I dont really like the Gyros. They are so big , they fall apart, the meat they used was bad.

I should get a frequent customer card for how often I come to this place. That being said, The Great Greek offers a clean, affordable, welcoming and most importantly, DELICIOUS dining experience. Immediately walking into the restaurant, you can sense the meticulous family touch that is all over the place, from the service, to the ambiance.   The food is not a wallet buster, which is an additional plus given the quality of the food. I am a frequent consumer of the chicken rice bowl. Freshly prepared, with fresh ingredients, you really can't go wrong.  I recommend The Great Greek frequently to my peers and friends. They have always treated me well, and I've always left full, and satisfied. Definite must try.

Third time I've been here this week with my family- we try something new each time and are never disappointed! Fresh food=light and fresh flavors. Best Greek food I've ever had! The salads are super fresh, proteins are perfectly seasoned and juicy, and the garlic feta fries are out of the world yummy. The prices are also super reasonable. Love this place!
Always a great Greek meal. Love the Gyros, not a huge fan of the feta fries, but their plain fries are great. Try the dolmas-very good. Always busy so be patient for a seat.

I have eaten there a few times and it was good average Greek food. If you have been to Greece, you know what I mean. Today I ate there and they surfed me and my kids warmed up and greasy Gyros. It looked like it was cut a few hours back and it was way too long on the grill afterwards. After telling the girl, she said sorry and ran off, never came back.  Don't ask the question if you may not like the answer, daaaah!  We all had a funny stomach all night and I was upset about their behavior. The food was yucky and the service was silly. Running off and not doing anything about it. $66 bucks out the window ...  I am gonna find a better place. Bummer ...

I have been there too many times to count, and every time the food is just as good as the first time. The reason for only 4 starts is the service. My husband and I have been coming here for years and there is one girl in particular who is very unfriendly. I'm a loyal customer and I always tip, but for whatever reason she is always rude. I really miss walking in and seeing Zack's friendly face. He is there on an occasional weekend, but not nearly as often as he used to be. Besides the service issues we've encountered, this is our go to Greek spot so check it out. Even if you're not in the area the food is well worth a drive!

I have been wanting to try this out for a few months. - The food was Excellent, tasty and pretty authentic. Half of my family is Greek so I compare and contrast to Aunts and Grandmothers recipes handed down for generations. I will be going back very soon to try the rest of the menu. I had the Greek Pastitsio and Avgolemeno soup and they gave me a greek salad on the side (may have actually been too much food, even for me). i give the Pastitsio an 8 out of 10 just because NOBODY makes it like my grandmother but this is pretty darn good. - the Avgolemeno soup however I will give a 9.5 - i will say this was one of the best tasting lemon soups with chicken i have ever had. I am extremely impressed. I was so into the food i completely forget to make some food porn images. I will take more when I go back.

Amazing food, fresh, homemade, very clean place and really good customer service!  We are really pleased to finally have a spot in the neighbourhood that's little different than average American restaurant. Athenian burger was awesome, my kids enjoyed rice bowls, veggie is very nicely cut!
I got the chicken kabob meal. Everything tasted fresh and good...I got two meals out of one. An excellent value!

Good food. The only thing I ordered was the great greek gyro. It was huge. I am so glad I decided to forgo a combo or getting a side and I don't think I could have handled anymore than the gyro itself. The flavor was great! I'd return if I was in the Vegas area again.

Better than average veggies.  Hubby loved the rice bowl.  Falafel in my salad was the best I've ever had.  Great crunchy outside, but nice and thin so you get a lot of the moist yummy inside.  Juicy lemons on the side were delicious.  Loved the eggplant dip.  I wish they had whole wheat pita and brown rice.

I stoped by on my way out of Vegas towards LA and wanted to get a healthy salad ... and found this guys on Yelp. Fantastic food .... great service.... lovely staff! Highly recommend this place. The salad was very fresh and the sandwich was delicious. The person behind the cash was very helpfully recommending options to me !
Great food and great customer service. Food is fresh and made to order. Meat is tender and very flavorful. This is my go to place!

We recieved the recommendation for The Great Greek as we were on the opposite side of the city and we were very glad we went.  For a fast casual, the food was excellent and so was the service.   We tried the lamb chop special which was great, gyro plate as well as sandwich, the burger, fries, hummus and baklava.   Everything we had was really good as we share family style and the environment was very comfortable to sit and talk after our meal.

I've been here exactly three times in the past two days, that's how much I'm diggin' The Great Greek.   They have ah-mazing vegetarian options. And while I usually go straight for the falafel at greek places, I find it pretty lacking here. I found it too dry and kinda bland. I also generally go for hummus, but I found it pretty unmemorable. HOWEVER, their salad wrap, greek salad with grilled salmon, and tzaziki sauce are amazing options I definitely recommend. And grabbing an order of feta fries is a MUST. Ridiculously crispy and simultaneously fluffy, these are fries are seriously delicious. The quality is decent, the taste is great, and the price is just right.  Also, while the service is friendly, you may not get your food super fast since this place is poppin'. Expect a lil' wait since it's made to order and enjoy the fresh options The Great Greek has to offer.

Perfect rainy day to visit a sick friend facing major surgery so I stopped at The Great Greek for a fast but tasty take out lunch. Fresh Avgolemono soup ( traditional thick Greek chicken & lemon rice soup), warm pita bread and a bit of white wine. I really like having lunch there but stopping by for take out at noon or dinner works too. Counter customer service is reliable, friendly and respectful. They remember customers and I appreciate that in the food industry. Thinking about using their catering service next.

I admit it, I cheated yesterday. And unfortunately it wasn't worth it! I was on the way to Greek Bistro, my usual gyro place when I drove past Great Greek. I remember seeing many great Yelp reviews so decided to give them a try. It was not busy when I arrived around noon.   The girl at the register was all business. Not unfriendly, but not friendly either. I ordered the Great greek gyro with the infamous feta fries and a drink. It was around $12.50 for the combo. I received my order in a decent amount of time. The pita was good, nice and soft. However the meat was really dry. I thought the feta fries were completely overrated, maybe I had a bad batch? The fries seemed under cooked to me. The meal was okay, but definately nothing I would return for.   I will stay true to Greek Bistro as I think their gyros and seasoned fries are much much better.

This tiny, family-owned & run Greek joint shouldn't be missed if you find yourself anywhere close to Stephanie & Warn Springs. The same family who owns The Fat Greek on the west side also owns this place. The Fat Greek has a larger dining room and includes a bakery counter (the family, as I understand, is actually mostly Armenian and whips up some pretty incredible Armenian baked goods). The Great Greek Grill is a smaller place without the included bakery, but it's clean and light (mirrors along one wall and windows along two other walls help it feel larger & brighter). Service here is always patient and with a smile; you can tell they really care about keeping loyal customers. I can vouch for the fact that their hummus, tzatziki, spanakopita, Greek salad, and chicken souvlaki all have great flavor. I don't like dolmades, so I can't really help you there, though I can tell you these are longer and skinnier than most I've seen/tried. Unlike most Greek joints, this one also offers avgolemono soup, which I enjoyed, but since I don't have too much experience with different incarnations of it yet, I'm not sure how it compares. I love their chicken so much that I haven't tried their actual gyro meat, but nothing I've had there yet has done me wrong.  (Note: Evidently there's a duplicate page out there for this place, listed under its full name, The Great Greek Mediterranean Grill. I'd posted this review under that listing first (there are 5 other people that reviewed under that one), and now I'm posting it here as well.)
I love the Chicken Souvlaki Plate. Tender moist chicken, rice pilaf, pita bread, and a side salad. It's big enough for two meals. This place consistently has friendly staff and great food.

Love the food! Love the service! Just don't love that sometimes the wait is so long! I usually get the Greek salad wrap with chicken and it is always so good! I would love to come more often but I don't because the wait for food is usually a bit long but if you're not in a rush, this place is worth the wait!!
Great gyro plate... Tasty feta fries... Very clean. Little on the expensive side but they give you a ton of food.

We came her last Sunday, and the women working the register was very abrasive. Not very upbeat and friendly. The food was good but the protein should not be placed on the fries, it makes them soggy. Don't know if I'll return.

My favorite new place in the Southwest. I go at least once a week. The gyro meat is delicious and the portions are very generous. The eggplant dip is my favorite appetizer. I can't say enough about how much I love this place.
Great spot for quick healthy options for dinner or lunch. I usually get the salad bowl and it's filled with so many toppings. The Greek fries are amazing as well. I love this spot.
I have a Greek food obsession & they definitely are the best in Las Vegas. From the hummus to the fries to the gyro... amazing.

I love this place! My classmate and I come here for lunch at least once a week. We go so much they know our names and I'm not at all ashamed.   The service is great - always friendly, always prompt. One time Jeck (Jack? I don't know how to spell his name) saw us shivering at the outside tables and came out to get us when a table inside opened up. There has never once been a mistake with our orders.   I always get the beef-lamb gyro combo with a side salad for ~$10. Since I always save the side salad for my dinner, that's a pretty good deal! The gyro is tender and flavorful, the tzatziki is just the right consistency, and the pita is always soft and delicious.   I rarely give 5-star reviews, but this is one my favorite Henderson haunts and they deserve it!

OMG I love this place. So glad they opened closer to me!! I got the lamb/beef gyro and it is so full of meat you can barely hold it with two hands. For dessert we had baklava ice cream. I thought I died and went to heaven, such a great combo of flavors.
Best gyro in Vegas hands down. Pretty much a must whenever we're on this side of town. Thank you Nordstrom Rack.

Today was not a 3 star rating by any means but I have to average the two visits.  This visit being a 1, maybe a 2, but the first visit a 5.  The food was very good the first visit.  Couldn't wait to get back there.  Today we ordered our lunch at 11 to be ready at Noon.  It was 12:30 by the time we got up to the register.  Our order wasn't ready.  An hour and a half??  (All we ordered was 2 salads and a skewer)  I ordered a chicken skewer to go with mine.  She said they ran out of chicken.  ???  I was adamant when placing the order NO OLIVES.  The cashier repeated no olives when ringing my order.  Guess what I got.  It was nasty and I did my best to sit and pick them out.  Today's visit was ridiculous.

Unfortunately I love eating at this place the food is amazing but this is now the third time i have ordered to go and haven't gotten everything i ordered...first time no tzatziki sauce second time no hummus that I ordered this time no tzatziki sauce or lemon....this is actually pricey food to not get what you ordered....looks like I need to find a new Greek place to go to once a week
Really tasty gyro meat, most places make it so greasy but this was fresh and tender, soft pita bread and a great Greek salad , would go back :)

Came here for lunch today to grab something somewhat healthy. I like how they have a generous portion of salad even if you get a small salad. I ordered a small salad and a steak skewer. The steak skewer is $3.75 on top of the salad which is $5.95.   It's nice because if you eat there they will bring your food to you, but since it was my first time ordering the salad I didn't know they were supposed to give you the dressing on the side. If my friend didn't say anything I wouldn't have known, which is why they got a four start instead of a five star.   The steak was good and they even provide you with naan and tzatziki sauce. Not sure how you spell it. The salad had an abundance of onions and oversized tomatoes which I didn't enjoy.   Overall, the food was good and the service was average. I'd come back again to try their other items on the menu.
